Please pass this along and do what you can to help them all out! It WON'T bring him back and it definetly won't take their pain away, but I KNOW it will be a huge relief and one last thing this grieving family will have to be burdend with!

title: DNC Delegate Trip
summary: Hello! My name is Rachel Gonzalez and I am the Chair of High School Democrats of Missouri. I was recently  elected as a Missouri delegate to the Democratic National Convention, where I will join Democrats from across the country to select the Democratic nominee for President. I am excited to represent Hillary Clinton and her supports as Missouri's youngest-ever elected delegate to the convention.For almost a year now, I have been volunteering on the campaign in Missouri and have also volunteered in Iowa and Kansas leading up to their caucuses. I am only 17 ---- so unfortunately I will not be able to cover the cost on my own. My love for Hillary and passion for politics came in 2008 at my first campaign rally, one for Hillary when I was 9 years old. This rally was a special one for me because on that day I started a countdown, the countdown to when I will (finally) be old enough to vote. I started at 3,182 days and I am now registered to vote and only 168 days away.  On my 17 1/2 birthday (The first day you can register to vote in the state of Missouri) I registered to vote in front of my Kansas City Hillary volunteers/supporters.The money raised will cover the cost of my round trip to Philadelphia and hotel expenses which are expected to be extremely high. I will also be responsible for covering my own food and transportation while in Philadelphia.Thank you  for taking the time to read this, and I promise to represent Missouri Democrats well in Philadelphia - let's just make sure I get there. Also, I look forward to using my first vote on Hillary Clinton in November (:For additional information on me, please email rgonzalez@hsdems.orgYou can follow my journey here! Twitter: @RachelRGonzalez

title: #JohnPfeilSeason
summary: Hi. My name is Blake. I am one of three children who was co-created by a man named John Moloney Pfeil of Lockport, NY. This is John:￼... he's on the left. My father. To say that my father is the man would be one thing; to say that my father is THE (note the capslock and bold font) man is another, and the latter is far closer to the truth. I know that a lot of folks out there stake claims: "My dad is great, my pops is greater than yours, my papa is nothing short of the greatest!" I hear you. I'm glad you feel that way. I have to disagree. John Moloney Pfeil of Lockport, NY is the world's best father. He has never touched a cigarette. He's hiked Everest. He is an All-American athlete. He has not one but TWO US patents - I don't know what he invented, but it was something cool. He has a really wicked sense of humor. He's the kindest person I know. His heart is actually composed of pure gold. I've had so many friends tell me that they wish my dad was their dad, and I calmly reply, "He is. He's everyone's dad." That's a fact. My father's door is always open for the poor, wayfaring stranger. Everyone is worth something to my dad, even the liberalist of Democrats. (He's a registered Republican. We disagree there, but he sincerely loves and appreciates the art of musical theatre, so he gets a free pass.)￼And it just so happens that, because of all his awesomeness, the past year or so has been #JohnPfeilSeason. I'm going to share a sorta-secret with you now. My father got sick last year, and it wasn't until very recently that we got a solid diagnosis: lung cancer. The ugly, ugly C word. Specifically, mesothelioma. We didn't want to hear it, but if you must know, we're glad to at least have a conclusive answer because first they said it was. Then they said it might be. Then they said it wasn't. And then they went back to the cancer answer. And so it went, round and round like this, for ten months. John was passed around for the past ten months, from doctor to doctor, none of whom could provide a solid answer as to what was happening with my dad until very recently when we got the answer, finally. This is the email my father sent our closest family/friends last week:___________________________________Guys,I went to see a Dr. Takita this week. He is a thoracic surgeon who is 85 years old with a heavy Japanese accent. That would put him at about 14 at the end of WW2. Sadly, I suspect he knows what a B29 looks like. Beth looked him up, and reports he has an excellent reputation. His office staff tells me he still plays racquetball quite often. Ya gotta love it!I guess the key info in that consultation was that the last PET/CT scan I had showed something on the lower lobe of my right lung (the one that has collapsed 9 times). The "brightness" of a hot spot on a PET scan is measured in "Standardized Uptake Values" (SUVs) which range from 0 for no uptake to 15 for maximal uptake. Most cancers are above 2 or 3. Sometimes, highly metabolic normal tissues can also be in that range. In my scan, the spherical structure, sorry to say, has an SUV of 7.8. High-SUV structures look very bright when one is viewing the scan. Mine looks like a spotlight. : (There is another abnormality in that lung, namely an area of thickening in the tissue surrounding the lung. This seems concentrated in a small area (less than 1", is my guess). It has a normal SUV, so the doc is not worried about that one.I have been scheduled for a May 24th surgery to remove the problematic tissue via a thoracoscopy, or more descriptively, a video-assisted thoracoscopic surgery (VATS). This will probably involve 2 incisions in my chest wall to insert a camera and the surgical instrument. After slicing and dicing, they will leave a thoracic catheter that allows the lung cavity to drain. I will probably be at Kenmore Mercy Hospital for three days. If surgery removes the cause of my lung collapses, the catheter will be taken out some day. If the cause persists, they will leave it in so that my monthly "oil changes", as Meg calls them, will no longer be necessary. After removal of the tumor, the lab folks check to see if further treatment is indicated (e.g., chemo or radiation therapy).I remain optimistic, so no worries. : )_______________________________________"OK. An answer. Let's act," we all said.Here's the thing, though. Leave it to John to retire and lose good health insurance altogether. The all-star athlete, non-smoker, healthiest dude alive got cancer, had super insurance for years that he never needed, retired, and a few months later got sick. Go figure.￼I know you see these all the time - which is a terrible, terrible fact in the world. And it's a terrible, terrible fact that our country's health insurance system is in dire need of continued restructuring. My dad is unemployed, and he needs help to solve this issue. (Side note: the issue, aka cancer, was given a name: Clynton.) And it's our plan to kill Clynton. We're going to annihilate her in cold blood, but we need your help.￼This money is going to help cover the cost of my dad's costly care. That's it. And if you've ever met him, you know that he would NEVER ask for help. In fact, I haven't told him that I'm doing this. He'd rather kill me for doing this than kill Clynton with the help of friends. It's part of his strange loveliness, but that's where we're at right now. If you've never met John, I can make that happen. We can sit down together and FaceTime him, and he can tell you all the stories about his incredible, valuable, wonderful life that he has lived fully and truly, enough that I don't think he should have to stop yet. This isn't the way that my father is supposed to leave this planet; it's not cool enough. He needs to leave it by saving a pile of puppies from a burning building or jumping in the way of a young chap or gal who almost steps in front of a bus or better yet? Peacefully. Not at the hand of his cancerous lungs.￼Not on my watch. Or yours.If you can toss a few dollars into the pot to help murder Clynton, I'll never forget it. Not as long as I live.

title: Send Hillary's Warrior To Philly
summary: ••ANYONE THAT JOINS ME IN THIS EFFORT AND DONATES $20.16 OR MORE WILL BE MAILED A HILLARY STICKER••(Delivery time may vary due to travel time, but it WILL be sent) Once upon a time…On Saturday May 14th, just two days shy of my birthday, I was elected to be a National Delegate for Hillary Clinton at the Democratic National Convention in Philadelphia during July 25 – 28, 2016. It was the best birthday present a girl could ask for!￼￼￼I’m currently a full time student at Nevada State, focused on finishing a B.S.N. (Bachelor of Science in Nursing). Over the past year, every minute that I was not at school, has been spent working for Hillary Clinton’s campaign as a Super Volunteer. During that time, I volunteered countless hours as I phone banked, canvassed, recruited other volunteers, encouraged many new voters to register, and even traveled to other states to help work their primaries. And somehow I also managed to co-chair LGBT NV Dems for Hillary.To know me is to know that I am profoundly passionate about what and also those that I believe in; and I wholeheartedly believe in Hillary Clinton. ￼￼￼￼￼￼Additionally, those who know me also know that it’s not typical for me to ask others for assistance. “I need your help.” Only four little words and yet for some of us they are four of the hardest words to get out. The truth is, I do need your help. As an elected delegate I am responsible for the financial responsibilities associated with attending the National Convention. These expenses include, but are not limited to; Hotel/boarding, airfare, and of course food. The estimate cost for this trip is upwards of $5,000, and partly due to the cost of hotel expenses. The rate at the hotel reserved for National Delegates is currently $500 a night. Aside from logistics…It’s very important to me that you know that I understand what I am asking of you and I value it beyond words. I grew up with a single mother, faced adversity living in poverty-stricken apartment-row neighborhoods, as a minority (Hispanic), I learned early on about inequity while not only being female, but a lesbian, and I am a first generation college graduate. If anyone understands that money doesn’t grow on trees, it’s me. Having said that, I am more than grateful for any size contribution, because truly EVERY bit helps. Also, there are other ways to help me. If you wish to help me, but absolutely cannot contribute monetarily, I ask that you’d please consider sharing this page with others you may know or Facebook groups that you may belong to. Also, if you have services that you are willing to donate please contact me as that may also be a huge help to me during this journey. Again, I am so humbled by this experience and I thank you from the bottom of my heart. It is my sole desire to attend the Democratic National Convention to represent Nevada’s Congressional District 3 proudly, and with an extreme dedication to my fellow neighbors, Nevadans (LGBT, Latinos, Millennials, Students, Females), and democrats. Making certain that OUR voices are heard, and defending OUR vote is my top priority. Making history is hard work, but together working hard we can live history in the making. Please join me in the effort, and DEAL ME IN!…happily ever after. **Please note that any excess funds raised will go to other National Delegates in need of financial support and/or the DNC.**Lastly, my journey will be documented both live and post, please follow the experience with me. Search the hashtag #HillarysWarrior on all social media platforms for updates, photos and livestream. Instagram and Twitter handle: @HillarysWarriorTHANK YOU A MILLION TIMES OVER. Sincerely yours, Alicia T.

title: NY CD-11 Town Hall
summary: Why Plan A Town Hall?South Brooklyn and Staten Island have organized to create NY-11 Town Hall, an evening of learning and conversation about issues facing Congressional District 11, currently represented in Congress by Rep. Dan Donovan (R-NY). The event will be held at the Bay Ridge Manor on Wednesday, April 19.Created in response to broad-sweeping changes in the federal government, NY-11 Town Hall is an opportunity for the public to listen to and ask questions of experts in: education, environmental sustainability, equality, health care, housing, and immigration. Questions for the panel can be submitted in advance through https://ny11townhall.com/ The event was timed with the upcoming congressional recess to enable Rep. Donovan's attendance. However, he has formally refused the invitation and will not attend. The Congressman has not hosted a town hall since his 2015 election and we believe it is time that he checks in face-to-face with a large number of his constituents, well before his 2018 campaign. Furthermore, we will not let Donovan's silence be our district's ignorance. In collaboration with several community groups, we have taken a proactive approach to informing and empowering our neighbors.Several prominent organizations will co-sponsor the event, including: Council on American-Islamic Relations (CAIR-NY), New York State Nurses Association, Jericho Project, Veterans for Peace, Arab American Family Support Center.Initiated by Fight Back Bay Ridge, NY-11 Town Hall was organized in collaboration with Bay Ridge Democrats Action Committee, South Brooklyn Progressive Resistance, and Staten Island Women Who March.NY 11 Town Hall is a free event. RSVPs are limited. Why We Need Funding.We must cover the space rental, sound equipment, promotional flyers in a variety of languages, and informational handouts for the day of the event.$1 - Sends one "Wish You Were Here" postcard (including postage) to Dan Donovan's office from a Town Hall participant$5 - Creates 3 "engagement bags" with follow-up materials for participants (all materials)$10 - Pays for participation stickers for 25 participants$15 - Balloons!$20 - Prints 100 copies of flyers in a variety of languages so we can reach people in our neighborhood who will attend the event$25 - Provides one microphone for the evening$50 - Coffee for everyone!$100 - Ensures that 100 "Wish You Were Here" postcards will be delivered to Donovan's office$200 - Provides all sound amplification we need to rent for the evening, plus two mics, and ensures mingle music before/after the event$300 - Projection screen for event, which includes slideshow and video streamingAll contributions are appreciated. Thank you!Visit ny11townhall.com  to RSVP and propose a question.

title: Caputo Family Legal Fund
summary: I'm Christine Hernandez and I live in Buffalo, New York. I've started this GoFundMe to help my cousin Michael Caputo and his family. The Democrats in the House of Representatives have him in their crosshairs again about this bogus Russia investigation. This time, he's had enough. He just announced that he won't cooperate with the House Judiciary Committee investigation that just started - and he's going to be racking up some legal fees. AGAIN!Actually, Michael is my husband Greg's cousin. They grew up together since they were in Junior High. When they graduated high school, Greg went into the Air Force and Michael enlisted in the Army. Nowadays, they're inseparable. Greg and I are also godparents to Ana Sofia, Michael and Maryna's six-year-old daughter. Their daughters are very special.Greg and I are huge Trump supporters, but we stay out of politics. I work in retail; Greg works in the defense industry. We've been so proud of Michael, fighting the good fight for our President and our country on the 2016 campaign and today on national television. And we were proud to contribute to his legal fund last summer when he appeared before the House, Senate and Mueller investigations. In fact, 8,500 people donated to his fund. Testifying as a witness - not a target or a subject, just a witness - Michael incurred nearly $200,000 in legal costs. Since the GoFundMe covered those costs, he was able to help several other Trump associates pay their legal fees, too. Now the Mueller investigation is ending (after finding no Russian collusion, of course), but the Democrats have taken over the House of Representatives and they're starting the whole thing all over again!To begin, the House Democrats are targeting 81 people associated with President Trump! Of course, that's outrageous, but Michael is right in the middle of it. Today, he announced that he does not intend to cooperate. I don't think any of these people should - this whole thing has gotten ridiculous! - but this is going to cost a lot more money than he has left in his legal fund. A whole lot more.Frankly, I don't know how much this will cost their family, but it's at least $50,000 and I want to raise it for them. Can you help? Michael, his wife, and his three daughters don't deserve this and I hope everyone who supports President Trump will support my cousin Michael Caputo because he backs our President - and he won't back down.All proceeds are deposited directly to:Michael Caputo Legal Fund Trustc/o Lorigo Law101 Slade Avenue, Buffalo, NY 14224716-824-7200rlorigo@lorigo.comFor more information please see www.caputolegalfund.com

title: River Swim for Cancer Research
summary: Amidst the backdrop of the unbelievably rancorous political climate in which we are living, I believe I've stumbled upon an absolute truth upon which we can all -- democrats and republicans -- agree: Cancer Sucks.  Cancer is insidious, insipid and indiscriminate. It knows no bounds and no one is immune. Right now I pray each morning for five people I know who are bravely battling the scourge; I am certain that with even a little sleuthing on my part, I could add a few dozen more. If that is you, I am sorry and I salute you. This past Christmas I lost two dear friends to cancer and it is in their honor that I am attempting to complete END-Wet, the longest swimming race in North America at 36 miles in length. I tried this swim two summers ago with my dear friend Lance Maly kayaking at my side. From a pre- and in-race strategy perspective we did everything possible that could be done wrong and we stopped at mile 24, two-thirds of the way through the race after more than six hours in the water; it still leaves a bitter taste in my mouth. Sadly, Lance is one of the two friends who lost his battle with cancer and I endeavor to finish this year, with his name emblazoned on my cap. The other name on my cap will be that of Tim Daly. When I showed up at the U of MN my freshman year he was a mythic figure. A former state high school champion, he was big, strong and without question the best swimming “racer” I ever saw. He was not a graceful swimmer, instead choosing to thrash the water into submission with a fury. When he passed away on Christmas Eve, he may have been less mythic and forceful physically, but spiritually he was just as vibrant as I remember him being more than 30 years ago. So too was Lance. His caring and concern for others as he prepared to cross over on January 2nd was humbling, awe-inspiring and a daily lesson on how to die with dignity and grace. Cancer may have robbed both men of their physical stature, vitality and strength, but it did not put even a small dent in their respective toughness, tenacity or tenderness.  I was able to spend some time with each of them in the days leading up to their deaths and am so, so grateful. Tim’s final words to me were, “Love ya’ Danny Boy” and Lance’s much the same (without the Danny Boy). Both men left behind loving, families and countless friends and they died much too young. Lance at 50 and Tim would have been 59 on Father’s Day. So why do I think I can do this this time, after failing so spectacularly Two years ago? I don’t have a great answer to that question other than I think I want it more this time? And maybe, if I learned anything from my previous failure, I can intelligently avoid the crippling mistakes. I also know that I will have two more Angels in heaven with more than a passing interest in my progress. I will also have a more robust crew alongside me to keep me company, and to keep me motivated.  So I am asking for your support, financial or otherwise. I know you are all barraged with fundraising requests and I have no expectations for any of you. Whether you can give or choose not to will not impact our relationship. I am an adult and don’t give to every request I receive either.  But if you do give you are not giving for me, and frankly you’re not even giving for Lance or for Tim. You are giving for someone YOU know who needs YOUR prayers, blessings, support and whatever dollars you can scrape up to help fund Cancer Research. As I said at the outset: Cancer Sucks and maybe, just maybe with this effort we can all make it suck just a little less. Thank you.

title: See You in Philly, Omero
summary: Hi, and thank you for visiting my GoFundMe page. My name is Omero Lara. I currently reside in Lubbock, Texas and I was elected as the National Delegate from Senate District 28, supporting Senator Bernie Sanders. We did it, 28, but “the struggle continues.”As a graduate student, I survive on a teaching assistant stipend to get through the month, but this Convention is so important to me that I am laying myself on the line and asking for any help you can give me.The hotel alone will be over $2000 for the entire stay during the last week of July. Round-trip plane tickets need to be thrown, food is a must, and it's always good to have an emergency fund.But with grassroots efforts, I know we can make it happen. Bernie never depended on SuperPAC money, but shattered records for individual and small donations; people came together and put whatever they could to a cause they believe in.Will you support my cause?Why Bernie Sanders? During this election cycle, Bernie Sanders’s enthusiasm has generated hope among millions of Americans and has transformed contemporary American politics. His message has resonated with young supporters that will become essential for the future of the Democratic Party. Like many of you, I firmly believe that Bernie Sanders is a once-in-a-lifetime candidate, who possesses authenticity, virtue and who has always fought from the heart. Our agenda offers the opportunity to transform American politics from a system controlled by greed into one that inspires the best of humanity.Why support me? As my endorsement from West Texans for Bernie Sanders and the Official Texans for Bernie Sanders organizations have shown, I want to contribute to a political system that will empower all Americans to thrive in a society that is truly fair and just. Though I have always voted Democrat, I had never been politically engaged. The Political Revolution changed that for me. Like many Americans, I was cynical about politics, but Bernie has given people like myself the optimism to act, and not just to vote. That is the essence of what this campaign is addressing. The message of this movement is about restoring hope and bringing new vibrant individuals into the political process. Help me be one of those individuals at what promises to be a momentous occasion in American history.My National Delegate Campaign Facebook Page

title: Molly's Jaw Surgery (oral cancer)
summary: My name is Molly and I was rescued as a puppy and now working as a hospice therapy dog.  I have been diagnosed with oral squamous cell carcinoma and my life can be prolonged another few years if the infected area of my jaw is removed.  It will take me a few weeks to recover but I know I will be happy to have a second chance at life to continue bringing joy to my friends, family and my hospice patients.  The doctor says I'll still be able to eat, drink, play and give kisses, even with part of my jaw missing.  I need to have X-rays of my chest ($500), jaw surgery to remove the mass ($3,000), and chemo/pain medication throughout recovery ($500-$1,000).  The cancer has not metastisized to my lymph nodes...yet...so, it is important I have this surgery ASAP.  Please help me raise these funds, as I am only 3.5 years old (30 in doggy years), and was hoping to be around many more years.  Xoxo, MollyClick below to watch my video...Molly featured in the Times & Democrat

title: Democratic Delegate Travel Costs
summary:
Hi All! My name is Charlotte Brandt and I live in Eugene, Oregon. On June 18th, at the Oregon Democratic Convention, I was elected to be an at-large delegate alternate for Bernie Sanders at the Democratic National Convention. Travel costs to go to Philadelphia in July, 2016, are  estimated to be an average of $4,500 which includes airfare, hotel, food and other travel incidentals for almost a week.This is my first foray into being a delegate for a presidential candidate. I am a life-long Democrat and have been voting since 1972. I have NEVER been this excited about a candidate before! I took early retirement two years ago for medical reasons and am now living on Social Security, so my sources for funds are limited. I hope you will support me in my life-changing endeavor to participate in the process of our democracy in action. Whether you are a Bernie supporter or not, I ask that you consider donating what you can. Every little bit helps.
Should I be called upon as a voting delegate, my votes will be consistently for Bernie. Even if he releases his delegates to vote for another candidate, I will STILL vote for him. 
It is difficult to explain how important this effort is to me. I have always been an ardent believer in the power of a person's vote. I spent the better part of a year with Lane County for Bernie Sanders helping to lead a team that registered hundreds (some say thousands) of voters for our primary last May.  We like to think that this effort had a lot to do with Bernie winning Lane County by 20%. The power of this movement, the Political Revolution, is gaining momentum and I'm so excited to be on this ride.Thank you so much!!

title: Send Nomi to Organize at the DNC!
summary: Aloha, My name is Nomi Carmona and I'm a community organizer in Hawaii, which is considered "GMO Ground Zero," due to the thousands of open air genetically engineered (GE) field tests conducted here. Our rights to protect our environmental health are under the attack of these billionaire multi-national pesticide companies with exorbitant legal budgets, and that is just a sample stripping of our Democratic rights in comparison to what the Trans Pacific Partnership (TPP) will bring. For 12 countries including the US, making up 40% of the global Gross Domestic Product (GDP) the TPP would be a disastrous trade agreement giving 600 of the world's largest corporations the power to sue taxpayers and entire governments for lost profits if any laws are passed which affect their bottom line. If we were to ban as a nation, Syngenta’s harmful atrazine for example, under the TPP Syngenta would be able to sue the United States for lost profits in a special corporate court! I was just invited to help organize and speak at the 'We Are Seeds Rally to Label GMOs and Stop TPP Now!' during the Democratic National Convention on Wednesday, July 27th at FDR Park in Philadelphia next week. With tens of thousands of demonstrators in town and many of the most politically involved Democrats and activists in the country, this is a huge opportunity to bring light to these difficult issues we face. I will be able to work with organizers and leaders of our movement from around the country to stop the TPP and for true and transparent GMO Labeling. We just got the permits so we just put up the event up so you can check it out at: http://bit.do/WeAreSeedsIt is time for Hawaii born President Obama to be accountable to Hawaii and to United States citizens and veto this fake GMO labeling bill we call the DARK Act (S764.) Obama must recognize the damages of corporate control and cease the advance of TPP. He has so far failed to bring justice for environmental health to Hawaii and we hope that in his final days as President that he will leave a legacy of aloha. Aloha never means poisoning your neighbors, lying to them, stripping their rights to protect themselves, or concealing what is in their food. Unfortunately, in the middle of election season in Hawaii as a grassroots organizer, I cannot afford to get to Philly on my own so I will need your help! Airfare is ranging from about $1500-$2000 and this website takes 7.9% so I am asking for $2k + the percentage GoFundMe takes. I have just a couple of days to raise at least $2,000 for my airfare which rises every day or I cannot purchase my ticket. I will have to miss a week of work and $2k will not cover my expenses, meals, or stay in Philly, so if you want to donate past my goal of $2,000 I absolutely will not object and thank you in advance for your consideration. Any excess I do not use in Philly will support my grassroots work back home. I understand there are a lot of amazing candidates and causes that require our attention, but if we all just pitch in a little bit, we can do this! We are a skin of our teeth, seat of our pants, bottom of the ninth, Hail Mary team on Hawaiian time up against the powerful corporate establishment so, I think we can do this! Would not be the first miracle I have seen for justice.I am hoping to fly out this Saturday, July 23rd so I can help cover the events, and report back home to the grassroots environmental and good food nation about what is going on in Philadelphia and the continental U.S. I will also be reporting live throughout the week for Viva Bernie via livestream, and you will be able to follow via FB.com/VivaBernie2016Please consider making a contribution and sharing this information throughout your networks to help me raise the airfare ASAP! If you are able to help, I do appreciate it very much because I cannot go if I cannot raise the airfare and time is of the essence. Don’t worry I will be back soon to keep helping with Hawaii elections! Mahalo nui for your consideration and malama pono. Best Ever, Nomi CarmonaP.S. (Hawaii Early Walk-In Registration & Voting is August 1st-11th and the Primary is August 13th voters! Time to clean House.)Help spread the word!P.S.S. WHY MUST I GO TO THE DNC IN PHILLY:This is why I must go to Philly and represent Hawaii, our people and our cause on the largest political stage this year.Our community has worked tremendously hard to pass several laws which would provide pesticide disclosure, buffer zones around schools, homes and hospitals, and environmental and health impact monitoring to protect ourselves from the experimental, agrichemical intensive GE agriculture here. However, these companies are suing against these laws in three out of four Hawaii counties for the right to spray toxic poisons next to our schools, homes and hospitals, without disclosure, without health or environmental impact testing. Monsanto and the chemical cartel prefer to sue rather than comply with mandated disclosure and tell us what massive amounts of undisclosed restricted use pesticides, environmental contamination and genetic experimentation is occurring in our communities. Disclosure means scientists can monitor impacts, and Doctors can treat patients exposed to pesticides, it would help us see more precisely what is causing the illness so many residents attribute to the chemical companies. Though many doctors, residents, environmentalists and Hawaiians have serious concerns regarding increasing birth defects, public and environmental health and our land, air and water - we still have no protection from the GE companies because of the ongoing litigation. The companies have given over half a million dollars to our elected officials and engaged in a high powered greenwashing campaign to prevent us from protecting ourselves by rule or law. Syngenta alone exposes our children to dangerous pesticides up to 16 times a day, 65% of days per year on average. We are already experiencing the loss of ability to protect our life, health and property here in GMO Ground Zero due to some of the companies contracted into the TPP using litigation to prevent fair regulation. Stopping the TPP is an urgent matter for Hawaii residents and people of all the 12 countries involved in the TPP if it passes. Compounded by the embattled legal history of the illegally occupied territory of Hawaii, the TPP spells disaster and international corporate control not only for Hawaii, but for all the people that will be affected by this trade agreement. That's one of the many reasons we sprung into action to organize a widely covered protest with dozens of national organizations when the TPP negotiations were held on Maui last summer. Progress was stalled but not for long. The TPP is coming to bring abominable harm to environmental policy, human rights and American jobs unless we band together to stop it. Recently, the Congressional House and Senate passed the DARK Act, a fake GMO labeling bill S764 which awaits President Obama's signature or veto. He absolutely must veto S764 which does not even label most current GMO foods. It uses complicated QR codes which require SmartPhones and signal to identify genetically engineered food, instead of plain labeling on the package. This discriminates against those who cannot afford a SmartPhone or service, and is another attempt by these agrichemical companies and their subsequent profiteers to prevent transparency. Over 100 million rural, low income, and elderly Americans would be denied their right to know about the food they buy and feed their families. Furthermore, this bill would stop state laws which label GMOs after twenty years of failure by the federal government to label GE foods. S764 is the unlabeling of GMOs. President Obama promised to label GMOs in his first Presidential campaign, and has not been pono on that promise. He has not helped us remotely to protect Hawaii from being GMO Ground Zero or label GMO foods, so this is his last chance, he absolutely must veto S764. As an organizer, advocate and Co-Founder of Babes Against Biotech which is the largest grassroots organization in Hawaii tackling GE and pesticide issues, I have a breadth of perspective to offer on these issues. The GE seeds developed in Hawaii are exported, genetically contaminating food crops worldwide, being engineered for experimental herbicide resistance and producing pesticides. Our air, land, water and health is being heavily genetically and chemically contaminated in what is considered the endangered species capital of the world. The TPP will hurt all of us, and it must be stopped. Help me rally the country to stop it,Nomi Carmona

title: Wisconsin 5th CD Bernie Delegate
summary: I am very proud to have been elected as a pledged delegate for Bernie Sanders for the DNC Convention representing the 5th Congressional District of Wisconsin. As a member of the leadership team for Progressive Democrats of America, back in 2013 we started working to convince Bernie to run for President. This July I will proudly be casting my delegate vote for Senator Sanders in fulfillment of the journey we began three years ago. If you are able to help offset the exorbitant costs (it's quite pricey for a guy that works in a garage) of attending the convention, it would be much appreciated.

title: Yami's Road 2 the Convention Fund!
summary: Greetings fellow Berners! My name is Yamina Roland and I am honored to be the top-ranked delegate in California's CD 22! Shortly after moving to the Central Valley, I Co-founded the Fresno Progressives for Bernie Sanders Organizations that have been actively registering voters, distributing Bernie Sanders information and organizing Bernie Sanders volunteers since fall of 2015. My political Focus has always been Black voter education and engagement. I became editor of the African Americans for Bernie Sanders Facebook page in September of last year the page has grown to 25K likes during my tenure. I created the online community Black Berner Coalition, run exclusively by black women, to connect black activist for outreach into communities of color on behalf of Bernie Sanders at the Grassroots level. We're over 10K strong and growing with members in PDA, DFW, elected local officials and the BNC!To the BBC fam: Yall know Imma be writin checks, flashin receipts, snatchin wigs, leavin no edges unsinged and the Petty is packed! I'm so ready....they not!I am a Bernie or Bounce Democrat asking for your support with Transportation costs. I give you my word, I will abstain before I ever vote for Hillary Clinton, under any circumstances, whatsoever. I arrive in Philadelphia in time to attend the People's Convention prior to the DNC convention. I take the role of being The Voice of California voters very seriously. With avocacy for PoC and the disenfranchised  in  everything I do, Thank you in advance for your time and support.

title: Chris Kolski Memorial
summary:
My Dad, Chris Kolski, Died on August 31st 2019 after fighting prostate cancer for 5 years now. This gofundmepage is for his funeral and burial service costs. Please if you can donate what you can we would be so grateful, thank you and God Bless.

Life of Chris Kolski: Krzysztof Jacek Ciesiołkiewicz (Name at Birth) was born in Poland on July 8, 1947- Died in West Hills, California on August 31, 2019.

He legally immigrated to the U.S. in 1959 with his parents.  He became naturalized as U.S. Citizen in 1971. Chris Kolski graduated from UCLA with a Bachelors of Science in Electrical Engineer in 1971 and had been a Registered Electrical Engineer since 1975. He had done electrical engineer consulting and had done work as a Real Estate Investor and Developer.  Chris Kolski was a California Engineering, proprietor since 1986.

He also spent years as a Political Activist:

Campaigned for Proposition 13 with Howard Jarvis, 1978

Founder of Voice for an Independent Poland, 1979

President of Polish American Republican Association of California

Past Member and Treasurer California Republican Heritage Groups Council (CRHGC)

California State Chairman of Poles for Reagan-Bush ’84 

Precinct Captain for Ron Paul Presidential Campaign 2008 & District Campaign Chairman in 2012

Although my father was an American Citizen, he still worked hard to help the Polish Community. He was part of many Polish American Groups: 

My Father was the President of the Polish American Congress Southern California Division, and National Director during 1982-1992.

Major accomplishments during 10 years as President:

Organized many Demonstrations against Martial Law in Poland and in support of “Solidarność” 

Greeted Pope John Paul II in Los Angeles at the old L.A. Cathedral 

Incorporator and Member of the Board Anti-Defamation Committee of California, Inc. PAC 1987-1995 

Organized the Solidarity Runs and Polonia Awards Banquets 

President PAC-SCD Charities; Sent medical equipment and other aid to Poland 

Contacts with Solidarity inside and outside of Poland 

Hosted and MC’d Luncheon with President of Poland Lech Walesa (1000 people in attendance) 

He was a Past President and current Member of the Board of Directors of Polish Center in Los Angeles.

He was also a Past Member of the Board of Directors of POLAM Federal Credit Union.

As well as the President Polish American Community Center of Southern California, Inc. 

Chris Kolski had even run for political offices:

Ran for Congress in the CA 30th Congressional District in 2010

Ran for the Republican Party Central Committee in 2010, and was Elected to the 40th AD RPDC (Republican Party District Committee – West Valley), later elected Chairman

California Republican Party Delegate, since 2010 

Ran for California State Assembly 45th District, and received 41% of the vote in the primary against an incumbent Democrat in 2012

Ran for California State Assembly 45th District in a 2013 special election

Elected to the 45th AD RPDC first served as V. Chair and later elected and served as Chairman (Republican Party District Committee – West Valley 2012 to 2016); 

Chris had also worked as an Occupational Technical Instructor for, Associate Builders and Contractors, ABC Inc. Ventura/L.A. Chapter since 2002 until 2018 when his cancer spread.

As you can see my father had a life full of passion for helping people. Whether it was teaching them as a Career Development Teacher at ABC, Inc or fighting for our freedom through the political process, he had always wanted to give to people. 

He was also been a family man; he got married to my mom and had been married to her for 39 years. He and my mother raise four of us. He now has one grandson and enjoyed spending time with him up until the time when the cancer spread.

My father, Chris died in hospice surrounded by his loved ones.

summary: Hello Friends,Hi, my name is Wendy and I have been elected to be an Alternate Delegate for the North Carolina Delegation to the Democratic National Convention. title: Let's Run an Anti-Trump Ad
summary: I'm an average guy from New Jersey, and just like you I loathe Donald Trump for a million reasons.But I'm sick of just fuming. I want to do something about this toxic hairclown: I want to run an anti-Trump newspaper ad in New Hampshire two days before the primary. (Because why should super PACs, corporations and labor unions have all the political advertising fun?) And I need your help. I've got a few half-page ads comped up*. (See below. ) I want to run one of them The Concord Monitor, the largest paper in Merrimack County, New Hampshire on Sunday, February 7th (the New Hampshire primary is on Tuesday, February 9th). The cost for a half-page ad that day is $1,530, and that's what I'm asking for.  To get the ad in the paper, we need to have it submitted on  Tuesday, February 2nd. So that's the deadline.Why do I want to do this? The same reason you do: You're losing sleep over what this gibbering hypocrite is doing to our already pretty messed up political system, and if you could reach out to just one person who's thinking of voting for him, and change their mind, you might get some rest. The  circulation of the The Concord Monitor is 22,000. And there are over 29,000 registered Republicans in the county. I know we can get one of them to think twice. So look at the ads, tell me what you think, and then donate $5 to help save America. * Why do all of these ads attack Trump from the right? Why not just call him a bigot?Of course he is a bigot. And so much more. But my thought process is this: The people who might vote for Trump already know about his irreponsible statements, and that's kind of why they like him: He says things no one else will say, so he must not be a regular, wishy-washy Republican. So calling him a bigot only plays to his strength as an outsider. But what will get a conservative voter to think twice is the fact that Trump is aaaanything but conservative: He really likes Democrats, Hillary Clinton and government handouts. So the ads go after that.

title: Help SD Young Dems get to SF!
summary: Hi, Codi Vierra here (again)! As the South State Regional Director for the California Young Democrats, it's my job to make sure that our local chapters are represented at the California Young Democrats meetings, the next of which is taking place in San Francisco, May 31st - June 2nd, in conjunction with the California Democratic Party Convention meeting. That's pretty far from San Diego! We're the largest region in the state at 31 chapters (the next closest has only 16!), and the vast majority of our chapters are made up of high school and college students who don't necessarily have the funds or means to participate in a lot of these meetings or events. I'm fundraising to pay for hotel rooms and transportation (again, San Francisco is pretty far from San Diego!). We're squeezing, but it still looks like it'll come out to around $115/person just for the hotel, let alone transportation, registration fees, etc. Not everyone can afford this, and it shouldn't be a barrier to participating. If we raise more than needed, then this money will go toward paying for the Summer Eboard, Tahoe Retreat, and/or Fall Convention. This money raised on GoFundMe will not be used to make campaign contributions or for other political activities. If we don't raise enough, then I'll be picking up the tab, so every bit helps! Find out more here: https://www.cydsouthstate.org/If you would like to make a donation to this cause from a political campaign/PAC, please email codivierra@gmail.com and will@cayoungdems.com.With deep appreciation,Codi VierraSouth State Regional Director,California Young Democrats
