People excited by the possibilities of political action, not disappointed by what the corporate media tells them to think. I need your vote to make that happen. I need your help to spread the word and tell people that this was never just about one candidate, one office, and one election cycle.I know how to work within the Democratic Party to enact change. I’ve done it. I know how to build external party groups and use them to expand the outreach efforts of the party to the progressive movement as well as push issue positions and policy ideas from the larger movement into the party. I’ve done it. I know how to teach people to answer the three core questions of an activist: “What decision is being made?”, “Who is making that decision?”, and “How can I influence that decision?” Answers to those three questions are what drive change.In 2008 the slogan was “Yes we can”. In 2016, it’s “Oh Yes We Will”. No matter what they say, we’re going to build a world that our children can grow up in. We’re going to build a future.Together.

title: Get WI Bernie Delegate To Philly!
summary: Hello! I am Cathy Brandstetter of Kenosha, WI and I need your help to get to Philadelphia in July! Who knew democracy was so expensive??I have been elected as a Pledged Bernie delegate for WI CD-1, and the reality of this is just sinking in. I booked the airline ticket ($300) and am waiting for information on how to book the hotel (5 nights @ $350 p/night). I'm adding an additional $950 for food and incidentals. I will try to find a roommate, and adjust the goal accordingly if I find someone.I have admired Bernie for many years and began working for his campaign last July, locally with the Kenosha For Bernie group (arranging debate watch parties, canvassing, etc.) and as a “super volunteer” with the national campaign. I spend many hours a week behind the scenes in Support and Lead roles, doing data entry (processing volunteers in VAN) and interacting with the Bernie Dialer, both as Dialer  Monitor (releasing numbers for callers to connect to voters) and as Pilot a/k/a Calling Program Volunteer Coordinator, “flying the plane”. I also provided support housing for a couple of weeks to out-of-state campaign volunteers while they worked in Kenosha to deliver the county to Bernie. I walk the walk! And I love helping other people help Bernie!I possess a strong ability to “herd cats”; gathering and inspiring diverse individuals into groups and setting them on a path for a common cause. This talent would be particularly useful in a contested convention scenario, but I believe Bernie will win the nomination. My convictions are strong; I will not be swayed by less-progressive Democrats and their hollow, status-quo policy promises.As you can see from the photo, I’ve got Bernie’s back! I hope I can count on you to have mine and help me get to Philly to nominate Bernie Sanders as our Presidential candidate!This is the YUUUUUUGest opportunity I've ever had to really help make a difference in all of our lives and in our world's future! I will be taking each and every one of you along in my heart, and will provide frequent updates via my FB page!

title: We must BEAT CLINTON !
summary: I am a Bernie Sanders Pledged Delegate for the 2016 Democratic National Convention. My name is Kathleen Burke. Please follow link for credentials.24-29 July, 2016 I will be attending the Democratic National Convention in Philadelphia. I would like your help to make the trip. I am a hard working Berner, trailblazing right alongside Bernie. I have spent many hours campaigning for Bernie in New Mexico and now preparing for the Convention. Any help you might offer would be greatly appreciated.  We just got word today that the hotel rooms in which we are required to stay cost $430. per night. I will be sharing a room with my Delegation Whips from New Mexico. We are trying to cut costs as much as possible!If you are a Berner or a Democrat wanting to save the party, please contribute. Thank you!

title: Our HERO
summary: The most horrific words you could ever hear: your Mother, Sister, Wife or Daughter  has been brutally attacked by a predator, her body mutilated, raped and tortured, and then left for dead.  Only by posting on Facebook in the desperate hope that someone, anyone, would see her plea for help, did rescue finally come.  This is the reality for a beautiful member of our community;  she had taken out a restraining order on an old boyfriend who frightened her and threatened her life.  She tried to protect herself by being safe and smart, but this monster had a plan.  What followed was hours of rape, torture and eventually, multiple slashes to her face and body.  As a therapist, she tried her best to talk the man down, even while her face drained of blood from multiple slashes and her nose nearly severed.  She was near death when her dogs began to bark.  The attacker left the room to see why, and this brave and amazing woman grabbed the only thing near, her iPad, and locked herself in the bathroom.  Not having a phone, she took to social media, pleading for someone to call 911, posting a picture of herself to prove this was no joke.  Even at such a late hour, friends were online and began frantically calling emergency numbers to save her, and thankfully, saved she was.  Miraculously she made it to the hospital where multiple surgeries and hundreds of stitches patched her face and body back together.  The attacker was caught and we can only hope he will rot in prison- but the real battle for this miraculous woman has just begun.  After seeing her face today, stitched slashes running across her face, she fell into grief, thinking herself too awful to look at; could she ever return to her job caring for others?? Was a life dedicated to providing mental health care to families and youth in need, working hand in hand with other community services to provide help to those who were helpless and hope to the hopeless over now??  She worked tirelessly for our most vulnerable age group, our youth, who depend on her to dole out loving advice, care and hope during their darkest hours. And now we need to help this amazing soul in hers.  We support our troops, our police, our firemen, our nurses, our community members that uplift our souls saved our lives and care for us when there's no one else- we call them our HEROS.  Rarely do we have the chance to give back to our heroes, to show them that we do appreciate, love and honor them, to show them THIER LIVES MATTER.  Now we can help this heroic woman in her urgent time of need. We are asking for $175,000 to use towards the extensive plastic surgery needed to repair this beautiful person's face. She didn't deserve what happened to her, and she doesn't deserve to live a life reminded of the brutality done against her every time she faces a mirror.  Evil cannot be allowed to triumph!!We are not going to post pictures-trust that it is just too graphic. In the attack, her face was slashed repeatedly, nose nearly severed, tendons and nerves destroyed, bones broken.  It is also inconceivable to expect a victim of such brutality to go back to the home where she was attacked and sleep in the bed where she was tortured, so some of the funds will go towards setting her up a new household while she recovers.  She saved her life using Facebook, now we can help save her future.  Thank you all so much for the outpouring of love and support you have shown already your generosity means more than you will ever know and our appreciation is endless for that.http://fox40.com/2015/05/15/woman-uses-facebook-to-escape-attacker/http://m.appeal-democrat.com/news/prior-to-attack-she-feared-for-her-life/article_2403be3a-fdec-11e4-932f-ab3dcfdb6758.html?mode=jqmhttp://m.appeal-democrat.com/news/prior-to-attack-she-feared-for-her-life/article_2403be3a-fdec-11e4-932f-ab3dcfdb6758.html?mode=jqmhttp://m.appeal-democrat.com/news/prior-to-attack-she-feared-for-her-life/article_2403be3a-fdec-11e4-932f-ab3dcfdb6758.html?mode=jqm

title: Support NDP Delegates to the DNC
summary: Democracy is a government By The People.  Economic means should not be a barrier to citizens being involved and engaged.Please help us raise money to support the Delegates from the Nebarska Democractic Party to the Democratic National Convention in Philedelphia.Nebraska will have the opportunity to send a Delegation of 30 Delegates and 2 Alternates to the convention. Of those, 5 will be Unpledged Party Leaders and Elected Officials (PLEOs), aka superdelegates.  This campaign is to raise funds to support the 27 (non-super) Delegates and Alternates traveling to the DNC to represent all Nebraska Democrats.  This includes Pledged Delegates for both Secretary Hillary Clinton, and Senator Bernie Sanders.The expected cost for attending the DNC, including airfare travel, hotel accomedations, and daily expenses, can be several thousand dollars.  The goal of this campaign is to raise enough to offer a $500 stipdend to support each of the 27 representatives.  Whatever funds are raised will be divided evenly between the 27 non-PLEO Delegates and Alternates.   EVERY Delegate will be, regardless of their prefered Pledged Presidential nominee candidate.  If the campaign exceeds $13,500, after covering the GFM costs of the campaign, any additional funds will be donated directly to the Nebraska Democratic Party.About the campaign founder:Scott Williams is a resident of Omaha, NE, CD2, LD7.  He participated in the Nebraska Democratic Caucuses, was an Alternate Delegate to the Douglas County Convention, and was selected to be a Delegate to the State Convention in Kearney.  He has submitted his name as a candidate for District Level and also At-Large National Delegate.  Scott is proud to make the first contribution to this campaign himself, in the amount of $27. Regardless of whether he is personally selected, all of the funds of this campaign will be donated.DISCLAIMER:  This campaign is NOT endorsed, supported, or in any other way officially affiliated with the Nebraska Democratic Party, the Democratic National Committee, or any other organization or entity.  It is operated By The People, For The People.

title: Sebesta for Secretary of State of Kentucky
summary:
UPDATE THE THIRD:  (the second update is on the update tabs if you want to see it)

I'm in the race and running fast!   For the last month I've been criss-crossing the state, speaking with every group that I can, knocking on doors, talking to people in the line at the grocery store and basically doing everything I can to get the message out.  When I started this race I thought it would be a simple matter of repeating that felons need the right to vote for three months.  Since then I've realized that what I'm offering is a lot simpler and a lot more important.

I'm publishing ALL correspondence when I'm in office.  ALL of it.  If the Secretary of State knows it, you will know it.  If I get an email, it goes on the web.  When I respond, it goes on the web.  When I get a letter or a memo, it get scanned and posted.  If somebody tells me I can't publish something, then I go on the web and tell you who told me that and what authority they have to say so.  No exceptions.  Perfect 21st century transparency.This has two major implications:

A)  There's no reason why any other official or candidate can't make the exact same promise, and in fact, some of them are starting to.  The more people I can tell about this, the more I can awaken Kentucky's latent desire to truly know what's going on, to have the information available so that we can decide for ourselves what is best for ourselves.  This is truly what I'm campaigning for.  This is what I'm accomplishing.  I'm not just offering 21st century transparency for myself, I'm asking for you to want it for yourself.  I'm asking for you to offer it.  I'm asking for you to demand it.

B)  "The Secretary of State shall keep a fair register of and attest all the official acts of the Governor"--Kentucky Constitution, Section 91.If it's in the office, it's official.  This means that I will use literally every power at my disposal, granted to me by the Kentucky Constitution, to publish literally everything that I can from the Governor's office.  No more secret deals.  If I'm working with a governor who respects the people, like Young or Adkins, then I can promise the most transparent state government in the history of this and any other state.  If I'm working with an adversarial governor, like that low-rent bargain-basement teacher-hating hack we have right now, then I will be in his office, in his face, every single day, saying, "What's that?  Can I print that?  What's on this post-it note?  You don't mind that I'm livestreaming this, do you?  You better not."

So please, donate, distribute, and volunteer.  When you donate, you help me amplify this message.  You help me tell everybody in Kentucky, "Hey, you want this too.  This is what we all want.  Ask for what we want."

 

Oh and also I've decided to design my campaign to be perfectly congruent with libertarian and socialist principles, because I can.  I'm running for an executive position without budget authority, which makes it easier, but the way I'll run the office will be in no way against the principles of either the libertarian* or socialist** movements; I'm running to return power to the people, I refuse all coercion, I refuse all secrecy, I am all for minimizing regulation and government overreach whenever possible, I will not in any way attempt to increase the budget of my office, and my voting rights platform is exponentially more ambitious and egalitarian than all the other candidates on both sides combined.  I'm still running as a Democrat, I'm just a Democrat who's willing to admit that libertarians and socialists exist and that we are willing to work to earn their votes.

I edited the campaign goal from $500 to $2500 because I could do some really cool stuff with about $2000.  Time's running  a bit short for my campaign to make a million dollars but I'm doing well with what I've got.

In the interests of transparency, here's what the last $90 went to:

Gas money for Boyd, Madison, Clark, Rowan, Powell, Bullitt (twice), Jefferson, (three times), Scott, Woodford, Franklin (three times) and soon Owen, Oldham, and Fulton counties.About a hundred tiny plastic Kentucky tokens (biodegradable PLA plastic, contact me on the website (s4sos.politicsky.org) if you want one)$20 of Facebook ads (hopefully starting today, Facebook has a weird verification process for political candidates, I'll let you know how it goes)

*  To the extent that libertarians agree with each other about their own principles.

**  The same as the libertarians except far moreso.

 

------------------

UPDATE:  I'm in the race!  Thank you very much for your donations, in the interest of transparency I'll tell you what I used them for:

$500 for filing fee$20 for business cards$25 for new toner cartridges for the printer

I am running because I want to stand on stage and talk about early voting, re-enfranchising felons, ranked-choice voting, modern voting security, and government transparency.

I am in the Democratic primary.  There are at three other people running.  The winner will almost certainly be the person who spends the most money.  Let's not have any illusions about that.  But running has a value all its own.  A good campaign is worthwhile in and of itself.

I can't promise that I'll win; that will depend on donors, voters, and fate.  But I can make darn sure that we talk about early voting, about same-day party registration for our closed primary state, about returning the right to vote to felons, about reforming first-past-the-post voting, about blockchain voting security, about the responsibility for perfect governmental transparency in every department, and about the unique genius of the Constitution of the Commonwealth of Kentucky.

It costs $500 to run for office in Kentucky.  All donations up to $500 were be used for the filing fee, all donations past $500 will be used for promotion of the campaign.  I strongly intend to run the campaign with the coolest swag.My campaign web page is s4sos.politicsky.org .

Thank you very much for your consideration.

title: Orange County NCGOP Arson Repair
summary: A North Carolina Republican Party office in Orange County was firebombed overnight, causing major damage and destruction. Thankfully, there was no loss of life. The explosive device was thrown through the window of the office, and the words, “Nazi Republicans, leave town or else,” were painted on a nearby building. Thousands of dollars in campaign materials was lost in addition to furniture, supplies and electronic equipment. While the fire did not destroy the building there was significant fire and smoke damage that will be both costly and time consuming to repair.We ask that you please give all that you can to help with repairs and replacement of inventory so that we can continue sharing the conservative story that we truly believe can help all American's discover and acheive a better way of life.“Whether you are Republican, Democrat, or Independent, all Americans should be outraged by this hate-filled and violent attack against our democracy,” said Dallas Woodhouse, executive director of the North Carolina Republican Party. “Whether the bomb was meant to kill, destroy property, or intimidate voters, everyone in this country should be free to express their political viewpoints without fear for their own safety. We will be requesting additional security at all Republican Party offices and events between now and Election Day to ensure the safety of our activists, volunteers, and supporters. We will not be deterred by this hate crime."I am a volunteer and have created this account on behalf of the NCGOP.  I have passed fund withdrawing power directly to the NCGOP communications team.These funds will specifically be used to provide materials and labor to repair the building and replace the damaged property.At the end of the campaign, the NCGOP will deliver the funds to the Orange County Office.

title: Jan's Trip to Dem Nat'l Convention
summary: I have two passions in life--politics and travel. That is why I am so excited about my upcoming trip to Philadelphia for this year’s historic Democratic National Convention. I am Jan Bauer, Chair of the Story County Democratic Party of Iowa and have served in this position since 1996. However, my time in the Party dates back even further to 1980 when I was the Democratic Voters’ Program Coordinator for Story County between graduating from Iowa State University with a bachelor’s degree in political science and starting graduate school in public administration at ISU. Since then I have contributed in many different ways to elect Democrats up and down the ticket. In 1992, I worked on Tom Harkin’s presidential bid, attended the Democratic National Convention on his behalf; and then returned home to work on Bill Clinton’s successful election campaign. During the 2008 presidential caucuses, I volunteered for Barack Obama and went to the National Convention as an Obama delegate. After President Obama was elected, I continued to promote his agenda, working as a community organizer for Organizing for America. As a result, President Obama appointed me to serve as an at-large member of the Democratic National Committee in 2009. In this last caucus cycle, I supported Hillary Clinton's historic run for President of the United States; and I am thrilled to attend this year's history-making convention as an At-Large Member of the DNC, supporting Hillary Clinton. Given that the Iowa delegation wound up with an extremely expensive hotel, I have looked for alternative lodging.  Because of my mobility challenges, however, there just isn't another room available that will work for me. For thirty-some years, I have helped raise money to elect Democrats.  Candidates from the courthouse to the White House have benefited from my efforts.  I am now asking for donations to help fund my exorbitantly expensive accommodations in Philadelphia.Thank you for your support!

title: The Campaign to Free Eddie Carthan
summary: The state auditor is demanding Holmes County Supervisor Eddie J. Carthan repay more than $184,000 — the salary, interest and other related compensation —  he has received since being elected to that position in 2015, because the attorney general’s office said Carthan can’t legally hold the seat. Carthan told the Clarion Ledger on Monday that he was "surprised and shocked" when he received the demand letter. "I didn't certify myself and I have ran five times for office," Carthan said. The letter, issued April 17, gives Carthan 30 days to satisfy the demand or the case will be turned over to the attorney general's office.More than 40 years ago, Carthan made national headlines when he won an election in the tiny town of Tchula to become the first black mayor in the Mississippi Delta since Reconstruction. He then went up against the town’s white elite in an extraordinary battle that ended with him being convicted of felony assault and tried for the murder of one of his political rivals.Tensions came to a head in 1980, when the police chief stepped down and Hayes engineered the appointment of a white businessman named Jim Andrews. Carthan recruited six men, including several police officers, to confront Andrews and tell him to step aside. Andrews refused and sustained minor injuries in an ensuing scuffle.The mayor was charged with assaulting a police officer who stood with Andrews that day. The officer later told reporters in a TV interview that Carthan had been set up. A white judge nonetheless sentenced Carthan to three years in prison, and Carthan was forced to leave office in 1981. Then-Gov. William Winter, a Democrat who championed racial justice, took notice. In the spring of 1983, Winter suspended the rest of Carthan’s assault sentence and sent him on to federal prison. A legal team led by former U.S. attorney general Ramsey Clark sought Carthan’s release, and a federal judge freed him after just eight months. We are raising funds to relaunch the Campaign to Free Eddie Carthan. The funds will be used for lawyer fees and to spread the word of the injustices in Mississippi. Your donation will not only help with lawyer fees, it will educate people around the world how Eddie Carthan was framed. People from all around the world came to Holmes County to support Eddie Carthan because they knew this was a political plot to destroy Carthan and deter other blacks hoping to seek office. Please share this stories with others. Invite us to your school, church or city to hear Mr. Carthan's first hand account. Email drcarthan@yahoo.com. Thanks for your support. #FreeEddieCarthan #IstandwithCarthan #MississippionTrial Sources:https://www.latimes.com/nation/la-na-mississippi-holmes-county-eddie-carthan-20190426-story.htmlhttps://www.clarionledger.com/story/news/politics/2019/04/30/eddie-carthan-holmes-county-mississippi-supervisor-repay-salary-felony-auditor-attorney-general-law/3620192002/https://www.nytimes.com/1982/11/05/us/jury-clears-a-former-mayor-in-mississippi-killing-of-foe.htmlhttps://www.washingtonpost.com/national/a-man-elected-before-his-time-in-mississippi-gives-politics-one-more-go/2015/08/03/67ca61bc-356b-11e5-8e66-07b4603ec92a_story.html?utm_term=.6c4495a24363

title: Support Ed Hall to the 2016 DNC
summary:
Fellow Lefties / Friends, I am excited to announce that I was elected to the National Credentials Committee of the Democratic National Convention - one of three Colorado members on the committee!   I intend to ensure that all credentials issues are resolved in a transparent manner and that our decisions are in keeping with the open-arms, big tent values of the Democratic Party.   Given the incredible numbers of new participants in our Party's nominating process and the sometimes confusing delegate selection system I expect the National Credentials Committee will have a good amount of work to do!I am honored to be chosen for this office and while I am excited to be attending this convention, the cost of attending borders on the preposterous...with hotel costs alone of well over $2,000, the total with airfare and other costs will be at Republican shindig levels.  So, I am asking for your help to defray some of the expense.  I expect my total outlay will be around $4,000, in part because I must be on site for an entire week - the Credentials Committee meets a few days before the Convention starts and then remains seated throughout the Convention.
I appreciate any gift of support you can make, whether it have the dour countenance of George Washington, the smiling face of Ben Franklin, or somewhere in between :)
Thank you for all you do.  Forward Democrats!

title: Get Trinity to Philly
summary: Hello, I'm Trinity and I am honored to have been elected to represent the state of Washington as a  Bernie Sanders Delegate at the upcoming Democratic National Convention in Philadelphia.  I am a living example of what Bernie Sanders talks about when speaking on income inequality, health care, and the cost of higher education, for these are  all issues that resonate with me.I am a progressive, feminist, Latina that grew up on welfare, a single mother, and first college graduate in my family.  My father was from Mexico City and my maternal grandparents and great grandparents were migrant farm workers, so my mother was born in Iowa, but was raised in Mexico.  I am dedicated and fully committed to getting Senator Bernie Sanders into the White House as our 45th President of the United States of America. I have phonebanked, registered voters, canvassed, collected Surrogate Affidavits for the WA caucus, attended Bernie Campaign organizational and training meetings in person, on-line, and via conference calls; served as a Bernie Caucus Site Leader, and was present all caucuses and conventions in this presidential cycle and arrived early and left late due to helping as a volunteer.  I've helped start and am an Administrator for two Facebook pages, "WA State Latinos con Bernie Sanders" and "WA LD39 Progressive Democrats" which serve the purpose of uniting and informing. I have attended Democratic Party meetings at the county and legistrative district levels and will continue to do so as a member and as a Precinct Commitee Officer.I am once again a Democrat because of Bernie Sanders. I strongly believe in enviornmental justice and social, political, and economic equality for all.  Our power is in our numbers, and united we can get corporate money out of politics, for that is at the root of our country's problems.I am absolutely thrilled to be a Bernie Sanders Delegate. I am here to humbly ask for your support with the funds needed to proudly represent Washington at the DNC in Philadelphia. All funds will be used for airfare and transportation, hotel accomodations, and meals associated with the DNC convention expenses.In the event that the funds raised exceed the costs incurred, any overages will be donated to local Bernicrats, remembering that change starts from the bottom up!Gracias, y si se puede!

title: Thousands of Bernie Delegates Unite
summary: Thousands of Bernie Sanders supporters from all over the country are uniting to send their delegates to the DNC Convention in Philadelphia.The trip will cost most attendees $2500 dollars minimum for the one week event (hotel costs alone). Delegates are to stay in the vicinity of the ironic Wells Fargo Center, which is very expensive. Hotels in the area have raised their prices by 400% most Sanders Delegates are young and just starting their lives making this all the more difficult. As of today I have raised $250 for this epic trip to save the country and still need $1250 to cover the costs I did not save for. When we ran to become delegates they told us we would be responsible for travel and hotel expenses however I think $2500+ is a lot to pay for our right to vote. So until we can get these laws changed and have publically funded elections, we really need the Bernie supporters to step up and help out. We are in the final stretch and on the verge of making history. Let's finish strong!  A little about Matthew:Matthew Killen came from Weatherford Texas, better known as the quarter horse and peaches Capital of Texas. Although the small town had all the charm of a Bible Belt village, the town also had all the hallmarks of big city problems. Weatherford was an excellent teacher to Matthew and a great place for people making the best future they can with what they have and the people they love. Those formidable years would shape him forever as he watched his Mom fight her way out of homelessness, literally. Anna Jerez was a karate teacher with a dream and the personal fortitude to look at herself in the mirror and tell herself she’s worth more, that she is unique and that she could help others. Her instructor Pat Burleson reached out and let her stay in a horse letting her do whatever she liked to it to make herself comfortable. One night she had a dream that her family and her students gathered all of their resources and built a giant karate dojo for them all to use. The next day she got to work putting her - vision to organizing - and invited all of her students out to help her build her dream. She told them if they helped, she would teach them karate for free, for the rest of their life and the rest, is history. Anna now lives on two acres, she owns with her husband, and now has several schools around the Dallas Fort Worth area with her now husband, Pat Burleson and Matthew’s brothers Luke and Chad Killen. During that time a lot of the home responsibilities were placed on Matthew’s shoulders as well as his other two brothers. His father, Richard Killen, worked grueling hours in various aeronautical establishments but still made time to cook dinner every night, tell jokes and rant on politicians that came on TV. The brothers would have to commit to schoolwork and chores without supervision, which didn't always happen. These days Richard’s hard work has paid off and he is now a lead inspector at Lockheed Martin. On September 11th 2001 Matthew was taking his GED to formally drop out of high school. He wanted to join the military however they changed their requirements from a GED to a HSD and he was also arrested several times for not paying ticket fines. In a town that small you don’t get away with anything, especially being a Puerto Rican in Texas. Matthew has a history with the police in his small town, they knew him by name. One day his Dad was driving Matthew’s car alone when he was pulled over for a “spot check.” Richard was surprised to be pulled over and even more surprised were the police to find Richard and not Matthew in the car. Richard knew that Matthew was telling the truth all along about being harassed by the police. When Richard came home he told Matthew what happened and apoligised. Matthew’s only option to go to Job Corps and spend 3-6 months there to show the Navy he was serious about joining the military, so he took it. When he finished, it was the first time he wore a cap and gown, but it wouldn’t be the last as Matthew likes to say, “success is addictive.”  In the US Navy BM3 (SW) Killen saw the vast cultures of humanity. He was constantly having his good ol’ Texas paradigm challenged. Matthew immersed in the cultures of Europe and South America which built his own personal perspective on the world. As he walked the streets of Colombia on his last deployment, he never knew it would be his last. (Earlier in 2008 he fell down a ladder well which caused a back injury and severe insomnia but he got by.) The next night in the Cartagena Bay, the number four diesel generator seized causing a massive fire. A combination of the already provoking insomnia mixed with rotating watch cycles and days with no sleep was taking it’s toll. Matthew was on watch while they were waiting for orders and hallucinated he told his medical officer and was honorably medically discharged in April of that year. After getting out of the Navy Matthew felt some regret, regret that he didn’t do more to help change the Navy for the better. He complained about his back pain several times to no avail and just kept pushing his limits. On top of that they took away their “day sleeper cards” because one person lost one, there was no time to sleep. Matthew says the math wasn’t there for anyone to get decent sleep. There were three - five hour - watch sections so every fifteen hours you were on watch on top of your work day. He thought maybe if he would have went up the ladder, he could have made a change but it was too late, he was already out. Matthew knew that some people didn’t take him seriously because of his crooked teeth so he put himself through braces at Jacksonville University, he fell in love with the campus and hoped to one day attend but he knew with a GED that it was a long shot. After getting out of the Navy Matthew went to Florida State College at Jacksonville, a large junior college with campuses around Jacksonville, he met some good people, learned a lot and started to find his place in the civilian world. He graduated and his parents couldn’t be more proud as he was the first person in his entire family to go to college. He applied to several schools and was beside himself when Jacksonville University sent the letter of acceptance. While at Jacksonville University Matthew studied Public Relations and Film, worked on the Organizing for America Campaign for President Obama, was the campaign manager for Ramon Day for City Council, started three companies, and even went on tour with the band Slightly Stoopid as a videographer. Matthew set up charters and clubs for The Young Dems,The Tiger Bay Club and The University Law review writing constitutions for each one himself. Matthew was on the Dean’s List and graduated Jacksonville University, Zeta Phi Eta, balling his eyes out like a hungry baby with his entire family together by his side. In July of 2015, Matthew and a few of Jacksonville’s most talented game changers started the Jacksonville for Bernie Sanders Campaign, to fight for progressive ideas in their city. Through which they have gained thousands of progressive volunteers information and are working with now to elect a new government. Matthew is often heard in the news talking about turning Duval to Bluval! Matthew is currently working as a public relations consultant for new media at his company Killen Media LLC and the Communications Director for the Jacksonville Young Democrats. Matthew is running to be a PLEO Delegate for Bernie Sanders in May 2016. Will you help send him?

title: Bernie Sanders National Delegates
summary: Hello Friends, Family and Political Enthusiasts,My fiance and I (Janee Pousson and Daniel Garcia) have been elected as Arizona national delegates for Bernie Sanders to the Democratic National Convention in Philadelphia this year!  This is a huge honor for both of us but there is one little hiccup.  We are getting married in September and saving every dime this summer to pay for it.  We are both public prosecutors with lots of student loans, so our expendable funds are minimal. Thus, we can't afford to go to the DNC without raising money. Hopefully, this situation will change when Bernie helps to eliminate student debt ;)  Until that day comes we need your help.  We need to pay for overpriced flights, $500 a night hotel rooms and an occassional ration of food (don't worry Janee doesn't eat much).  As you can imagine, prices went way up in Philadelphia due to DNC being there for a week.  If you can contribute any amount will help. Bernie would probably recommend $27 or $270 or really any variaton of the numbers 2 and 7.  Because many other delegates in Arizona will be raising money the same way, I am making a special shout out to all our friends across the country who always ask Janee and I "when are you going to run for something?" (you know who you are).  Well we ran for something, won and now we have to pay for it! Finally, we are going to the DNC to cast our votes for Bernie Sanders and to represent his platform. However, there may be a time that we have to focus on creating party unity to defeat Donald Trump in the general election.  I hope you all appreciate how important that is to our country.  Janee and I believe we are great voices of reason when it comes to this issue.  Additionally, we have an extremely important US Senate race and US Congressional races in Arizona and we intend to ensure the DNC is aware of that fact and that Donald Trump will put Arizona in play for the Democrats in the presidential election.  Thus, we will be doing a lot more than just attending the convention.*We must abide by the following rules for Janee and I to fundraise together as National Delegates for Bernie Sanders. See below.*Federal Rules for Fundraising:http://www.fec.gov/pages/brochures/delegate.shtml#committeeDNC Philadelphia 2016:http://www.discoverphl.com/visit/DNC-2016-in-Philadelphia/?gclid=CjwKEAjwya-6BRDR3p6FuY2-u3MSJAD1paxTPx4mvdveVEnpTwMPFAeZ0uf1qGcSceAwxBFaioumGhoCzIHw_wcB

title: Keep the FCDW on the air!
summary: The Franklin County Democratic Women need funding to have a bi-monthly radio show every 2nd and 4th Thursday morning on WCDT 106.9 FM and 1340AM, broadcast all over Franklin County.   It costs $90/show, so will cost the party $180/month.   Many people listen to the radio as they get ready for work in the morning, and this is an excellent chance to get our message out.  If you miss the show, we will be posting a link on SoundCloud, which will be posted on Facebook.  Please help us keep this show on the air, so that people can learn what Democrats stand for on healthcare, the minimum wage, education, privatization, and other issues. To hear a sample of prior shows, go to  https://soundcloud.com/user-5173887/fcdw-on-wcdt-112315

title: Fund Anti-Ted Nugent Billboard
summary:
My wife and I have experienced the horrific effects of gun violence. In 2015 our daughter Alison was gunned down on live television while reporting for WDBJ7 in Roanoke, Virginia—her home, and a place she loved.  Since that time I have become a passionate and outspoken advocate for gun violence prevention. 

I was horrified to learn that The Berglund Center in Roanoke will be presenting NRA board member and has-been musician Ted Nugent on July 17, 2018 for a "concert".

Nugent is a disgusting human being. He smeared feces on himself and did hard drugs before a draft physical for Vietnam to avoid serving his country. He adopted a 17 year-old girl from Hawaii so he could have sex with her when he was 30. He's said, "Apartheid isn't that cut and dried. All men are not created equal."

Recently, Nugent said that the Parkland student-survivors who have advocated for stronger gun laws "have no soul." Then he went on Alex Jones' show and compared Democrats, reporters, academics, celebrities and "half of government" to "rabid coyotes" and told his fans "every time you see one, you shoot one."

By hosting this reprobate, the Berglund Center is telling victims and survivors of gun violence in Roanoke "We don't care about you." They're also putting a man on stage who is known to promote and provoke violence. It's a cruel and negligent decision by the Berglund Center.

I want to do everything I can to shame the Berglund Center, so I am launching a #BoycottBerglund campaign that will start with a three-sided, jumbo mobile billboard that will drive through downtown Roanoke during the  work day on July 2 and 3.

Below you will see the following photos: 1) An example of the jumbo billboard truck we are using, 2) Side 1 of our Nugent billboard, 3) Side 2 of our Nugent billboard. The rear panel on the truck will simply say #BoycottBerglund vertically.

This striking mobile billboard will appear in downtown Roanoke two weeks before Nugent's concert date. That will get the Roanoke community and media talking about the #BoycottBerglund campaign.  Dan Casey of The Roanoke Times has already done two stories in advance. More media will follow.

Will you help me offset the costs of this mobile billboard? The billboard costs just $2,000 for a total of 16 hours (8 hours each day). I also incurred $100 in costs for the design of the billboard.

Please help if you can by clicking the DONATE NOW button on this page and making a contribution! It doesn't matter if its $5 or $50. Every donation helps.

I want to send a message to the Roanoke community—to all of our communities—that Ted Nugent is not fit for polite company. NO ONE should be hosting this violent creep for any type of event, PERIOD.  After decades of his racism, misogyny, homophobia, anti-Semitism, and violent threats, we don't owe him a stage.  Especially in Alison's home.  

Thank you for being part of this effort! I believe Berglund Center is going to hear us loud and clear. WE CAN DO THIS. Let's show Berglund that Roanoke deserves better.

title: Help Send Me To The Dem Convention!
summary: Fellow Progressives,My name is Kristi Lara. I was elected as a National Delegate from TX to represent Bernie Sanders at this year's Democratic National Convention in Philadelphia. This will be my first time attending a convention as an "official delegate". I am asking for your help to fund my trip to the DNC.  As many of you know, going as an "official delegate" is extremely expensive. Political participation at this level is often limited for those of us who are in the 99%. Our DNC assigned hotel room is over $500 a night. Many of us are sharing rooms to cut down on expenses. This does not include our flight or food.   We will be in Philadelphia for 5 days. This year I will be attending the DNC in honor of Ms. Fannie Lou Hamer and all civil rights activists who stood up  to the DNC in 1964.￼￼Fannie Lou Hamer - stood up to the DNC and fought vigorously alongside Student Nonviolent Coordinating Committee (SNCC) lunch counter protestors and the  Mississippi Freedom Democratic Party (MFDP) against segregation.  Ms. Hamer helped give me the inspiration to follow Bernie to the DNC. I believe our work now is a continuation of their work. We are standing up for what we believe in. We are demanding justice for all Americans regardless of race or class; not just for the millionaires and billionaires.  In  the early sixties, Bernie was a civil rights activists and  member of the Congress for Racial Equality (CORE) and SNCC. Bernie was arrested for protesting  segregation. He walked across the bridge in Selma with Dr. Martin Luther King and attended the March on Washington to fight for justice, end systematic poverty, and fight for good jobs and fair wages for every American.  As progressives, we still have so much more work to do to achieve Economic Justice, Social Justice, Racial Justice, and Environmental Justice.  I will go to the convention this year to stand not only with Bernie, but with every progressive fighting for justice.Politcal and Social ActivismMy Journey with Bernie materialized in 2011 with the Occupy movement. Like millions of Americans, I became an active organizer and supporter of Occupy Wall Street. I traveled to New York to sleep out on Wall Street. For almost 2 months, I maintained an Occupy tent here in Dallas in protest of a system that I knew denied millions of Americans access to Economic, Social, Racial and Environmental Justice.  Since then, I have dedicated my life to helping change a system that perpetuates injustices upon "the least among us."OWS activists worked tirelessly to educate the public about breaking up the big banks, student loan debt, race and class discrimination, and getting money out of politics. The pursuit of Economic and Social Justice is a calling that I do not take lightly.  Bernie Sanders is the only candidate who has unequivocally brought our progressive message to millions of Americans. I do the work it takes to help spread the progressive message and increase Democratic voter participation. As a political activist, I have worked tirelessly to help organize voters in pre-primary, post-primary, and post-local conventions here in Texas, and in 10 other states. My national phone bank and field work has included KS, KY, WY, CO, CA, MN, TX, VA, NM, and FL.As a volunteer, I block-walked and phone-banked for Bernie pre-primary and pre-convention in Far North Dallas and Collin County. I organized a Bernie Sanders welcome table at the Collin County Convention.  Dallas Bernie Sanders Campaign staff also helped me organize a caucus effort in Colorado Springs, CO. Bernie won that caucus by almost 70%! It was a great early win for Bernie!After the Colorado primary, I did substantial planning and organizing in Wyoming, working with Wyoming University Students for Bernie Sanders. We had very successful voter outreach, registration, and organizing efforts which culminated with the Wyoming Sanders Rally. As you can tell, it's been a very busy year for this activist!Because of all of my primary work organizing for Bernie, I was humbled and honored by my appointment as the Official SD 8 Chair for the TX Bernie Sanders Campaign. As a political activist, I worked tirelessly to help create a progressive majority. Now I am asking for your help to get me to the DNC. Until Bernie came along, I never felt inspired enough to try for an "Official" Delegate Position; but I have always worked to spread a progressive message. I was previously involved in the Democratic Party process--as Co-chair and Field Organizer for Rockwall for Obama 2008. I also attended the DNC in 08' as a volunteer,  and was awarded with a credential pass for the final days of the convention. While in attendance, I caucused with the Progressive Democrats of America  (a group that helped get Bernie to run), organized with Move-On , and Code Pink Women for Peace . I continued to work with these groups long after the convention.￼￼Post Occupy, I worked with Sierra Club  activists in Dallas to get a ban placed on a fracking site near a DISD public school and as an education candidate to help stop privatization efforts of public schools. I helped support and organize many Trans Pacific Partnership (TPP), Our Walmart, End Citizens United and  #FightFor15  demonstrations.  I also sat in the Senate Gallery with Wendy Davis and the Orange Army,  standing up for Planned Parenthood.I was a founding member of Dallas' Mothers Against Police Brutality (MAPB) and have  worked diligently to end systematic racial discrimination.  As a member of MAPB, I helped organize demonstrations and actions where thousands were in attendance. This year, I am working to bring Bernie's message home. I am continuing my efforts to help End Mass  Incarceration and Decriminalize Marijuana  possession. I am also currently helping three progressive candidates here in Collin County and two candidates in Dallas. Why am I asking for your support? I am a committed Democratic Activist and Political Organizer. My commitment has been unending; through thick and thin. I truly believe that this is not about me, but about us. I intend to continue our fight through the 2018 and 2020 election cycles. I can promise you that your investment in me as a national delegate will not be wasted. Our message is too important to let it go by the wayside. As a strong progressive, I intend to fight for our message for the rest of my life.I hope to make you proud by representing Democratic Progressives for Bernie Sanders at the National level! I would be extremely thankful for any and all contributions made to help me Stand for Economic, Racial, Social and Environmental Justice!￼￼Fannie Lou Hamer Link: http://americanradioworks.publicradio.org/features/sayitplain/flhamer.htmlhttps://demconvention.com/news/

title: Democratic Convention Delegate - TN
summary: I am a Tennessee delegate to the Democratic National Convention.  I am a supporter and pledged at-large delegate for Sen. Bernie Sanders.   I need funds to help cover convention expenses in Philadelphia.  The State of Tennessee DNC says it can go as high as $8,000 to attend.  I have not received any help from the state party.   They are supporting Hillary.   I need $2,500 in order to attend.  I will be supporting Bernie on a tight budget.  Bernie or Bust!I am a lifelong democrat who has worked as a volunteer for youth organizations, like the Big Brothers/Big Sisters and Girl Scouts and for individuals with disabilities through the Arc Mid-South.  I have voted in every local, state and national election since I turned 18.  I have conducted voter registration drives.   I am saddened by the voter suppression that occurred this primary season.  Bernie has solutions, and our country needs help.I am excited and grateful to have the chance to support Bernie at the Philadelphia Convention.  Many of my friends don't understand why I support Bernie because the media has not given him the attention he deserves. Bernie is for the 99 percent.  Please donate whatever you can.  I need the funds by July 18, 2016.  I will be forever grateful to stand with Bernie and with all of you in support of a living wage, single-payer healthcare, free college tuition, protecting our climate, repairing our infrastructure, LBGTQ, civil rights and social justice for all the disenfranchised. Bernie will fight for us against Wall Street and the big banks.  He is honest!  He makes sense!  I support Bernie's platform: He can get the job done. "No one should work in the United States for 40 hours a week and live in poverty."Thank you very much for helping me.

title: Send Jeffrey to the DNC in Philly
summary: Jeffrey Eide here, passionate volunteer and organizer for Bernie Sanders. I am 100% committed to Mr. Sanders and have worked hard to use my skills to share his accomplishments and message with the world around me. While working for human rights campaigns abroad, I followed the great work of Bernie Sanders with what little I could find online, and after moving back to the states, when I learned he would be running for president, I was ready for more. Last summer, while in the Capitol, I sat down in Sen. Sanders's office and learned how I can help organize. I was excited to organize in the Fargo area, and working with a great grassroots crew, we covered the state with events.  Appearing on the news, organizing events, and communicating with volunteers, WE North Dakotans built our own success.While the Bernie ND Headquarters was in town, I hosted the staffers and volunteers at my house and was in the office volunteering every single day, no matter how busy life got. What North Dakotans did by coming together and getting 75% of the district delegates makes me incredibly proud of the state.We were told the cost of going is estimated at $2,300, not including flights. If I can raise $2,300, I will pay for the flights myself.  I currently have three jobs which make ends meet for me to volunteer as much as I do. I can not do this without you. You have stood with me in the streets, you have stood with me in the Bernie office. Let me go to Philadelphia and raise hell, hold the DNC and establishment democrats accountable for their responsibilities to voters.

title: Harry For State Delegate
summary: Dear friends and families:Harry (H.B) Bhandari, the recipient of 2017  Baltimore County Asian American Award, has lived the American Dream. Born in rural Nepal, his first job was as an English teacher, school textbook author, principal and lecturer in Nepal’s capital, Kathmandu. Twelve years ago, he was invited to present a scholarly paper at George Mason University, Fairfax Virginia; his American journey started upon receiving his U.S. Citizenship. He attended Johns Hopkins University to continue his higher education and now teaches in the Baltimore City schools as well as served as adjunct faculty at Baltimore City Community College. He was a delegate candidate from District-8 in 2014 gubernatorial election. He also served as national secretary of Young Democrats of America (YDA) Minority Caucus and board of director of district six democratic and civic association club. He also volunteered as president of Linover Community Association and was appointed by Councilwoman Cathy Bevins to serve as a member of the Baltimore County Pedestrian and Bicycle Advisory Committee (PBAC).  In 2016 presidential election, he founded an organization Nepali for Hillary and actively mobilized the volunteers in more than dozen states in the U.S. Currently, he is pursuing his Ph.D. at Language, Literacy, and Culture at the University of Maryland, Baltimore County. He believes that the full potential of our country lies in diversity.  He and his wife have two children and reside in Baltimore County.Currently, he is running for state delegate for Maryland legislative district-8. I would like to earnestly request each of you to help support our campaign with any amount possible.  Sincerely,Indra ThapachettriTreasurer, Friends of Harry Bhandarihttp://www.harryforstatedelegate.com/ By Donating you confirm that the following statements are true and accurate:--I am a United States citizen or a lawfully admitted permanent resident.--This contribution is not made from the general treasury funds of a corporation, labor organization or national bank.--This contribution is not made from the treasury of an entity or person who is a federal contractor.This contribution is not made from the funds of a federally registered foreign agent.--I am not a minor under the age of 16.--The funds I am donating are not being provided to me by another person or entity for the purpose of making this contribution.--Contributions are not tax deductible.-- The maximum donation is $6000.00Law requires we ask for your employer and occupation. Friends of Harry Friends, Indra Thapachettri, Treasurer

title: Get Me to Philly for Bernie
summary: I was elected to be an alternate at large Delegate for Bernie - heading to Philly to represent us all in case I'm needed. This means I get to be inside the convention center and if for any reason a Bernie delegate can't make it, I may be asked to step in as an alternate. So, I have to get there because I might need to be there!The expenses are crazy - we're told to expect to spend $4000 per delegate - maybe more. I'll get there no matter what because it's a responsibility as well as an honor to have been elected. If you can help at all, I would really appreciate it. This will help me to avoid going into huge credit card debt. The hotels are over $475 per night and my horse is fast but I don't think it's wise to try and make Philly by convention so I need to fly. Meanwhile if you can, please also go donate to Bernie. He's going to be helping his delegates make up the difference who are unable to afford it on their own, and he needs to get there, too. It's not over 'till its over and there's a lot that will be happening between now and the end of July so keep the faith and Feel The Bern! More about me....Most of you know I was heavily involved as a  volunteer in the Bernie campaign since May of 2015 beginning with the PDA We Want Bernie campaign and later with the Arizona Bernie Sanders 2016 campaign. I was an active volunteer both at the state level and the national level. I hosted phonebank parties, made tons of calls for Bernie, was a call moderator and note taker for the state calls with the national team, volunteered at 2 different Phoenix rallies, canvassed, recruited over 500 more volunteers, organized a huge Debate Watch Party with over 100 people, went and spoke in Payson to the Democratic Women of Rim Country about Bernie, and organized a YUUUUUUGE fundraiser in Phoenix for Bernie with a healthcare theme called Feel The Bern for Healthcare.  All proceeds went to Bernie Sanders. I operate a facebook group called Healthcare Providers and Advocates for Bernie Sanders, and a facebook page called Feel The Bern for Healthcare. I'm involved in my local legislative district as a precinct committee person and helping our local candidates. As a social worker and a mental healthcare provider, I've been supporting progressive issues that honor human rights, equality, civil rights, quality education and social services since 1970 something. Like Bernie, I believe that healthcare should be a right, not a privilege.  I'm a member of Progressive Democrats of America (PDA) and involved in People Demanding Action.  I support several environmental and wildlife groups. I believe we  need to tackle Climate Change now and end fracking everywhere forever. Let's get Bernie in the Whitehouse and his agenda on the platform in the Democratic Party. Woohoo!So please support as many Bernie delegates as you can and any amount of contribution for my trip would be greatly appreciated! Thanks much & See You In Philly!Shannon

title: #StillSandersPLEODelegate4Philly
summary: My name is Susan Soto Palmer and I was elected on, June 19, 2016, as a Party Leader and Elected Official (PLEO) delegate for Senator Bernie Sanders.  If you support the political revolution, if you're hurting and hoping for real progressive change, Senator Sanders still needs you and he needs me and every other Delegate to fight  for US and vote for Senator Sanders in Philly!  Today's news was rough and brought a lot of tears and broken hearts, but we're not done!  Grieve, brush up and take heart and then help us fight on!   7/12/16Sincerely, Susan#StillSanders #SeeYouInPhilly____________________________________________________________ Along with friends, allies and other party leaders, we have worked diligently to register voters and encourage participation in the Yakima Valley and push Democrats to embrace more progressive stances on issues important to all of us.  Senator Sanders energized us all!  I am a strong supporter of Senator Sanders and had the honor and pleasure of introducing him and endorsing him at the Yakima rally in March.   As a result of working with other amazing community organizers along with Senator Sanders' visit to Yakima, I gained the courage to run as a Democrat in Washington State's election this year*.  "Thousands come to Yakima to cheer for Bernie Sanders" The Democratic National Convention begins on July 25, 2016 and I need your immediate help to secure accommodations.  Your generous donations will be used for transportation and hotel accommodations for the week of the National Convention and any additional funds will be used to help other elected Berniecrat delegates.  I will join my fellow Berniecrats in making sure we do all that we can to elect Senator Sanders as our next President and secure the most progressive platform and policies needed for all of us because this movement is about us!  Thank you immensely for your support!   Let's make sure every elected Berniecrat delegate finds their way to Philadelphia and let's make sure we carry your generosity forward so that others can join our movement!  #NotMeUs #StillSanders*If you intend to donate to my 14th Legislative District State Representative, Pos. 1 (D) campaign, please donate to Friends of Susan,  732 Summitview Avenue #664, Yakima, WA 98902 or 14th LD State Rep., Pos. 1 Campaign. .

title: Matt Levy to Philly--Bern Delegate
summary: As a life-long Roosevelt Democrat,  a Medical Worker, and a former inner city High School teacher, Bernie has captured my heart and soul.  Since Day one, I have actively promoted him non-stop on the street and online. This campaign is a great Democratic and historic moment,  a GOOD FIGHT that has to be won.  As a Committed Arizona CD2  Bernie Delegate, I very much want to take this fight to the Convention Floor.

title: Help Marvell attend HSDA D.C. Summit
summary: Hello i'm Marvell Reed  a student activists , organizer and President of Milwaukee County High School Democrats. I'm 17 Y/O I grew up on the near north side of the city of Milwaukee, Growing up in some of the most  underserved communities I have seen first hand how people of color have been disproportionately discriminated against and that's why I got involved.I got my start in politics in the sumner of 2016. I helped volunteer on congressional races as well as Hillary Clinton's 2016 presidential campaign. I also just started showing up to event in my comnunity including townhalls, fundraising events, trainings and listening sessions.  The best advise I can give to our youth is to show up, Just show up - it's one of the only ways you can have your voice heard. My application was just accepted to attend the High School Democrats of America's 2019 Summit in D.C.  as many of you know I have been heavily involved in high school democrats and youth issues. Unfortunately I can't afford to pay for the cost's to attend because I'm currently unemployed. Here's how the money I raise will be spent:$495 + $20 processing fee$400 for airfare two-way$30 lyft fee to and from the Milwaukee airport$150 for miscellaneous things while in D.C.$50 gofundme feesThe DEADLINE for me to PAY is MAY 6TH!!! Below is some of the things I've done through the years:2016~ Volunteer for Khary Penebaker for congress & Hillary Clinton for President2017~ Jr. Mentor for a mentoring organization in Milwaukee.2018~ Outreach Director for March for Our Lives Milwaukee.2018~Founder & President of Milwaukee County High School Democrats & Candidate for Development Director of High School Democrats of Wisconsin.2018~ Deputy Campaign Manager/ Campaign Cordinator for Fred Kessler for State Assembly.2018~ At-Large Member City of Milwaukee Youth Council.2018~ Intern Lisa Neubauer for the Wisconsin Supreme Court.2019~ Democratic Party of Wisconsin Organizing Fellow.Please help me attend this years High School Democrats of America's D.C. Summit so I can network with other young progressives and speak with them about getting youth envoled in politics and speak on issues effecting youth across america. Again the deadline for me to pay is May 6th.Thanks in advance, It's very much appreciated!

title: Send Yvette Joseph to the DNC
summary: Dear Friends, I’m writing to seek your support, as a National Delegate for Hillary Clinton with plans to attend the Democratic National Convention in Philadelphia, PA. I’m very proud to represent the 5th Congressional District of Washington State as Hillary’s delegate, covering 11 Counties in Eastern Washington. Our district is centered on Spokane, the state’s second largest city.  When I worked in Washington, DC, for U.S. Senators Dan Evans (R – WA) and Dan Inouye (D- HI), with the Senate Committee on Indian Affairs, I was involved in President Bill Clinton’s Health Care Reform Task Force and met often with First Lady Hillary Clinton. For 12 weeks, I attended toll gate meetings at the White House to help shape the American Security Act. After that process ended, we invited Mrs. Clinton to meet with Tribal Leaders at the Senate Committee on Indian Affairs. As you know, we were not successful in realizing health care reform, but under Hillary’s leadership, 48 states became part of the State Child Health Insurance Program in 1997. And because of these early discussions, Hillary helped President Clinton to encourage the establishment of the President’s Executive Order on Government-to-Government Consultation with Tribal Governments.  Today, my primary work is to help expand oral health care in every community, by promoting the use of dental therapists. A dental therapist is a provider who works as part of a dental care team, similar to how a nurse practitioner or physician’s assistant works as part of the medical team. Midlevel dental care is common in more than 50 countries around the world, including Canada. In 2003, the Tribes in Alaska started a program to bring services to patients in places where dentists don’t normally work, including schools, nursing homes, mobile clinics and other settings. Now dental therapists serve 81 communities in Alaska and are authorized in Minnesota, Maine and Vermont, and are working in the Swinomish Indian Tribal Community and with two Tribes in Oregon.  We are working to promote this policy change because 130 million Americans lack access to needed dental care. And in Washington State, 35 of 39 Counties do not have enough dentists to meet the needs of our citizens.It is my goal to mobilize Washington State Democrats to help expand dental care to every citizen, especially working families who cannot afford to access care.  I’m honored to serve as an elected Precinct Committee Officer in Spokane County and will do all that I can to share updates and work to get out the vote in the upcoming campaign. I am working to ensure Democrats win the U.S. Senate, the U.S. House and in our State Legislature. Attending the Democratic Convention will help me to realize this goal.We worked at the WA State Convention to successfully include language to support dental therapy in the Tribal Nations plank. Some of that language made it into the latest draft of the national platform because of the great advocacy work of Tulalip Tribal Member and Bernie Sander’s Delegate Deborah Parker. This week, I’ve been spending many long nights helping to prepare a provision to expand oral health care to every American under the Health plank. This is important because there is no mention of dental or oral health care in the platform. Ms. Parker is hopeful that she will succeed in getting the language adopted.  I hope you can see that I am devoted to advancing health policy to serve working families, will seek to address racial justice and support the creation of good-paying jobs by promoting clean energy to overcome climate change.  If you have a burning issue you believe needs attention, please let me know at my Facebook Account. As a single mother with a 2016 graduate of Washington State University and another student who attends Whitworth University, I need help, mostly to pay for the hotel room in Philadelphia, PA, along with taxi, meals and other costs.  It is important to secure these funds before July 22, 2016. I believe that in order to give, is to receive.  So I plan to gift a beautiful Hillary for America beaded medallion and a pair of beaded earrings to two people who contribute to my go fund me account. These individuals will be selected before the Convention on July 25 to 28, 2016.  So please consider donating $5, $10, $25, $50 or $100 to my go fund me account.  Your support will be used wisely and with great appreciation, as I hope to continue to serve others. Thank you for considering this request.  Lem Lempt – Thank you!! Yvette Joseph

title: Help Eloisa's Delegate Costs
summary: My name is Eloisa Melendez. I'm a 22 year old Latina college student and councilwoman in Norwalk, CT.  I'm a pledged PLEO (Party Leaders and Elected Officials) delegate to the 2016 Democratic National Convention for Senator Bernie Sanders. As a young progressive elected official, I'm inspired by Bernie Sanders' fight for equality in all aspects of our society. He understands the needs of Americans and his candidacy has changed this election completely. He's brought so many different people to the table and because of him the unheard now have a voice. I'm honored to have the opportunity to represent Connecticut and support Senator Bernie Sanders in Philadelphia. Unfortunately, I need help getting there. Although being a delegate is free, the week in Philadelphia is not. The Connecticut delegation is required to stay in the same pre arranged hotel. We have to cover our own hotel, travel and food expenses during our week in Philly.  This week will be life changing for me. Please help me get there! If you have any questions please feel free to message me. Thank you so much! * Reminder to my friends, family and supporters who are either not Bernie supporters ( :( ) or Democrats, the money I raise will NOT go to the Democratic Party or the Sanders campaign. The money is for my expenses ONLY. * THANK YOU/ GRACIAS!!!!! xo

title: Pursuing a J.D. for Social Justice
summary: My name is Marisol Conde-Hernandez. The above video is the first episode of a serial documentary about my family and I, produced by Talking Eyes Media and a project of Newest Americans . I have a deep-rooted, long term commitment to social justice & civil rights and I joined the Rutgers School of Law to become a more effective advocate.I graduated from Rutgers University, summa cum laude, in 2011 with a B.A. in Sociology & a minor in Women’s & Gender Studies. I co-founded the New Jersey Dream Act Coalition prior to law school and currently serve as co-chair of the Immigrant Rights Collective and as a Marsha Wenk Public Interest Law Fellow at the law school. I am Treasurer of the Evening Students Association and a proud member of the Minority Student Program . My advocacy, public service, and leadership has been recognized by several organizations, including my two alma maters,  Middlesex County College , Rutgers University , and even the New Jersey General Assembly . I am dedicated to social justice lawyering and I want to use my legal career to serve and advocate on behalf of the under-represented and disadvantaged. In the summer of 2015, I had an extraordinary opportunity at social justice lawyering.  I served as summer counsel at the Harvard Legal Aid Bureau , the nation's oldest student-run non-profit that provides free civil legal services to low-income Boston residents. Two organizations, RU Law's Public Interest Law Foundation and the Equal Justice America, awarded me with fellowships that enabled me to relocate to Cambridge/Boston for three months. There, I managed about ten housing and wage/hour cases and I worked at a restaurant part-time.  I was so lucky to work alongside City Life/Vida Urbana (CLVU), an outstanding grassroots organization fighting gentrification in Boston and mobilizing communities against displacement. My clients there, and the staff at CLVU, reinvigorated my commitment to my study of law. The second installment of Newest Americans captures a bit of that summer, and you can watch it here . I am raising money to help me pay for the cost of law school, bar prep and study, and the NJ and NY bar exams. I sent several administrators an email in the Fall 2015 semester to explain why I need assistance, so now I invite you to read it as well: "I am undocumented. My parents and I entered the United States in 1988 when I was a year old. We have only lived in New Jersey since our arrival almost thirty years ago. I have been open about my status since childhood and I have been public about my story for about ten years.  A Rutgers- Newark project, Newest Americans, is the most recent platform to share my experience via a multi-part, serial documentary.There are approximately 2 million undocumented young adults like myself who entered the United States as children.   Various research organizations estimate that only about 5-10% of undocumented high school graduates go on to college.  Far fewer proceed towards a graduate program.  In fact, based on a national list-serve created exclusively for undocumented law school students, there are fewer than 30 of us (known) nationwide. We are in California, Florida, New York, New Mexico, Connecticut, Pennsylvania, Texas, District of Columbia, Michigan, and Illinois. Only three jurisdictions- California, Florida, and New York- have addressed whether undocumented law school graduates can practice law. All three of those states now admit undocumented law graduates to practice under varying criteria.I am the first undocumented law school student in the State of New Jersey, and the only one so far*[There's another undocumented law student in NJ, but I will not 'out' that individual without his/her consent. I am still poised to be the first undocumented law school graduate in 2017.]  But for the following financial constraints, I would not have such a difficult time paying for school:I pay for law school out-of-pocket because I am ineligible for all forms of publicly financed and/or subsidized financial aid, including federal and state loans and grants. I am ineligible because those prominent and popular means of financing higher education are available only to U.S. Citizens and Legal Permanent Residents. I am neither a U.S. Citizen (USC) nor a Legal Permanent Resident (LPR); rather, I am undocumented/unauthorized. I still have no legal status under immigration law despite possessing valid work authorization through Deferred Action for Childhood Arrivals.Private loans through financial institutions like Wells Fargo and Bank of America also require applicants to be USCs or LPRs. Even if those institutions allowed me to apply, it would be very unlikely for the banks to offer me a loan because I do not have the requisite credit or assets to qualify. Undocumented/unauthorized immigrants who never (or until very recently) had a Social Security Number, like me, cannot establish the qualifying credit so quickly. I could list a co-signer who is a USC or LPR on an application, but I do not have family members who are either willing or eligible. Both my parents are also undocumented/unauthorized and cannot apply. My only adult sibling lacks good credit and she has four children of her own to sustain.  Therefore, I can only pay for school out-of-pocket and I can only enroll for the amount of credits I can afford.  The amount of credits I can afford is offset by my living expenses: whereas many of my peers “live at home” and are spared living expenses, I live alone. Even if I lived with a family member, my family is working-poor and cannot afford to help me. I have been financially independent since the age of seventeen, and I have assisted and continue to assist them however I can.Currently, I bartend and manage at a brewpub in New Brunswick and there are several factors contributing to my reduced income- over 90% of my income comes from tips. As a result, I dropped my health insurance coverage to afford the costs of transportation. I’ve applied to scholarships, and Nicky Fornarotto of Financial Aid has been the most helpful person on campus, but I continue to struggle every semester.As an undergraduate, my exceptional GPA, a 3.9, justified the University’s decision to pay the last two years of my program. Unfortunately, my law school GPA is deplorable. I attribute my sub-par performance- and the consequent loss of my partial academic scholarship- to the year-long depression that afflicted me in my first year. I paid out-of-pocket to seek professional help and I have since recovered.  My GPA does not reflect my intellect and neither does it predict my potential as an attorney: Internship supervisors, practicing attorneys, faculty and staff can attest to my abilities and skills.I need help financing this semester and the rest of my time at Rutgers Law School. Every other undocumented law school student receives aid. A few schools provided full tuition scholarships to their respective undocumented law school student. Another student took out an institutional loan from his/her private law school.  I do not know how Rutgers University can help me now.I defer to you and the administration's decisions. I would gladly meet to brainstorm solutions. "In my two years between my undergrad and law school, I started a scholarship in honor of my parents at Rutgers University to financially assist immigrant students. While I can no longer maintain that commitment now- as I am the one in need- I fully intend on paying it forward and resuming my donations to assist other similarly-situated students once I graduate.All money raised will go directly to pay for tuition, a bar prep course, and the bar exam itself. Your help will enable me to save money so I can take some time off work to exclusively study for the bar exam in 2017. Thank you for learning about me. Thank you for sharing. And especially thank you for donating. No donation is too small. <3Additionally, you're welcome to peruse some of the following media/press coverage of me and my work:Feature in Rutgers SAS Alumni Newsletter  March 2013Video: Featured on Due Process' "DREAM Act- One Step Closer" August 2012NJ Star Ledger Article about DACA  August 2012Video: Featured on Due Process' "DREAM Act: Dead or Deferred?" April 2011Video: Addressing Princeton Democrats  2010NYT Article about NJ In-State Tuition Bill April 2009NYT Article about Mexicans in NJ  April 2006#GFMScholarship

title: ForwardMarch
summary: My Name is John Archer. I have been a lifelong Democrat since at least May 4th, 1970, when at age 13, I heard about the shootings of 4 Kent State students protesting the Vietnam War. I have voted Democrat and Progressive ever since I was able to cast my first vote for Jimmy Carter in 1976. I have designated March to be Progressive Month better known as Forward March. 'I am developing a SuperPAC devoted to Progressive Causes. Working name is Forward March. My main goal is to be the Progressive answer to Citizens United. The funds that are raised from this GoFundMe page are going to go to the establishment of the PAC and the complementary Non Profit that will be directly connected to Forward March. T-Shirts and other rewards/thank yous will be available during the campaign.

title: Send Shay to DNC 2016!
summary: I was elected to attend the Democratic National Convention and it would be an honor if you supported my efforts to attend the convention by making a contribution.  This year's convention will be held in Philadelphia from July 24 to July 29th.  However, the convention costs are preset by the National Committee and this year's are the most expensive in convention history. Contributions go towards hotel and transportation expenses. Here's some info for you... About MeI am Shay Wyrick Cathey, a lifelong democrat, who began working on Democratic campaigns as young girl learning at the feet of my mother, a decades long Democratic precinct chair. I have pushed cards, block walked and phone banked for many Democratic candidates as child, teenager and now as an adult.I never missed voting in a Democratic Primary or Runoff or ANY election since I became eligible to vote in 1990. That’s 26 years of supporting Democrats for office!I  have served on the Texas State Democratic Executive Committee as the Democratic Committeeman for the Texas 23rd Senate District since 2006, which is a volunteer position.I am full-time wife and mom who also works outside the home. My participation in Democratic politics and organizations is voluntary.Election to the Democratic National ConventionI was recently elected at the Texas Democratic Convention as a pledged national alternate for Hillary Clinton. However, I have recently been elevated and will now be a Delegate I am so honored that I will be casting a vote for Secretary Hillary Clinton to the Democratic nominee for PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES!How will your contribution will be used? And why is Shay asking for help?DNC 2016 is the most expensive convention in history. Being elected to attend is an honor yet it is also a huge financial commitment. The DNC hotel group rate for the assigned Texas delegation hotel is $565 a night with a minimum of five nights. I am committed to attending, however, any assistance would be appreciated.  Funds raised through this GoFundMe campaign will be used for hotel and transportation costs. How soon are funds needed?A deposit will be charged by the hotel on Sunday, July 17 and I hope to raise as much as possible by that date. Your Support is AppreciatedThank you for checking out my page and I thank you for even considering supporting my efforts to attend the Democratic National Convention.
