Your support means so much to me and your help is needed so that I can attend the convention.  ANY contribution amount is welcome. Thank you!Me with two other Hillary delegates from Dallas County at the TDP Convention￼￼Me and two of my sons and Chairman Gilberto Hinojosa at the TDP Convention￼￼My supportive family who is sacrificing for me to attend the DNC 2016 in Philly￼￼

title: Send Mike to Philly for Hillary!
summary: I feel very honored and privileged to represent Wyoming as a National Delegate for Secretary (not to mention former Senator and First Lady) Hillary Clinton. I was very proud to stand with former Wyoming Secretary of State, Kathy Karpan, to nominate Secretary Clinton to be our next President of the United States of America! Leading up to the caucuses on April 9th, I was thrilled to meet President Clinton and Secretary of the Interior Ken Salazar. Both of them spoke about how diversifying Wyoming's economy into cleaner technologies like Wind and Solar could help Wyoming become a leader in the new energy economy. Hillary Clinton supports building our infrastructure to export this clean energy that Wyoming so desperately needs. The only way to prevent the boom and bust cycle that hurts Wyoming's families is to work together to diversify our economy and take advantage of the renewable resources that Wyoming has so much of.Wyoming IS the Equality State and it's time for true Equality for all Wyomingites including LGBT, women, immigrants and so many others. My husband, Jeran Artery, and I have had the privilege of leading Wyoming Equality, our state's largest LGBT organization. We were instrumental in bringing marriage equality to Wyoming and we continue to fight for non-discrimination and transgender rights on the local and state levels. Additionally, I would be remiss if I didn't mention my unequivocal support for equal pay for equal work. The gender pay cap must be closed and I can think of no better way to do that then to elect our first Female President! I'm not voting for Hillary because she's a woman (although that's awesome!); I'm voting for her because she's the most qualified person to take the helm on day one. I'm proud to work for the Wyoming Retirement System and take care of our public employee's pensions. I'm a member of the Wyoming Public Employee's Association, I'm the Treasurer of the Laramie County Democrats, and I believe in fighting for public employees. Unions have been the foundation of the Wyoming Democratic Party and we must fight to keep them strong and relevant. Lastly, I had the distinct privilege of volunteering and working with the Cheyenne for Hillary campaign. I created the Cheyenne for Hillary Facebook page. I had the opportunity to work with the young, dedicated individuals who came to Cheyenne to fight for Hillary in Laramie County and help her win our State's Capitol and most populous county. Meeting President Bill Clinton and Secretary Ken Salazar was absolutely amazing. But the most important moment was when my amazing friends, Jeran Artery, Wendy Soto, Kate Wright and I made dinner and brought it to Kathy Karpan's Law Office to support the tireless efforts of these volunteers. I have never had more joy in my heart:Nick, my main contact with the Hillary campaign, tweeted:First Inaugural @HillaryforWY Supper Club! Love these people. #CameForTheFood#StayedForThePeople It would be honored to have your vote!Mike Bleakley, Hillary for Wyoming, Hillary for America This money will be used to pay the approximately $600 airfare, $1,200 hotel expenses and $200 of meals and incidental expenses.  Fundraising will end prior to my departure for Philidelphia on July 24th.  This means the world to me!  Please follow my journey to make Wyoming and Hillary proud on the Facebook page below.  I couldn't do this without your support, THANK YOU!  Facebook:https://www.facebook.com/Mike-Bleakley-for-National-Delegate-for-Hillary-Clinton-Wyoming-1093652264027557/timelineTwitter: @MikeBleakley1E-mail: mike_bleakley@yahoo.com

title: NEW Ohio Bernie Delegate to Philly
summary: Hello fellow Bernie supporters! I'm Mayo Makinde, Ohio's NEWEST National Delegate for Bernie Sanders and I'm raising funds to go to Philadelphia to represent Sen. Sanders at the 2016 Democratic National Convention.I was appointed as Bernie's ONLY alternate delegate for the whole state! Then, a few days ago, I received exciting news: I'VE BEEN BUMPED UP TO OFFICIAL DELEGATE! Another pledged delegate was unable to continue. It is my privilege and great honor to be Ohio's only African-American male delegate for Bernie Sanders.A LITTLE ABOUT ME:I am the son of Nigerian immigrants, a practicing Baptist, and a lifetime resident of Ohio.  I am an alumnus of Western Kentucky University, were I played defensive  end on the 2002 WKU National Champion Football team! I'm also a member of Omega Psi Phi Fraternity.I'm active in state and local politics here in Ohio, hosted a political radio show, and even ran for the state House of Representatives in the March primary.Okay, so I didn't win, but while I was running, I discovered Bernie Sanders' campaign. His issues and ideals are equal to mine and THAT's when I realized that I "Feel the Bern!"HERE'S MY SITUATION:While other delegates have had some time to plan for the Philly trip and start saving money, I am being called in late in the game. We only have a month to go and all of the hotel fees were already due June 14th!BREAKDOWN OF COSTS:I'm staying in the Ohio Delegation's official hotel and the rooms cost $425/ night x 5 nights. That's $2125. (Prices for everything in Philly during the convention have been inflated.) I'm sharing the room, cutting my part to $1062.50. I'll be traveling from Ohio to Philly by carpool with other Bernie delegates and will pay my share of gas: $50. We have been told to plan for about $80/day for food, parking, and other fees x 5 days = $400. TOTAL EXPENSES:Hotel: $1062.50Gasoline: $50Food/Fees: $400TOTAL NEED: $1512.50(Rounded to $1500.00)I support Senator Sanders' Progressive platform and I'm excited to attend my FIRST National Convention after more than 10 years of service to the Democratic Party.Your donations mean everything to me because it will go a long way in telling America that enough is enough and progressive Democrats are ready to fight for our progressive issues and candidates like Senator Bernie Sanders.Through your support, I will fight hard for Bernie and will have a voice in the fight against corporate money in politics. Thank you."Not me, us" ~Senator Bernie Sanders

title: Finger Lakes Tour
summary: UPDATE: Finished Cayuga Lake Aug. 21; all 11 lakes completed, and my fundraising goal met! Click here for my blog posts. I'm Justin Murphy, a newspaper reporter for the Democrat and Chronicle in Rochester, New York. I've been lucky to live in the Finger Lakes region  of upstate New York for most of my life; this summer, I'll get to know those lakes a little better.From May to August, I'll be riding my bicycle around each of the 11 Finger Lakes, a total of 435 miles. I first had the idea after riding the length of the Erie Canal,  from Buffalo to Albany, in 2013. I wanted another cycling adventure, and the Finger Lakes - long, skinny and hilly, all within 90 minutes of my house in Rochester - fit the bill perfectly.While I originally conceived of it as a fun project for the summer, I also hope to raise some money for a good cause. As the K-12 education reporter  in one of the poorest urban school districts in the country,  I see the effects of grinding generational poverty nearly every day at work. I also get an up-close look at some of the people and agencies working tirelessly to help children onto the path toward a brighter future.One of the most impressive is the Nurse-Family Partnership, a national program operating in Rochester and hundreds of other communities across the country.  The concept is simple: first-time mothers living in poverty are connected with a nurse early in pregnancy. The mother - on average, 19 years old, unmarried and living on less than $10,000 a year - learns some of the parenting skills that she herself might not have benefited from. The nurse visits continue through birth and until the child turns 2 years old. The outcomes  are pretty remarkable: one follow-up study showed declines of 48 percent in child abuse and neglect, 67 percent in behavioral and intellectual difficulties at age 6 and 72 percent in mothers being arrested. Another study showed a benefit to society of $5.70 for every dollar invested in the program.Rochester is a wealthy community with incredible resources. For infants in our city to be condemned to a life of poverty because their mothers lack for basic information and services is wrong. This is a program that helps.As I go, I'll be posting progress updates, photos and video to my blog. I'll also be joined on the rides by some of my friends - more about that later. In the meantime, I hope you'll consider donating some of your hard-earned money toward a truly worthy cause.

title: Beechlinc goes to Philly!
summary: Being Democrats... our other full time jobs...Van and Chelsea are proud Idaho Democrats who work tirelessly to make this great state even greater!Holding positions with the Democratic party in the state of Idaho has proven to keep them both significanly busy. The duties of working towards the most progressive platform to date are fullfilling to say the least. Van solidifed her ticket to the DNC after being elected as the Vice Chair of the Idaho Democratic Party in February of 2016. Chelsea wasn't far behind her, garnishing enough votes in the first round to be selected as a national delegate for the Sanders Campaign at the recent Idaho State Dems Convention held June 16th-19th. After board, travel, and expenses the duo needs to raise approx $5000! The couple is committed to representing Idaho, supporting a nation in denoucing a candidate like Trump, and coming home to continue working on local candidate races state wide. We would greatly support any contributions and sponsorship in accomplishing this feat, rapidly approaching four weeks away! Thank you for your support!***Any extra funds raised, will be donated back to the Idaho Delegation, go team Idaho!

title: On-going Support for Standing Rock
summary: (Pic from Hueco Tanks, TX)Why does Standing Rock matter? Because abuse of Native Americans is not a thing of history. It is current, alive, and it is ours to deal with. If we do not act, we are compliant with those abuses.  And because our water is our life. We must start paying attention to how we care for our water resources, and our planet.We can't stand by and watch yet another treaty be ignored, and yet another watershed get set up to be contaminated by a multinational who will only get a slap on the wrist as they destroy our nation's natural resources for profit. This is a matter of integrity for all of us. Let's take pride in right action. This is a matter of national security. Let's treat it as one. This impacts all of us, and sooner or later, if left unchecked, this sort of abuse will show up in your community too. ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~I am only asking for $500 because I am leaving *this Friday morning* September 9th (in two more days!) to be there in time for the announcement of the Federal Court's decision on whether the pipeline will continue or be put on hold for review. It's short notice, I know, so I am looking for meaningful supplies that will help spread the word and tell their story: high-powered, portable solar chargers and supplies that can be used to keep TV cameras and other recording and broadcasting devices working. I'd also like to bring up the usual supplies that thousands of people might need: reusable water bottles and dinnerware, food, and first aid supplies. ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~A little about me: I am a Berniecrat activist and New Deal Democrat (the real ones who fought for Progressive values in the 'old days'!). I met Chief Arvol Looking Horse, keeper of the Sacred White Buffalo Calf Pipe and chief of the Lakota, Dakota, and Nakota Nations as a college student at the Conference on World Affairs in Boulder, Colorado, where I served as his local host in 1997. He invited me to a Gathering at Pipestone, Minnesota to meet up with the Thunder Riders as they rode to mend the Sacred Hoop. That experience changed my life. I hope that this trip to Standing Rock at least begins to repay the kindness I experienced from the elders at that event. It is the least I can do. May I have many more opportunities to stand for what is right, and may we all lend our voices and our actions to healing our communities and our planet. Thank you for your good heart, for caring, and doing what you can do. We- individually and collectively -are more powerful than the people currently in power want us to know. We *can* make a difference each day, and with each decision we make. Chief Arvol Looking Horse's message from August 26, 2016

title: David Morgan for Aldridge-Brownhills Fund
summary:
My name is David Morgan and I am proud to have been selected to be the Labour candidate for the Aldridge-Brownhills constituency in Walsall in the upcoming General Election on Thursday 12th December 2019.

I live in the centre of Brownhills and I am very aware of the issues that our towns and communities face. Aldridge-Brownhills feels like a forgotten part of our borough, with its fate being decided by only 66% of its voters. After 40 years of Conservative representation in Aldridge-Brownhills, now more than ever, real change is needed.Having worked in schools for over 15 years, I have seen first-hand the damage that has been done by almost 10 years of Conservative and Liberal Democrat imposed austerity. Everyday I see the cold, hard reality of how Conservative government policies and choices are affecting our children, friends, families and communities. I have seen and heard real life accounts of how Universal Credit is devastating lives, plunging families into poverty and debt, causing ill health and forcing people to have to rely upon food banks.Aldridge-Brownhills is now home to three food banks: one in Pelsall, one in Brownhills, and one in Aldridge. This simply should not be happening in 2019 and in the fifth largest economy in the world.Our high streets and towns are littered with empty shops and buildings, poor infrastructure and outdated transport links. Many promises have been made by the Mayor of the West Midlands and Government alike, but in reality these are just empty words with no action. We the people are left to pick up the pieces of this broken infrastructure.As an ordinary resident living in Brownhills, I want to stand up for our constituency and argue for and help to deliver change. We need real actions, not empty promises. Our great towns and villages from Brownhills to Streetly, Aldridge to Pelsall, Walsall Wood to Rushall, Shelfield to Clayhanger, Lazy Hill to Shire Oak and Catshill to Ogley Hay deserve better.This general election is a chance to vote for real change. Vote for a local voice to make Aldridge-Brownhills heard at the heart of Westminster. To achieve this I need to be able to connect with voters, through leaflets, calling cards and social media. All of this comes at a cost, and as a non-target seat we have to raise our own money to campaign and take the fight for real change to the Conservatives. 

Please help us to take the fight for change to the Conservatives and make a huge impact in Aldridge-Brownhills.

 

IMPORTANT INFORMATION:  By making a donation to this campaign you understand and accept the following: If I am making a donation of more than £50, checks will be made to ensure my name is included on a UK electoral register (excluding the Isle of Man and Channel Islands). My name and the amount I have donated will be included in the candidate return submitted after the election. This information will be available for public inspection on request, although my home address will not be made public. The money you use to make a donation must be from your own funds. 

Thank you for your support- every penny will help us make a big difference here in Aldridge-Brownhills.

 

David

title: Bernie Delegate Matthew Rock ! ! !
summary: Hello to everyone and thank you for your donations.   I have been a YUGE Bernie supporter in this political cycle, spending countless hours canvassing, phone banking, training volunteers, holding informational dinners, organizing rallies, and everything else that I could possible do to register hundreds and hundreds of voters as Democrats in order to vote for Bernie. Even life time Republicans have made the switch! I was honored by my fellow progressive DNC members by being elected as the Male Congressional District 2a National Delegate here in Oregon and had the extreme pleasure of being elected as a State Convention Delegate which allowed me to help chose the other amazing PLEO's and At-Large Delegates here in Oregon. As a fervent Bernie supporter I would very much appreciate your help in covering some of the costs that I will incur in getting to and attending the Democratic National Convention.  I am eager to attend and truly represent, not only my Congressional District and Oregon but ALL Bernie supporter across this great country and those abroad.  We need strong representation at the convention and I believe that I will be a voice of reason amidst the chaos of our current political system.  We must continue the fight to see Bernie as our next President.  We shall not back down.  We shall not relent.  We shall be steadfast in standing up for this political revolution.  I am confident that I will be able to work across candidate lines and bring in the support from the other team that we need to plead our case at the Democratic National Convention AND WIN.  #AlwaysBernie #BernieOrBust #BernieForPresident #OnlyBernie #VivaLaRevolution ! !  !Thank you so much for your support.  The people UNITED shall never be divided.

title: Send a Bernie Delegate to the DNC
summary: The movement continues!!! AND BERNIE STILL NEEDS YOU!! I need your help to get to the DNC. I'm a Pledged Delegate for Bernie Sanders and worked for the Senator the last few months as a field organizer. The Democrat Party makes this very expensive and will likely cost $2000 or more. Anything you can do will be very helpful. I really want to do this for Bernie... vote for him from the convention floor. Can you help make this possible? About me: Back in August 2015, I made a decision. I wanted to help Bernie Sanders however I could become president of the United States. I had my eye on Bernie for a while and was a big supporter of the "get money out of politics" movement. It seemed clear to me that Bernie was the man for the job and we needed him now more than ever. Along with my full-time job and in the middle of writing my Master's thesis, I started organizing meetings. First meeting we had in my living room, 45 people showed up, including a State Senator and a Representative. We planned flyering, canvass events and future meetings at the more spacious bar around the corner. Along the way, I met other ambitious organizers like Keith Mundy, Steve Holecko and Michael Berler. Together we orchestrated opening 6 volunteer offices across the state, the first here in Lakewood. Our first mission was getting Bernie on the ballot. Then organized for our delegate caucuses where many of the grassroots crew won delegate spots at the Democratic National Convention. Following that, I was hired by Bernie 2016 as a Field Director and worked in Ohio and New Jersey on Get Out the Vote and field organizing as well as delegates and ballot access. Thank you for your time and consideration!ps. If you are like me, financially strapped, please at least SHARE this post!! I would greatly appreciate your help in this way as well :)

title: March For Our Lives Bus Trip to DC
summary: Enough is Enough!Will you please consider helping the Young Democrats of Worcester County sponsor a bus for our local youth to attend the March For Our Lives in DC on March 24th?A roundtrip coach bus costs approximatley $2700.We want all students and youth who want to attend be able to afford to attend. The individual cost is $55.-$60. per seat/student. A contribution in that amount will cover one person. However, any amount small (or big) is super appreciated. Something  has to change. Students in Worcester County want to see that happen and have our voices be heard. We want to be there to represent our county and support a cause that is directly impacting our daily lives.Gun violence and the innocent slaughter of masses of people has got to stop. They say the youth of today don't care what's going on. Don't believe it. We do! We will make the change. Please visit our website below for more info about us.Thank you,Isabel EmondPresident of the Worcester County Democratic ClubThe official youth arm of Democratic National Committeewww.worcesteryoungdemocrats.comYoung Democrats receive first-hand experience in campaigns and elections, grass roots organizing, fund raising and candidate elective office, just to name a few. Many of the Democractic Party's leaders got their start in politics with the Young Democrats of America

title: #ThumbsUp for Matt #MISheCan
summary: (TL;DR in bold)My name is Matthew Leahy, friends call me Matt or Mateo.  Not everyone finds their calling when they are in Junior High. In 2008, I realized that I had a passion for Democratic politics. I wanted to learn to use the gifts and talents and the education I had to become the most effective campaigner and advocate I could be; I wanted to put my hands on the wheel of government and steer it towards policies that would help families and neighborhoods like mine. Impoverished but hopeful. Diverse but united. Just like the biracial president-elect, who inspired biracial me.8 years after Barack Obama inspired me I have gone from summer intern for Bill White for Governor, to organizing for two different State Reps, to field director for an El Paso city councilman, to being the only staff for a newly elected appellate judge in a race that spanned 17 West Texas counties. After staffing now on five consecutive winning campaigns (and learning a little bit of Spanish), the Hillary Clinton campaign has offered me a chance to be a Regional Organizing Director in Michigan.The Great Lakes State is at risk of swinging to Trump. In an election with some of the highest stakes in US history, I want to work hard to keep "Trumpence" from gaining traction.  I've always wanted to work on a presidential campaign and this may be the only opportunity I ever have to do so. Organizing this area could even provide lessons on how to elect more Democrats here in Texas in 2018, 2020 and beyond. But there is one thing keeping me from this dream duty...I need to get a car before August 1st.From the age of seven, I grew up with a single father below the poverty line. Throughout my school years, while many peers were getting their licenses and first cars, my Dad and I relied on public transit. My father now only has a car because, as a cab driver, it's his livelihood.  I got used to that way of life and never really had the time or resource to learn to drive and get a car. Lack of a personal vehicle has been the number one limiting factor in pursuing my goals, and it is a requirement for any position with the Clinton campaign. My joining the team in MI is conditional on my ability to get a reliable car to traverse the mountainous terrain within the next two weeks. To paraphrase a quote from a favorite movie, "This is my most desperate hour. Help me, you are my only hope."My ego isn't big enough to think I'm entitled to this, or that Hillary won't be elected without me, and my nature isn't to ask for anything I'm not able to repay in short order. I'm doing this only because several friends and family, who have long believed in and supported me, have encouraged me to do so.But this car could change my life. This job could change my life. Both are bound. I humbly ask for whatever generous contributions you can make. If you can't donate I ask you to share this with your network, or lend me some advice. I'm asking you all to enable me to pour my soul into long hours of difficult work in an unfamiliar place.The drive to Detroit from Dallas, TX is 17 hours nonstop. Whatever monies aren't used to cover expenses for the trip and, of course, a fuel efficient car or truck, will be donated to United Way, a favorite charity of my late mother.Please, check out my LinkedIn to see more about my experience and feel free to contact me with questions and/or wisdom. Whatever the outcome, however you choose to help, Thank You.

title: Help Cat get to the DNC for Bernie
summary: Hi everyone,My name is Cat Williams and I am the young democrat representative of the 45th legislative district, and am also on the executive board of the King County democrats. On May 21, I had the honor of being elected to be a national delegate for Bernie Sanders. This means I will get to represent Washington's 1st congressional district at the Democratic National Convention in Philadelphia. I am beyond honored to have been elected and I am going to do everything I can to make a difference. I truly believe this could be a pivotal moment in our nation's history, because Bernie Sanders has given so many of us a voice to stand up and demand change in our system. By going to the national convention, I will be able to directly have a part in invoking the change we need for our future generations. As I said during my speech, I will do whatever it takes to make our voices heard and make the change we're fighting for now, a reality for our future.I have heard it will take about $5,000 to pay for the trip. The cost of airfare, hotel, and all other expenses are not covered. I am asking for your support in whatever form you can offer it - whether it be donating or sharing my gofundme page, anything helps! Thank you so much.

title: Shaughnessy for Mayor of Westbrook
summary: New Vision...Solid Leadership!My name is Michael Shaughnessy. And I am asking for your vote this November and your support to be the next Mayor of Westbrook, Maine. Join me in working for the future of our city.  Westbrook is a city of vast potential. It has a burgeoning downtown, a beautiful river running through it and many historic neighborhoods. It is a place that is transitioning. I would bring a fresh and broad vision to the city. A vision that is not clouded by past battles and resentments. I would value the work that has been done here, while looking beyond our borders for innovative approaches to economic and community development. ￼￼￼We must find collaborations and new ways to support our citizens in need and welcome our new immigrants. We can and should set the bar high for other communities and lead regionally and nationally. With innovative leadership I will support:· Strong and vital neighborhoods· Small businesses and entrepreneurship· Downtown quality of place· Environmental stewardship· Historic Preservation· Codes that lead change · Civil leadership · Quality education for all our childrenMy fresh vision for Westbrook is grounded in a great many experiences:· 30 years as a member of the USM faculty· Multiple leadership positions at USM· An installation artist showing nationally· Elected to the Windham Town Council· State and local Democratic Committees· Various boards including the Maine Center for Creativity, the Maine Arts Commission and a Founding Board Member of Space Gallery· Founding board member / current President of the Friends of the Presumpscot River, the leader in the restoration of our river.￼￼￼Malory and I have lived in this area for 30 years raising our four sons - Theo, Avery, Ciaran and Tulleigh.  With Malory's mother and our son Tulleigh, his partner Sarah and our grandson Aebel, we live in a four generation household in the old Ellie Conant Saunders house on Conant Street and together are beginning a small farm there. While I have worked across party lines on various initiatives in my community or in my professional life, and will continue to do so, as a lifelong Democrat, I was honored to receive the nomination for Mayor by the Westbrook Democratic Caucus.     The election is on November 8th so I need to raise money fast and work hard to reach out,  knock on the doors and hear the stories of my neighbors. I cannot wait to hear their ideas and visions for this great city we all call home! Please contact me if you want to share your thoughts or ask any questions at 207-329-5042.And if you can help -- please donate what you can. Every little bit helps reach the goal. Thanks!NOTE: All contributions are going to the Committee to Elect Shaughnessy.  Any left over campaign funds will be donated to the Friends of the Presumpscot River.

title: Keys Dem Delegate to Philly 7-25
summary: Thank you for visiting my gofundme campaign. I have recently been elected by Democrats in District 21 of Florida to represent them as a Delegate for Bernie Sanders at the Democratic Convention in Philadelphia on July 25th. I believe I will have an opportunity to raise non-partisan awareness about issues that are locally important to all residents of the Florida Keys including but not limited to environmental concerns, jobs and wages, housing and homeowner insurance. Many who will visit this page will already know that I am a lifelong resident of the Lower Keys, having moved here with my parents when I was a child. I graduated from Key West High School in 2005 and went to Florida Keys Community College and received an Associate in Arts in 2007 and and Associate in Science for IT in 2008. I am currently a videographer and part time real estate agent. I have literaly fallen into this position because there is a great need for people with passion, charisma, energy and new ideas. I never intended to enter politics, but I am doing it because it is clearly the right thing to do with the current political climate we are facing today.Despite being prepared mentally and educationally to succeed in this task for my fellow residents of District 26, the financial burden is immense for most people to handle alone. The Democratic Party has arranged hotel rooms at Philadelphia's Downtown Marriott. Below is an except from the Democratic Party about the hotel rooms."The convention will be at the Philadelphia downtown Marriott. With taxes, fees, etc it is estimated that a king room will cost around $600/night. Delegates are expected to arrive Sunday and need to plan to be there 5 nights. You are definitely able & encouraged to fundraise to help cover the costs of the trip"Aside from that, they are many other costs associated with travel, food and proper attire (I will need to trade in my flip flops)I am grateful in advanced for all of your kind words and support and am very honored to have this opportunity to represent the community and show the big wigs up north a thing or two about "One Human Family"

title: AD39 SFV Progressives - ADEM Delegate Candidates
summary: Funds go to: Outreach material + travel expensesWe are the Progressive Candidates running for seas in California's  Assembly District 39, in the Northeast San Fernando Valley!Every two years, the CA Democrats elect 7 self-identified females and 7 other than self-identified females from each Assembly District in CA as delegates to the state party. Those who are elected will have a chance to vote for the new party chair and other leadership. The race is hotly contested and will determine how welcoming, grassroots-focused and innovative the party becomes or how beholden it will remain to big money interests.Delegates elect Party officers, endorse candidates for statewide, legislative and congressional office, attend the annual convention, network with other Democrats, represent your constituency, promote the California Democratic Party agenda, and vote to endorse resolutions and ballot measures.We need your help to elect Progressives that will stand for our values!Funds go to: Outreach material + travel expenses

title: Honoring our Pledges and Bernie
summary:
HOLD ON!  We are going to the convention to fight!    Bernie will be there and we, his pledged delegates, as well.
 We will have a roll call vote.  I pledged to vote for him and I will.  He will speak and I will be there to support him. 
It's a time of great wonderment and flux, to be sure, but we have spent a year making historic strides.  WE have brought issues to the attention of the public and the media and even the Democrats that would otherwise be avoided and diverted.
WE have something more to say in Philadelphia.  WE will seize any further opportunities to speak out loudly that our country must be returned to the people.

title: Help for Nikki : House Fire Relief
summary: Nicole – Daughter to Richena Johnson,  has lost her apartment in the W. Steele lane fire last week.   Nikki, her husband (Neal), and their daughter (Abby), have lost all of their belongings due to the fire/smoke damage.Santa Rosa apartment fire displaces 140, causes $500,000 in damage (Photo Credit: Press Democrat : Alexandria Bordas and Nashelly Chavez;  April 5, 2019, 7:25PM)For those of you that don’t know Nicole, she worked as an LTE for Mead & Hunt, Inc.  for roughly 1 year.  She was instrumental in  donating and selling office furniture during our last move and she focused our time on becoming paperless.  She is still part of the Mead & Hunt family and we are looking to support her and her family in their time of need.(Neal (Left), Richena (Middle Top), Abby (Middle Bottom), and Nikki (Right))Funds will go towards lodging, food, clothing, supplies, and replacement of belongings that can not be salvaged.All three of them are fighters and just need a little ray of light to help them through this dark time.  Any help you can give them will be greatly appreciated.

title: Support Eric Cardenas' Trip to DNC!
Send San Diego YDs to DNC2016
summary: Hey Everyone, As you know, Kelvin Barrios, Daniel Firoozi and myself (Will Rodriguez-Kennedy) were elected to be pledge delegates and alternates to the DNC Convention in 2016 for Hillary Clinton. It's a huge honor. When we go to convention we will be part of the most diverse delegation, Daniel and I will be part of the largest delegation of LGBT delegates to any major party nominating convention in American History and all the while we will be making history by nominating the first woman to the Democratic nominee! Unfortunately, it's expensive. We have joined together to bring costs down but the California delegate's cost is among the highest in the nation. Rooms alone will cost $629 a night. Food will probably be a few hundred per person. Flights are between $550-700. We did a budget and it will likely cost a single California Delegate around $6,000 to attend. Well by joining together we can do three for the cost of one!Now, obviously, we're young Democrats, each a student,  an activist and we don't have that kind of money. We need your help, friends, family, supporters. You were instrumental in our election to this honor and we need your help to make history. Please consider contributing to this effort! Every dollar you contribute will be greatly appreciated and we young Democrats know how to stretch a dollar so that we can make it work. Thank you so much! In Solidarity,Will Rodriguez-Kennedy, Kelvin Barrios and Daniel Firoozi

title: Help support Sergio for DNC 2016!
summary: My name is Sergio Lopez and on May 1, I won election as a delegate to the 2016 Democratic National Convention, I'm the youngest person representing our district, CD-18, as part of the California delegation to the convention, but I need your help!I've been involved in politics at both the local and national level for years, from schoolboard races, to serving on Hillary's team in Brooklyn and helping work on California policy. Along the way, I've fought to ensure include equal rights for women, AAPI and Hispanics, and representation for young people in politics. In my race, I was proud to be endorsed by local Assemblymember and former Campbell Mayor Evan Low.As Democrats, I believe we have the responsibility to pay it forward by mentoring and supporting the next generation of party leadership -- something I have done and continue to do by mentoring other young people and encouraging them to become more involved.I ran for delegate because I strongly believe that young people and people of color should have a voice in our political system to ensure that system represents the people. Delegates have a role in nominating the party's nominee and attending caucuses at the convention, and I will make sure both that the Bay Area and young people are represented.I can't do this without you -- thank you for the help.More info on the costs involved here: http://www.cadem.org/our-party/national-convention/2016-Delegate-Travel-Cost.pdf

title: Mr. Lockridge goes to Philly (DNC)
summary: Welcome to my 'Mr. Lockridge goes to Philly' GoFundMe page!Thank you for taking an interest in this amazing, (perhaps more than) once-in-a-lifetime opportunity. Here's the scoop for those of you just tuning in: I was selected to attend the Democratic National Convention (DNC) in Philadelphia in July as one of 27 delegates from the state of Montana. I am extremely honored to be a part of this talented and diverse group of statesmen and women. But I need your help. Can you chip in $25 or $50 or whatever amount feels comfortable to help send me to the DNC and the City of Brotherly Love? The convention runs July 25-28 and each delegate is responsible for their own airfare, lodging, and meals -- not to mention any sight-seeing money they may want. I've been told that a trip to the DNC can cost in the neighborhood of $3,500. Please know that I've saved up roughly $1,000 of my own money in the hopes that this day may come and this trip is not in jeopardy just because I am asking for money assistance from those nearest and dearest to me. I invite you to share in this journey, whether you give or not. Please mull this over. And let me know if you have any questions about the DNC  trip or the Montana Democratic Party convention, where the delegate selection took place. In case anyone is wondering, I am a pledged delegate for Hillary Clinton, as evidenced by this article......and this Twitter post. FYI, that's a cardboard cutout of the former First Lady and Secretary of State at her campaign's Missoula field office. Mostly I'm just proud to be a Montana Democrat and I cannot wait to go to the DNC with my fellow delegates and kick Trump's ass. Thanks for your support.Cheers to all!Nick#Philly #ImwithHer #DNC #Montana #DemsCare

title: Let's start a new political party,  American Party
summary: This is a fundraiser to start a new political party or movement.  If you are tired of watching corrupt politicians and corporations enrich themselves then let’s start the revolution now.  My vision is to create a political platform void of corporate sponsorship or special interest groups, PACs, etc.  The difficult question is how?  I am seeking a donation of $10 per individual. I am looking for 1 million like minded people who have had enough.  If 1 million people donated 10 per month it would raise 120 million a year enough to legitimately fund legislative campaigns with our initial goal of electing one honest and decent individual to congress within the next two years.  The mandate of the party would not be affiliated as a liberal or a conservative but as an American.  With the initial start up we will build a social media platform free from advertising where each member of the party can express their views and the entire party can instantaneously vote on issues like illegal immigration, tax reform, tort reform, healthcare and all issues that effect our health and well being as individuals and as citizens.      So how do we accomplish this by limiting donations to 10 dollars initially and to 10 dollars per month after the American Party has been established.  That way no one person has any greater influence over the party.  The American Party will develop an app that is a crossover of social media and financial services to ensure the party member’s identity.  As the party progresses we will be able to lobby and elect representatives and congressmen that are not beholden to any corporations, religions or political ideologies.  Our goal will be to find and support decent and honest human beings.  Most of you that read this the first time will probably think I am crazy and rightfully so.  Anyone who tries to battle the corporate political party structure generally gets eaten alive.  It starts as the first person who puts on the yellow vest or creates a movement by refusing to move to the back of the bus.  Most will probably laugh at the idiot that posted this but just think if it started with a million people what 50 million could do and so forth.  What could a party of 50 million with 500 million a month accomplish maybe elect a president and few hundred legislators.  The last question you will ask or maybe the first will be who is this idiot that wants to change the world for 10 dollars a month.  A disgruntled political science major who has only voted once in the last 20 years.  When in college a newly tenured professor full of lust and zeal asked the class “give me the definition of political science” and I blurted out BULLSHIT!  Needless to say I received my first and only F but I can’t say I would go back and change my answer.  Let’s end the bullshit. Most  of us who work for a living have no real influence.  We either have to choose a democrat or republican or waste a vote on a libertarian.  All sounds great but what are the principals of The American Party?  That’s hard to answer it’s up to us as an organization to develop as we grow.  I can tell you what I believe in is having the right to say Santa Claus and Christmas, though I am not religious prayers before sporting events, and generally most of the ideals of our founding fathers who warned of big governments and corporations.  But I am only one vote.   The Party will be established with the social media platform so that members can instantaneously vote on core issues.  No more main stream corporate media polls ,propaganda, and data mining.  If 50 million members vote towards open borders or border walls at least the real Americans will finally have a voice! And can be truly counted.  I appreciate if you actually read my midnight ravings and if you did it means I was either dumb enough to post this or brave enough.  Either way I refuse to get up and move to the back of the bus and I will have a voice going forward.  And for those of you that didn’t make it to the end well that’s ok I’ve been with you for the last 26 years, silent and watching ROME burn.Ps  It’s less than a movie and I am the first to donate.  Your donation is important but it’s spreading the idea that makes it work.

title: Brittany's DNC Adventure!
summary: My name is Brittany MacPherson and I am by far one of the most ardent Hillary supporters you will meet. I am currently a grad student at Oregon State, AFT union steward, Marion County Young Democrats Chair, Founder of Salem for Hillary, HUGE supporter of progressive candidates & causes, and overall good person :)I was just elected to be a delegate to the Democratic National Convention! Yay! Go me! ...but if you recall I am a student which means funds are hard to come by. Our party's state delegates entrusted me with the task of going to Philadelphia and ensuring that Hillary Rodham Clinton become the DNC's nominee! I need your help to do just that!I'm asking for $2,016 (get it??) to get me to Philadelphia, house me, and feed me. That amount is fairly conservative seeing as though I will be going across the country on such short notice. Several times during the State Convention delegates would come up to me and told me they voted for me because I am the future of the party. It's incredibly humbling and meaningful that so many people trust me to carry on the legacy of this wonderful party. I won't let them down and I will represent the Democratic Party of Oregon with pride. Thank you for donating!P.S. everyone who donates $35 or more will get a Hillary or Bernie button from me, your choice!Visit my website to learn more about mehttp://brittanymacpherson.weebly.com/

title: Funeral Fund for Jim Wilson Jr.
summary: Jim wasn’t expected to live past the first two years of his life, but in the face of all medical odds, he made it past his 62nd birthday, and made a wonderful impact in his hometown of Petaluma, CA. Our family is pooling resources to raise funds to cover the cost of the funeral and obituary in the Press Democrat, but we are reaching out to our network of friends and family, and to anyone else who knew Jim, to contribute. For those of you who didn’t know Jim personally, we hope that his life story inspires you!Here’s Jim’s story:James Thomas “Jim” Wilson Jr. was born on March 1, 1956 at Selfridge Air Force Base in Michigan. When he was born, it was discovered that he had spina bifida, a birth defect related to the spinal cord that causes paralysis and swelling of the brain. Back in 1956, treatment options were so limited that doctors often advised parents not to take their babies home.Jim’s parents, Frances Wilson and late James Wilson Sr, did not accept the troubling medical prognosis. Instead, they fought for their first-born child to grow up and have a normal life. In his infancy and early childhood, his parents cleverly figured out ways to help overcome each of Jim’s challenges as a baby. They came up with things like protective devices for the sensitive areas around his spine, and even built wheeled carts for baby Jim to have help while learning how to crawl.Jim went on to become a big brother, having both a sister and a kid brother. They all looked after each other and formed a close bond. Attending public school in the 1960s before wheelchair accessibility and specialized education were common, Jim graduated from Casa Grande High School in 1975, and even went on to take college courses at the College of Marin. Jim and his family enjoyed travels to New York, Arizona, Japan, Mexico, and Hawaii. As an adult, Jim was a dedicated volunteer at Petaluma Chamber of Commerce for more than 25 years, and also volunteered at the Petaluma Library. He was known for being fiercely independent around town, often seen cruising in his electric wheelchair to the local Starbucks and other local businesses. Knowing how important mobility is to people, Jim worked with his mother and the city to make many ofPetaluma’s sidewalks more wheelchair accessible.In his senior years, Jim attended art classes at the Petaluma Senior Center, where he created many beautiful ceramics and paintings. Throughout his life, Jim had an optimistic attitude that inspiredeveryone around him. On March 31, 2018, Jim passed away peacefully at home, due to recurring breathing complications. He is survived by his mother Frances, sister Lori, brother Greg, sister-in- law Tammy, uncles, aunts, and many nieces and nephews. He also leaves behind his greatly loved dog, Foxy. Our family and community already miss Jim terribly, but are grateful for his incredible contributions to our hometown. All donations will go to obituary and funeral costs. Any remaining donations beyond our fundraising goal will go towards the Hospice of Petaluma, to support an organization that supported Jim and his family through a time of need.Friends and family are welcome to attend a memorial service Monday April 23 at 11am at Parent-Sorensen Mortuary and Crematory in Petaluma.“Those we love don’t go away,They walk beside us every day,Unseen, unheard, but always near,Still loved, still missed and very dear.”

title: Earles Family Fund
summary: Some things to think about when you read about Anthony. He spent years as a volunteer for the democrat party. Logged 500+ hours a year volunteering for the Salvation Army. Volunteered on every habitat for humanity project in mower county. Took in 6 children over the last 20 years and raised them next to his own 6. Then a year ago this month he lost his wife of over 20 years. This year he lost his youngest son. Last month he was diagnosed with cancer. Last week local kids let his service dog out of the back yard and was hit by a car. Yesterday he was handed a forcloser notice on his home with just a year left in payments. It has been one battle after the other for him and the 2 young children he still has at home. Money from this fund will go to pay his medical and help them save there Home and all other bills till he can get back on his feet.

title: Send Paul to the Philadelphia DNC
✨ Helping The Homeless 1 Person at a Time ✨
summary: Many of you know, I have a passion to help the homeless. I believe that people should feel safe , warm and have food. Last year I was able to give out over 15 large IKEA bags filled with Tarps , Blankets , Hand-warmers , Personal Hygiene Items , Clothing , Food & Sun Protectant at a cost of approximately $100 a bag. My goal is to be able to help people in need find services that provide them with Protection from the Elements , and food to help with hunger. Among all of the troubles in today’s world we all too often forget one important thing: that we are all just  human. We are not black or white, Democrat or Republican, Liberal or Conservative we are only human. Everyone deserves love and respect. Everyone deserves to feel important.

title: Help Courtney with tuition so I can finish college
summary: Hello, my name is Courtney. I’m a student at American University in Washington, DC studying psychology. I’m 21 years old and 3 semesters away from graduating. I transferred here last fall from Macalester College in St. Paul, MN. When I transferred, I received no type of tuition assistance or scholarships from AU. At first I thought it was a mistake and registered for classes. When I saw my bill, I cried in my car and panicked. I contacted my reservation, Big Grassy River First Nation, and they helped as much as they could. In spring of 2018, I participated in the Native American Political Leadership Program at George Washington University where we studied politics and interned in agencies and offices in DC. I’ve also been on the Dean’s List twice at Macalester and held a 3.68 GPA and at AU, I have a 3.7 GPA. I’ve been apart of AU Democrats and Proud Indigenous People’s for Education, while I worked as a building manager.I can sit here and tell every mistake I made to get myself into this situation, but I would rather fix the problem. I have a $8,000 bill that is keeping me from registering for classes next semester. I’ve exhausted all help I have access to and it’s taken all the courage I have to admit I need major help. I only have 3 semesters left until I have my bachelors. I’m currently on a leave of absence to work and save money for future semesters. I’ve secured more help from my school and outside scholarships for Fall 2019, but only if I pay off this remaining $8,000. I haven’t been able to think of anything else since September of last year, and I’m sure anyone who has been in stressful financial situations understands the weight I feel on my shoulders. School is my everything. That may sound weird, but it’s the only thing I’ve ever been good at. I want to go to grad school and get my doctorate in psych, so I can be a child psychologist for a reservation. Unfortunately, it’s hard to put in the energy towards doing my best when I am more worried about money. Please consider helping me finish my degree! Thank you so much for reading.

title: The John Wood Heart-Attack Recovery Fund
summary: On the morning of May 29th 2019 my uncle John Wood (age 71) of Albany, Oregon suffered a massive heart attack. It started with difficulty breathing and pain in his arm, which John described as feeling like an elephant was sitting on his chest. He was rushed to the hospital where he underwent an angiogram that revealed several severely blocked arteries, one of which was 100% blocked. As I type this, on May 30th 2019, he is undergoing a triple bi-pass surgery to save his life. Aside from small Social Security checks, John is the sole source of income for himself and his wife, my aunt Ruth. For many years John has worked 7 days a week delivering newspapers for the Albany Democrat Herald. In fact, when he suffered the heart attack he was at the newspaper picking up his papers for early morning delivery. John will be in the hospital recovering from surgery for the next few days to a week, but will likely not be able to work for another eight weeks or more. Your donations would help John and Ruth cover whatever medical costs their insurance doesn't cover and help them to pay their bills and buy food until John can return to work or another financial solution can be found. The need for these funds is very urgent and any amount you can give would be greatly appreciated.Thank you,John Leys

title: Michael Harrington Convention Whip
summary: I am seeking travel funds for the Cleveland Convention with Free the Delegates.I bring many capabilities to the table and I have done much for the cause already.1) I am the man who did the math showing 12 million Democrats crossed over in the election.2) I did not start this early, instead I predicted in advance the South Carolina Democrat vote to 0.1% accuracy.  I know what I am doing in this arena3) I have joined a network of anti-Open Primary experts, activists, and politicians. My presence there can help shape a future where Democrats will not be in Republican Primaries and Caucuses. 4) I have brought hope and relief to our many volunteers and supporters in our cause to get Ted Cruz elected.  I may be able to make a real difference at the Convention.5) I will either be a Whip, or a support person. In my roles I could potentially be the man keeping track of the probabilities at various stages and help identify our needs. 6) I can definitely have some effect upon the Oregon Delegation. -----I will be using the funds specifically for transportation to Cleveland, for a Rental Vehicle, and for other Expenses associated with staying in Cleveland exclusively. #NeverTrump#FreeTheDelegatesI am not at this point formally on the team, there is pending discussion on that, but they are interested in me. If they do not take me then I will return 100% of all cash.

title: Send Tamborine to Philly for Bernie
summary: At the Washington State 10th Congressional District Caucus on May 21, 2014 five delegates were elected to represent Bernie Sanders at the 2016 Democratic National Convention in Philadelphia, PA. Out of the five, there were three women from Thurston County. Tamborine Borrelli was one of those 3 women!Tamborine is asking for YOUR help to raise money to defray the cost of flights, hotel rooms and other travel expenses to get from Thurston County to Philadelphia by the week of July 24, 2016. Meet Tamborine:Tamborine was born and raised in the San Fernando Valley of Los Angeles. Her parents were small business owners of a beauty salon and her father worked a second job as an educator teaching psychology and civics to high school students.Tamborine was inspired to get involved in politics as the movement around Bernie Sanders came into being. She opened up a volunteer campaign office to organize the people of the 2nd LD to register to vote, pre-register for the caucus, as well as facilitating phone banking and doorbelling for the campaign. She became a deputy field organizer for the campaign, a caucus site leader and was on the Thurston Democrat Platform committee.Tamborine’s passion for justice and ensuring that everyone has a chance to live their best life has been a driving force in her life for years. From running after-school programs for underprivileged girls in the Chicago projects, to working as a personal coach in Los Angeles, to opening a community cafe featuring organic, local food as well as local theater acts, using her skills to serve others just comes naturally.She also isn’t afraid to stand up for what is right. Tamborine was one of roughly 1,400 activists arrested on the steps of the Capitol as part of the Democracy Spring movement urging Congress to pass legislation to overturn the Supreme Court’s Citizen’s United ruling. As Tamborine was getting handcuffed alongside activists, journalists, and ordinary citizens from across the country, she looked up into the windows of Congress and wondered how America could work better if just a few more of those offices were held by people with the kind of forethought, integrity, and passion as the citizens she was now sharing a police van with. Bernie's vision is what has inspired Tamborine to become involved as a National Delegate and was at the root of her decideding to run for State Senator in WA state. As challenging as running a campaign can be it makes it all the more powerful for her to be there in Philly as one of Bernie's advocates.Being a National Delegate was something Tamborine knew she had to accomplish so she could be there in Philly ready, willing and able to STAND WITH and FOR Bernie, the one man who has fought for the people and has refused to give up. Tamborine feels she was born for this REVOLUTION and will be the kind of delgate that Bernie can DEPEND on to fight and not give in to the pressures of the establishment.Please consider contributing to this fund to help with the expenses that come with traveling to Philladelphia, PA as a National Delegate. Tamborine will be forever grateful to be able to give all that she is to this process without having to stress about financial concerns in making it happen. Thank you in advance for your consideration and In Solidarity.

title: Send Bruce to Philly for Bernie
summary:
I have more information about my trip to Philly and my likely expenses, so I've lowered my goal in accordance with that information.My name is Bruce Fealk.  I've been a life long Democrat and I can't even contain my excitement today.
I'm 62 years old and I've never been to a Democratic convention and I probably won't have the chance again.  I've campaigned for Bernie in Michigan, Indiana, and Iowa and held debate watch parties, phone banked, volunteered at Bernie's rallies in Michigan.  
Michigan's 8th Congressional District elected me today to be the only male delegate representing Bernie in Philadelphia.The money raised will be used for transportation, hotel, ($400/night), food and other expenses related to attending the Democratic National Convention in Philadelphia July 25-29.If I raise more than my goal I will donate any excess funds to Bernie's general election campaign or to the National Breast Cancer Foundation.  My sister died of breast cancer at age 41, so it's personal.  I've decided to drive, so that's one of the reasons I've lowered my personal fundraising goal.I have been a Democratic activist for several years and it is such an honor to represent Michigan and Bernie Sanders at the convention in Philadelphia.  Bernie is a once in a lifetime candidate.  I will be eternally grateful if you can help me fund my trip to Philadelphia.

title: CPAC
summary: It’s that time of year again!! The time of year where young conservatives gather from around the country to attend the Conservative Political Action Conference (CPAC) and learn about how to be young activist in a predominately liberal environment. Once again, I was offered to attend CPAC due to my current activism in politics, and I need your help! CPAC takes place in Washington, D.C. which can be very expensive when it comes to food and housing, and on a college student budget, this can make it hard to afford things. Therefore, I’m asking for donations to help my path to becoming the best young conservative activist I can be! Since my last time attending CPAC, I have been able to successfully accomplish quite a bit more in the political world. Here are some things I’ve done: -Current Secretary of State on the Executive Board of College Republicans -Personally met President Trump and greeted him into South Dakota (and got a selfie!)-Internship for Dusty Johnson (current South Dakota Congressman) -Volunteer work for political candidates such as Kristi Noem, Sue Peterson, and Jason Ravnsborg-Met Michael Knowels (author of “Reasons to Vote Democrat) -Met Sean Spicer (former White House Press Secretary) -Internship for Americans for Prosperity (non-partisan political organization) -Worked for the State GOP With that being said, I hope that I can count on you for help to further my knowledge of what being a active Conservative looks like in my community! Donations will be accepted up until February 20th.

title: Cindy's Mom's funeral home expenses
summary: Hi, Friends:I'm Cindy.  You probably know me from the San Diego Democrats for Equality, my activism on choice, or my honor as a Friend of Pride in the San Diego LGBT Pride Parade in 2013.On Monday my Mom died.  It was coming, but we never knew when.   Now that day arrived.  I feel so alone.The past few years Mom and I sacrificed a lot to care for her.  She was 87, was bedridden, and needed constant care.   Last year I gave up my independent life and my apartment to move in with her.  Mom's expenses drained her savings and my pension.   Now my brother and I can't afford the funeral home bills - we can't lay Mom to rest until we are able to pay.I so hate having to do this, but could my communities, the LGBT community, the Democrats and the Democratic Club, the women's community, my Kaiser friends, please help us bury my Mom.  She was all I've got, and to get her to her final resting place will be so much a relief.Thank you so much for your support!  It is urgent.  Thank you.  Love to you, Cindy

title: Nebraskans Against Gun Violence
summary:
About us:
We come from all walks of life in Nebraska: Democrats, Republicans, and independents; teachers, lawyers, scientists, professors, information technologists, retirees, students, faith leaders, stay-at-home parents. We are Nebraskans concerned about gun violence in our state and country. We think we can do better, and we advocate for ways to reduce gun violence. We do not oppose gun ownership–in fact, many of us own guns. However, we think Nebraska and the U.S. can do a better job of ensuring that guns stay out of the hands of irresponsible people, and that we can implement sensible ways to mitigate gun violence through universal background checks, safe storage, rigorous training requirements for carrying guns in public, and keeping guns out of certain areas of our lives.
Our ask:
Nebraskans Against Gun Violence has already been fighting for sensible gun laws in our state. Our volunteers testified against seven dangerous gun lobby bills at our legislature this year and are busy building an interfaith coalition. Now we are excited to formalize our organization so we can do even more to protect Nebraska citizens. We don't charge membership fees. We are asking for donations to pay for the non-profit incorporation fees for our 501c3 Coalition of Nebraskans Against Gun Violence and 501c4 Nebraskans Against Gun Violence. Any money we raise over the $888 we need and modest GoFundMe fees will go toward normal operating expenses of the organization.  Thank you! Together we can make Nebraska an even better place.

title: Help send Brandon to the 2016 DNC!!
summary: Dear Friends, On May 7, 2016, I was elected by Democrats in my congressional district to serve as one of the National Delegates to represent Florida at the Democratic National Convention (DNC) in Philadelphia, PA.It is a great honor to be a member of the Florida Delegation who will travel to the DNC during the week of July 25th to join fellow National Delegates to nominate Hillary Clinton for President Of The United States Of America. I am one of the 141 delegates that were allocated to Hillary Clinton per the results of our March 15th primary election.  To be elected as a delegate to nominate Hillary Clinton as the Democratic Party's presidential candidate is a once in a lifetime experience for me and means a lot to me to see history in the making.As an activist who cares about civil rights, human rights, immigrants rights, voting rights, workers rights, and liberty and justice for all, I am proud to represent you at the DNC. Participating in the DNC is a chance to strengthen our country and Democratic Party's commitment to inclusiveness and fairness. In order to go to Pennsylvania to fulfill my duties as a delegate, I need your help today! I need to raise a minimum of $4,000 to cover the cost of flight, room and board, and transportation for that whole week. Donate $250, $100, $50, $25 or any amount. Be part of this grassroots effort.I sincerely appreciate your support for my "Send Brandon Nelson to the 2016 DNC fund"If you have any questions, please contact me at nelson_brandonp@aol.comWith much love & appreciation, Brandon Nelson2016 Hillary Clinton National DelegateFlorida Congressional District 10Proud Florida Democrat

title: Newspaper publishing Chuck Eddy Essay
summary: I wrote a short essay about the real issues in this election for Kentucky Governor being state issues of Public Education & Healthcare, etc., rather  than the false federal issue of abortion.  I believe Gov Bevin is pushing abortion because his attacks on Education, Teachers, State Workers and Healthcare for working poor & have turned many people against him. In the Republican Primary, Bevin only got 52% of the vote. 123,794 Republicans like me voted against Bevin. I would like to share this around the state. Because it includes an endorsement of Democrats Andy Beshear and Jacqueline Coleman, I believe the only way to do this is to pay for it. I am retired and do not have the money to do this by myself. Thank you for your consideration.Chuck Eddy

title: Help Send John to Philadelphia!
summary: Hello Friends! As you may have read on my Facebook page, I was recently elected to represent New Mexico's CD 1 as a pledged delegate for Hillary Clinton at the upcoming DNC Convention in Philadelphia.This is incredibly exciting -- being able to be a small part of nominating the first woman as a nominee for a major political party is a huge deal and an honor, and I am so fortunate that fellow Democrats in NM CD 1 supported my candidacy.That being said, getting to Philadelphia will be on my own dime, and I have a little over a month to raise the needed funds for transportation, accommodations, and any incidentials that tend to pop up when you are away from home.As a Young (millennial-ish) Democrat, LGBT Democrat, and Union Democrat (Go AFT NM & IAM #794!), I believe I represent constituencies which will be critical in delivering the White House for Hillary Clinton and the Democrats in November.Please consider pitching in a little money to help me represent New Mexico and our nominee, Hillary Clinton.(If you would like to make a donation but prefer to not donate online, please e-mail me at john.dyrcz@gmail.com and I will happily send you my address.)

title: Democracy in Detroit
summary: SAVING  DETROIT BY A HUMAN RIGHTS TAKEOVERThe war waged on the people of Detroit is not a conventional war. In this war, both the Republicans and Democrats have over the years sought to wear us down by depriving us of material assets such as businesses, land, employment, education, housing, water and insulating themselves by encapsulating us into a Police State.  In this war, the Detroit City Council has waged a vicious war against the people of Detroit that has evicted the people of Detroit from their houses of Detroit, while closing down the schools and cutting off the war. The land developers and the Police have brutally suppressed our people and have taken the best areas of Detroit, and have left the crumbs to our people. WE NEED YOUR PARTICIPATION and Your COFFEE OR SANDWICH money because we are printing “Takeover” ballots so that we can all come up to the tune of 2 billion dollars per year. We need the participation of all Afro-Descendants from all 50 States because we want to show you how to obtain democracy in the 21st Century. We are accepting increments of 5,10, 20 and whatever you can spare for this great democratic precedence in the “Battle for Detroit” We need to print 500,000 ballots and we will need 25,000 over the next 30 days to print the Ballots, The entire cost of this war will be around 600,000.00 so we will need more help but we need 25,000 right now!!  Winter is coming and we want to put our people into these abandoned houses now.  We can do this with the power over the Detroit City budget. We want to finish this battle over resources now and forever as free indigenous Afro-Descendant citizens. We Want the Power

title: PEBLing for a Carbon Free Future
summary: PEBLing for a carbon free futureFlorida - the beautiful sunshine state - is at the forefront of climate change. Rising sea levels, saltwater intrusion, stronger hurricanes and a state government that will not allow the word Climate Change in official communications....Florida is ready for climate solutions.I will ride this electric tricycle, called PEBL, from Miami Beach to Jacksonville and try to inspire everyone I meet to contact their representatives in Congress about passing effective climate change legislation. The PEBL makes it very easy to get talking with people and once in conversation, it is easy to get talking about solutions to the climate crisis. One such solution is putting a price on carbon. And Citizens' Climate Lobby, which I am a member of, lobbies with every single member of Congress, Democrat and Republican,  promoting carbon fee and dividend legislation.CCL's approach emphasizes building relationships and trust, listening, and working together beyond partisanship. It's worth spreading the word about!Thank you for supporting me in this work and journey!This is how donations will be used:trailer rental for the PEBL to Florida and back                                                      $  570share of estimated personal cost (40 days)    $ 1400estimated event/ material costs:                          $  300estimated gas for pulling trailer  from MA to Florida and back                                                       $  450Carbon off-sets for gas                                              $     80through Nature Conservancyestimated repairs, service                                         $ 200total:                                                                                    $3000All donations not needed for the trip will be donated to CCL.I hope you'll support this project but even if not, stay in touch with the trip on my blog page: https://peblingforacarbonfreefuture.wordpress.comThank you!

title: Help Jordan
summary: A good friend of mine just experienced losing everything he has due to a fire that took his apartment. Looking to help him get back on his feet with the help of others. Anything will help. http://www.nj.com/hunterdon-county-democrat/index.ssf/2015/01/high_bridge_fire_leaves_two_cats_missing_all_resid.html

title: Get me to the CA Democratic Conventions
summary: I am humbled to have been elected as a Delegate to the California Democratic Party state conventions.  It is my first time running for an elected position.  I was one of 14 people running on the Progressive/Labor slate in CA Assembly District 2 and 11 of us won.I am excited to represent my district and all Democrats in CA as we meet to set the platform for the state party and influence the national debate.  I will also be voting on who the Democrats endorse in 2019 and 2020 elections.  This is a very important time in our history and I am honored to be playing a part in the electoral process.I am also signed up for various caucuses including LGBTQ, Labor, Rural, Progressive and Environmental.  There are two conventions each year.  In 2019 the first one is in San Francisco on May 31- June 2.  The second one is in November.  It will cost me about $1500 for each, including travel, hotel, meals and registration.  This is beyond what I can comfortably do financially and need your help.It means a lot to me that at such a turbulent time in our history that I can be a part of the solution.If you want to help, my gratitude will know no bounds.  There is no contribution too small or too large.  Ultimately, my dream is to be part of the national Democratic Convention in Minneapolis in 2020.  My head explodes just thinking of that but first things first.I hope you will help even if you are not a registered Democrat.  I will be representing you too in my efforts to make California, America and the world a safer and more equitable home for us all.Thanks

title: DNC Watch - Summer 2019
summary: Let's talk about transparency in the Democratic Party. Three important meetings will happen this summer. The June joint Rules and Bylaws and Executive Committee meetings in Pittsburgh, the July Rules and Bylaws in DC and the August full DNC meeting in San Francisco.  The Rules and Bylaws Committee will be reviewing and approving the Delegate Selection Plans.  How will you know what happens at these meetings?  You can:A.  Attend the meeting yourself, ORB.  Request transcripts from the DNC after the meeting (you really can do this) ORC. Watch it on my Facebook LIVESTREAM so that you and others can watch this public meeting in our pursuit for truth and transparency. I hope you help with Option C. Why do we want to know what happens at these meetings? We just wrapped up two and a half years of advocating for major reforms within the DNC, especially reforming superdelegates, and had huge success!  However, it is no secret that many of the DNC members fought the reforms, but felt pressure from grassroots Democrats across the country that were demanding transparency and fairness.  It is also not a secret that DNC members were told that the reforms weren't permanent and could be changed later.  I would hope that the DNC members would not reverse the reforms they just passed, but how will we know if we don't keep our eyes on them and hold them accountable?  After the 2016 DNC Convention, I have been at every DNC meeting possible and began LIVESTREAMING to share what I was learning with others.  I've learned valuable information every time.  At first, I did this all on my own dime.  Then, one DNC member attacked me and accused me of being a Russian operative and working for Vladimir Putin with the intent to destroy the Democratic Party.  The grassroots were furious and many people stepped up and offered to help not only cover costs, but to watch and  share the LIVESTREAMS, which created even more transparency.I want to be clear that my intention is to make sure that grassroots Democrats and left leaning voters know what is happening in the party. Republicans need to fix their dysfunctional party and Democrats need to fix ours.  I do not want the Democratic Party to fail. In fact, as long as we have a two-party system, I want the Democratic Party to succeed and thrive and work for the people they claim to care about.  Unfortunately, I don't trust that this will occur without us watching and advocating within the party.  If you can, and if you would like to support the DNC Watch Summer 2019 LIVESTREAMS for the next DNC meetings,  you can make a donation here.   I will Facebook LIVESTREAM the Meetings on my FB Page - https://www.facebook.com/selinavickerswv/  You can also find other LIVESTREAMS on that Facebook page by looking at the "Events". You can also find links at https://www.selinavickers.com/livestreams Expenses for these summer DNC Watch trips will include travel to and from Pittsburgh, DC by car and San Francisco by plane, lodging, travel around the city (bus, uber, taxi), meals and wifi at conference centers, if needed.  I travel inexpensively, stay at AirBNB's and hostels and with friends when I can.No rubles accepted.  By donating, you are confirming that you are an American citizen.Thank you for your support!

title: Send Alexsis to the DNC in Philly
summary: I am humbled and excited to have been elected to represent Virginia's 3rd Congressional District at the 2016 Democratic National Convention in Philadelphia. I hope that I can count on your support to get me there.2016 is a big year for Virginia Democrats. In addition to keeping a Democrat in the White House, we will pick up more seats in the House of Representatives and defeat the anti-worker constitutional amendment on our ballot.I am committed to advancing democratic values as a leader in our party and state public policy:      – Lt. Governor Ralph Northam's Policy Director     – Virginia Young Democrats Political Director     –Richmond City Democratic Committee Executive Board Member     –Metro Richmond Area Young Democrats Outreach Chair     – Emerge Virginia Graduate & Board Member     –President Barack Obama's 2012 Re-Election Campaign Organizer     –New Organizing Institute's Most Valuable Organizer NomineeCan you contribute $15, $35 or more to  help cover my transportation, hotel and meal costs at the DNC?Thank you in advance for your generous support that will help me represent Virginia at the national level.

title: Ask John Moolenaar
summary:
A year ago, local citizens challenged our Congressman, GOP Representative John Moolenaar, to host a townhall meeting where citizens could voice concerns.
That meeting was very successful for citizens, but not comfortable for Mr. Moolenaar. It is not likely he will do it again during this election cycle. But the issues grow only more urgent.Many Americans are deeply worried about a Russian cyberattack on American Democracy, just yesterday, all leading Trump-appointed intelligence agency heads agreed that our elections continue to be under attack. But Mr. Trump has not made any directive to counter that attack, in fact, the President refuses to activate sanctions that have been ordered by overwhelming vote in both houses of Congress.This initiative will challenge Rep. Moolenaar to answer the question - "What is John Moolenaar doing to protect Elections against Russian attack".
By cross promoting a billboard campaign, through mainstream and social media, we hope to force local media to engage on the issue, and demand an answer to this most basic question of national security.According to inquiries I have made, billboards locally can be leased for 4 weeks, at price points of about a thousand, and 2500 dollars.  We could begin a campaign as soon as end of March or end of April.FYI: Midland Progressive Democrats is not a 501c3. Donations to this GoFundMe are considered "personal gifts", and thus not subject to taxes.

title: Volunteering in Nevada for Dems
summary: Hey guys! As you may know, we, Deirdre and Abby, have been in Las Vegas volunteering full time for the democratic party. We’ll be here up until election day. It’s a crazy, super emotional, exhausting (14 hours a day, 7 days a week!), fantastic experience. We’re not just fighting for Hillary, but also for the incredibly close senate race here, and for local democratic congresspeople and ballot measures. We are insanely dedicated, we have already registered tons of new democratic voters, and now we are out canvassing.  Although we are volunteers with no compensation, we've been asked to take on the full time responsibilities of paid organizers.  It's ridiculously hard work and long hours, but we love it! We need your help, because we both took off 5 weeks of work to do this, and are paying for it out of our own pockets.
