Our expenses are car rental, gasoline and food. We are staying with friends, so thankfully we don’t have to pay for that. But, as expenses add up, we are going to end up having spent about $5000 by the time this is over. Please, if you love us, and want democrats to have a majority in the senate, and want there to be more gun control in Nevada, and think it’s super cool that we are registering many immigrants who just recently became citizens, and wouldn’t otherwise have registered to vote, and that we are organizing communities and bringing people together for phone banks, and all that good stuff, DONATE MONEY DAMMIT!

title: Help us fight Facebook
summary: The liberals who run the social media giants have openly discriminated against conservative publishers since the election of President Trump, as we were instrumental in his 2016 presidential election. Candidate Trump tweeted one of my articles to the world in February 2016. Facebook, Twitter, and Google are in an all-out war against conservative publishers, manipulating (restricting) our traffic,  thus advertising revenue, which has dropped 98%  in two years as a result, an effort by The Big Three to drive us out of business due to our support for President Trump. Liberal Democrats will not allow a second Trump term if they can prevent it and will go to any lengths to do that. My website, Powdered Wig Society (powderedwigsociety.com) is dedicated to the restoration of, and strict obedience to, the United States Constitution. I am an ex-Army officer and love my country deeply. Powdered Wig was started in 2013 as a protest to the anti-American actions of Barack Obama, and took off almost immediately, becoming a growing, self-sustaining operation within one year. Our weekly Facebook reach was as high as 15 million. As of October 1, 2018, our Facebook reach is 203,782, a drop of over 98%. We have nearly 300,000 Facebook followers, yet Facebook is preventing Powdered Wig's articles from reaching our followers.The social media giants are deliberately preventing the dissemination of conservative, patriotic content. We have been shadow-banned by Twitter, making us virtually invisible, and Google prevents our articles from being anywhere near the top of searches. Google has disallowed conservative publishers the use of its advertising platform Adsense, which was once our top advertising revenue producer. Now, our Adsense revenue is $0.     UPDATE: Powdered Wig was among the conservative pages shut down by Facebook in the "Big Purge" on October 11, 2018. There is no such thing as free speech at Orwellian Facebook. This is anti-conservative hatred in a most wicked and unAmerican form. If this egregious discrimination is allowed, then we have no First Amendment. President Trump and Congress are aware of Fascistbook's bias against conservative publishers and I believe will address it in a meaningful way at some point over the next two years or possibly into the next administration. Until then, we desperately need help. We are trying to raise $150,000 for legal expenses to sue Facebook and to keep the lights on at Powdered Wig and the message alive over the next two years. Anything we can raise in addition to that will go toward future operations beyond 2020 or until Washington finally tames the belligerent social media giants which are openly violating the First Amendment rights of conservative publishers. Please help if you can. Anything will help. No amount is too small. If you can't help with a donation, then please share our GoFundMe link (https://www.gofundme.com/powdered-wig-society) on your social media pages. Thank you in advance for anything you can do to help. My gratitude is boundless. And, by all means, check out our website, powderedwigsociety.com and visit us on Twitter. Together, there is no question, we will make America great again.

title: Scottsproject-BlueWave2020
summary: Our country is going through tumultuous times. Since the 2016 election the values embodied in the image of Uncle Sam have been eroded by Trump and a Republican party unwilling to stand up and refute the lies and missdeeds of the current President.It's going to be up to Democrats and undecided voters to right the wrongs committed by the current administration.Help Uncle Sam and the Dems recruit new members to champion a return to real American values like Liberty and Justice for all.All funds donated go directly to the publication of digital billboards in West Michigan, a key battleground state.

title: My Presidential Inauguration Summit
summary: I am currently a senior at Bishop Noll Institute and have been chosen to represent my school and community at the 2017 Presidential Inauguration Leadership Summit. This prestigious Summit will take place next January in Washington, DC, inspired by the inauguration and the issues that face next generation leaders.During this Summit I will have the opportunity to witness the 58th Presidential Inauguration and listen to inspirational speakers such as Malala Yousafzai. I will participate in workshops, seminar discussions, and presentations that are designed to broaden my perspective on local, national, and global issues facing my generation. This will be a powerful experience, enabling me to interact with respected professionals in various fields while building relationships with students who might someday be my future colleagues. Attending this program will enable me to further my interest in the field of medicine and reach my career goals of becoming a leader in the medical field. I maintain a 4.23 GPA, am involved in Bishop Nolls yearbook staff, cheerleading team, National Honor Society, Spanish National Honor Society, and Multicultural Club. I am a Lake County Young Democrat,  a member of The Society of Torch & Laurel, am a student worker through Regional Federal Credit Union, and volunteer at Community Hospital over the summer. I am currently an Indiana ambassador for the National Society of High School School. This prestigious Summit is only offered to a select few from past envision programs. I participated in Envisions National Youth Leadership Forum on Medicine last summer where I was able to participate in hands-on medical activities and true-to-life medical simulations created by top medical training professionals. Through this program I was able to receive college credit from George Mason University. This summer I travelled to Boston, Massachusetts where I participated in The Congress of Future Medical Leaders and Physicians. At the closing of this program I achieved an award for excellence. Participating in programs such as these will help me establish a connection with others throughout the country that have the same ambition and goals that I have.Imagine if you had been given this opportunity for a life-changing experience when you were in school and were unable to participate for lack of funds. That is why I am actively looking for sponsorships and have created this account. I am investing every dollar I can of my own money to make sure I don’t miss out on this unique experience and am also taking on extra jobs to raise the funds. The total cost of attending this program is 4,502.99.Your sponsorship would be greatly appreciated.

title: Fiona's Election Campaign
summary: I am standing for election to represent the people of Athlone and Longford/Westmeath in the next round of elections in 2019.I enter politics as a member of the Social Democrats: a progressive party that is working hard to alleviate the problems facing our nation and its citizens.Our country currently faces many crises: widespread homelessness; rising levels of child poverty; an over-burdened health service; and failures in the provision of healthcare for women. These crises have brought misery for many people in our community. The housing crisis is one that affects so many in our town. Rents are rising and people are being priced out of the market. Landlords are refusing Housing Assistant Payments (HAP) and rental allowances, while picking and choosing who they rent to and for how long. Families are left without basic shelter and security because both local and national governments have failed to plan for and deliver the required housing. This is unacceptable and it is a stain on our society. The myriad excuses for inaction and delays are unacceptable. Our councillors and representatives are tasked with holding powerful institutions to account but too often they fail in this task. It is true that there are local plans for new developments and new houses. These are very welcome but it is taking far too long for plans to become reality. We need to see results that bring improvements to people’s lives. We need to keep lobbying, agitating and demanding a better response from our government and our representatives. As the Social Democrat candidate for Athlone I am standing for election to represent all of our community. I cannot accept that some people fall between the cracks in our society, nor can I ignore the reality that many people are not heard, not seen and not represented. I’d like to make our society, our town and our local area a fairer and better place: one that is more representative of today’s Ireland. So, I’d like to offer myself as your voice in your local council. In order to run a successful campaign, I hope to raise funding to finance, leaflets, canvassing cards and posters. These are essential items for any political campaign and they will play an important part in my early efforts to engage the local community and to introduce myself as a new candidate in the area. Therefore, I am asking anyone who would like to support me, but who struggles to find the time, to support this campaign fund instead. I promise to spend contributions only on necessary campaign costs and publicity. No contribution is too small!

title: AK 2 Philly - Democratic Convention
summary:
Hi,

My name is George W Sookiayak, I am an Inupiaq Alaska Native and I am a National Delegate from Alaska House District 25 located in Anchorage Alaska.

I am attending the Democrat National Convention in Philadelphia PA as a delegate for Bernie Sanders.

Travelling out of Alaska is always a logistical headache.

But to travel from Alaska all the way to Philadelphia in the middle of summer? And not to mention that I am an Eskimo? Yeah. It'll be rough.

A donation of just a five dollars or ten dollars will help with travel costs in a great way. Every donation received will be greatly appreciated.

Help me get to Philadelphia so I may cast my vote at the Democrat National Convention to select our next President of the United States!

title: Help Kate get to the DNC! CD 27
summary: Hi Friends and Family!  I am an elected delegate to the Democratic National Convention - representing Bernie Sanders - in the city of brotherly love -  Philadelphia! I have been a staunch progressive Democrat for most of my life and will continue to advocate for the Bernie Platform long after this election is over!  The expenses for delegates is pretty steep; the hotel they are putting the NY Delegation in is $450 a night!  Some of us have found alternative housing, but it is still a financial stretch.  So any money you can contribute to offset the costs will be greatly appreciated.  All funds will be used for housing, transportation and at least one Philly cheesesteak!  The DNC is  July 25-28, so, yeah.  I am a bit late on this. Thanks so much for any support, moral or financial you can send my way.  And I promise NOT to get arrested.  Love ya, K8

title: Send Jessica to the DNC for Bernie!
summary: Hello friends! I am fundraising for my trip the 2016 Democratic National Convention as a National Delegate for Bernie Sanders. I am thrilled to be able to do this amazing thing for my fellow Wyoming Democratic Bernie supporters, Wyoming Democrats, Women, and Youth. This is the first round of fundraising (I was also elected as the next National Committeewoman to the DNC from WY , which I am also pretty excited about- but first things first!)All money raised in this campaign will be used exclusively to travel, stay, and to cover any other little expenses that may arise for the purpose of attending the 2016 DNC! I need to raise the money within the next month in order to secure my plane tickets and acommodations. Any excess funds will be donated to my fellow Wyoming National Delegates to the DNC who are in need.  I plan on taking the energy and dedication that has driven me to organize in Jackson, Teton County, and accross Wyoming - accross the US to the state where I was born. Any support will be put to great use, will be thouroughly appreciated, and I'll represent us all well! Thank you from the bottom of my heart.

title: Rene de Monchy's  memorial fund
summary:
(memorial details below)

Rene de Monchy passed away unexpectedly in his sleep August 14, 2017. Born in Bethesda, Maryland on March 27, 1949, he resided most of his adult life in the Russian River Area.

Passionate, caring, and knowledgeable, Rene (owner of HomeWorks) was renowned for resolving difficult building and planning issues for his clients. HomeWorks will continue its valued work maintaining the tradition and work of Rene de Monchy.

He is greatly missed and survived by his wife Dianne, brother Pieter de Monchy, sister Dopey, step children Shana Barrett, Dawn Ramey and Nicolas Whitaker, his adored grandchildren, Asia, Kalea and Brynn and many loving extended family and community members.

Rene will be buried at Green Valley Cemetery during a private ceremony.

A Potluck Celebration of his life will be held Saturday, September 9, 2017 from 11AM to 3PM at the family's home on Hwy. 116 in Guerneville. All his family and friends are invited to attend. We look forward to seeing you there. Please RSVP at ddemonchy@yahoo.com

If you would like to contribute to Rene's burial fund, your donation would be gratefully recieved.

If you are interested, here is a link  to Press Democrat articles related to Rene de Monchy:

http://nl.newsbank.com/nl-search/we/Archives?p_product=SA&p_theme=sa&p_action=search&p_maxdocs=200&s_search_type=customized&s_dispstring=(rene)%20AND%20(de%20monchy)%20AND%20date(all)&p_field_advanced-0=&p_text_advanced-0=(%22rene%22)%20AND%20(%22de%20monchy%22)&xcal_numdocs=20&p_perpage=10&p_sort=YMD_date:D&xcal_useweights=no

title: Send Jeff to Philly! DNC 2016.
summary: I was elected as a delegate to the Democratic National Convention and it would be an honor if you supported my efforts to attend the Democratic National Convention by making a contribution.  The convention this year will be held in Philadelphia from July 24 to July 29th. The convention costs for the Philadelphia convention are the most expensive in convention history. Contributions go towards hotel and transportation expenses. Here's some info for you... About me-Twenty-two years ago, I moved to Dallas (in a U-Haul and with $600 in my pocket) for my first job. I fell in love with the community and I quickly got involved in both the community and the Democratic Party.  Since then I have been a regular volunteer and leader for the party. I have done everything from phone banking, driving seniors to the polls (even cleaning the Democratic Party office bathroom) and since 2013 I have served on the Texas State Democratic Executive Committee as the Democratic Committeeman for the Texas 23rd Senate District.Election as a delegate to the Democratic National Convention-I was recently elected at the Texas Democratic Convention as a pledged national delegate for Hillary Clinton. I am so honored to be elected since 1000 Texas Democrats ran for the 148 national delegate spots. There are 20 national delegates for Hillary from Dallas County and I am 1 of the 4 LGBT delegates. How will your contribution will be used? And why is Jeff asking for help?DNC 2016 is the most expensive convention in history. It’s crazy and sad. The DNC hotel group rate for the assigned Texas delegation hotel is $565 a night. It’s a steep rate for the length of the convention and I need some help to fund.  Funds raised through this GoFundMe campaign will be used for hotel and transportation costs. How soon are funds needed?A deposit of $2200 will be charged by the hotel on Sunday, July 17 and I hope to raise as much as possible by that date. Your supportThank you for checking out my page and I thank you for considering supporting my efforts to attend the Democratic National Convention. Your support means so much to me and your help is needed so that I can attend the convention.  Any contribution amount is welcome.  I have worked my butt off for the Democratic Party and Hillary and attending the Democratic National Convention is an important and productive commitment. Thank you!  At a Hillary organizing house party before the Texas PrimaryWith Shay Cathey at the Texas Democratic ConventionWith friends at the Hillary fundraiser in Dallas on May 20thI had an opportunity to meet Hillary on her last trip to DallasIn addition to volunteering, I have raised $34,000+ for Hillary. Follow me on Twitter:   https://twitter.com/jeffstraterMore about me on LinkedIn:  https://www.linkedin.com/in/jeffstraterFacebook: https://www.facebook.com/jeff.straterDemocratic Committeeman Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/JeffWStrater/Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/jeffstrater/

title: Michele Chimene for Justice
summary:
Welcome, and thank you for taking time to inquire and consider voting and contributing to a fellow citizen.  Michele Chimene is running to be an Appeals Justice for Position 8 in the 14th Court of Appeals. She has 25 years experience in appellate law, handling both civil and criminal matters. She is a life-long Democrat who will play a very predictable role in the court.   Under Texas Law, the Legislature, "makes new law", the courts are only supposed to enforce the law.  And that is exactly what Michele plans to do,  without any political agendas. Michele is the proud mother of three grown children, one of which happens to be a part of the LGBT  community, enforcing her rights. All-in-All, Michele has a passion to uphold the current laws in a way that makes common sense given the particular facts of the individual case before her. SHE WILL LISTEN TO THE PARTIES BEFORE HER, both Appellant and Appellee. Fairly! She will fight hard for justice and seek for equal rights so that everyone has a chance to live decent happy lives. 

Justice!Justice! Shall you Pursue!

title: Help Ethan cover Convention costs!
summary: My name is Ethan Petzold and I'm the youngest member of Michigan's Delegation to the Democratic National Convention this year, and the youngest delegatge ever for Democrats from the State of Michigan! As many of you know, going to the Convention is very expensive and there is still some money I need to raise to ensure I'll have enough to cover all of the costs. Thank you in advance for all of your genorosity!Some more information about my election and the reason I got involved in poltics: http://www.fixthemitten.com/blog/off-to-philly-how-an-18-year-old-activist-made-historyhttp://www.freep.com/story/news/local/michigan/wayne/2016/06/03/ethan-petzold-democratic-national-convention/85370216/

title: Robert Williams National Delegate
summary: Hello Friends and fellow Democrats,I am Robert Williams, Messaging Committee Chairman for the Texas Coalition of Black Democrats. I attended the Texas Democratic Party State Convention in San Antonio, in June where we worked to communicate and advocate a number of key issues that are affecting our community. Our efforts were successful in starting the conversation for change in policy making and representation, but our job is far from over...I am looking to take our message to the Democratic National Convention in Philadelphia from July 24th thru 29th, but I need your financial help!The costs of attending the convention are very high, the airfare and hotel accommodations alone are approximately $3,500, not considering food and transportation for the week. Please consider donating to assist me, so that I can be a passionate and powerful voice for our community and Texas Democrats. Your donation will allow me to share our message with Hillary Clinton and the Democratic National Committee in Philadelphia. The message that I will take to Philadelphia simply stated is this: "We are tired of our vote being taken for granted"!For almost four decades 88% of the African American vote has supported Democratic candidates. The black votes represents 33% of the Democratic Base making us the "backbone" of the Democratic Party. And what have we received in return for our vote? Unfortunately, the facts and our research tells us not enough....- Our criminal justice system needs major reforms...- Our public education system is failing our children...- Our black women and girls have been inadequately represented and/or advocated for...- Our communities suffer from wage inequality and lacks sufficient economic development...- Our African American candidates and businesses receive little if any resources from our party...We can do better and we must do better! Help send me, Robert Williams to the Democratic National Committee....Let me tell the Democratic Party "They must not take our votes for granted"! Thank you for your donation.Robert WilliamsMessaging Committee Chairman

title: WA State Dem Delegate to DNC 2016
summary: Your support is needed and appreciated:Need to raise $3,500 travel funds to attend the DNCConvention in Philadelphia July 24-29, 2016 Back ground information: Elected Washington State Democrat Delegate to the DNC Philadelphia Convention. July 2016Elected Washington State Elector College Representative 2016Volunteer Services:For 21 years have organized a National Indian Women’s Honoring Lunch in WA DC to recognize the accomplishment of Women Leaders from around the United States.  Provides volunteer Domestic Violence support services. Chair, Native American Caucus, Washington State Democrats.  Committed to equitable treatment of all people. Committed to the participation of all 29 tribes & Indian Organizations to participate and support the WA State Democrat Party and the election of Native Leaders.  Elected Committeewoman for Clallam County 2009-present.  Support and Vote for Clallam County  Resolutions at  three State Democrat meetings a year. Northwest Indian College Foundation Vice Chair.  Raise funds for scholarships for Native Students.  We have 1,400 students from 130 Tribe who attend NWIC. Awards: 2001: Selected as the “Distinguished  Alumni for Antioch University” and Guest Speaker at the Antioch University Graduation 2002:  Clallam County Appreciation Award for the development of Youth ServicesPeninsula State College Appreciation Award for 10 years of Volunteer Services as a Board of Trustee member.  Appointed by two different Governor’s of Washington StateTwo National Indian Health Board Awards:  (a) Development of Home Health Care for Senior Citizen Services and (b) On-Site College Credit Training for Tribal  Staff 2004: Northwest Indian Women “Endearing Spirit Award.”  (WA, OR & ID - 43 Tribes)2005: NWIC Foundation  “Board Special Recognition Award” Goal to raise 44 Million for new college2008:  ATNI Native Vote – WA “Award of Excellence” Title:   Amazing Role Model for Native Women 2008:  WA State Democrat Central Committee:  2008 Hillary Delegate2012:  Female Clallam County Democrat of the Year Honor    2012: Potlatch Foundation:  Pearl Capoeman-Baller Award: Community Service Award  (WA, ID & OR)2013: Women Empowering Women for Indian Nations (WE-WIN)  Lifetime Achievement Award  National Indian Women’s Leadership Award2016:  Elizabeth Peratrovich Tlingit & Haida Award “Civil Rights Award” at UW Intellectual House.2016: Guest Speaker at the Evergreen State College Graduation on June 5th.  Olympia, WA.

title: Owen's Election Campaign
summary: On May 24th I will be standing in the elections for Galway City  CouncilOur local council members and the decisions they make shape the environment we live in today, in every way.I don't feel like the Council represents me or you, but it can and should. This campaign is about reaching out to everyone and making that argument. In 2014 voter turnout was desperate and it will take a hell of a campaign to change that. But a lot of things have changed since 2014, anything is possible.  People desperately want to have trust in local government again. They want the Council to be transparent, approachable, and able to get the job done. There is a massive disparity between the people of Galway and those meant to represent them and in that space there's a vacuum. A vacuum of common sense, a vacuum of genuine participation, a vacuum of honest politics that works for all the people.We need candidates can who can offer solutions to our biggest problems with a new vision and fresh approaches and ultimately that is what the Social Democrats are all about.The election is only 3 months away. Between now and then I will be canvassing for your support and vote. Unfortunately this involves getting lots of leaflets and merch with my ramblings and face all over it, which is why I am asking you all to go away and fund me the price of a pint, movie ticket, or ! This will make a huge difference to my campaign as it would buy a poster or a handful of canvass cards or leaflets. I want to have a voice in our local government, if you think I could be a voice for you too, please sponsor my campaign, together we really can make a difference.

title: KC's DNC Trip
summary: KC CALDWELL GRISTA Tupelo, Mississippi native,  I come from a long line of Democratic public servants. My great-grandfather, two grandfathers, father, brother and husband have held elected office.Now I have been elected to follow in my grandfather Gilbert Mayer’s footsteps and serve as a delegate for Hillary Clinton to the Democratic National Convention in Philadelphia — a role he held there 80 years ago.Times have changed since 1936!  One major change is the expense of attending the convention.  It will cost this year's delegates around $5000.  Hotel rooms alone will cost $2500!  It should be noted that because of security issues, delegates and their families must stay in the delegation hotel.  I have spent much of my career helping Democrats win elections.  I am honored to represent Mississippi this summer in Philadelphia and would sincerely appreciate any help with the travel expenses associated with this opportunity.Thanks so much in advance for your help!

title: Send Alex to Philly for the DNC!
summary: Hello to all my friends, family, and progressives all over America!  My name is Alex, and just a few days ago I was elected by all the county-level Bernie delegates from Nebraska's First Congressional District as Nebraska's only male alternate to the Democratic National Convention next month in Philadelphia.  From the bottom of my heart, I thank everyone who put their trust in me to represent them in Philadelphia.  I am honored to not only share in the Sanders campaign's ideals, but to carry them forward with your blessing!  I would also like to thank my sister Leah, my parents Rick and Marcia, and my girlfriend Eve, all from whom I draw an amount of support I can't even begin to describe.  Here is an idealized version of the 60-second speech I delivered to Sanders supporters at the CD1 Caucus (and I say "idealized" because nerves and time constraints contributed to some unplanned omissions!):-----"Hello everyone, my name is Alex Houchin, and I'm from LD28 in south Lincoln.  I stand before you today as a brand new Democrat, one of many brought into the party thanks to the inspiring campaign of Senator Bernie Sanders.  Though I am new to the party, I am not new to activism: I was heavily involved in Occupy Lincoln, and in the time since that involvement I have taken action on many of the issues that movement focused on.  Although I have volunteered for several local and state Democratic campaigns and I have helped in the battle to eliminate the death penalty, my primary form of activism has been my multi-year involvement in Citizens Climate Lobby, a nonpartisan group focused on building bipartisan support for a national carbon fee and dividend program in order to stop climate change.  When Senator Sanders was asked during a televised debate what he thought the greatest threat to the American way of life was, he answered - without any hesitation - 'Climate change.'  I agree whole-heartedly.  In fact, to this day, he remains the only Democratic candidate who has ever voiced his support for a carbon fee and dividend program!"After my participation in Occupy Lincoln, I briefly considered running for office myself.  When I met with representatives of the Nebraska Democratic Party over whether I should run as a Democrat or as an Independent, I remember saying to them, 'I just don't know if your party is progressive enough for me.'  The young man across the table looked at me and said, 'You know, if everyone who ever said that actually joined the party, we would be.'  While I ultimately decided not to run, that conversation has stayed with me ever since."...And now here I am.  I joined the party.  I volunteered for the Sanders campaign, I canvassed, I hosted and attended phonebank parties, I stood up and spoke as a precinct captain during our March caucus, I was chosen as a delegate to the Lancaster County Democratic Convention, and I was elected there as an alternate to the State Democratic Convention.  Even though I was an alternate to State, I showed up anyway - and since some LD28 delegates couldn't make it, I was seated.  And now I speak before you."I'm asking you to send me to Philadelphia to carry this important work forward as a national delegate.  When Sanders talks about taking the 'Political Revolution'  to Philadelphia and beyond, he means that we need to start finding candidates who believe in these ideals and get them elected at all levels of public office: PTA boards, city councils, county boards, statehouses, and even the US Congress itself.  When he talks about taking the 'Political Revolution' into the future, he means that if we can't find these candidates, we need to become these candidates.  When we unite to do this critical work and carry on his legacy, together, we have the power to transform this party, this nation, and this world - with PEACE, JUSTICE, COMPASSION, and LOVE."Thank you all."-----I did not make the cut as one of CD1's two Sanders delegates to National, but by virtue of the March 5th caucus results, CD1 Sanders state delegates were allowed to elect the state's only male alternate to National, and they chose me.  I imagine some of you might read this and think, "If he's only an alternate, why should I help him go?  He might not even get a chance to participate!"  Well, I was also "only an alternate" to the NDP state convention, but because I showed up for all three days, I was seated as a delegate to help shape the state party platform and, hopefully, its future.  There's always a chance that any of the 15 Sanders delegates to National could fall ill or be otherwise forced to miss it, so as the only backup, I aim to once again be there, ready to roll up my sleeves and jump in.I'm asking for your support because, well, I'm not the 1%.  It's going to be expensive!  The hotel bloc that the Nebraska delegation will share with the Nevada and Colorado delegations is estimated to cost between $500 and $600 each night, for five nights, which doesn't even include the cost of travel (or possibly even food).  I've set the goal at $3000 to reflect those realities.If this funding campaign goes over the goal, or if it gets close enough to the goal that there are any funds left over after the trip, I will donate any remaining balance to the Lincoln chapter of Citizens Climate Lobby.Thanks for your time and your support!

title: Joe Williams for Congress
summary:
SEND A  SOCIALIST TO CONGRESS!Sam Farr is retiring. The 20th District congressional seat is open. Jimmy Panetta, Leon Panetta's son, has basically claimed the seat by birthright alone. The Panetta name scared off more worthy replacements for the office and no other Democrat will run against him. But I don't think a Panetta coronation should go unopposed.
We need a strong progressive to fill Farr's shoes! Jimmy Panetta has endorsed Clinton, But Bernie's call for a "political revolution" resonates with me, and when Sanders wins, he'll need allies in Congress. You now have the opportunity to send him one.
I am running as a socialist candidate on the Peace & Freedom Party ticket. Given the success of Kshama Sawant in Seattle, and Bernie Sanders nationally, the time is right for a socialist to represent the Central Coast!Joe Williams for Congress in 2016!  We can make history this year! Thank you for your support!
-----------------------------------------------------------
Please visit 'Joe Williams for Congress' on FB for campaign updates, and lots of politics! https://www.facebook.com/joewilliams4congress/

title: Final Expenses for our Father
summary: My name is Sheena Bray, I am the daughter of Richard T. Bray Sr. My siblings and I have started this go fund me to help my mother with funeral expsenes for our dad. My mom is terminally ill herself and doesnt have the means to give my father a proper burial. My father had a whole life insurance policy, but passed a year to early for it to take effect. He was a builder for most of his life. In his later years you could see him at the Saint Mary's Feast cooking up his famous sausage and pepper sandwiches. His other passion was politics. My father also served on the the cranston city council as a Democrat for Ward 1 for many years as well. He would have never wanted to put the burden on his sick wife or his children. Due to an unexpected illness, he has now passed on. Please any donation would be greatly appreciated by my family and I. Thank you so much for you time.

title: Go Green Cities
summary: Go Green is a group of researchers from Maui, Hawaii who set out over 2 years to find and analyze the top sustainability projects in the world for cities, towns, and counties.  Out of 250 projects identified from around the world they found the top 50 proven and already-demonstrated projects that 1) slash carbon and other pollution, 2) restore or protect regional ecosystems, and 3) earn on average over $40 million per project over 20 years for the local governments and their citizens.  Go Green has published the results of their breakthrough research in an easy-to-understand research guidebook that shows every town, city, and county in America how they can learn from the world's leading Green Heroes to make the Green shift to a sustainable community in 10 years or less.  Best yet, they can simultaneously bank tens of millions of dollars in new positive Green cash flows for their local government and citizens.  This is the Win-Win Green-Green Ecology+Economy set of solutions we have all been seeking for over 20 years.  Now that Green Heroes from around the world have already figured out the solutions ~ we simply need to learn their secrets and adapt their successes right in our own local communities.  This breakthrough Sustainability Solutions guidebook eliminates the divide between Liberal and Conservative, Democrat and Republican.  How?  Every Mayor and local government leader wants to make millions of dollars for their local general fund while they create a safer, healthier, and more prosperous and sustainable future for their citizens.  With this proven project information, everyone can copy and adapt proven successes to achieve their own local sustainability success.  Proven success is infectious.  The Go Green team is now raising money in this crowdfunding campaign to a) complete the research publication, b) conduct the initial outreach to 100 leading motivated cities, and c)  build a consulting team to support cities, towns, and counties everywhere to copy-cat these brilliant proven projects for ecological + economic success.  70% of all greenhouse gases come from cities.  When 100, 500, and then 1000 cities come on board to learn how to duplicate these proven sustainability successes, our country can finally accelerate the achievement of a sustainable and prosperous future for citizens everywhere.  Please Donate Now to help us raise the modest funding necessary to complete the guidebook, to conduct our outreach to our first 100 cities and counties, and to start to build a team of consultants to support local government leaders as they learn to prosper with these sustainability Best Practices.  Thank you for donating now.  The future of our Green Culture depends on you and me.  Please donate now (every level of donation helps).  Just don't do nothing!  Why? Because for the first time in modern history, our collective action forward ~ with already proven & lucrative solutions ~ can lead us to a sustainable and prosperous future.

title: James for Mayor
summary: I'm James Tranchemontagne and this November I am asking for your vote for mayor of Westbrook. There are many things we can do as a city,  to help rebuild our image and name. Join me as we work together for a better Westbrook. This site gives you some information about me and what we are looking to achieve. It is also a portal to help us raise money to get our message out. WE don't need to be labeled “a Democrat or Republican” nor vote that way. I'm a father, husband, business owner, volunteer, avid nature lover and many more similarities between you and I. I'm not running for myself but for all citizens. To level the playing field and to allow opportunity for all.Thank you for any support you can give our campaign.Come November- WE will put the WE back in Westbrook.

title: Stephen for Bernie in Philly DNC
summary: When I was 21 years old, I was teargassed by the Chicago Police for trying to march to the Democratic Comvention in my hometown. Now, I will be inside the Democratic  National Convention in Philly this month  as an elected national delegate from Virginia for Bernie! I am a retired civil rights attorney and have been active in Bernie's campaign for President in five states. I am Virginia Co-coordinator of Progressive Democrats of America. I am also National co-chair of the End Corporate Rule Issue Organizing Team for People Demanding Action and care deeply about returning our government to the people.  I humbly request your help with the extensive costs in Philly so that I do not eat away my retirement funds. Thanks so much.

title: Giving Back to Bruce
summary:
If you don’t know Bruce Strazza, he just happens to be the guardian angel of hundreds (maybe thousands) of recovering addicts in and around the Mid-Shore region.  Bruce recently fell ill and has not been able to work for almost a month.  We are hopefully going to get some answers soon about what is causing his illness, and with God’s hand Bruce WILL make a full recovery!His medical bills and lost wages are adding up by the day.  If you do know Bruce, you are one of the thousands who know that he would give the shirt off his back to help anyone.  He is “on call” 24 hours a day as a trusted resource for those in desperate need of help with their recovery. Look no further than the Star Democrat front page below the fold from 9/12/19 for proof of his dedication to his community. He is one of the most generous people on this Earth and he could really use the help of our community in this trying time.  If you cannot help with money, please keep Bruce and his wife Tawney (his “Queen” as she is affectionately called by Bruce) in your prayers.  

Here is Bruce’s story as told a few years ago. He’s done amazing work since that time...

https://youtu.be/i3Zxvr9Wzvk

title: Gerry Harvey
summary: Any & all donations, large or small, will go to helping Gerald's supported  charities and foundations. He had a big spirit and became fulfilled by helping others, many times privately. .The direct family will distribute funds as needed, continuing through with annual support to groups, charities and organizations Gerald supported. .The Harvey FamilyClick here to view the full Press Democrat article PD Article

title: Helping  a homeless artist
summary: Well, as we all know, life is hard and takes some rapid turns sometime.  Michael and Angela Koerber are hard- working, good people who got by just fine for most of their lives.  Michael is a very talented artist, whose work ranges from portraits to innovative found-object art.  Yet, due to a combination of health problems and the economic downturns of the past decade or so, Michael and Angela have been homeless for about ten years now (and living on the street for about six years since their car broke down).  Yet, despite their heart-breaking circumstances, Michael and Angela help others on the street, especially helping the newly homeless to cope with their changed circumstances.Can we who are blessed with steady incomes give them a hand in this critical situation?Thank you so much!  Below please find the Press Democrat article: In Petaluma, a rain culvert serves as this homeless artist’s gallery And please come to the benefit concert arranged by friends and greatmusicians! We were pretty successful with raising money for Michael at the concert and more than half of Michael's arts were sold. We have collected an additional 5,000 dollars! Thanks a lot to all the generous people who made it happened. We also received direct donations  sent to the Monastery. God  bless all people that are helping. Before I was going close the campaign, I was asked to provide  more information about myself and the fund usage.Here are the questions and my answers to them:1.    Who you are and where you’re from.  My name is Sergei Moroz. I'm  an engineer , living in Calistoga and working in Santa Rosa. I was born in Belarus. Now  I have been a California resident for more than 20 years.If someone wants to ask me direct questions, please use my personal email: sm472000@yahoo.com2.    Your relationship or contact to the parties you're raising funds forI know Michael and Angela through the nuns of Holy Assumption Monastery in Calistoga. They met Michael and Angela on a street in Petaluma, where he was selling his art. I  also came there one day to meet with Michael  and Angela personally.3.    How the funds will be spent (be specific as possible)The plan is to rent a studio or apartment where Michael and Angela may live and Michael can paint. We are in a process of locating inexpensive housing in Petaluma area. If someone knows available options, please contact me at my email above.4.    Your withdrawal plan to get the funds from the campaign to the ultimate beneficiary/ies I'm personally withdrawing the money from this campaign. We are combining funds and placing them in a dedicated account held by Holy Assumption Monastery. The first withdraw for the amount of $8,784.06 was transferred by me into this account . Funds will be disbursed from this account once a suitable place is found. Here is the Monastery web site and contact info: https://www.holyassumptionmonastery.com/contact.html

title: Raise A New Roof for Suzie and Mike
summary: Mike Thomason and Suzie Ditmar have been two of the most stalwart parts of Democrats for Equality, and the Democratic family in general. They're always there, offering a helping hand and making sure we get the job done.It's time to offer a helping hand to get the job done for them now.You may have heard that Suzie and Mike suffered the complete lost of their home to a fire over the weekend. They are busy trying to put their life back together so they have not been able to provide us with a list of their current needs but we know they are safe and alright.While we don't know their specific needs, we know that most of those needs (clothes, temporary housing, etc.) can be helped with money so, we're asking you to help out with a donation to this appeal. Please donate to help Mike and Suzie out right now and send out this appeal to other Democratic Party family members for whom they have worked so hard over the years.Thanks.San Diego Democrats for Equality

title: Pine for Bernie Sanders Delegate
summary: With the support of over 35 donors, I raised about $850 to cover the costs leading up to the VT convention. On May 22, I became one of Vermont's delegates to the Democratic National Convention for Bernie Sanders. All of VT's elected delegates are Bernie delegates and the delegation is very strong.100% of the costs of travel to Philadelphia, lodging and meals must be covered by each individual delegate. I am taking off time from work and making this trip to support the political revolution that Bernie has inspried in America.Here is my statement about why I sought to be delegate:My involvement in politics and public service was inspired by Bernie when I arrived at UVM in 1981. He threw open the doors of City Hall in such a meaningful way that I became actively engaged in this community and built a sense of belonging and purpose that has only grown with time. I served as the organizer of Students for Sanders during my UVM time.Over 85% of voters in the Vermont Democratic primary chose Bernie and I want to ensure that his cause has strong allies capable of remaining true to his core principles yet capable of building the important bridges needed to ensure a general election victory.In addition to working on virtually every one of Bernie's elections since he became Mayor, I have also worked on the elections of many Democrats over the last three decades. To quote Hilary, "there is more that unites us than divides us." I want to be part of making sure that the party is united advancing a progressive agenda that blends the best of the respective platforms of both Bernie and Hillary. I will greatly appreciate any support that you can provide to help me cover the expenses of representing VT at the Democratic National Convention and ensuring that Vermont's delegation brings and holds firm to the values embodied by Bernie.Thanks,Brian

title: Help Ellen get to the DNC
summary: Hi! My name is Ellen Lindblom. I am a 25 year old college student from Michigan and I have been a Democrat for as long as I can remember. Even before I really knew what it meant to be a political activist. I have been a member of College Democrats ever since I began my collegiate studies at Northern Michigan University(NMU). From there, I became the president of the NMU College Dems, a Regional Director through the Michigan Federation of College Democrats for Northern and Upper Michigan, and am a member of the Marquette County Executive Committee. My newest adventure includes being the President of our State Federation of College Democrats and an intern for the Lon Johnson for Congress Campaign in Michigan's 1st Congressional District.And perhaps most exciting yet, I was recently elected to serve as a delegate to the Democratic National Convention(DNC) in Philadelphia this summer! I am so excited to represent my fellow democrats in Nothern and Upper Michigan at the DNC, as this is likely my last opportunity to do so in this capacity. This has been a dream of mine ever since I started paying attention to politics. I always said, "if I ever go to the DNC, I can die happy" - just ask my mom! Unfortnately, this is a difficult task for a college student. The Michigan Democratic Party(MDP) and DNC do not offer funding assistance for delegates to attend the convention and costs are likely upwards of $3,000 for tansportation, food, and lodging for the week. I am asking for your help. I can't let this opportunity pass me by. I will be able to contribute a small portion, but I'm hoping that my friends, family, and anyone else who is reading this might find it in their hearts to make my dream come true! For those who do donate, I will do the following:For donations up to $25:A personalized thank you card from me detailing the amazing experience of being at the National Convention.Donations $26-$50: Thank you card + piece of memorabelia from the convention. Donations of $51-$100:A phone call from me during the convention(please be sure to give me your phone number) plus the above. Donations of $100+ All of the above plus a Facebook post dedicated to you with pictures from the convention with someone awesome. -Again, thank you so much for reading this. I would never be where I am today without the help and support of others, and there is no way I could possibly thank you enough.

title: Keep Me Off the Streets!
summary:
Dear Family, Friends,  and other Compassionate people...It humbles and saddens me to ask others for help, but I find myself in a situation where I am in dire need of financial assistance.  I understand that some may not have the means to donate and others may need to make small donations.  Whatever you can do to assist me will be most appreciated....even if it's just to share this request on Facebook.I am so blessed to have an awesome family and dear friends in my life.  Thanks to my talented daughter, Heather Haze, her partner, Bobbie and her musical associates, I have great music enhancing my life. Music and dance are gifts the Universe bestows on us, if we're lucky enough.Yes, I am truly blessed, but yet I find myself in a very perilous situation.1. UPCOMING HOUSING CRISIS:  In 1987, after my divorce, I fled Iowa from an abusive husband, to resettle in the DC area. I virtually started my life over at 40.  After some help from a dear friend and his family, I found a one-bedroom condo to rent in Fairfax.  It's been my home for over 30 years.  My landlady, who is now elderly, has informed me recently that she needs to sell it soon to move in with her daughter and she wanted to give me a heads up. Time flies.... I have always dreamed of owning a home, but it's been an elusive dream for me.  Life often gets in the way of our dreams.  Now I find myself, as a Senior citizen on a severely limited income, which is going to make finding a decent place a real obstacle.  Rents are high in Fairfax with most one bedrooms starting at $1400-1700 per month and 2 bedrooms $1700 plus.FURRY FAMILYAlso, I have 3 furry friends (a 7-year-old dog and 2 cats - One is 10 and the other 16 years old.) They are my babies and my forever friends, so they must be part of the plan.  I am truly concerned about them even beyond my own concerns of relocating.  I will NOT let them down in anyway.It's my hope to get funding to cover moving costs, security deposits, pet fees and at least three months rent to give me time to get settled.  In the meantime, I'm working through 30 years of accumulated stuff.  You know the saying, “When one door closes, another opens” (that is if you don’t have too much junk in front of the door…)  It’s time to reorganize and keep only those things dear to me and are practical and useful in my life.  Not an easy task - emotionally or physically.Ideally, it would be so wonderful, not to worry about my income for a couple of months.  I spend so much time trying to supplement my Social Security, it leaves me with little time or energy to get everything else done.2. ONLINE ACTIVISM: When I lost my 5 year job on an Army contract, due to a workforce reduction in 2009.  I needed to regroup and didn't like what I saw was happening within the Tea Party..  Having served as an Online Communications Consultant for such national services as: America Online, The Source, AT&T's Interchange and CompuServe, I felt I could make a difference in America by using these skills on Facebook. I've used my own resources to fund the many hours a day that I've devoted to changing messaging where the need arises.  I would like to see this thru the Mid-Terms and possibly thru the next presidential election.  Any funding that goes above my housing goals will go towards my activism. I'm passionate in my belief, that thru online activism, we plant seeds that can grow and spread - much like the "Johnny Appleseed" effect.  The photo below was taken at the Supreme Court during a protest to try to encourage a recount in Florida during the Bush-Gore fiasco.  This was really my "awakening" toward how much politics affect our lives. I was an Independent most of my adult life, however, I made the decision to register as a Democrat and get off the fence.  I never looked back.

WHY ME???This is the question I mulled over a long time before creating this Go Fund Me Request.  My dear sister responded with the answer, “Why Not Me!”  To be honest, I know that there are many people who struggle with life situations that go beyond mine.  I’ll try to make my best case of why I am worthy of this funding.  Then I’ll leave it to you to decide.I am a caring individual who is loyal to close friends and family.When significant people in my life developed terminal illnesses, I was there for them 100% even when others turned away.  Care-giving was one of the most physically and mentally demanding things I’ve ever done, but also very gratifying and some of the most meaningful experiences in my life.  Anyone who has gone through the experience knows they are changed forever.1.       In 1995, my parents, who lived in Denver became critically ill. My mother suffered from Alzheimer’s for several years, but her condition deteriorated and she was placed in a nursing home, prior to my father collapsing and being diagnosed with terminal brain cancer. I flew to Denver to assist my family with my father's care.  He was placed in hospice care and was able to return to his home of 60 years.  I became his hospice caregiver assisted by my sister. My brother continued to work.  My father was my night and day for two months.  My mother's condition worsened quickly in the nursing home and she died in June and my father followed in July. We were devastated. I stayed in Denver for six months to assist my family with the estate.2.       Then in 2000, my ex-husband was diagnosed with Stage 4 Lung Cancer.  He lived in Bradenton, Fl.  When we met he was a handsome 28 year old radio newsman and I was 17-year-old dancer, so at one point in my life he represented fairy tale love, until I realized he was a frog, not a prince. We were married 21 years before we divorced.  He was a recovering alcoholic and had virtually no one significant left in his life by the time he got sick.  Although, my daughter and I had stopped communicating with him, we both agreed that this was a chapter of our lives we needed to finish the right way, so we decided to care for him.  Again, I became his hospice caregiver and he was able to stay home during his illness.  I had my own business then, so I had to arrange it around my trips to Florida.  I would work Tuesday through Thursday and fly to Florida to care for him Friday through Monday. Of course, as he got sicker, my daughter and I spent more time with him.  After going through chemotherapy and radiation, he died on January 22, 2002.(After I returned to DC, I started working again.  I was working on a contract to the Department of Labor then. I was blessed because others believed in my capabilities.)4.       In April of 2002, my neighbor, Alice, who I knew for 17 years and was a mother figure to me, announced that her pancreatic cancer had taken a turn for the worse.  My heart sank…I loved this woman.  Her sister from New Hampshire visited her and assisted her with her initial care. The day before her sister left to go home, she and Alice made the decision to sell her unit and move to an assisted living facility.  Alice called me that afternoon quite upset.  She told me that she sold her unit.  Being from New Hampshire, Alice was a very stoic woman, however, she could hardly speak between her tears, when she told me about selling her unit. After we hung up, all I could do is cry.  I knew that I had the skills to help her, but it was just too soon after my ex-husbands death to consider it.  As I worked through my tears, I knew that I HAD to help because of my love and respect for her.  I called her and told her that she wouldn’t have to move, and I could care for her.  She was touched but called me that night and said that she had made the right decision after all.  I told her that when the time came, I would be there for her.  Her sisters, who were in there 80’s, lived out of state.  To make a long story short, her conditioned worsened in August and I began to stay the night with her at the request of her sister.  Her sister flew back to help with her care in September.  She slept on the sofa, I slept on the floor with a baby monitor, so that I could hear Alice.  She passed in late September.Then last year, a dear friend and neighbor, Bob, who I had known for over 15 years,  succumbed Parkinson's Disease.  His care took an all-out effort on the part of his family and they asked if I would assist with his care since I lived so close.  For four years, we were a close team working to care for him.  I wanted my role as a friend, to  help him enjoy his life up to the end.  We had a lot of laughs along the way.  I miss him.Being someone who had to take care of herself, I worked hard and with passion since I was 17. Here are a few highlights from my work journey:After literally starting from scratch with a high school education,  I founded two businesses, one lasted 20 years and the other 15 years.  My first business was a mission of my love of dance and that passion led to my own dance business in Iowa. I loved every minute of it and it grew to three studio locations.  I had to leave it all behind when my life was at risk, if I stayed in Iowa.  Starting over in DC, was humbling to say the least, but I knew I had to work hard to succeed and thrive. I learned every software application possible and became proficient enough to start teaching software classes. One of the more significant opportunities, offered to me, was with a Government contractor  teaching software applications to thousands of students at the Pentagon. During this period of time, I was working five jobs: Technical Training, teaching online classes and hosting a regular chatroom shift on America Online, DJing at Weddings and teaching dance at a local studio on Saturdays.  Needless, to say I wasn't home much.  I was promoted to Manager of the Training Task before I yearned to be independent again.I started a computer consulting business in 1991.  It was definitely scary, but exhilarating, too.  For the first year, I supplemented my earnings by teaching computer classes at Microcenter.  I built my business one client at a time and it grew and lasted 15 years.Some highlights of that period, were working at the White House performing technical writing services-first for the Y2K efforts,  and then to assist with the transition efforts from Clinton to Bush.  I also worked on contract to the Department of Labor assisting the People Power Team with obtaining their Exhibit 300 funding request.I take pride in the effort it took to achieve so many milestones, however, here I am...  I did everything possible to have some security as I aged, but unfortunately life has other plans.Here's a great example of life's "interruptions "...when I started the job on the Army contract, my 12 year old car's transmission went down, so I decided to buy another better used one.  Soon after I bought the car, I had to be rushed to the hospital with a severe Diverticulitis attack that almost killed me and required emergency surgery, then in 2 months I needed another surgery. Shortly after surgery, I caught a nasty, dangerous infection from my previous stay at the hospital which put me back in the hospital for another 16 days. During a 4 year period, from 2006-2010, I had 4 surgeries, and a 16 day stay in the hospital.  I continued working each time I recovered until 2009, when my employer decided to let me go due to a "workforce reduction.”  During that period, my dear daughter, who was helping with my care, drove my new car, more than I did.I will be so grateful and humbled by any assistance you deem me worthy of.  Depending on my Landlady, my present housing could change rapidly, so I need to prepare myself for a stressful few months.   I haven't received a formal notice yet.   I'm also having trouble paying my bills, so the stress is constantly there.  I've been doing freelance PowerPoint work, to supplement my Social Security, however, it's sporatic. My energy and ambitions have changed as I've aged.  I was hoping to have a life beyond work before I die.  In Trump's America, I'm not sure that's possible any more.  That's why its so important to me to continue to resist.

title: Half Marathon in Honor of My Dad
summary: Over the past few months I've been toying with the idea of doing a half marathon, and I have recently found the motivation to actually sign up. I will be running the Van Nuys Father's Day Half Marathon in honor of my dad, David Bilford. I will be fundraising for charities that were close to his heart. If you are interested and able, please consider making a donation. My goal is to raise one hundred dollars for each mile I run. Your strength and support have been immeasurably comforting, and I can't thank you enough for helping us get through this. With your donation, please indicate to which of the following charities you would like to contribute. I will add up the amounts and send them to their respective charities in his name after the race in June. The American Parkinson Disease AssociationThe Alzheimer's Foundation of America My grandfather suffered from both diseases, and my father and our family were devasted by their effects. The A.C.L.U.Planned ParenthoodNatural Resources Defense CouncilMy father was a self proclaimed "VERY Liberal Democrat." In recent months, he was very vocal about the dissapoinment he felt with our current administration and the direction of our country. He was very proud of my brother for the work he did with the A.C.L.U. and of me and my husband for participating in the recent L.A. chapter of the Women's March on Washington. He would be honored to have donations go to causes that will continue the fight.

title: Hillary 2016! #PhillyOrBust
summary: My name is James Dustin Baker. I ran, and won, a spot for the DNC Delegation from the Georgia 10th Congressional district - and I am proudly and enthusiastically supporting our Former First Lady, Former Senator, Former Secretary of State, and all around current awesome individual Hillary Clinton to be the Democratic Nominee and next President of the United States.  I'm 29, a young LGBT Democrat, and a proud UGA Bulldawg. I have two degrees from UGA - a B.A. in Political Sciences and an Masters in Public Administration.I'm raising funds to help pay for the cost of going to the convention. Our state party is estimating it will be between $4000-$5000 for the flight, hotel, food, and related expenses to attend the convention, and encouraged us to raise funds from friends, family, and fellow supporters. But, I'm going to forego the expensive meals and use some frequent flyer miles I've accumulated and try to do it for $3500. Going to support Hillary Clinton has been a dream of mine. I went to the 2012 convention, and I as much as I like and respect Obama, my goal was to meet Hillary Clinton because she has been a personal hero of mine. Sadly, this was not going to happen because, as Secretary of State, she followed the tradition of not attending political conventions while serving as America's top diplomat. However, this time, it will be different! So, your donations will be much appreciated. I'm going to represent the 10th district, LGBT people, and young Democrats across the country. Not only will your donation help me attend the convention, it will help me cross off something from my bucket list - meeting the next President of the United States: Hillary Clinton!

title: 20 new videos for the 2018 election
summary:
If people don’t care, they don’t vote.  We make videos to make people care.Help us make 20 more before election day!

 

OUR STORIES

All summer long, our videos have reached tens of thousands of people in districts and states where votes matter most.

By focusing on the personal stories of candidates and people directly affected by issues like climate change, healthcare, gun control, and the economy, we put faces on the issues of this election, and create an emotional connection to the act of voting.

When we're able to share stories like Carter's below, who we met in Virginia while interviewing Jennifer Wexton (VA10) and Leslie Cockburn (VA05), we help show people that their votes do matter, and that when they vote, they're speaking up for the people they care about and the issues that matter most to their lives.



Now, we're raising funding to produce and release another twenty videos in the two months between now and election day, November 6th.

We've done it for over 50 videos so far, and we're committed to doing even more with #20for2018!

 

YOUR SUPPORT

Covering this election is a labor of love, and your support provides the means to cover expenses like travel, basic overhead, and promotional targeting of the videos to voters in the races that we feature.  



Every $500 we raise is another video we can produce, release, and promote.  Some videos will cost less than that, and some will cost more, but this amount represents an average required to meet our goal.

We've organized a group of nearly 100 talented creators across the country who are ready to do as much as possible by election day. We'll make as many videos as we have funding for in the coming weeks.

 

WHO WE ARE

36campaigns is a grassroots social media news publisher focusing the attention of Democrat and Independent voters on thirty-six critical congressional races in 2018. Our videos help tell the stories of those races, and the issues defining this incredibly important midterm.

 

Thank you for for your support!

- Alana, Jeff, and the 36campaigns Team

 

Twitter: http://twitter.com/36campaigns 

Facebook: http://facebook.com/36campaigns 

Instagram: http://instagram.com/36campaigns 

EXAMPLES OF SOME OF OUR VIDEOS SO FAR:

title: Phil and Nancy Crowe
summary: Help for Nancy and Phil CroweMy dear Aunt Nancy woke just after midnight to find her bed on fire, after attempting to put the fire out Phil and Nancy had to abandon their house of 42 years with nothing but the clothes on their backs. Being a 130 years old  the house  went up in minutes.  They were truly lucky to escape with minor injuries.  That is where the luck ran out.  The house, all its conents and their car were burnt to the ground in hours.  Unfortunately they  had no insurance to help them rebuild or replace any of their belongings.  Red Cross has put them up for a few days in a hotel but they are now faced with finding a new home, and rebuilding all that they lost.   Any financial help you can provide would be immensly appreciated by the family.http://www.appeal-democrat.com/news/fire-destroys--year-old-farmhouse-in-sutter-county/article_c69694d8-125f-11e5-a1e1-d77d0f176390.htmlhugs to all...

title: iRunWithLula on the Road to the DNC
summary: Guess what, y'all? We are headed to the DNC!  Y'all are still running with Lula, right?On June 12th, I was unanimously approved to serve on the Credentials Committee for the North Carolina Delegation to the 2016 Democratic National Convention as appointed by the Bernie Sanders’ campagin. I’m deeply honored to have this opportunity to represent Charlotte and North Carolina at the upcoming Democratic convention. As the youngest member elected to any committee on the North Carolina Delegation, I’m happy to continue to educate and include my peers and fellow Democrats about the importance of the DNC and the political process, at large.Make no mistake about it, we have a long fight ahead of us to ensure a Democrat takes the White House in November. First, we must select our Democratic nominee in July. I am headed to the DNC in support of Senator Bernie Sanders however no matter if you’re “Feeling the Bern" or “You’re with Her”, I hope you will continue to Run with Lula on the road to the DNC. Everything in life favors the prepared and the preparation for this opportunity is $1875 to do this work. That cost will cover my hotel stay for 5 days, breakfast while there, ground transportation once on the ground in Philly, and other delegation events. That price does not include travel to Philly nor does it cover other meals while in Philly. Is $5, $25, $50, $100, $500 or more something you'd be willing to consider donating in order to help me fulfill my role as a committee member? Whether you are able to give little, much, or nothing at all I am grateful for your support. Please keep the entire delegation in your thoughts and prayers as we, both, raise funds and travel to represent our great state of North Carolina.Democratically yours,Lula Dualeh

title: Train a leader & support autism
summary: My name is Megan and I have been nominated to attend the Junior National Leadership Conference in Washington, D.C. this summer. I have been working hard to EARN the money to be able to attend the conference. I have done some cleaning, tutoring, gift wrapping, as well as some other odd jobs to earn the $3000 needed for my trip.I have also been working on a project that is very close to my heart, Spreading Autism awareness and love for those that are different not less. Two of my brothers are on the autism spectrum, so I have seen first hand how autism can impact families. I am working on ways to raise money to buy supplies needed in the autism classrooms in The Collinsville School District. I'm going to be selling homemade autism bracelets after the holidays to help fund this project.While I was trying to work to earn all of my money for my trip, there have been people who wanted a place to donate to help me which is why I'm creating this page. My goal is set for $5000 because any money I receive over the amount I need for my trip, will be used to purchase items needed for the Unit 10 autism classrooms.I was also featured as the student of the week in the Belleville News Democrat. You can see my story in today's (December 13) paper at BND.com.Thank you for reading my story and for the love and support you have given me .

title: FL CITIZENS RIGHT TO  PETITION  Legal Defense Fund
summary: FL CITIZENS RIGHT-TO - PETITION LEGAL DEFENSE FUND TO REPEAL HB-5 LAWHave you ever signed a legal constitutional amendment ballot initiative petition to vote on an issue?  Or voted for such laws in the past?  You no longer have a right to do so.  Politicians just removed your rights.  If you let them, unless you stop them. Why do we ask you to join our Florida citizens volunteer people's peaceful  Florida Citizen's Right To Petition movement?  Given the number of Florida voters who have signed petitions or went to vote for or against ballot initiative petition issues over the years, we believe most Florida citizens will join together and act to retain this right we treasure.Our nonpartisan ad-hoc volunteer group, FL CITIZENS RIGHT TO PETITION, opposes Florida House Bill-5 (HB-5) that shreds Florida citizens’ inherent state constitutional rights by seeking to stop us from putting our own Florida State constitutional amendment laws on the ballot for a vote.  It seems some Florida politicians believe they should have this right, but not the people.  Not to protect our environment!  Not for fair election boundaries!  Not for medical marijuana!  Not even to restore the right of people to vote, if convicted of a felony, despite serving their sentence and wishing to rejoin us as a full citizen with rights. HB-5 blocks our rights as citizens, while corporations, millionaires and politicians now will be the only ones with the real ability to conduct petition drives.  Therefore, they decide what is on the ballot to vote for in the future, not the voters.Our ballot initiative petition process was designed so ordinary everyday citizens to have this "right" to bypass politicians as a means to approve laws that "we," the citizens, desire, but our elected representatives repeatedly refused to pass.Look what happened the after our 4th of July weekend holiday, on July 8th, 2019!  Not one citizen volunteer petition campaign continuing on after Independence Day!   Only corporate sponsored or millionaire owned petition campaigns.Using paid petition canvassers only; to collect voter signed petitions.  Politicians just passed HB-5 to push aside our once inherent fundamental constitutional ballot initiative right to write a law; sign petitions; and go vote to approve our law.HB-5's abrupt changes impacted on-going petition drives; ending or suspending  the opportunity of Florida voters being able to vote in 2020 on several very popular issues, like Medicaid For Low-Income Adults, Background Checks For Buying Weapons, Ban on Assault Rifles, Solar Energy and the Right Of Adults To Cannabis; which fully legalizes all plants of the genus, Cannabis, and right of adults in Florida to possess, use and grow your own at home,  just to mention a few.Moreover, HB-5 suppresses the vote of certain voters in our 2020 election.  HB-5 was initiated in the middle of an election 2 year cycle, when ballot initiative petitions were all still being circulated and signed to hand in for the 2020 election.  But we were stopped with six months left in the cycle.  Several ballot initiatives sponsors suspended or ended petition drives for 2020.  The above noted petitions, if on the 2020 ballot, were expected to bring many voters to vote.The HB-5 law was designed to discourage and disillusion people from voting. HB-5 limits progressive, minority and independent voter turnout in our 2020 Florida election. It can help explain a lot!  It seems HB-5 was enacted in the improper way that it was done to "tip" 2020 election results in Florida.  It is well documented that petitions bring out the voters. When an issue is important to ordinary citizens, they show up to vote. Of course they do, because 766,200+ people have already signed a petition to get their concern on the ballot.  Independent, Republicans, Democrats, Green Party, Libertarian Party and so on . . . it does not make a difference. This was a constitutional right shared and used by us all. The right not to have our elections manipulated is a right we all share.Now consider that ballot initiative petition processes have also been restricted in several other states, by state officials to alter 2020 state and national election result outcomes; in Arkansas, in Michigan, it North & South Dakota and Utah.This is may be why HB-5 was passed now; with little thought as to what was actually being done, under false pretenses, by sleight of hand maneuvers.  I speak as an Independent Voter, on behalf of other voters, when I say our constitutional amendment ballot initiative petition process is not someone's special interest playpen. The Floridian people's rights and best interests are not anyone's playpen play toys.  It is why many Floridians have joined us already.  We need you, too.Gov. DeSantis, who pushed for this law, recently appointed three new Supreme Court Justices who all belong to the Federalist Society; suggesting the new Judges may support this attempt to solidify the hold politicians would have over us.   Whether Democrat or Republican, ETC . . . this is an impermissible coup that threatens to eviscerates many rights.I oppose this as an Independent Voter (NPA) in Florida.  As a Florida citizen volunteer who has collected a variety of citizen-led constitutional ballot initiative petitions, I bypass any and all partisan Florida politicians once again.  I go to federal court. We retain well-known top Civil Rights Attorney, William Sheppard's law firm from Jacksonville, Florida to file this legal court challenge to HB-5 to save several popular proposed laws as well as our state constitutional ballot petition process. Bill Sheppard is still ranked as one of the five best Civil Rights and First Amendment attorneys in the USA.  Last year, he won the 2018 "Florida Best Attorney Award" once more.  I know and trust Bill Sheppard is the best there is to handle this case.                                                                                                              Once filed, we request the Judge to issue a "Stay Order" to stop enforcement of  HB-5; allowing us to collect our ballot initiative petitions, all 766,200 of them, as our case is being decided in federal court.  Other petitions will also become available, when the Federal Judge's "Stay Order" is issued!  These petition collective drives could resume.We have strong reasons to believe our request for a "stay" will be granted, given the way the politicians interfered with the rights of the Floridian people to vote on these issues in 2020, and the questionable way this law was enacted.  We further believe HB-5 will be overturned for violating our constitutional rights. The impact of suppressing the vote now an issue! We are forming a people's peaceful "political revolution" by creating our own county petition teams to pass laws we all approve of enacting.  We collect voter signed petitions.  As we conduct our petition drive, we find good candidates who support the people of  Florida and our issues.  We vote to approve our new ballot initiative laws and elect our candidates.People in the State of Florida need to take these matters in hand.  Join our legal challenge to HB-5 by donating  $3 if you can, and print out, sign and pass along petitions if you can; ask those voters to do the same "sign one . . . pass two along . . . ." Create a cannabis "daisy chain" of petitions flowing to our county and regional petition collection sites.RIGHT OF ADULTS TO CANNABIS [Ballot Initiative Serial # 15-20]https://dos.elections.myflorida.com/initiatives/fulltext/pdf/64864-1.pdf(May have to "reload" page to see petition).  (Sign and mail) (Pass two along to other Florida voters to sign and share).This legal cannabis petition, sponsored by Floridians For Freedom (FFF), a non-partisan volunteer Florida citizen-led group, is a focus of this federal court challenge to the HB-5 law, since this is what this constitutional ballot initiative "petition process" was exactly designed for . . . Florida citizen's having the right to decide our own laws, that we live with to abide by.Join us to stop the improper political attempt to compromise our 2020 elections under the guise of HB-5.  Join our statewide petition drive by "sign one, sharing two more"! Christopher M. Kennard      FL CITIZENS RIGHT TO PETITION Legal Defense Fund (on FACEBOOK)4315 SE 10th Place, Ocala Florida 34471https://www.gofundme.com/f/Fl-Citizens--Right-To-Petition-Legal-Defense-Fund?

title: Help Richard Get to CDA National Convention
summary: Hey y’all! Coming up this September, the College Democrats of America will be holding their annual National Convention in New Orleans. At the convention, students will be afforded a unique opportunity to meet with fellow College Democrats from all over the country, allowing us to build relationships as we work together to change this country for better. In addition, there will be multiple workshops related to a plethora of different topics that we as Democrats are working hard to advocate for and address. As a member of the USC College Democrats Executive Board and as a Clyburn Fellow, I want to take this opportunity to get to know fellow College Democrats from all-over America and to learn what more I can do to advance our cause. I need your help to get me there! Any funds raised will go towards helping me pay for plane tickets and housing! Any donations will be greatly appreciated! Thank y’all!-Richard
