title: Send Delegate Trey to Philly
summary:
Hi, my name is Trey and on June 19th I was honored to be selected as an At-Large Delegate to represent Bernie Sanders at the Democratic National Convention in Philadelphia during the week of July 24th.  I believe that I will make Washington State proud at the Convention because in addition to the sincere passion that the Democratic Party inspires in its followers, I also bring strong leadership skills and personal diversity to the table. 

Throughout the caucausing process and in district meetings I have built bridges of communication and mutual respect between the supporters of both candidates.  In order to avoid a catastrophic Republican presidency, Democrats must unite with respectful dialogue and honest understanding.  I have demonstrated that I'm the delegate that can help make this happen. 

I am also an Asian-American, a US Army Veteran, and a proud supporter of the LGBT community, all of which further enables me to create productive alliances among Democrats. 

As a respectful, engaging, and diverse leader, I am thrilled to represent Washington State at the National Convention.  I am here to humbly ask for your support with the funds needed to make that happen.  All funds raised by July 31st will be used to offset plane fare, ground transportation, hotel accomodations, and meals in Philadelphia.  In the event that the funds raised exceed the costs incurred, any overages will be donated to the Washington State Democratic Party. 

Thank you for you support in this historic opportunity.

title: San Diego Pride March for Pete!
summary: Our group needs $1000 TODAY in order to pay for the contingent fee to march in the San Diego Pride Parade.  Today May 31 is the deadline to register.With 35% of the Democrats not knowing who Pete is, a presence in San Diego pride parade is a must.  It is one of the largest Prides in the United States, attracting over 250,000 people.We originally planned to march and handout stuff but we just learned that we would have to pay the $1000 parade contingent fee for a political organization.  Even though we are grassroots, we have to march under the political category.  San Diego Pride Registration Fees The $1000 will go toward the contingent fee for us to march.  The $100 will go toward the cost of a large banner (mandatory) and the remaning $100 will go toward the costs of promotional items like buttons.If you believe in Pete like we do, help us reach that goal to help promote him!If we do not raise sufficient funds to register, all donations will be reimbursed.

title: Alaska Young Dem for Bernie
summary:
Hello! My name is Olivia Garrett and I have been elected as an Alaska Delegate to the 2016 Democratic National Convention in Philadelphia this July. This is an amazing oportunity, however I am unable to fund this trip on my own and am asking for your support. ABOUT MEI am 22 years old, a student at the University of Alaska Fairbanks, and a former staffer with the Bernie campaign.  I am a lifelong Alaskan, born in Soldotna and currently living in Fairbanks. I'm am completing my degree in Secondary Education with the goal of teaching in rural Alaska. WHY I SUPPORT SENATOR SANDERSI have been a proud supporter of Senator Sanders since before his presidential campaign. His leadership on issues like campaign finance reform, LGBTQ rights, and income inequality have always stood out to me. He is one of the only candidates that will properly address these issues and more. COSTSLodging: $1,200Round Trip Flight: $700 including baggage fees Meals and Incidentals: $300Total: $2,200Thank you for your support!
http://www.alaskademocrats.org/press-releases/2016/5/16/alaska-democrats-concluded-successful-convention

title: Fire Fund for the Cooney's
summary: On Wednesday January 27, 2016, the kids had a fire at their house.  My daughter Domin'ee got everyone out of the house safe including the animals.  She actually tried to put the fire out with a fire extinguisher before it got out of control (super woman daughter) The fire started in the back bathroom and consumed the bathroom and half of the kid’s bedroom.  The kid's beds, toys, and most of their clothes were destroyed by either fire or smoke damage.  The rest of the house was consumed by the smoke and is uninhabitable.  Currently the family is staying in a hotel for a few days until we can figure out a place for them to stay.  Keith is working with the insurance and doing what he can to take care of his family in the meantime.  We know this will be a long process so I wanted to set this account up for them to help with any additional expenses they incur while the house is rebuilt.  Below is the article that was published in the Press Democrat about the fire.  We appreciate and thank you for all prayers and any help you can provide.http://www.pressdemocrat.com/news/5140213-181/fire-damages-santa-rosa-home

title: Laura Thien Disability Caucus Chair
summary:
Please help me celebrate my 30th birthday!!
Friends, instead of hosting a fundraiser, I wanted to ask you to consider helping me celebrate my 30th birthday (March 28th) by making a donation to help me continue to serve the Young Democrats of America - and to run again as Disability Caucus Chair.  

Since the summer of 2015 - when I became chair of the YDA's Disability Caucus - I have been able to build a structure that didn't exist before, have strengthened our presence within the national organization, hosted guest speaker calls for hundreds of interested Democrats, hosted a disability forum in Delaware this past spring, and have worked really hard to be the face of the Disability Caucus - and, really, young Democrats - outside of YDA.  I've had some wonderful experiences over the last 18 months and want to continue making you all proud.  
Your donation will help me participate in two events this year - the YDA National Spring Conference (in Arizona ) March 24th - 26th and then the National Convention (in Texas).  Your donations will help me pay for flights and hotel costs.  
Attending the Spring Conference will give me the ability to campaign to continue on as Disability Chair before the National Convention. I will oversee the Disability Caucus meeting during the Spring Conference (stay tuned for who my special guest is)!  I really need this experience and those face-to-face contacts to be successful in carrying on this mission and continuing to serve in this capacity; and that's why I am asking for your help.

title: Send Delegate Ashley 2 DNC 4 Bernie
summary: Hello Everyone,My name is Ashley Bynum and I have successfully secured the support of my district convention to be one of three Bernie Sanders delegates from the Virginia 8th Congressional District to this July’s Democratic National Convention in Philadelphia. District 8 is comprised of Alexandria, Arlington, Falls Church, and portions of Fairfax County. Based on the results of the March 1st Virginia primary, District 8 was allocated 3 Bernie Sanders delegates to Hillary Clinton’s 5. I have been selected as the sole female Bernie Sanders delegate for these crucial Democratic strongholds in Northern Virginia, and am thrilled to be a representative of my community, along with Mark Wiznitzer and Boyd Walker. I am asking for your financial assistance, so that I can finance the expenses associated with attending the June 18th Virginia Democratic Convention in Richmond, and the July 25-28th Democratic National Convention in Philadelphia. As many of you know, I was very recently employed as the Operations Director for the campaign here in VA, and after the expiration of my contract with the campaign, I thought serving one of the campaign’s delegates to Philly was the best way to keep Feeling the Bern! A lot of you already know this about me, but, I’m originally from the South Bronx, and moved to Virginia in 2012, after graduating from St. Bonaventure University with a BA in political science. As a graduating senior, my first venture into politics was working on President Obama’s re-election campaign. I moved to VA to pursue a graduate degree at GW in Political Management. While at GW, I worked for Will Smith’s campaign in Maryland, and worked on Patrick Hope’s congressional bid for a short stint. After graduating, I was a Field Organizer in the Hunter Mill District in Fairfax County for Senator Mark Warner, where I successfully mobilized a turnout of nearly 49%, ranking the 2nd highest in the county. Last year, I was offered a role on Senator Sanders’ South Carolina team. I started out as a Regional Field Director, then moved into a role as Scheduling and Advance Director, before becoming the state’s Faith-Based Outreach Director, ultimately ending as Virginia’s Operations Director. On the campaign, I had the pleasure to work with Campaign Manager Jeff Weaver, Senior Adviser Phil Fiermonte, SC State Director Chris Covert, VA State Director Peter Clerkin, and Marcus Ferrell, the Southeastern Political Director for African American Outreach, and so many more. As VA Operations Director, I opened up 5 offices and managed 24 staff, and a budget of $265,000. I made sure volunteers had what they needed to assist Bernie and his dream of a political revolution. I stand before you guys today, thankful for your support and your faith in my ability to adequately represent the Virginia 8th! Our Democratic delegates decided  to send representation that coincides with the coalition of voters the Senator is trying to turn out, in order to secure a win in this primary! I know that I am best able to represent Virginia, as well as give a voice to the coalition of young, independent, and minority voters that are the source of the Senator’s strength at the ballot box and in the polls. Polls consistently show that Senator Sanders is the best Democrat to take on Donald Trump in the fall. I feel that as an African American female millennial, and a previous campaign staffer, I have the grit and drive to best represent these passionate voters, alongside the 108 other members of the Virginia delegation in Philadelphia this July. According to the misleading media, the Senator apparently lacks supporters who look like me, but here I am ready and willing to give his vision a voice. Your support would solidify that vision. Best Wishes,Ashley Bynum

title: Send Carl to Philly Fund
summary: Friends, I was elected a Delegate to the Democratic National Convention in Philadelphia. It is an honor to be elected to represent Democrats from the 1st Congressional District in Oregon at the convention.  We elected 9 delegates, 5 for Bernie Sanders and 4 for Hillary Clinton. I was one of the 4 delegates elected for Hillary Clinton. As a longtime volunteer and campaign worker I am not a billionaire and need some help to get to the convention.  Airfare and housing are the largest expenses. I am setting my goal to raise my funds by June 30th as the Democratic Party of Oregon needs to know flight information by the first of July. I hope you can help.CarlSpecial Rewards Morse of Course Reward (Only 5 Sets) As Wayne Morse fan, I've picked up a lot of Morse items over the years. Now I'm gonna pass some on to you!All these items are from his 1968 U.S. Senate Campaign1 of the Morse Psychedelic Posters2 Green Morse Senate Litho Pins1 Re-Elect Morse Bumper Sticker 1 There is Still So Much To Do Morse brochure Hillary Button Display (Only 2 Sets) Offering a display of 2016 Hillary Clinton buttons made and used during her historic 2016 campaign. They will be mounted on a white canvass perfect to hang up in your office or wherever you like to hang that sorta thing up at. Bernie Button Display (Only 2 Sets) Offering a display of 2016 Bernie Sanders buttons made and used during his historic 2016 campaign. They will be mounted on a white canvass perfect to hang up in your office or wherever you like to hang that sorta thing up at. Classic Clinton (10) These 1996 Clinton-Gore Posters were issued by AFSCME and printed in Washington State. They feature the slogan 'Building Bridges to our Future' and feature photos of Clinton and Gore.Temporal Ethics (1) Explore the ethical considerations of time travelers with your host Carl. This was my thesis paper in college philosophy that I had to present during Academic Showcase. We filled an entire classroom of nerdy people wanting to talk about time travel and the ethical problems such travelers experience. I'll dust off the speech and give you something to think about it. (if you want me to show up, please be within the greater Portland Metro area) Join My Quest (1) What is it you seek? What all men have sought since time began...the ultimate wisdom...Yes, I will bring Star Trek V: The Final Frontier to your home! We will watch it. We will debate why it is the greatest or not so greatest Star Trek film of them all. We may even roast marsh mellons. (Again, to inspire friends in Portland and Salem areas to give). For Humanity Invite your favorite guests and I will bring Cards Against Humanity for us to play.Qapla'! My friend John G. Hertzler is going to send you a personal autograph to help celebrate 50 years of Star Trek and to also celebrate me attending a different kind of convention this year. As much as I would love to join friends and Trekkers from all over the world in Vegas, Democrats need to some hard work this summer and fall to win.

title: Help Jason Sasser Get His Black Belt
summary: Jason Sasser, who has Cerebral Palsy, has a life long dream to become a Black Belt. He has had a hard time finding anyone who is willing to teach him. He was able to reach a yellow belt with a previous instructor. We, at Southwind Taekwondo would love to help him make his dream come true. We would like to raise enough money to be able to travel once each quarter to instruct Mr. Sasser. We can do the rest of his training through the internet using videos, but we will have to be face to face to test him and train him to break boards and spar. Mr. Sasser's determination over the past 20 years proves that he has what it takes to move ahead in Taekwondo!Over the past two years Jason has accomplished getting his GREEN BELT, breaking boards with newfound power, being on the cover of the Arkansas Democrat (as well as the Ashley News Observer)!  His training is going well, but we always need funds to cover travel expenses. Please consider donating to a worthy cause!

title: Margo & Jack to DNC in Philadelphia
summary: Help send Margo & Jack to the 2016 Democratic National ConventionOn 21 May 2016, Margo was elected by fellow Democrats to serve as one of the At Large National Delegates to represent Florida at the Democratic National Convention (DNC) in Philadelphia, PA on 25-28 July 2016.  So Margo and Jack are going to Philadelphia!It is a great honor to be a member of the Florida Delegation who will travel to the DNC to nominate Hillary Clinton for President Of The United States Of America.Margo is one of the 24 At Large Delegates that were allocated to Hillary Clinton per the results of our March 15th Florida Primary election.  To be a delegate to nominate Hillary Clinton as the Democratic Party's presidential candidate is a once in a lifetime experience and means a lot to us be there to witness history in the making.Margo and Jack have been political activists for many years.  We have worked to get Hillary elected since 2007 and are glad she will finally be our nominee.  We helped form Greater Orlando Team Hillary in 2007 and recreated it as a powerful grassroots force in 2014 in anticipation of a second run for the Presidency by Hillary in 2016.  We have worked tirelessly to build Greater Orlando Team Hillary into a 1000-person powerhouse to elect Hillary.  Greater Orlando Team Hillary has held many events, fundraisers, and has worked directly with the campaign to provide volunteers to staff phone banks and support rallies and numerous other campaign events.We have long been actively involved in numerous other causes including human rights, LGBT rights, voting rights, as well as arts, environmental, and conservation issues.We are excited and proud to have this opportunity to represent Florida at the DNC.As might be expected this trip will be very expensive due mostly to the extremely high cost of the hotel where the Florida Delegation is staying ($600/night), therefore, we need your help.  We need to raise a minimum of $5,000 to cover the cost of flight, room and board, and transportation.You can be part of our grassroots effort.  Please donate today!  No amount is too small...or too big!We genuinely appreciate your support, an you have our deepest gratitude.Margo & Jack

title: DNC Pittsburgh Delegates Fundraiser
summary: THANK YOU, YOU WONDERFUL, PROGRESSIVE, BEAUTIFUL PEOPLE! WE HAVE RAISED ENOUGH TO MAKE THE TRIP POSSIBLE! If you would still like to contribute to someone, PLEASE consider contributing to Keli Vereb on the Rules Committee . Keli is a Steelworker and a Pittsburgher, and because the Rules Committee has such an important job, they are required to stay 2 days longer than the Delegates, which means she has to spend $2940 for hotel alone. Bernie is relying on the Rules Committee to help shape future elections, including the removal of Superdelegates from the electoral process, passing legislation for automatic voter registration at age 18, and the creation of open primaries for all states. Keli's participation is crucial! From the hearts of Alex, Beth, Greg, Carolyn, and Maddie, we want to extend our gratitude and love for you all. This movement has never been about a single voice or a single candidate, it's about the people uniting to fight the many wrongs in our society. Please keep fighting with us, and we promise to fight for all of you - both on the Convention floor and after! #seeyouinphillyWe are Beth Ussery and Alex Austin,  two of the founders of Burghers for Bernie, a grassroots organization dedicated to electing Bernie Sanders as President! If you don't know Burghers, Beth is also a co-chair of PA Labor for Bernie, and Alex is the head of Pitt Students for Bernie. Basically if you've been to a Bernie event in the city of Pittsburgh, chances are you've probably met us, bought a t-shirt off of us, and/or received a high-five from us. And we think you are awesome! Today, we're here to ask you for some help in funding our journey to the Democratic National Convention in Philly! In addition to ourselves, we're also raising money for the at-large delegates supporting Bernie from District 14: Greg Schaffer, Madeline Whitehill, and Carolyn Kazdin.  That's 5 delegates who need your help!! Alex and I were both fortunate enough to be elected to serve as  pledged delegates to Bernie at the Democratic National Convention this July. So before we say anything else, thank you for giving us this YUUUUGE honor! We will do our best to represent you all, to be your voice on the Convention floor, and to stand strong for our platform and our candidate! Not only will we continue to fight for Bernie until the very last vote is cast, but we promise to continue to push Pittsburgh's Progressive movement long after this election cycle is over. Now, "regular" people don't usually get picked to be delegates. This is an honor reserved for mayors (our own Bill Peduto is a delegate for Hillary) and the political elite. It's viewed as a status symbol, or a reward for helping the Democratic Party to raise a lot of money. Each delegate is required to pay for their own transportation, food, and lodging. We know you're thinking, "Yinz only gotta go across the state, how much could it cost?!" Well lemme tell ya: the hotel alone costs $2100 (proof ). Due to the incredibly tight security perimeter surrounding the convention center and the  need to get our daily security credentials before the meetings begin, the Sanders Campaign has made it mandatory that all delegates stay at the hotel designated solely for the PA Democrats.  We have a friend who's going to New Zealand and her plane ticket across the world is cheaper than our trip across Pennsylvania.  For most middle-class folks (like Beth) or amazing, single dad-slash-Air Force Veteran-slash-fulltime college students (like Alex), the cost of the trip is too much.  But the Sanders campaign chose us as delegates because they know how passionate we are about the cause, and because they know that we will do everything we can at the Convention  to push Bernie and his platform through to the nomination. Together, we are stronger than the Billionaires! Help us get to the convention by chipping in whatever you can. If we exceed our goal, we will use the extra money to help other PA Bernie delegates reach theirs! Thank you, and we're honored to represent you! Beth and Alex

title: Berning Up The DNC!
summary: Welcome! Thank you so much for taking the time to check out my funding page for the National Democratic Convention! As you may have figured out by now, I have been elected to be a delgegate to the DNC representing Bernie Sanders in Philadelphia this July.  What this means is I have a very expensive but CRUCIALLY important trip to plan! It's important to me for several reasons. 1.  I am a PRIME example of the kind of disenfranchised and cynical young person in our political system. Although I was a registered Democrat the day I turned 18, I had lost faith in the system and removed myself entirely from the process. This campaign has motivated and inspired me to take a PROACTIVE role in my community and my nation. 2. I am not a big celebrity, smooth talking politician, or some other type of big wig. But despite my seemingly low status of influence, I share important values with millions of YOU! It's these values that inspire me to fight passionately for our poor and disenfranchised in our communities. It's these values that motivate me to stand with my LGBT brothers and sister. And it's these values that give ME of all people the opportunity to journey to Philadelphia and stand with thousands of others and we demand a CHANGE in the way things are done in our country! I waited a little bit to launch this page because I have plans to do some other even more creative and engaging fundraising efforts in the coming month. But until I get those details worked out, I wanted to give you the opportunity to pitch in what you can. Some of the money you give early on will help me to do some even more creative fundraising down the line. Fundraising that I hope will first and foremost result in spreading BERNIE'S message! I thank you in advance for your donations and look forward to keeping in touch with you all through social media as I set out to "Bring The BERN to Philadelphia"!

title: Convention 2k19
summary: Help send members of the Young Democrats at Virginia Tech to the annual statewide Young Democrats convention! Every donation helps and allows us to ensure that every member who wants to attend is able to do so. Thanks!

title: We the people will fight the Fake News
summary: If you don’t think President Trump can lose in the 2020 election, just look who got voted into office in 2018!  TRUMP CAN LOSE! Is it possible that these new members got elected because of their hatred of Trump? By simply jumping on the "I hate trump bandwagon" are they able to push their socialist ideals on our country?PROBLEMBit-by-bit, our nation is being shaken from the foundation it was built on of life, liberty, and the pursuit of happiness, by attacks on capitalism, religious freedoms, personal rights and so much more. This is taking place because FAKE NEWS has permeated the fabric of our culture. Consequently, the ones that are succumbing to the rhetoric and propaganda are not just the liberals and millennial generation, but even moderate and conservative Republicans. The days of unbiased reporting are long gone.Look how Bernie Sanders shifted our country and tore into the fabric of our capitalistic ideals of freedom and liberty by building a following of thousands and thousands of self-entitled supporters. Not to mention he just announced he is also running in 2020.SOLUTION How do you stop FAKE NEWS? You tell the truth, based on facts, not opinions. And, it all starts with the highest office in our land, the presidency.The presidency is our launching point and this is critical, because never in the history of our country has our president been attacked by such viscous blatant propaganda from the media. Trump’s Winning Report will fight back because our country has lost all respect for the office, and now we will expose the truth of how our president is winning based on facts, not opinions. Help support Trump’s Winning Report because by joining us, you too will be making a stand against the destruction of our conservative values from the liberal media. THE DETAILSWe will create a 13 Part Video Series, each with 3 parts explaining Trump’s wins. We are going inside. We are going to find out the truth on several topics: - How Trump’s tax plan helps create businesses- How Trump is beating China on trade- How his economic incentive for some communities works- How he saved money on NATO- His Buy American - and Hire American- Other New Trade Deals- How Trump is Creating Manufacturing Jobs- How the forest clearing works and why he signed an executive order- And many more... We are going to give you a place where Americans can learn exactly what is truly going on.  WE NEED YOU We are going against news sources that make $100’s of millions of dollars a year by attacking and reporting negative news on Donald J. Trump. So please, we ask you to donate what you can as we want to go in-depth as much as possible and prove to the naysayers what Trump has done. So when these Democrats in 2020 ask you what he has done, you can be informed of the answers or tell them to watch this series to learn the truth.To make Trump’s Winning Report work, we need to hire:- Writers- Producers- Story makers- Journalists- Video editors- Researchers- Support staff- And moreDonate what you can, share with all your friends and family, and finally be sure you subscribe to our youtube channel, "Trump’s Winning Report." If you cannot help by donating at this time, please share this message with everyone you know, and of course, subscribe to our youtube channel. Also, be sure to turn on your notifications because the video series will be free to watch.I’m Chris Kelly. I didn't fight for our country for it to be taken over by socialists. Thank you for your support!Chris KellyUSAF Lt. Colonel Retiredp.s. copy and paste the following text when you share this on facebook:PLEASE SHARE: I really believe the fake news is getting out of control. Finally, someone is fighting back to do something about it. Please donate and share this with as many people you know to get this going viral. MAGA!

title: MAGA knitted hats for the homeless
summary: Giving away MAGA knitted hats to the homeless of Michigan. Event will be aired, in Detroit, live via Facebook live. Any donations will be greatly appreciated. Everyone of Michigan knows that a knitted hat is a necessity for these cold temperatures and no one knows this better than the homeless of the major democrat cities that get cold, like Detroit MI. A minimum of $200 will be needed to start this process and any extra donations will be used for more hats, and hopefully MAGA hoodies, depending on how well this goes. I promise to negotiate the best price possible for large orders with communication to vendors. God bless and thanks for your support in the matter and any continued support you can afford to provide.

title: Billy's Trip  to DNC Convention
summary: My name is Billy Moffett and I am a 22 year Union Member of the Communications Workers of America.  I have spent my whole adult life fighting for the Underprivileged and standing up for what I believe in. With my hard work I have been rewarded by being elected by our members President of my Local (6450) for two terms and last year being hired as the Missouri State Campaign Lead for CWA District 6. When Senator Sanders announced he was running for President I like most others didn't know a lot about him. I had heard him speak on the Senate floor and was often impressed with his positions on most issues. As I got to know him I have realized he is the best Candidate Labor could ask for in my lifetime! In December of last year CWA actually endorsed Bernie. From there I have been knocking doors, making calls, and visiting our members worksites to spread the word about his campaign and why we need Senator Sanders as President. I am proud to be the Vice-Chair of the Cass County Democrats and the opportunities they have given me! Being the Vice-Chair is a huge honor as I love Cass County and will always represent them with great pride and honor no matter what role I have.  With great honor I was elected as a National Delegate from Missouri to represent Senator Bernie Sanders at the Democratic National Convention in Philadelphia in July. With this trip comes a lot of expenses. The rooms alone are $629 a night before taxes so for five nights that’s $3,145. I do plan to share my room with a roommate and also drive to cut back on cost. My National Union has given us a $500 stipend which is awesome however won't even begin to scratch the surface.  I have never asked for money from anyone and feel really awkward doing so. However this is a huge expense that unfortunately since I am not part of the 1% I cannot bankroll the whole amount. I need your help! Please help me out and I promise I will represent the State of Missouri and the Democratic Party with great Pride!I appreciate any and all donations to get me to Philly for the DNC Convention!In Solidarity,Billy Moffett

title: Lawsuit to Stop CA District Voting
summary: 100% of the money raised here will go towards attorneys fees and legal expenses for our big Federal Lawsuit against State of California for it's unconstitutional CVRA (California Voting Rights Act), which is being abused by left wing activists and their sleazy lawyers to coerce our smaller cities into adopting race-based (Latino) voting districts to try to give more power to Democrats and Latinos in our cities.  The only way to stop this illegal voting scheme is to get it up to the higher courts for injunctions and eventual rulings on the legalities of  dividing our cities (and school districts and hospital districts) up by race for the purpose of electing more minorities to city councils and boards.  The Supreme Court has already ruled several times that you cannot separate voting districts by race.These city district schemes also affect every voter in California as they take away 75% - 80% of your voting power since now you will only be able to vote for one council member for your "district", instead of all four or five on the council with our current "at large" voting system.More information at our Facebook Page:https://www.facebook.com/STOP-Race-Based-District-Voting-in-Our-California-Cities-1794406937474672/  We plan to hire Kassouni Law, a Constitutional law firm in Sacramento to begin the work on the lawsuit just as soon as we raise the $3500 for the Retainer.  We have spoken to Tim Kassouni and he and his team are excited to take this case all the way to victory!www.kassounilaw.com/

title: Send Caleb Hansen to National!
summary: Please consider supporting me in my journey to the National Democratic Convention. I am deeply dedicated and hardworking and will be honored to represent those who voted for me while in Philadelphia as a delegate.I started volunteering and organizing for Bernie back in 2015 because he was saying what I knew needed to be said but I never thought I would live to hear a Democratic Presidential candidate say. What resonates with me as a small business owner is that unfettered capitalism and the influence of wealth in campaigns is ruining our economy and our society, and Bernie Sanders’ policy proposals are the solution.I was lucky enough to be able to volunteer full time for the 2 weeks Bernie's staff was in our state working to win our caucuses. I’d been working hard in preparation for our caucus for months and am honored to have been designated by staff as Bernie’s sub caucus chair for Boise / Ada County CD2. Driving in Bernie's motorcade in Idaho Falls and serving as a sub-caucus chair at the largest caucus in our nation’s history are two experiences I will never forget, but the friends I have made and the work that so many of us across the state have done together are much more rewarding.When I started organizing in 2015, my goal was to get people active in the movement and give them the tools to make a difference and become leaders in the movement themselves. It warms my soul to see so many people around the state getting active in the revolution and stepping up to be grassroots leaders in their communities. The power of this movement and the deep beauty of people working together for a revolution humbles me. When 1500 Idahoans came together to March for Bernie I felt like the earth moved. I am overjoyed to have played a roll in Bernie’s success in Idaho and to have worked with you to make that happen. Congrats to everyone on 78%!!I’m a bit of a wonk. I’ve been studying rules for months to make sure our delegation has every tool possible to be thoroughly prepared for our state convention. Already I was fortunate to win an argument with party officials at the caucus that allowed us to include many delegate ballots that would have been thrown out. I was recently surprised by the party naming me the Credentials Committee Chair, and have used the opportunity to fight for an inclusive convention. Several important decisions have been made by the committee which may affect you and I am proud of the relationships which I, as a long time unaffiliated voter, have built within the Democratic party and its staff. Our delegation must arrive in Philadelphia with a strong plan and a sound strategy to ensure we make the most of this opportunity. I am determined to be a dedicated voice for Bernie and his platform at our National Convention, and I need your help to get me there. As both the Democratic Chairman of Idaho's Credentials Committee, and an unaffiliated voter I have a unique voice and ability to help counter those who will challenge the credentials of the many Delegates who are not registered Democrats at our National Convention. Voter suppression tactics of this kind cannot be allowed to succeed and I promise I am prepared to ensure Bernie delegates are fully credentialed and their votes counted! I promise to represent you and Bernie well. Your support means the world to me.

title: LGBTrump - Gays For Trump (Events & Group)
summary: ￼     As many LGBTrump supporters know, our application to participate in the Rochester Pride Parade was DENIED by the Out Alliance for the 2nd year in a row for political reasons.    Instead, the group ‘Super Happy Fun America’ invited LGBTrump to be apart of their event, Boston’s 1st Annual Straight Pride Parade and welcomed our group LGBTrump with open arms, & we gladly accepted their offer!    We 100% SUPPORT Boston’s Straight Pride Parade, NOBODY should be bullied, harassed & shamed for celebrating their sexuality or political views, yet that’s exactly what MANY people, media outlets, and corporations are doing to Super Happy Fun America! People are treating SHFA the same exact way that people treated the gay community and their Parade before the Stonewall Riots, and that is UNACCEPTABLE!          Our group is looking to raise funds to attend this amazing, yet controversial event (for a group of 4-6, depending on what we are able to raise!) We will be using the funds for transportation, hotel, food, supplies for our own float, signs, banners, & political merch to represent our group! #MiloYiannopoulos will also be in attendance headlining the event as Grand Marshal!!    (As some have pointed out, this is FAR from a “vacation” - and more to do with us being given the opportunity to spread and share our message, and bring more awareness to our group, LGBTrump - Gays For Trump.)     LGBTrump is not given MILLIONS of dollars like other groups for events such as this, who rely & receive help from the Government, Politicians & George Soros. We rely solely on the support of our AMAZING and patriotic supporters, and we would really appreciate your help, EVERY $1 HELPS!((Update: LGBTrump was recently hit with 4 threats in less than 1 week, the threats are claiming to be from an AntiFa group in NY. We have reported these threats directly to the FBI. Because of these threats, we are hoping to raise the funds needed for personal Security to keep our group safe and protected during this event, as AntiFa has already publicly called out and targeted the owners of this event and Milo Yiannopoulos, the Grand Marshal of the Parade!))    While we are looking to raise funds mainly for our trip, but could also use some funds for our group to cover the expenses of keeping our website up & going, we are also hoping to grow and expand our group by turning it into an official licensed organization and we plan on getting our name Trademarked & registered (If anyone is familiar with trademark laws and such we could really use your help!!!)      On LGBTrump’s first Facebook page, we hit 20k supporters and was in the process to open “chapters” and groups across the US, but we have currently put those plans on hold until we are able to get our new FB page as big as our first! We are hitting 10.3k followers in just under 3 weeks, & that is AMAZING and we can’t thank our supporters enough!!! Please consider donating to LGBTrump. You can do so via GoFundMe, PayPal and Pay!Our PayPal: PayPal.me/PeterLBrownOr via Pay: LGBTrump@iCloud.comThank You guys so much for your continued support and for sticking with us as we try to expand and grow our group!!=================================================================================￼ABOUT LGBTrump: (OUR MISSION)When LGBTrump was formed in November 2016, LGBTrump supporters were mocked and I was laughed at. But we didn’t care. LGBTrump saw something that the media, the party establishments, and the LGBT+ Left did not want to see – a candidate who unlocked Americans from the chains of identity politics and gave a voice to working America. Our plan is to usher in a new era of politics – an era in which your identity does not determine your ideology and an era is which the needs of the nation are placed before the needs of special interests. To the Beltway bandits this is scary as hell. To the American people this is a liberation of unprecedented heights.Our message is clear: GAYS DO NOT HAVE TO BE DEMOCRATS!!!We welcome EVERYONE to join our movement! We have some of the BEST SUPPORTERS out there who are Gay, Straight, Bisexual, Trans, Black, White, Purple, Christian, Jewish, Muslim, Asian, Mexican, LEGAL Immigrants, etc. and we couldn’t be more thrilled to have such a diverse group of Patriotic Americans who share the same goal: to MAKE AMERICA GREAT AGAIN!!I am Marky Hutt. I am the founder of 'LGBTrump - Gays For Trump' and I am a PROUD gay conservative. I’m ashamed & embarrassed that I once defended & enabled the LGBTQIA+ community, a group that once demanded equality, tolerance, & acceptance, yet they REFUSE to show that same respect for others that may hold different political views or beliefs, & god forbid you wear a red hat!There isn’t a day that goes by where liberals don’t call us “TRAITORS, bigots, self-loathing, self-hating homophobes, self-hating anti-semites, Islamophobes, transphobic, racists, fascists, “alt-right,” white supremacists, & Nazis” We LOVE our supporters simply for their constant support and for sticking with us, we’re a group that isn’t like the others, we definitely are a different breed in politics and we take FULL PRIDE in that and we wear that badge with HONOR!Thank you for sticking with us as we continue to share and spread our message as we try to expand and grow our group! SOON we will be opening “chapters” & LGBTrump groups across the US, so stay tuned with more info on that and for ways that you guys can help and get involved!Thank you,-Marky HuttFounder of LGBTrump - Gays For Trump

title: Danielle for YDA Vice President
summary: I am running Vice President of the Young Democrats of America because I want to bring my experience revitializing the Young Dem chapters in Colorado to the national level. As VP I hope to increase trainings for Young Dem leaders across the nation and create more opportunities for chapters to organize and mobilize around issue advocacyI'm proud of the work I've accomplished as chair of the Colorado Young Democrats: building chapters, increasing youth performance in elections, and empowering young activists. I'm also proud of myinvolvement with Young Democrats of America as Deputy Issue Advocacy Director, working with other state chairs around the county.  You can learn more about me here!  I'm asking for your help to continue this work as part of the EmpowerYD team. It is important that I travel to other states to meet with young Dems and learn about their needs and what they want out of YDA. Your donation will enable me to travel to places like Virginia, Arizona, Nevada, California and other places. EmpowerYD's vision is to empower Young Democrats by equipping your chapters and members with the tools you need to give every young progressive in your community a voice (www.empoweryoungdemocrats.com).The Mission of the Young Democrats of America is to elect Democrats, advocate for progressive issues, and train the next generation of progressive leaders. Founded in 1932, YDA is the largest partisan, youth-led political organization in America (www.yda.org).

title: Weather Relief
summary: ￼￼Our father, Harold, was one of many victims that were hit by one of the 30 confirmed tornadoes hitting Illinois on December 1st.  Our father's insurance will not cover all the damage.  He will need a new roof, new windows, new gutters, and the list continues. However, we are focused on repairing his home! Our family cannot afford to finance the repairs.  We are guesstimating this can be fixed and repaired for around $15,000.  We just need the help in financing for our father.  We will all help repair, replace, and fix what is most necessary and relevant for him to continue living at home.  Our father is older, second to his wife and family, his home and property mean the world to him; he spent his entire life acquiring.  He had other items on the property destroyed but his home is most important.  His area has not been declared, by the Governor, for aid relief.  Our father is not only dealing with his wife of 50 years having dementia, the loss of his daughter, our sister, last December, but another child/sibling was diagnosed with a serious medical condition this year, and now a tornado.  Anything anyone is able to do would be a great help and a monumental blessing!  (1st Picture: located on the front page of The Fulton Democrat newspaper, see website).  https://2409.newstogo.us/editionviewer/?Edition=a3f31485-6668-464f-acab-80be42dca5f4&Section=0

title: Save Sam Seder's Abused Work Wife
summary: Michael Brooks, work wife of Majority Report's owner and peversely smug MSNBC contributor Sam Seder, is in an abusive relationship . Seder's most notable accomplishment in life is being temporarily fired from his comfortable sheepdog position on Democrat's propaganda outlet MSNBC after making a tasteless  rape joke using his own daughter.  The horrors that must have occurred that night.  One could only imagine!During 2016 election Brooks said he wanted a "radical" left but under the ever vigilant eye of comfortable Democrat Seder, screamed voting for Hillary was the way to get there. This of course is nonsense on stilts. The notion that status quo Clinton is the path to socialism is rank incompetence or a hallmark of the mental gymnastics abused work wives must perform just to get through the day to keep the likes of men like Seder satisfied.Help us provide a safe space for the soft passionate Brooks to escape and actually push for radical change that will reach that new world. A different world is possible!  Propping up the system that got you this one is not the way to get there.No person calling for a radical left should have to live under the whip of a boss setting themselves on fire for Hillary. Save Michael Brooks! ****Partial satire. It is unknown whether work wife Brooks is abused, incompetence is always possible.  I'm giving the benefit of the doubt. ALL proceeds literally go towards domestic violence prevention. It's never okay! Real talk. ****Explanation video

title: Pemberton For House District 19A
summary: We are running for MN House of Representatives District 19A.  We are proud to be representing the Democrat Party. Thank you so much to those of you who have donated already. Goals: Make America Love AgainAccept 50 million immigrants/refugees---state wide. No deportations!Make The World Nuclear FreeReduce US military spending by 90%Millions of New Green Jobs Invest Entirely In Renewable EnergyReduce Prison Population by 90%Community Control of Police: End Police Murder, Stop Domestic/Sexual Voilence Pro-Choice Health Care, Basic Income, 15$/hour For AllLow Threshold Party-List Proportional Representation Overthrow the 1% nonviolently

title: Syrian Refugee School Children
summary: There are more than 4 million Syrian refugees and over half are children (http://data.unhcr.org/syrianrefugees/syria.php)! The children are the future and I would like to influence their education in a positive way.  If you agree please contribute as much as you can to this small fund.I am in Lebanon as I write this campaign request.   I was amazed at the number of people suffering but also at the determination to survive and make their way.   I met Amera a mother of 6, whose husband died a few months ago of illness unrelated to the fighting.  She must now provide for her children and herself.   She is in her 40’s and before leaving Syria, she and her husband owned a farm where they raised cattle and sheep and grew vegetables.  They weren’t wealthy but they were doing ok.  Now Amera is working as a maid when she can find work, as is her 15 year old daughter and her son.   All contribute to the household and they barely scrape by.  Her dreams and the dreams of her children have been put on hold. Today, her biggest concern is the education of her children.  In Syria her school age children did very well in school but since fleeing the war they have not been able to attend school.  They have missed a year.   The village where I am staying is called Btekhnai.  This year the Village Council requested and received a waiver from the central government to allow Syrian Children to attend the public schools in Btekhnai.   Btekhnai is the exception in Lebanon.  Most other villages in Lebanon and the central government in Lebanon fear that if they educate the Syrians they will not want to leave Lebanon.  Btekhnai doesn’t agree and in fact believes if they do not educate the children it will lead to children seeking other outlets such as vandalism, crime and worst of all as the children are old enough they will return to fighting – possibly in Lebanon.  Btekhnai is a small village of about 900 plus year round.  During the summer months the Villages population increases by about 3,500 people most Americans of Lebanese descent returning to enjoy their historic family homes in the fresh cool mountain air, to visit family and friends or to attend weddings.   They have no relationship to these children other than most are typical Americans (Democrat and Republican) that see an opportunity to help make a real difference in the world.I believe this is why Btekhnai is the exception.   In addition to giving their own money they have been successful in working with the United Nations and other NGO to provide basic facilities for Children.  I believe that out of this humanitarian crisis there is an opportunity.  An opportunity to educate these children to help them build a better Syria.  Use of Funds: This fund will be used to buy books, backpacks, paper, pencils, school supplies in general and learning aids.  Funds will only be used for this purpose.  I plan to use my own resources to arrange for delivery of the supplies.   All children up to 12th grade, Lebanese and Syrian, attending school in Btekhnai will be provided supplies (as long as they last) with the Syrian Children given first priority.  Funds not used during the year will be carried over to the following year.  Who am I?You may want to know who is this guy trying to raise money for children and how can I trust him to use my money wisely.   I am one of those “crazy” Americans that return to Lebanon for the mountain air and to honor my parents whose dream it was that my brother and sisters and I would use the family home which has been in our family for over a hundred years.   I was born in Kingsport, TN but grew up in Florida.  My father was Lebanese and my mother was a Virginian (German/Irish) from Dunganon, VA not too far from Kingsport.  They met during World War II when my father, who was fighting with Patton’s third army, was on leave.  My brother and Sisters grew up as typical American kids.  I graduated from Cocoa High School and went on to get an undergraduate degree in Public Administration and a Master’s Degree in Public Policy  from the University of Central Florida.  After college I become a public official serving as City Manager in several cities in Florida and eventually ended up in the private sector as a real estate developer and entrepreneur.  The children are the future and I would like to influence their education in a positive way.  If you agree please contribute as much as you can to this small fund.

title: Help get Alyssa to Carnegie Hall.  She won Gold!
summary: My name is Alyssa Gaines, and I am freshman at Park Tudor School in Indianapolis, IN. I am an active student within my school’s community. This year, I played volleyball, basketball, and lacrosse; I participated in both of my school productions; and I was a member of my school’s Black Student Union and Young Democrats’ Club, in addition to starting my own Slam Poetry Club. Through all of the activities that I am involved in, it is clear to those who know me that my passion is writing. I have been writing spoken word poetry and competing in slams since the third grade, and over the years my love for poetry has only grown. I was fortunate enough to be given the opportunity to compete in The Poetry Slam at the 2016 Library of Congress Book Festival in Washington, D.C. , in which I was awarded third place; to travel to the international Brave New Voices youth poetry festival both in 2017 and 2018 as a competing member of the Indianapolis team; and now, my writing has given me another amazing opportunity.I am excited to say that my poems, “Tongue-Tied,” “Sentences That Set,” and “that one park where so-and-so got shot,” have been awarded gold keys in the Scholastic Art & Writing competition. Out of 320,000 submissions, it is with gratitude that I am also able to say that I have been honored with three national awards: a Scholastic Gold Medal, an American Voices Medal (awarded to only one writer per region), and the Best-in-Grade Award (awarded to two writers per grade level in the country). In receiving all three national awards, it places me within the top 1% of all submissions; therefore, I have been invited to Carnegie Hall in New York City this June to receive my awards and participate in showcasing my work. If I am able to go, I will be able to receive my awards on the Carnegie Hall stage. In being awarded this honor, I will be joining a legacy of celebrated authors and artists including Sylvia Plath, Truman Capote, and Andy Warhol. I am very grateful for this opportunity, but I need help getting to New York City. Please help me to be able to represent my community with my art on a greater scale.

title: Send Ali to the DNC!
summary: Hi Everybody!I am honored to be representing Indiana's 7th Congressional District at the Democratic National Convention. I have been working to get Hillary elected for 10 years. I will be sharing a room so the cost of convention and travel for me will be about $1,500. This is a lot of money for Zach and I, so I am reaching  out for funds.  The initial $1,000 (to cover hotel and convention costs) is due to state party by June 30th, so we are under a time crunch.Any little bit helps. Going to the convention means so much to me. I can't even descibe how seriously I take this honor. Please help me out. I promise to continue to work hard and get good Democrats elected in Indiana.Thank you,Ali

title: From Sorbonne to Cambridge LLM with your help
summary: Dear All, 5 years… It took me 5 years to finally get the desired invitation from the University of Cambridge to pursue my Master’s degree there.I graduated from Jean Moulin Lyon 3 University and French University in Armenia with academic excellence. Currently, I am a graduate student at Paris 1 Panthéon-Sorbonne University, which is among 25 best universities by law studies.It is noteworthy that it was thanks to my academic achievements that I have been granted a 75% tuition waiver scholarship at the French University of Armenia and other scholarships that helped me make my way to Paris 1 Panthéon-Sorbonne University. During my studies, I was honored to be taught by Armenian and French practitioners who showed how to combine practical skills with doctrinal interpretations, at the same time sharing both Armenian and French values. Among my tutors were the General Prosecutor of the Republic of Armenia, Deputy Chairman of the Investigative Committee of the Republic of Armenia and other practitioners who worked in the law enforcement system. I believe that having such lecturers have conveyed me theoretical and practical knowledge to continue my education in the University of Cambridge.During my education process, I have managed to conduct numerous researches on law. My scientific work includes topics like plea bargaining, the retroactivity of the decisions of state high courts, the incompatibility of the parole mechanism of Wales and England with the European and International documents etc. I believe that this course will later create a solid foundation for undertaking research in these fields, as well as in others, more thoroughly.It is noteworthy that my theoretical knowledge has also been successfully applied in many domestic and international moot courts, where I have had different achievements (e.g. Jessup International Moot Court to name but a few). I am sure that my previous experience of this kind will help me concentrate on practical issues during my studies.Starting from my school years, I have participated in more than 200 professional projects. Thus, I have built and maintained professional relationships during these programs not only within my country, but also abroad, including both European and Asian countries, such as South Korea. Studying abroad also has an important role in creating professional relationships.I believe it is important to state that I consider myself an active member of the civil society, who has long-term goals, strives to be open to any new ideas. After entering the university, in the first month I was elected as a member of the Student Council where I was the representative of 120 students. At the end of the first year, members of the Student Council, who were representing several thousand students, elected me as a Person-Responsible for the Development of Education and Science, in the framework of which I have completed corresponding courses at the National Quality Assurance Center, becoming an expert in education quality. In the second year of my university education, I was elected Secretary-General of the Student Council, thanks to which my leadership qualities have improved, since I led many events, with dozens of people involved in the organizing teams.I was a member of the Armenian National Students' Association, where I have been in the Scientific Committee.The desire to continue my education at the University of Cambridge was further strengthened by studying its infrastructure and lecturers’ work. Particularly, I would like to work with Dr Antje du Bois-Pedain, lecturer on Criminal Law. I have read several scientific articles written by her and found out that we share points of view in almost all crucial issues. I think it would be fruitful to carry out research with her.Firstly, being interested in human rights and criminal law, I am going to work as a prosecutor after my Master’s degree program. I am convinced that this course will give me certain skills, which will be prop in future prosecutorial activities. As far as the work as a prosecutor is concerned, for me it is a means to fight against crime. During my internships, I have encountered many professional difficulties and, by overcoming them, I became more inspired to contribute to fair and equitable criminal justice, as well as efficient protection of citizens against crime. Secondly, it is important to state that I have accepted the position of the president of the NGO “Justice and the Rule of Law”, within the framework of which we have tried to contribute to the establishment of a competent civil society, by informing people about their rights through various events (seminars, conferences, trainings, legal advice). Human rights protection has a primary role within the framework of my career, and the NGO is an effective tool for its implementation. After gaining my Master's degree, I am going to enlarge the activity spectrum of the NGO I lead, by further expanding the circle of people whose rights our organization tries to protect.Thirdly, I am aiming at transferring my knowledge and skills to students, by mean of lecturing in the domain of law at different HEIs. I am planning to design a course on criminal law, human rights and lecture it in Armenian universities. In my country there is a huge demand of scholars of criminal law and human rights; therefore, I believe that the selected course will be the right pathway for me to develop the study field of the discipline I am concerned with. For me it is momentous to work as a practitioner and a lecturer at the same time, as I consider it important to exchange knowledge between generations.Unfortunately, studying in Cambridge is very expensive. The cost for the full Master's degree is 40,000 Pounds sterling (53,000 US dollars). With scholarships and family support, I am able to pay only 43,000 US dollars. Thus, this fundraising is aimed at collecting the remaining 10,000 US dollars (7,600 Pound sterling). I only need to meet financial condition.Now, educational fundraising can be the only means by which I can continue my education at the University of Cambridge.EDUCATION 2018-present:           Paris 1
