title: Help Herb - U.S. Citizenship Application Fund
summary:
If you have ever offered to help Herb with his citizenship filing fees, or wondered why this U.S. Marine Veteran is not a naturalized citizen, and wished you could help make that happen, now is the time to do it.  Unfortunately it is not as simple for Herb as filling out the application and sending it in, and he has to retain an immigration specialist to ensure his smooth acceptance as a U.S. Citizen.  This is currently in the works, so funds are needed as of beginning this campaign (July, 2019), and this page will be updated regularly with progress. All funds received will go directly to practical expenses associated with attaining citizenship such as application fees, document retrieval, background checks, professional fees, and visa renewal fees (if needed). 

If you need not know more, please support his citizenship efforts below.  From our hearts to yours, we bow deeply in Gratitude. 

If you would like to learn more about Herbe and his life, following is somewhat of an outline ...____

Herb moved to Southern California from his homeland on the Isle of Carmen, Campeche, in the Yucatan peninsula (Gulf of Mexico) with his mother and sister in 1990.   After serving in the Marine Corps. for 5 years, he began to explore a different path of service and self-healing, studying sustainable agriculture, irrigation, community gardens, nutrition, fitness, massage, and other holistic therapies. 

He volunteered extensively throughout San Diego County in a variety of areas of need; for example, to implement gardens in schools and other community areas; in equine therapy for victims of domestic violence; installing solar panels for low-income families; and guiding youth in Tai Chi and meditation practices.  He has also volunteered on permaculture projects in the Dominican Republic and Costa Rica. 

These days, he is a regular installation at his local monastery's Day of Mindfulness, and can be found on the meditation cushion, during mindfulness walk, or having lunch contemplatively with the lay and ordained Sangha, the latter of which he affectionately refers to as "Dharma Jedi's." 

Herb volunteers with and serves as a board member for Veteran's for Peace, and is working to increase membership diversity for the San Diego chapter. 

He also volunteers and serves on the board of the Peace Resource Center in San Diego.  Due to Herb's efforts, the PRC recently pledged to "go vegan" at all of their events.  

In line with his passions for animal rights advocacy and the geopolitical sphere, Herb serves as the Vice President of the Vegan Democrats of North County San Diego Vegans.  He participates widely in protests and marches throughout the county. 

Of course, no description of Herb's life would be complete if it did not include Gaia, his tiny Chihuahua companion of 12 years. Though she weighs in at a mere 3 lbs., she has a huge personality needed to guide Herb on his path.

title: Help Ryan Get to The DNC Convention
summary: My name is Ryan Turner and I was recently elected by the DPCA (Democrats Abroad) to be a Pledged Delegate at the DNC Convention in Philadelphia for U.S. Senator Bernie Sanders.It is an honor to be elected, and myself, along with 12 other elected delegates will proportionally represent the Global Presidential Primary results. Our delegation is comprised of 4 delegates that will represent Secretary Hillary Clinton and 9 delegates that will Represent Bernie Sanders. I'm very excited to be part of such an exceptional delegation and I'm extremely confident that we will make waves at the convention by ultimately representing the varied and important interests of American citizens living abroad. There is a lot at stake in every presidential election but arguably much more at stake in this election. We find ourselves fighting against the most extreme perversions of xenophobia, racism and misogyny in our country, As democrats we will need my presence in the convention to make sure that everything is done to make sure that we promote policies and ideas that will ensure that darkness does not prevail in our country. We are an extremely intelligent, diverse and activist delegation and I'm sure that our presence will be felt.Unfortunately the Democratic National Committee has limited funds to help delegates like myself get to the convention. I am responsible for paying my way to Philadelphia and the costs of airfare, hotel, transportation and food will prove difficult without help. As a (currently) unemployed adjunct professor supporting a family, my economic means are limited and I am calling on YOU to help make my dream come true so that our delegation can make waves at the convention.If Bernie Sanders has taught us anything through his campaign it's that EVERYONE can make difference. Every little bit helps and even through small contributions we can provoke change. I'm calling on you to help me pay the way. Anything helps, even if it's only a couple of bucks. Please open your hearts, your minds and your proverbial pocket books to help me make a difference in Philadelphia this year. WE CAN make a difference and we will!-Ryan TurnerPledged Delegate to U.S. Senator Bernie Sanders and President of Democrats Abroad Madrid.Congratulations to Ryan Turner

title: Help Jessica go to the CA Democratic Convention
summary: Hello friends! I consider myself extremely fortunate to have a chance to go to the California Democratic Convention in Long Beach, CA from 11/15-11/17 as a proxy! As many of you may remember, I had the opportunity of attending the California Democratic Convention in May. I feel profoundly lucky that I was able to attend and it is truly one of the best things I’ve experienced to date. While there, I represented Silicon Valley DSA on a panel for the Green New Deal at the CYD Environmental Caucus, and was elected to be the Bay Area regional director for that caucus soon after that!I was able to meet Bernie freakin' Sanders and listen to him and many other presidential candidates speak! I was also able to network, which has already helped my life and career in immeasurable ways. Since then, I have been quite busy- I was asked to be the deputy regional director for the California Young Dems, have been elected to be the chair of the environmental committee of SVYD, and have even helped work on local campaigns. This is truly my passion and I see myself doing this for a long time (or until we save the planet - whichever comes first!). I have the unique opportunity to represent my community as an Eco-Socialist and also a Young Dem, and I'm extremely honored to be given that chance. This season’s CADEM will be even more special, as I will be able to cast a vote (as a proxy) on who the California Democrats should endorse for President (!) and get to learn so much more about the Democratic party. However, the CADEM convention in May was in SF and so it was a lot easier for me to pay for the expenses associated with that trip. This time around, it's going to be a little tougher to pull off because it will be in Long Beach. The only thing standing between this myself and this incredible experience is cost.So here's the catch! I need help with the costs. Could you help me with that?$1, $5 or even $20! It may not seem like a lot but any little bit helps! I will need to pay for room & board, gas & parking (or a flight & then taxis!), food for 3 days, plus any expenses or fees that may come up while I’m there! Thank you so much for taking the time to read this and considering to help support me to go the CADEM Convention! I am forever grateful!

title: London's Road to Leadership
summary: This campaign has been created to help support the tuition for the participation of London Lamar in the NOBEL Women Leadership Training and Educational Development Institute.London Lamar is the President of the Tennessee Young Democrats, the premier Democratic organization for young voters in Tennessee focusing on getting the youth active in civic engagement and the political process. London received her Bachelor of Arts degree in Political Science with double minors in Sociology and Intercultural Studies from Saint Mary's College and is currently working on her Master Degree in Public Administration at the University of Memphis. London is the Memphis Organizer at Stand for Children Tennessee and works to ensure all students have access or prepared for college through parental and community advocacy and engagement.As an independent political and non-profit consultant, she not only consults to ensure that progressive political candidates have the advice, resources, and strategies needed to run efficient and effective campaigns; but also, advocates and lobbies for progressive issues and policies that benefit Memphis and the State of Tennessee. As a strong advocate for youth civic engagement, London also sits as the Director of Programs for the Tennessee Federation of College Democrats, Vice-President of University of Memphis College Democrats, and Executive Committee Member of the Shelby County Democratic Party.  London ran her first campaign for the Tennessee Democratic Party State Executive Committeewoman District 33 and was the youngest candidate on the largest ballot in Shelby County history. She was recently recognized as Memphis Flyer's Top 20 under 30 Class of 2015.

title: Alexander C. Gonzalez's DNC Trip
summary: Good day!My name is Alexander C. Gonzalez and I am a 25 year old veteran of the U.S. Navy, American citizen studying abroad, and a proud supporter of Bernie Sanders. I recently was elected one of nine pledged delegates of Democrats Abroad that will go to the Democratic National Convention in Philadelphia, PA.I am starting this GoFundMe page to raise money for my flight and hotel. Tickets on cheapoair.com are ranging right around $300-$600 and I am definitely seeking a bargain for the lowest deal. I'm low maintenance so I may just stay a hostel or a super cheap hotel in a safe part of the city. I have a set goal date of a month so that I may hopefully catch a great deal.Any leftover contributions will be given to our desired candidate, Bernie Sanders or Democrats Abroad depending on the circumstances.I hope you support me in fighting for the candidate that represents true American values and freedoms for all. Just as I fought hard to protect this nation, I will be on the frontlines at the convention to garner support and push to propel Bernie straight up and into the White House. This is the democratic revolution we have been waiting for and as I continue to campaign for him in California and all over the globe, I hope you will too and stand with me as we work together in true party unity! Thank you very much!!!FEEL THE BERN!!!

title: Rob Corr LE 2019
summary: My name is Rob Corr and I am to run for a council seat with Social Democrats in Laytown / Bettystown Ward.The Social Democrats have selected me to challenge for a seat to represent the people of Laytown area on Meath County/City Council at next May's local elections.To run a successful election campaign candidates will need to have some funding.Donations: A “donation” means any contribution given for political purposes by any person to a candidate at a local election or a political party in connection with a local election which is accepted in whole or in part by or on behalf of a candidate.I would be delighted to get donations of any size €1 - €100.But If you cant donate but would like to asst my campaign in any way just drop me a line  www.socialdemocrats.ie - I have many things to be done during the election, and any help I can get will be gratefully received. About Me:Rob Corr is from North Dublin original but has been living in East Meath area since 2002; Rob has been working in the area of Special Needs for over 15 years. I have been a professional advocate for people with a disability all this time. I helped develop sports programs and community links all across North Dublin that allowed my clients be part of same clubs and teams as those without a disability.Rob Corr said:“I’m thrilled to be given the opportunity to run for a council seat on behalf of the Social Democrats. I firmly believe that we can deliver real improvements in people’s lives through grass roots activism, compassion and bold leadership.  “Local democracy is at its strongest when people work with others to improve our daily lives and our environment in ways big and small. I certainly will be keen to do what I can to work with others to help make a difference in sports, special needs advocacy and youth engagement” Rob Corr added:“I’m really pleased to be standing for Meath council with the Social Democrats. We are a young and fast-growing party that stands for honest politics, a strong economy and a fair society.  “Our leaders have a reputation for hard work and a focus on sustainable policies that are about ensuring that everyone has a fair go and gets the supports they need to reach their potential. We plan to offer voters in every local authority in the country a chance to vote for our vision of change at next May’s council elections.” For more information, see www.socialdemocrats.ie

title: Will & Jeremy's Spring 2019 DC Lobby Trip
summary: ​NH Peace Action needs your help to send a delegation to DC to talk about peace and justice issues with our elected representatives!  All of NH's reps are democrats who we feel we can build relationships with.  This is our opportunity to make real progress on the issues that matter to us and the world! Help Will Hopkins and Jeremy Love head to Washington to take part in the annual Peace Action Affiliates Meeting, where organizers from around the country will discuss important legislation and campaign objectives for coordinated efforts to build peace around the country. After two days of intensive training and discussion, Will and Jeremy will head to Capitol Hill to discuss with our New Hampshire legislators how we intend to build a more peaceful world, and how we expect them to vote and act on behalf of their constituents. Will and Jeremy will be discussing the push for a peace treaty with North Korea, the importance of getting the US back into the Iran Nuclear Agreement, ending US support for the Saudi-led offensive and blockade in Yemen, cutting wasteful pentagon spending to support human needs, the increasing danger posed by nuclear weapons and proliferation, and more.Click the link below for more information about New Hampshire Peace Action Education Fund: Education to build a culture of peace and seek effective alternatives to military actions.http://nhpeaceaction.org/Will Hopkins is a lifelong New Hampshire resident who served for six years in the New Hampshire National Guard, he was decorated for valor during a year-long tour in Iraq as an Infantryman, including the fall 2004 Fallujah offensive.  Hopkins also served in New Orleans after Hurricane Katrina.  He was honorably discharged upon completion of his six year term in the National Guard.  Hopkins has a Bachelor’s degree in Anthropology and Sociology, and a Master’s degree in business administration with a certificate of advanced graduate studies in strategic marketing management from Plymouth State University.  He has served as a national member of the board of directors of Veterans For Peace, as well as the board of NH Peace Action Education Fund before taking over as executive director in September 2009, he is also a member of Iraq Veterans Against the War and attends Quaker meeting.Jeremy Love received his BA in Political Science from UNH and is now a master’s candidate at Antioch University in the environmental studies program. He is currently working on his capstone – a project to confront American exceptionalism. During the summer of 2018 he helped to co-found the NH Coalition for Indigenous Peoples’ Day, and helped organize the NH Poor People’s Campaign 40 days of protest.

title: Cheryl Rosen - Save My Car! Health & Finance Fund
summary: I’m desperate and alone. I have no family to turn to. A few friends have helped (but not many).  And now, I don’t know what to do.I am a good person, a loving, caring person who has unselfishly made sacrifices for others throughout my life and never asked or expected anything in return. But, now I need help.If you can muster up the goodness in your heart and a few extra dollars, please help me. I would help you if I could.My story has been featured on an episode of ‘SOAPBOX’ on WCAC-TV in Worcester.  You can see the entire show here.  https://archive.org/details/SOAPBOX1209. WHO I AMMy name is Cheryl Rosen. And I am as Worcester, Massachusetts, as it gets. I’m a proud graduate of Doherty High School and Clark University, am active in the local Jewish community and attend many political events and functions.I am a self-employed photographer/graphic designer. I have been an active member of the Hudson Rotary Club and others in Central Massachusetts for more than 20 years and a past president of Gift of Life New England, an organization which provides lifesaving surgeries to children around the world with congenital heart defects.A MEDICAL MISDIAGNOSIS, BEING STALKED BY A NEIGHBOR, MOM DIEDThe last few years I have gone through a lot - the loss of my mother, the stress of being stalked by a neighbor, deteriorating health and, subsequently, a loss of wages.Health wise, I am falling apart. I’m in desperate need of root canals, crowns and implants as a result of my stalker. I have already had infections in my teeth twice. And insurance won’t pay for any of this.The uncorrected dental problem specifically affects one of my health issues, Trigeminal Neuralgia, in which an artery is pressing against a nerve in the base of my skull sending stabbing pain through the upper and lower jaw on both sides of my mouth and into my ear.To make matters worse, I was misdiagnosed with multiple sclerosis. This year, I was finally diagnosed with reactivated Epstein Barr Virus and Cytomegalovirus, along with Hypogammaglobulinemia (CVID), a rare immune deficiency, requiring weekly blood product infusions for the rest of my life. Many of my medications and supplemental treatments are also not covered by insurance.What I am going through I wouldn’t wish on my worst enemy. Then again, I have never had a feeling of ill-will to others. It’s not in my nature.  WHY DO I NEED YOUR HELP?First and foremost, I need to get better. I need my independence back. And the only way I can get better and be independent is to have my car.If I don’t come up with $5,000 by the end of the month (September), I lose my car and become a shut-in, deteriorating in health every day.A car is crucial to have because I am in and out of visits with counselors, physical therapists, neurologists, chiropractor, immunologist, sleep neurologist, vision & hearing specialists, endocrinologists, labs for monthly bloodwork, infusion treatments, orthopedic surgeons, urologist, rheumatologist, primary care physician, and dentists, so often, that rarely a day goes by that I don’t have some kind of medical appointment, and some of the appointments are as far as Northampton and Boston.I have a personal care attendant but insurance won’t allow her to drive me to appointments. Paratransit is not reliable timewise (oftentimes, if you’re late 5-10 minutes, your appointment is canceled, no matter how far you traveled) and, even if they were reliable, they are not able to combine two to three appointments in any given day, which is often the case.I need a car so I can continue my quality of life.PLEASE HELP MEI know everyone has bad luck. I know everyone hits hard times. But I have run out of options and people to turn to. That is why I am turning to you. Any donation, small and large will help. Please share this with everyone you know. If you want to hear more details about my plight (and there are plenty of details that I am willing to share), don’t hesitate to contact me directly at cherylrosen.gofundme@gmail.com.My story has been featured on an episode of ‘SOAPBOX’ on WCAC-TV in Worcester.  You can see the entire show here.  https://archive.org/details/SOAPBOX1209. Love and God blessCheryl#WorcesterMA #ClarkUniversity #medical #DMHS #DohertyHigh #WCACTV194  #dentalhealth #idf #adobecreativecloud #rarediseases #photography #promoproducts #rotaryinternational #rotary #nord #healthycommunities #stalking #graphicdesigners #judaism #democrats #worcester #giftoflife #domesticviolence #massachusetts #volunteering

title: Send Matt to the DNC in Philly
summary: In May 2016, I was elected as a delegate to the Democratic National Convention in Philadelphia as a pledged Hillary Clinton delegate representing the 4th Congressional District.  This is a tremendous honor as a lifelong North Carolinian.Elected delegates are responsible for funding the trip by themselves, and the costs include that of hotel accomadations, travel, transportation, both to and within Philadelphia, and food. One of the first campaigns that I volunteered for was Hillary Clinton’s 2008 presidential campaign. The excitement I felt carried me to being a very involved Democrat and work hard for those who share Democratic values. Now, I’m excited once again for the candidacy of Hillary Clinton to become our next President, and I’ve never been prouder to say, “I’m with her" because she's with us.In addition to being elected as a National Convention Delegate, I currently serve as the Orange County Democratic Party's chair.I appreciate your support!

title: DNC Convention Lodging
summary: Danielle Simms and Morgan Jameson have been elected as delegates to the 2016 DNC Convention in Philadelphia.They are both members of the Virginia Young Democrats and serve as the liaisons to the Young Democrats of America in their roles as National Committeewoman and National Committeeman.They both have served Young Democrats at the local, state, and national level. They are 2 of the youngest delegates in Virginia attending the DNC Convention.Danielle studied environmental science, and has volunteered weekly on the Hillary Clinton campaign planning precinct ops on Primary Day and traveling to other states for GOTV.  Morgan works for a non profit and was an early backer of the campaign, he notarized a vast number of petition signatures so that Secretary Clinton would qualify for the ballot in Virginia.The hotel the Virginia delegation will stay in costs an outstanding $500 per night.  That comes out to a total of $3,000 for the entire convention - in lodging alone!  Danielle and Morgan have opted to share a room in order to be as budget friendly and cost efficient as possible.  Please help offset their costs by making a contribution today.  Between the costs of living in the DC metro area, and their student loan payments, every penny contributed will be of great assistance and will be more than appreciated.

title: Diana Madoshi to DNC/PA Convention
summary: Hello Friends!A very deserving Placer County, California Democrat, Diana Madoshi, is needing to fund her trip to the Democratic Party National Convention in Philadelphia, PA this July. Diana is chronologically gifted and on a fixed income.  Any and all donations will help reduce her travel expenses . We love Miss Diana and are so honored to have her represent us as a Hillary Clinton delegate at the National Convention. Not having to worry about how she will pay to travel will be such a blessing. Any amount helps. Please help Diana by donating and spreading the word about this very deserving campaign.  ANY amount truly helps our efforts.Thank you and God Bless You!Olga Trevizo and Family

title: Help Nate Be Our Voice in Philly
summary: Nate has the honor of representing Wisconsin and our next President on the Platform committee in Philadelphia.  Nate is a committed pro-choice activist, has worked tirelessly to elect progressives up and down the ticket and his voice is so needed on the Platform Committee.  We are lucky to have him but the costs are very expensive.  Platform Committee members must also go to Orlando.  He has two 4 day trips to pay for and this account is to make sure that this great feminist can afford to go to Philly.  Help Nate make our voices heard as we decide what Democrats stand for.

title: Send Bernie Delegate to Philly!
summary: My name is Kari Mosleh and I am a Democrats Abroad Global-At Large Pledged Delegate representing Bernie Sanders at the 2016 Democratic National Convention in Philadelphia. I currently live in London as a first year PhD student studying chemistry at Imperial College. I am asking for your donations to help me cover airfare and accomodation for when I attend the convention July 24-July 29. I have been an organizer helping run LondonForBernie since January. This is an extremely active grassroots organization involved in getting out the vote abroad as well as back in the USA; we run phonebanking parties weekly. I need funding soon as tickets and accomodation are already very expensive! Being able to attend and participate in the 2016 DNConvention means the world to me since it is a chance to be a voice for Bernie Sanders supporters who live abroad. Please contribute if you can (only American citizens, abroad or living in the US can donate), and if you cannot, please share my gofundme page and follow my Kari Mosleh Democrats Abroad Bernie Delegate Facebook Page!You can follow  me on twitter @KAmosleh.Thank you so much! FeelTheBernPhoto: Democrat's Abroad Europe, Midde East, and Africa regional pledged delegates; Larry Sanders (Bernie's brother), me, and Ryan Turner (member from Spain) at the Democrat's Abroad Berlin Convention.

title: YDA National Convention
summary: Hi all, my name is Kimberly and I’m fundraising to help with the costs of attending Young Democrats of America National Convention in Indianapolis, Indiana from July 17-21. This will help to cover airfare, hotel, food and transportation for myself. Thank you all in advance for your support.

title: Send Eli to Philly
summary: Turning Texas Blue has been my primary political goal for over a decade. I believe that all Texans deserve the rights and dignity from this State and the Nation.  At the Texas Democratic Convention in San Antonio on June 17th, our Senatorial District 20 Delegates bestowed me the honor to represent our district as the Clinton Democratic National Delegate in Philadelphia on July 24th to support and help elect the most qualified candidate for President, Hillary Rodham Clinton. A position and responsibility I take very seriously and honorably.  As your Clinton National Delegate, I will be representing you, the people of South Texas confirming that we will turn Texas Blue and make history in electing the first woman as President of the United States.This convention is the most expensive convention in history so I am asking for your financial assistance. Funds raised will go through GoFundMe. As your Delegate I am also going as your State Democratic Executive Committee Man for District 20, a member of the 2016 Texas Leadership Council for Hillary Clinton, member of the National LGBTQ for Hillary Clinton, member of the Texas Hispanic Caucus, and President of Texas Stonewall Democratic Caucus. With your support, we can turn Texas Blue and elect more Democrats all the way to the White House.  Estamos con Ella.Thank you so much,Eli OlivarezTexas National Delegate 2016

title: College: A Dream Come True (Dreams Shouldn't Die)
summary: I'm a fellow student at Webster University in Saint Louis, Missouri, but my name is not what's important here - the only name that needs to be on your mind is Marcel Dalton. Marcel, recently 19, is a Freshman at Webster University. He is double majoring, right now, aiming for a Bachelor of Arts in Art History and International Human Rights. After Marcel completes his journey at Webster, his goal is to continue onto law school to work in the field of immigration law. The problem is: Marcel may not even be able to continue onto his second semester, here at Webster. Marcel is not from the Saint Louis area and doesn't have any family members around. Because of this, he doesn't have the ability to limit many expenses by commuting and has to rely on Webster's Campus Housing. Marcel grew up in Southern Missouri, a transgender child struggling with mental health issues, living in poverty. He lived with his disabled mother, who couldn't get approved for government disability aid and was unable to hold down a job.  Growing up, and continuing into his young adult life, he dealt with many different addicted, absuive, disabled, and neglectful parental figures - leading to difficult and strained relationships with them all. Even if any of them had the ability to help Marcel in his journey to attend college, they wouldn't have bothered. Even with the help of the FAFSA/Government Aid, the income from his on-campus job, and Webster's Scholarships and Financial Assistance (from getting a 3.83 GPA in high school and a 30 on the ACT) - Marcel is still at risk of not being able to attend Webster next semester. On top of the expenses of attending university, Marcel has to pay nearly $50 a month for medical perscriptions, as well as extra expenses relating to his gender transition. Marcel loves being at Webster. He made a great and supportive group of friends that he feels may follow him throughout his life. The childhood he grew up in conditioned him to think that he'd never come across that kind of unconditional love and support, but now he feels he has finally found it. The last thing he needs is for that to be ripped away from him. Even as a first generation college student, he is determined to give his best efforts in it all. Marcel is heavily involved in campus activities, on top of working and taking classes, including: The Residential Housing Association (RHA), Literature Club, History Politics and International Relations (HPIR), The Philosophy Coalition, Webster Democrats, and Webster's LGBT+ Alliance. Despite being a freshman, he is serving in several leadership positions in these groups. He is the Secretary of HPIR, the Chairman of the Advocacy Committee in RHA, and the Vice President of the LGBT+ Alliance. Despite facing several hardships throughout his childhood, and his high school career, he fought hard and earned himself a place at a fantastic, private university. After all that fighting, Marcel is at risk of losing his chance to attend Webster just after the first semester.  When people say attending college is a privilege, they're right. But the problem with that is: not everyone who earned and deserves that privilege is able to. Marcel earned that privilege after years of hard work. His one dream he had as a kid was to grow up, move out, and get to college. He wanted to be the first in his family to make a difference.Please help US help MARCEL achieve his dream. Every penny and every share/reblog counts! Thank you.

title: SFV Progressives for AD46 Delegates
summary: The Democratic Party’s elected Delegates represent the opportunity to fight against special interests, party insiders, and establishment politicians — but only if we elect truly progressive Delegates. Together, the San Fernando Valley Progressives are running to ensure that real, bold progressive voices hold our statewide elected officials accountable to the People.HOLD UP: WHAT EVEN ARE Y'ALL RUNNING FOR?Watch this short video for a great explanation of what Assembly District Delegates are:WHO WE AREWe are a coalition of 14 dedicated progressive activists with diverse backgrounds, endorsed by leading progressive groups such as Our Revolution, Democratic Socialists of America, and Americans for Democratic Action.CLICK HERE to connect with us on Facebook .CLICK HERE to read our full Candidate Statements, and check out our introductory profiles below:WHAT WE'RE ASKINGYou can donate any amount, but we are asking that you consider donating just $5.00. That's Go-Fund-Me's minimum donation. We are less interested in big money than big engagement, and we hope you’ll agree that getting corporate money out of politics should be a primary focus of the national Democratic platform headed into 2020, and that starts here in California.HOW WE'LL SPEND ITAssembly District Delegate is not a paid position. We are all volunteers. In fact, in addition to any campaign expenses, we will be expected to incur estimated costs of up to $2,000 each in travel and lodging for the annual State Democratic Convention.We will spend any funds we raise on:(1) Printing Costs(2) Targeted Facebook Ads(3) Signage, Name Tags, Coffee & Donuts at the election meeting itselfAny additional funds raised will subsidize the costs of our travel and lodging for the 2019 State Convention in San Francisco.ELECTION DETAILSThe Assembly District Election Meeting in AD-46 will be held on Sunday, January 27th, at the State Building Auditorium, 6150 Van Nuys Blvd., 91401. You must vote in person between 10:45am and 12:45pm.CLICK HERE for a Google Map of the district and the election location. (You can also CLICK HERE to quickly look up what Assembly District you live in by your address.)This election is open to all registered Democrats in AD-46. If you aren't registered or are registered with another party or as No Party Preference, you can register as a Democrat at the event.Here's the full schedule: 10:00 AMDoors Open 10:15 AMSpeeches Begin 10:45 AMRegistration Starts 12:45 PMRegistration EndsCLICK HERE to view this event on Facebook. There will be FREE coffee and donuts, and you are allowed to skip the speeches. As long as you're there between 10:45 and 12:45, you'll be able to vote!Be sure to vote for all 14 of us, and to vote for Clifford Tasner for both Delegate and Executive Board!OUR SLATE CARD

title: Shelby's Democratic Convention Fund
summary: Greetings friends! I am fundraising for my trip the 2016 Democratic National Convention as a National Delegate for Hillary Clinton! I am beyond proud and ecstatic to be able to participate in this experience for my fellow Wyoming Democratic Hillary supporters.Some of you may know that I work at a Jackson-based non-profit, and that my wife Rosie and I have a combined student loan debt of over $ 200,000. We paid for both our under grad, and grad studies ourselves.....hence the ungodly sums we owe for our education. Rosie is an immigration attorney, working primarily for low-income folks in and around Jackson. The truth is, if I don't raise these funds, it will be difficult for me to attend the convention.All money raised in this campaign will be used exclusively for travel, food, the hotel, and to cover any other nominal expenses that may arise for the purpose of attending the 2016 DNC! I need to raise the money within the next month in order to secure my plane tickets and accommodations. The convention is the last week of July.I will represent what is important to Wyoming Democrats and also offer a unique perspective as a black, female, LGBT, youth from this amazing state. Attending this convention is a once in a lifetime opportunity and I cannot let this chance to attend pass me by! Any and all support is greatly appreciated! I hope to blog my experiences leading up to and while at the convention....stay tuned!Thank you for all of your encouragement, love, and support!⭐️Shelby

title: SC radio host Anne Eller to RNC
summary: WCRS in Greenwood, South Carolina is going to broadcast live from the RNC in Cleveland, OH in July. This convention promises to be as exciting and controversial as any in recent history. At 1450am and with the addition of our FM component at 98.5, our coverage is much broader and more clear. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ROpcDIUBYD4Anne Eller and her assistant Emerald Williams will be embedded with the South Carolina Delegation giving her a unique inside view. Our listeners will get to hear what is really going on through her savvy and questioning interviews. You can tune into WCRS for the “meat” when it comes to politics, as you can always count on Anne to ask the hard questions and not let our politicians “off the hook.” Her colorful, insightful observations give you more info than most TV interviews. By being embedded with the SC delegation, she will have unlimited access to delegates, our politicians, and even Gov Haley.Poltical Involvement:Recently we went to Washington DC for the FAIR Immigration Radio Row and interviewed guests like radio host, author, and FOX News contributor Kevin Jackson , Congressman Jeff Duncan , Ranchers Ladds  and Davis's , Border Patrol Agent Chris Cabrera and so many more!I've interviewed Senator Lindsey Graham, Senator Tim Scott, Congressman Trey Gowdy, Congressman Jim Clyburn, Gov Nikki Haley, Senator Floyd Nicholson, Rep. Mike Pitts and more! In 2012, I went to the RNC in Tampa and the DNC in Charlotte.  I would love to be able to go to the RNC this year too.We are asking for your help to sponsor our team to Cleveland. Your sponsorship will help to defer our costs; Anne will be your voice in Cleveland getting the answers to your questions from the politicians. Please help us keep SC and Greenwood informed as only I, Anne Eller, and my team can do. With my assistant Emerald, we will keep you continuously updated through Facebook(https://www.facebook.com/wcrs.amradio) and Twitter (https://twitter.com/WCRSRadio)Why should you support this station? WCRS is a community, grassroots radio station that is celebrating its 75th anniversary this year. A well-known station throughout South Carolina, it has kept its community focus and has also shined a light on the important issues of the First Amendment. Anne has constantly upheld the values of Freedom of the Press through the interviews and guests she has on her shows. It matters not, Republican, Democrat, or Independent; all are welcomed and valued on Anne’s shows. After all, WCRS stands for “World to Community Radio Stations.” As an independently, woman-owned radio station, WCRS has a unique voice among all the chatter. So, now that we have your attention, tune in and give your support to WCRS. Tune in locally in Greenwood County, SC at 1450AM & 98.5FM and worldwide through our website www.wcrs1450am.net and our free downloadable app “wcrs 1450am radio.”We thank you for your consideration in covering this historically significant event and look forward to answering any questions you may have.

title: Emilie Mitcham Bernie Delegate DNC
summary: EMILIE MITCHAM, CREDENTIALS COMMITTEEEmilie Mitcham has been a Bernie activist since the first day she found out he was running for the nomination. She didn't know every detail of his position on every issue, but she knew him to be a man of integrity, and a man who was not afraid to speak truth to power. The more she learned about him, the deeper and deeper her commitment grew.She is a forty-seven year old, mother of four boys and because of Bernie's presidential run, has finally joined a political party for the first time in her life.Prior to Bernie's run, she voted as an Independent, mostly aligning herself with the Democrats. Her parents are Democrats, and it would have been natural for her to register as a Democrat, but she could never bring herself to do so until Bernie Sanders declared his candidacy as a Democrat.To her, it has always felt as if the Democrats were slowly but surely giving their voices over to the corporations, and conceding their power to the forces on the right, to the war industry, and to corporate interests. Without Bernie's candidacy and his advocacy for a real change and a democracy that is "for the people, by the people and of the people" she felt she could not distinguish the differences between the Democrats and the Republicans, and she was wary of what looked like a system that was not really running in the interests of the people but was instead, running primarily for the best interests of profit for industry and power for a small group of elite.With Bernie Sanders, she believes American citizens have a chance to put a person of integrity in the White House who understands the real frustrations of a country governed by special interest groups, the war industry, big money, and the buddy system.Emilie will fight for Bernie's nomination at the National Convention as hard as she has fought for his nomination here in Colorado. She has been a "boots on the ground" volunteer since day one, engaged in everything from canvassing to event planning, to marches.She was elected as a National Credentials Committee member and is working hard to learn her role in this job. She was on the Colorado State Credentials Committee and also the Jefferson County Credentials Committee.Emilie is a paralegal, a painter, and a writer. You can read some of her writing on www.elephantjournal.com and also on Medium. You can see her paintings on www.emiliemitcham.com. She works for a small family firm in Wheat Ridge called Affinity Fundraising Registration. Affinity helps non-profit companies register with the states, so that they can fundraise legally in those states.She welcomes contact with the people from CD 7 who elected her, and with other engaged Bernie supporters. You can reach her via Facebook, and if you would like to become more involved in helping get Bernie elected but aren't sure how to help, feel free to reach out to her on Facebook.

title: Martin Quigley Documentary
summary: Funding Needed to Complete St. Louis Film‘The Whole Damn Crew: The Martin Quigley Story’ Martin Peter Quigley’s work touched first Kansas City, then New York, and finally his beloved St. Louis, and to some extent, America and the world, but whether he was diving out of a flaming B-24 bomber, helping the Ford Foundation raise funds, running a charity to help poor St. Louis kids get new shoes, mentoring young up-and-coming St. Louis writers, or promoting the St. Louis Cardinals, Martin, who died in 2000, was also the author of nine books -- including Joe Garagiola’s first memoir, “Baseball is a Funny Game ,” -- a poet, playwright, journalist, pr guy, patron of the arts and a St. Louis treasure.  “Quig,” as he was known, also was the first manager of St. Louis’ own KETC public television station in 1954. A civic leader, he promoted the City of St. Louis and served on several civic boards. He was a leader in making the St. Louis Bicentennial celebration in 1964 a huge success, and was the author of a history, “St. Louis: A Fond Look Back” that year. Around the same time, he co-wrote the book for the musical, “Molly Darling,” the only locally written musical ever staged at The Muny. He was a supporter and frequent visitor to the old Gaslight Square, and he wrote the book for another musical, “The Raspberry Queen,” which was staged at the old Crystal Palace cabaret. An avid softball player, Quig created several teams in the area. A locally produced documentary on his life is under way, sponsored by the Press Club of Metropolitan St. Louis. He was a co-founder and the organization’s first president in 1954. The script is complete and will be narrated by the popular Ron Elz, of KMOX radio and Johnny Rabbitt fame, and directed by the talented St. Louis-based filmmaker Eric Butler. The film is being produced by Quig’s daughter, Catherine (Katy) Gurley, a local journalist and former St. Louis Globe-Democrat reporter, who wrote the script. No one is being paid for working on this film. It is a true labor of love for a man who gave much to the St. Louis he cherished and grew up in. The Press Club helped fund the film initially, but Ms. Gurley is seeking $3,500 more to pay for copyright permissions for jazz music to be woven through the film. Quig was a jazz lover and historian, and authentic music will be an integral part of the film. Contributors of any amount will be listed in a poster about the film at its opening in September and will be invited to attend the opening night and reception free of charge. Contributors of $50 or more will receive a DVD of the film. If you’re a long-time St. Louisan, Quig touched your life in ways you might not realize with his many contributions to all things civic in St. Louis between the 1950s to the 1980s. Please donate today!Thank you!

title: Tracey Smith for Ballina Local Elections
summary: I am contesting the Ballina Local Elections as the Mayo Candidate for the Social Democrats.After being involved in the successful campaign to repeal the eighth amendment last year I feel the time has come for a progressive youthful voice and council representative.I am a mum of five who faces the same struggles as many of us, affordable childcare, accessible healthcare, amenities for our young people...these are just some of the issues I am hoping to tackle if elected.Ballina is made up of many young families and I would be proud to stand as their local representative.Read more

title: Healing Trip for Bob Myers' Family
summary: You wake up from most nightmares, and they're quickly over. For Cathy Craig-Myers and her family, they are living a nightmare from which they can never awaken.While an investigation is underway, and some details reported through the news media and other sources appear inconsistent, this much is certain: On the morning of Friday, February 17th, Robert "Bob" Myers reported to a professional building connected with Tallahassee Memorial HealthCare (TMH) to conduct maintenance on an elevator.  Hours later, his lifeless body was recovered in an elevator shaft by firefighters who had to rappel from upper floors to gain access. Here's just one article from the Tallahassee Democrat. In an instant, Cathy lost her husband of 38 years and received a phone call that no one should ever receive.We cannot imagine the horror of receiving such a call, much less living day in and day out with such traumatic loss.This is a family that is still grieving the recent loss of another family member. Our hearts are breaking for Cathy and her family.Because Cathy has been such a friend to The Children's Campaign and Voices for Florida, and a tremendous advocate for children and families, we have started this fundraiser to help ease the grief Cathy and her extended family are suffering. Our wish is that when they are ready, they can take a trip that hopefully will be an important part of their healing journey. Please know that 100% of the proceeds from this fundraiser (minus the amount GoFundMe takes) will benefit Cathy and her family. Funds are being collected by GoFundMe, and Cathy will have direct access to them.Thank you for helping us help Cathy during this very difficult time. Any amount that you can donate will be very much appreciated.

title: CNMI 4 Bernie at Philadelphia
summary: My name is Stephen Woodruff, and I am a Bernie Sanders delegate to the Democratic National Convention in Philadelphia in July from the Northern Mariana Islands (NMI ).  I am the authorized representative for Bernie in the NMI and lead the Bernie component of the NMI delegation.NMI Democrats caucused on Saturday, March 12, 2016, with sites on Rota, Tinian, and Saipan -- the three main populated islands.  Bernie won on Saipan -- the most populous island -- in a close contest that would have yeilded a 3-3 delegate split for NMI pledged delegates.  The smaller islands went heavily for Hillary Clinton, however, resulting in a final delegate count of two for Sanders and four for Clinton.Prior to the Democratic Caucus in the NMI, I laid out my views in an article for the local papers urging participation in the caucus.  The NMI has two local dailies; my piece appeared in both the Marianas Variety  and the Saipan Tribune.The other Sanders delegate is Abby Gail Iderbei , and our alternate is Vincent Bidez .  Here is an article in the Marianas Variety  on the caucus.  Officially, the NMI is the Commonwealth of the Northern Mariana Islands, or CNMI .  Travel to Philadelphia for the Convention will be extraordinarily expensive for delegates from the CNMI.  The NMI is 7,825 miles (great circle) from Philadelphia, a very long trip (over 23 hours, at best).  Hotel accomodations may run as much as $3,500 per delegate for the duration of the Convention.  Ground transportation may add another $600.  Meals and incidentals will also be a substantial cost.  Finally, we need to budget for logistical support and costs to maximize the effectiveness of the NMI Sanders delegates.Although I am attorney, I am financially challenged at present.  I have practiced mostly public interest and human rights law over the past 20 years.  In the process, I have made enemies among the powerful, who in recent years have done everything possible to attack my livelihood.  Consequently, I am completely unable to self-finance my trip to Philadelphia.If possible, I will bring my three youngest children (ages 17, 12, and 11) with me to Philadelphia for the educational experience.  All three of them are extremely interested in the Presidential race this year, and Philadelphia, of course, is one of the nation's most historic cities.  Incidentally, I am a single parent for these youngsters.I need to raise at least some of the money in the next couple of weeks to purchase airline tickets and the rest (or as much of it as possible) by July 1.  Each NMI Bernie delegate is fundraising for their own expenses but I regard myself as having a special responsibilty for our group and our success at the convention,  I want to be sure to be prepared for any contigencies.  Funding raised through this page will be used not only to support me with Convention related expenses but also for logistical support under my direction and to help guarantee we all work effectively in Philadelphia.I don't need to tell you how important Bernie's political revolution is or how challenging our work will be in Philadelphia.  If you are reading this page, you already know.  I will be there to fight for the platform and everything else we can accomplish for the future of our nation and our children and life on this planet.  For now, I just want to express my sincere gratitute for whatever contribution you feel able to make.  I am always eager to hear the thoughts and concerns of supporters.  Here are some ways to find out more about me or communciate with me directly:Daily Kos:  scwlawReddit:  scwlawFacebook:  https://www.facebook.com/stephen.c.woodruff.3Website:  www.WoodruffLawOffice.com2014 Campaign Facebook page:  https://www.facebook.com/profile.php?id=100006318908851&fref=ts

title: Victoria Goes To London
summary: Hello everyone!! Victoria has been accepted to the Hollins University Abroad Program and will be traveling to and interning in LONDON this summer for seven weeks. Here is a little back groundVictoria is a second-year Horizon student majoring in English with an emphasis in Creative Writing and Multicultural Literature.  She has received a scholarship that will cover most of the comprehensive fees for this trip. It is our hope that you are willing to support her to cover the additional expenses. These fees included the remainder of the comprehensive fees, airfare, visa fees, food and personal expenses. We are anticipating approximately an additional $8,000. No adventure is complete without its nitty-gritty financesAttached here is the financial rundown from the Hollins' website.https://www.hollins.edu/academics/beyond-the-classroom/study-abroad/study-abroad-in-london/london-summer-internship-program "THE INTERNSHIP These are just a few of the organizations previous students have worked with during their London Summer Internships. Members of Parliament, Dulwich Hamlet Football Club, Marriott Hotels, Venture Business Research, Shorts International Film, Carlton Books, Cutting Edge Press, Tesco, Jane McAdam Freud, Travel Channel, National Portrait Gallery, British Museum, Westminster Archives, Perfect Storm Media, Prospect Capital, Liberal Democrats 2011, Germain Financial Associates, Imperial College, Theatro Technis, and National Youth Orchestra of Great Britain."Please feel free to peruse Explore the Possibilities (PDF) at the bottom of the Hollins website page.  The university website strives to keep it's viewers well informed!Victoria is in the process of working with the internship-partnership program and will be excited to share her work assignment with everyone as soon as she finds out.The  Hollins Travelers' experience The Hollins student's interning in London, including Victoria, have the opportunity for many learning experiences over the summer. While the website names some of these experiences, here are a few of the ones Victoria is most looking forward to:* "Contemporary Britain" class*  Traveling paths paved by centuries of writers*  Working along side creative professionals *  Four days in Scotland A note from mom Through many conversations over the past week, I have been reminded that my daughter is very humble and private. This form of fundraising is my idea. I want her to find delight where ever she can, and this part of her undergraduate experience is one that I need help with. If you are able to help, THANK YOU SO MUCH. If you are not financially able, please keep her in your prayers.  The past twenty-five years have shown both her and me that it does take a village to raise a child. I am forever grateful for my community. Love to you all.Keeping in touchVictoria looks forward to sharing her appreciation of you from London. Tips, Tricks, and advice on navigating the London streets always welcome :)

title: Be the Change Scholarship
summary:
WILL YOU HELP US? 

The cost of continuing education is an extreme concern for many families in our community and state. The "Be the Change" Scholarship is designed to help offset those costs. Students apply by filling out demographic information and answering two essay questions. 1. Tell us about yourself, your background, long and short term goals, and why this scholarship would be important to you. 2. If you had the authority to change your school and/or community in a positive way, what specific changes would you make? How would these changes be important in your community? Seniors from all educational backgrounds, that reside in Albany County (Wyoming),  are encouraged to apply! Every student that plans to further their education after high school will be considered and application reviewed by the selection committee.  You do not have to be committed to a four year university.  This year (2019) one scholarship in the amount $1,000 was awarded. This money was raised through an organized bake sale at Freedom Has a Birthday, a BINGO night at O'Dweyer's Public House, and MOST importantly- private donations from people like YOU!  In order to continue to this scholarship, we would love your help in raising money.  All funds raised go directly to the scholarship fund and our hope would be to 1. increase the monetary value of the scholarship and/or 2. offer a second scholarship based on funding raised each year (depending on how much is donated). 

This GoFundMe is the kickstarter to fundraising for the 2020 school year! If everyone that visits this site chips in a minimum of $10 we will be well on our way to seriously helping a student with their educational costs! Will you help? 

JOIN US!Join us on May 13, 2019 at 5:15pm (dinner) and 6pm (Central Committee Meeting) where we will award this year's recipient of the Albany County Democrats "Be the Change" Scholarship! We will do the award ceremony at the beginning of our Central Committee Meeting- all are welcome and encouraged to attend! 1402 East Gibbon Street, Laramie, Wyoming 

 

MORE INFORMATION: 

Members of the Scholarship Committee (2-year term) as of February 2019 include: Lindsay StoffersJackie GrimesAli GrossmanDenise Greller Bern Hinckley Randy WallIf you have any questions about the scholarship, or would like more information or like to obtain a copy, please email us at: BeTheChange.AlbanyCoDems@gmail.com“To the young people here, and the young people out there: do not ever let anyone ever make you feel like you don’t matter, or like you don’t have a place in our American story—because you do. And you have a right to be exactly who you are. But I also want to be very clear: this right isn’t just handed to you. No, this right has to be earned every single day. You cannot take your freedoms for granted.” – Michelle ObamaHere's to the change makers. Thank you so much for your donation! 

Sincerely, 

Lindsay N. StoffersCommittee Chair

title: Medical Fund to Help the Blind See
summary: This campaign is no longer active as Arman Soltani is running for Governor of California as a write in candidate. The goal is to raise money for a medical surgery that will implant  artificial eyes and restore partial vision by  connecting a camera to the brain so individuals with no eyesight will have a chance to see. Why is Arman Soltani running for Governor? Arman Soltani will listen to your needs and fight for your dreams. Governor Soltani will bring people together and will replace big money politics with hope and optimism. Arman Soltani lost most of his hearing and all his eye sight when he was two from cancer. Nothing stops Arman Soltani from achieving great things. Arman has strength, will power, and the ability to overcome difficult challenges. Governor Soltani will increase wages and create better jobs. Soltani will fight for lower smarter taxes. Arman will reduce costly state regulations Governor Soltani will help you access state guaranteed loan programs to buy homes, real estate, and businesses Together, we will develop the best private and public education system in the world. Arman Soltani will bring democrats, republicans, Libertarians, and independents together to achieve concrete results. Soltani will Drastically cut down crime by bringing hope and opportunity to young people. Writing in Arman Soltani for Governor this June 5th will make history, shock big money politics, and will  insure amazing things will happen in California. ask five or more friends to vote and spread the word to five or more of their friends. Vote for Arman Soltani by writing Arman Soltani on the ballot for Governor of California on or before June 5th, 2018.

title: Help send Meriam to DNC Convention!
summary:
Help me send Meriam Reynosa to Democratic National Convention!
Having had the privilege of serving with Meriam both as Co-Secretaries of the Alameda County Democratic Party and as Co-Presidents of the East and South Bay Young Democrats, I know first hand how deserving Meriam is of being an elected delegate to the Democratic National Committee!Her passion to elect strong Democrats, empower young Dems, and to lift up the Filipino community is evident in the work she does every single day. Now it's our turn to stand with Meriam and help her fulfill her dream to attend the DNC Convention!Attending DNC convention is incredibly expensive, between registration fees, flights and hotels (CADEM estimates $4,250 - $ 4,750 ) -- especially for a young Democrat trying to save up for her upcoming wedding!Meriam stepped up knowing this to be our voice at convention and to represent Alameda County and young dems across the state. Can you chip in to help Meriam attend the DNC Convention and do our community proud?Thank you for your help in supporting Meriam!
Update: Someone told Meriam we are doing this, so it is no longer a surprise. Upshot is folks can now share openly on Facebook and email without worrying about ruining the surprise!

title: Send Blake to Philadelphia!
summary: My name is Blake Kitterman and I am honored to have been elected as the youngest delegate to the Democratic National Convention in the state of Tennessee!This entire experience has been focused on empowering youth. Together, we were able to show that no matter who you are or where you come from, you have it in you to succeed!Empowering youth is the centerpiece of all my work. As the High School Constituent Coordinator for the Lenda Sherrell for U.S. Congress campaign, I focused on engaging youth in the political process and rallying behind the candidate.Shortly after, I became the founder and President of the Bradley County Young Democrats. This was a way for youth to become involved and feel comfortable being who they are, even in the second most conservative county in the state. We were the first organization to partner with a local Democratic Women's club and together we have supported technological revamping in underprivileged schools and literacy programs.I transitioned into my work with Organizing for Action, where I trained as a Fellow and later Fellows Manager. I worked diligently in raising community awareness of issues such as Insure Tennessee and school vouchers.I was recruited on to the Tennessee Democratic Party Outreach Committee, reaching out to young, disabled, and LGBTQ+ voters and encouraging them to run as delegates to the DNC. Later I worked as an intern and Tennessee State Liaison for the incumbent Mike Honda for U.S. Congress campaign (CA-17).Currently I am studying Political Science at UT Chattanooga and serve as the Tennessee Young Democrats LGBTQ Caucus Vice Chair, Freshman Senate President, UTC Students for Hillary founder/President, Chancellor's Ambassador, and the Experiential Learning Assistant at Think&Achieve.I am humbly asking for your support. This is my journey to empower youth everywhere, and I would love to have you join me!Best,Blake KittermanDelegate to the Democratic National Convention

title: Jen Little Helps So Many - Now She Needs Our Help
summary: It has become obvious to all that know Jen Little, that she is happier and healthier in Portland.  Did you know Jen MUST MOVE for health reasons? Did you know that Jen doesn't have the money to make the move or to support herself? Jen is still interviewing with companies for full-time employment, yet she doesn't have a permanent job lined up at this time. She plans to do consulting to get started. We all know she has talents and skills that will land her a job fast, but it could take some time. She is taking this risk because she knows that leaving for Portland is what she needs to do to take care of herself. She knows that she and Libby need to be in Portland.We need to support her through this transition for her happiness, but mostly for her health. We can't lose her!￼￼Jen is taking this on so bravely as though she is living one of the inspirational quotes she shares on Facebook and Instagram.Jen Little is an AMAZING WOMAN with the courage to leave her beloved Virginia and travel across the country to take care of her health.  Something happened to Jen earlier this year, I am not sure what exactly, but it must have been tragic. It hit her hard and she hides it well. She won't share information regarding these circumstances, but I can see it had a profound negative impact on her confidence, self-esteem, and overall quality of life.Did you know?Jen mentors young women actively to build them up. I have no idea how many Democrats she has helped elect over the years and worked with over the years. Jen is seriously an Award-Winning Virginia Democrat! Jen has always been a prominent member of the business community in Hampton Roads and Virginia's Peninsula, and the Middle Peninsula for almost twenty years! When she moved to Staunton she did the same thing. In her house you can see the awards she's won for being a Woman of Achievement and a Top Forty Under 40 professional, but she plays it all down humbly.Sadly, Jen hasn't been the Jen I've known and you’ve known over the years. I desperately want to see her happy again. She is so deserving of the joy Portland obviously brings her.￼￼￼When Jen met Portland, the Jen I know came back to life from whatever she was going through and bringing her down.Portland makes her smile brighter, her eyes sparkle, and she oozes positivity. You notice her joy in her social media posts alone.When Jen returns to Virginia from her trips to Portland that smile evaporates.  She sinks into deep depression.Jen will move to Portland.  Jen will be successful.  My desire is to make sure she has the support needed to make her success easier.￼￼￼I hope that as her friends we can make it a little easier for her.She can use a little help from her friends in starting her new life. Jen would never, ever ask for anything like this herself.  She wants us all to think she's got it under control, she's even offering donations of her furniture to churches to help others while she has so little. Jen is known for giving to so many in our communities and state, now she needs our help.As her friend, I want to make things are just a little easier for her to start her new life. She has done a million good deeds for others, including me.Please join me in helping this inspirational, brave and strong woman, who has helped so many of us over the years.Merry Christmas,Jill(All photos from Jen's Facebook page)

title: Julia's Education Fund
summary: *From friends of Julia: this is an amazing young woman with a bright future ahead of her. Funds raised through this effort will go towards her college books and other expenses associated with attending Barnard College.My name is Julia Coccaro and I am a senior at Spanish Fort High School located in a suburb of Mobile, Alabama. I have been heavily involved in political activism for the duration of my high school career. My sophomore year, I founded a chapter of High School Democrats of America on my campus and served as South Regional Director for the state organization. My junior year, I moved up in rank to Vice Chairwoman of ALHSD and simultaneously served as Editor-in-Chief of The Progressive Teen, the national publication of HSDA. This past summer, I worked as the PR Director for Jason Fisher, a former U.S. Senate candidate from Alabama. This year, I currently serve as Chairwoman of ALHSD and am volunteering for three state legislature campaigns as well as Walt Maddox’s gubernatorial campaign.I have also gained quite a bit of publicity for my outspokenness regarding a controversial summer reading list for my AP Government class at SFHS. The list, which I received in June, contained titles such as Liberalism is a Mental Disorder, Climate of Corruption: Politics & Power Behind the Global Warming Hoax, and 48 Liberal Lies About American History. The thirty books on the list, which I proved to be in use for several years, blatantly conveyed radical conservative bias. I posted the assignment on my Facebook page; within a matter of hours, it had acquired millions of views and the list itself was retracted by our Superintendent. Two days later, my post reached over 200 national news outlets. Because of the immense attention the list garnered in such a short period of time, I decided to strike while the iron was hot. The list was not the only circumstance in which I had noticed bias within the classroom.In my sophomore year, my Driver's Education teacher spent multiple class periods preaching his political beliefs and Christian faith, preventing us from completing our classwork. That same year, I founded a chapter of High School Democrats of America on my campus. At one of our meetings, I suggested that the club members travel to Montgomery to lobby our legislators for comprehensive sex education. I was then told by my school's administration that our club was no longer allowed to discuss LGBTQ-related issues. Finally, in my junior year, I oversaw the "Self-Expression" page of the yearbook, and a student I had asked to be featured on the page wanted to include the phrase "coming out" in her quote. Our yearbook advisor and assistant principal made it clear that they would not allow that phrase in the yearbook. After a long and heated discussion with our principal in which he stated his concerns about controversy and bullying, I was required to alter the quote and remove the "controversial" phrase. These issues, together with the list, were evidence of a culture of bias and discrimination at my high school. As a result, I decided to draft a formal complaint with the school system.For two weeks, I skimmed through the Board of Education's policy manual and found where each incident described violated a specific policy. I cross-referenced the occurrences with the violated policies or Constitutional rights. Additionally, I included a list of remedies in which I requested for the Board of Education to enforce its policies and to provide objectivity, inclusivity, and tolerance training for all teachers within our public school system. The final pages of the complaint were composed of signatures from both students and parents that supported the cause. An acquaintance with legal background proofread the complaint and it was delivered by certified mail to my Superintendent on July 10th.Following the delivery of the complaint, I interviewed with several news outlets and brought my concerns to local representatives, such as my District 1 Congressman Bradley Byrne, as well as individual members of the school board.The national media attention the complaint received exposed the use of extremely racist, sexist, and overall inaccurate PowerPoint slides by the same AP Government teacher who created the reading list; however, despite the unveiling of this curriculum, neither my school’s administration nor the Baldwin County Board of Education have taken hardly any measures to correct the conservative agenda that is being taught in that class. The backlash that I have received from my candor has undoubtedly made my senior year extremely difficult.Next year, I will be attending Barnard College, the women’s college affiliated with Columbia University. My decision to attend Barnard was not an easy one; while I was more than willing to go into debt for such an amazing education, I did not anticipate the lack of financial aid I ultimately received from the institution. However, I watched as almost every single one of my friends were mailed rejection letters from their dream schools despite being more than qualified for acceptance. Had I planned on majoring in a STEM field, I would’ve immediately chosen a much less expensive state school that offered me a scholarship; however, because I plan on working in politics, the location and name recognition of the school and thus the connections I make will ultimately be more pertinent for my career. My gut feeling told me that this was an opportunity I had to take and I feel incredibly content with my decision.

title: Almami I. Cyllah Memorial Fund
summary: In loving memory of Almami Cyllah, we his friends would like to recognize the impact this great man had on many of our lives by raising funds for a memorial in his name. We are currently researching options, such as a scholarship or internship fund and/or a charity donation to a cause that Almami would have championed. Once funds have been raised, we will decide democratically among all contributors how to best put his memorial fund to use.  Please share this widely with friends and colleagues who also knew Almami or who would share his ideals. For those who did not have the opportunity to know him well, please see a bio below for a glimpse into his life.Almami Ibrahim Cyllah was born in Makeni, Sierra Leone on May 31, 1951 to parents, Mr. Sallu Cyllah and Haja Isata Nabie. As the only child born to Isata, Almami was a “gift from God” from the beginning of his life, and his kindness, generosity and love touched many lives.As a child, Almami attended St. Francis Secondary School and Bo School in Sierra Leone. He travelled to the USA to attend Catholic University in Washington, DC, and worked multiple jobs to pay for his education and provide for his young family. After graduation in 1980, he joined Amnesty International, where he served for more than a decade as a human rights defender, advocate and head of the Africa program. Many years spent speaking truth to power solidified within Almami the sense of justice, honesty and integrity, that all who knew him recognized in his convictions. His colleagues from Amnesty remember his mentorship and inspiration that he cultivated especially among the younger staff to prepare them for the time, energy and commitment required to protect human rights.In 1994, Almami was called back to Sierra Leone to serve as commissioner in the Interim National Electoral Commission, when the country was still at war. Preparing for the first elections in 30 years, stakes were high and deadly threats were made frequently, but this did not deter Almami’s commitment to his country. Even after being targeted and seriously injured in an attempt on his life, Almami continued to play a leading role in organizing Bintumani I and II, which decided the electoral future of Sierra Leone. Turning down the offer to join the administration that followed the elections, he returned instead to his work at Amnesty and his dedication to strengthening democracy.In 2000, Almami began work with the NDI overseeing programs in Haiti and later was part of NDI-Carter Center electoral observation missions across Africa. Meanwhile, Almami joined the IFES as Country Director, first in Haiti, then Liberia and Cote d’Ivoire, where he directly supported efforts for free and fair elections. Almami became Africa Regional Director for IFES in 2008 and although he was based in Washington, DC, he travelled frequently to Africa to provide support to colleagues across the continent. Many who worked with Almami through these years remember his leadership, his sense of team (which to many felt like family) and his commitment to democracy in Africa.After his retirement in 2014, Almami began the exciting chapter of following one of his lifelong goals—to establish a political party and use his decades of experience in human rights and democracy to bring a new leadership perspective to his beloved Sierra Leone. Earlier this year, the National Progressive Democrats party was officially registered by the Sierra Leone Political Parties Registration Commission, an institution that Almami had been instrumental in establishing to bring greater transparency, honesty and accountability to the electoral process in Sierra Leone. Sadly, we lost Almami before he could fully participate as a future candidate for leadership in Sierra Leone.Almami leaves behind his family—his children and his grandchildren whom he cherished—and his friends who number across countries, continents and cultures. His is a legacy that we hope will live on within all of us.

title: DNC Convention Trip
summary: Hello my name is Koran T. Saines, I am excited to have been elected as a delegate to the 2016 Democratic National Convention in Philadelphia.  After spending years helping to elect Democrats including President Obama, Governor McAuliffe, our state delegation and my election last year, I will be representing Virginia at the National Convention.The hotel costs $500 per night, and that doesn't even include transportation or meals. Will you contribute $10, $25, or more to help cover my hotel, transportation, and meal costs at the Convention?Every contribution (no matter how small) will be greatly appreciated!

title: Hernandez Sisters off to Philly!
summary: As you may know my sister and I have the great honor of representing Congressional District 3 as a delegates for Hillary Clinton at the Democratic National Convention in Philly along with my brother Daniel. This has always been a dream of ours however multiplying the high cost of one person to attend convention by three is a bit out of our reach, especially as graduate students. Our involvement with the democratic party started at a very young age. We quickly learned the importance of civic engagement and the difference we could make at a local level. We have worked tirelessly over the years to help get democrats in Southern Arizona elected and now we ask you for your help in reaching our goals. We are reaching out to all of our good friends who know our passion for politics and know our work ethic to help us get to the convention. Any donation is greatly appreciated to help Consuelo and I as we will be splitting everything. We are expected to pay for this out of pocket as the DNC does not help with any funding. Whether you’re a Bernie supporter or Hillary supporter from the beginning I hope we can count on your support and that we as democrats can work together to make this election possible. We are very excited to be able to cast our votes for someone we strongly believe in and have admired since we were young children and do this as a family! Thank you again for taking your time to read this! Democratically yours,Alma & Consuelo Hernandez
