title: 2018 Florida Midterm Elections
summary: Thanks again for your participation! The Florida Senate horse race numbers have been released and are fully open to the public! Read them here: https://bit.ly/2NCzBt7 Results from the Florida Governor's race are also available: https://bit.ly/2NawI32 The goal has now been raised for a 2nd poll series on the Florida race to run later this month.U.S. Senate:The incumbent: Bill Nelson (Democrat), a member of the Senate since 2001.The challenger: Rick Scott (Republican), current governor of Florida, a post he’s held since 2011.Governor:Two-term Republican Governor Rick Scott is term-limited and cannot seek reelection. The major candidates are:Ron DeSantis (Republican). A retired Navy officer, he has been a U.S. congressman since 2013.Andrew Gillum (Democrat). Elected to Tallahassee’s governing City Commission while still in college, he has been mayor of the city since 2014. Politics: Republican George W. Bush carried Florida in the 2000 and 2004 presidential elections, but the state switched sides and gave its electoral votes to Democrat Barack Obama in 2008 and 2012. Donald Trump won the state by just over a percentage point in 2016.Florida’s other U.S. senator is Marco Rubio, a Republican.The GOP holds 16 of the state’s 27 seats in the U.S. House of Representatives. Democrats have 11.Why does public opinion matter? Amy Holmes discusses the importance of public sentiment and why she relies on Rasmussen Reports for polling information...Did you know you can also contribute to other state surveys? Click on the links below to contribute to polling in:Arizona  Illinois Indiana  Missouri Montana Nevada  North Dakota Ohio Pennsylvania Tennessee Utah West VirginiaSponsorship contributions to the Rasmussen Reports Citizen-Source project will cover direct and indirect polling and reporting costs for up to four separate polling cycles for each of the designated battleground states. There will be no profits charged or accepted by Rasmussen Reports on this project. Rasmussen Reports will remain solely responsible for all polling matters including timing, questions, fielding, tabulations and reporting. Overall project contributions will be capped so as not to over-raise funds we cannot use specifically on project polling and reporting costs. This undertaking is solely about getting independent unaffiliated battleground state polling data out and into the hands of voters.Questions? Visit our Frequently Asked Questions  page about this initiative.

title: Invest in Lena's (Madeleine) Leadership
summary: Last Spring I was elected committee person in the 46th Ward in Philadelphia. I ran because I was tired of the status quo. Tired of fighting for policies to protect people and planet only to watch democrats and republicans alike side with corporations and the 1% over people. I knew that change would not come until we actually engaged with electoral politics on the grassroots level. Following that, I have been trying to take on more strategic leadership roles with organizing as I consider what grassroots political power looks like. Through this process, I have had to wrestle with my white shame and identify toxic behaviors of white supremacy that keep me and my community from building political power. The result is that I am building deeper relationships with my community as we work together to fight white supremacy, take on the corporate politicians, and build collective people power. I want to continue growing and learning from mentors, and in that pursuit I’m looking to attend a People’s Action  Institute Weeklong Leadership Training Program in Chicago in a few weeks. But I need your help. My non profit employer provides a nice allowance of vacation days, but to attend the People’s Action  Institute Training I will need to pay for my own travel and tuition. These are the types of barriers that keep many of us from organizing and achieving our potential. My end date is fast approaching and I can’t get to Chicago without y’all! I’m asking people to make a contribution to my leadership growth, and help me get to the Peoples’ Action  Institute Weeklong Leadership Training in Chicago. I’m starting to understand the potential influence I can have on my community when I step up and lead. Please donate generously and share this page so that I can reach my goal!

title: Ashleys' DNC travel fund
summary: Hi everyone! My name is Ashley Rodriguez, I am an official Bernie National Delegate for Texas Senate District 29 in El Paso. I am fundraising for my trip to the Democratic National Convention in Philadelphia in July 25th to July 28th. The costs however are absolutely astronomical, it's clear the Democratic Party has become extremely disconnected from the class of people they claim to represent... I believe there should be more voices at the DNC representing lower and middle income people but by driving up the costs they are trying to make it impossible for that to happen. Nevertheless I am trying to do whatever it takes to make this opportunity happen to be able to represent the awesome, but most times, underheard people of my community. Let's take the oligarchy out of our democracy and bring back the voice of the people, not the voice of the rich and the powerful.In order to keep the costs as low as possible I sought out aid from an amazing organization I belong to, the Democratic Socialists of America, where DSA's Deputy Director, David Duhalde was a total badass and hooked me up with free housing in Philly. So the money raised through here will go towards my flight costs which are around $600, rideshare costs, metro card cost, food costs, and the numerous add-on charges the DNC is applying to most of their convention functions ($200 for "breakfast bash" where delgates need to be in order to receive their credentials). Any remaining funds will go towards helping fellow DSA members here in El Paso that will be attending the peaceful protests taking place at the DNC, with any of their travel costs. Since I was just elected for this spot at the Texas State Democratic Convention on June 18th it hasn't alloted for very much time for me to be able to fundraise, but anything you can do from now until July 22nd will help tremendously!    I have worked tirelessly for the Bernie Sanders campaign as a Super Volunteer and as a founder of a grassroots organization that I and other Bernie supporters started up about a year ago called West Texas Border for Bernie. Even as a broke college student I donated what I could when I could, to Bernie's campaign. He has inspired me to become the change that we have all been wishing to see in this world. As a latina, a first generation college student, a former working single mother of two, and as a wife/daughter/sister of veterans, Bernie's message deeply resonated with me and I fought and will continue to fight for the people's revolution that he has brought forth. I have continued this political revolution at home by running for, and being elected to, precinct chair for precinct 56 for the El Paso County Democratic Party, and by helping to bring a DSA chapter/organizing committee to El Paso, DSA - El Chuco del Norte. I am a member of YDS (Young Democratic Socialists) at the University of Texas at El Paso where I am currently attending studies for my undergraduate degree. That after a decade of being unable to afford college I am finally able to attend and am in my senior year of college with a 4.0 GPA, poised to graduate this December with a major in Political Science with a concentration in Law & Politics and a minor in History. I am a member of Pi Sigma Alpha Epsilon Epsilon chapter, the Political Science Honors Society. I am also the newly appointed Secretary for the El Paso Northeast Democrats, and the interim Secretary for the provisional El Paso Stonewall Democrats.  I hope to serve my community well and make them proud of me at this years DNC and to represent Bernie and the countless people that are supporting him and are depending on this revolution just as much as I am! WE CAN DO THIS!

title: DNC or BUST!
summary: I am honored to be representing New Mexico's 3rd Congressional District on behalf of Hillary Rodham Clinton and thank you for visiting my GoFundMe page to help me get to the National Convention in Philly!A little bit about why I ran for HRC National DelegateIn 2004, I attended the largest march in our country’s history, the March for Women’s Lives in DC. I was in college and just learning about what it meant to be a strong, feminist woman living in the South and Hillary Clinton gave a keynote that moved me to action.  I went on to lead organizations that dealt with issues like sexual assault and LGBT & women's rights and obtain my Masters in Social Work.Toward the end of my Master’s Hillary announced for President and I immediately applied to work for her campaign.  Now…that didn’t happen but I did end up with the DNC.  Sadly, their rules prohibited State Party staff from participating in caucuses, so I never got to cast my vote for her in 2008. Just like the March for Women's Lives, having the opportunity to cast such an important vote for such an important position with a unique place in history will be one of the most defining moments of my life.  Thank you to everyone who helped me make calls, whip votes, and showed love during this process! Now I need your help to raise the necessary funds to get to Philly.The Costs$800 - Airplane Ticket$2,100 - Mandatory Convention Hotel Room$500 - Taxis, Food, & LibationsGetting this once in a lifetime opportunity - PRICELESS!Show some monetary love and I promise a home cooked meal and a trip to see you after I get done winning a few targeted races for Democrats in New Mexico! I love you all and look forward to sharing this experiene with you via Facebook!  XOXO - Tarin

title: DoucheLeaks - Media Parody Site
summary:
DoucheLeaks is coming!To fight the growing censorship on Twitter and social media (and my inevitable ban) I'm creating a parody website, titled DoucheLeaks, which will launch on March 31st.This new media site (platform for the 65 million) will be free for all and consist of several parody pundits and journalists. I'll produce a constant stream of articles and additional material under the accounts of:Peter Douche: Verrit-like cards, NostraDouche predictions, etc Russia Maddow: Russia, Russia, RussiaKurt Eivgonebald: Strategies for losingMarkos Makesitso: PollingMax Bootlick: Democratic strategy from a Republican(with more to come)
The goal is to create content that is effectively censor-proof, designed to be easily shared across all social-media. In other words, it will include lots of shareable images. CONTENT:1) The characters will each regularly write their own articles for my fake news organization. 2) There will be cards (similar to Verrit cards) that are sized appropriately with punchy content designed to be shared on Twitter/Facebook/Instagram.3) I will introduce new material such as draft tweets, "hacked emails" (DoucheLeaks) and whatever else is fun and useful to push back against centrist (Republican) Democrats and helps to elevate the progressive agenda.4) I will accept guest parody submissions.5) I will share real news from independent journalists (fake news section)6) There will be a meme section of content I don't produce, but is a place for finding/sharing good stuff mined from the internet.I intend to dedicate the time equivalent of a part-time job on my end to this project and will never charge for the web-content. Down the road, the site will be funded by a shwag section of progressive stuff like t-shirts and bumper stickers and (if necessary) an entirely optional donation link.If you're unfamiliar with my account and story, I was banned from Twitter as Peter Douche, but revived my account as Peter Douche's Liaison - @SilERabbit. My non-parody account is @PatTheBerner. I also recently published "An Inconvenient Douche."I'm dedicated to creating fun content that helps get Bernie elected and pushes for positive change in the world. I pledge to always be mindful of producing content that aids our cause.I sincerely thank you for any and all support, as well as sharing the campaign to others! The website will launch, regardless of the funding, but your support will be greatly appreciated!Peace, Love and Outrage!-Pat (Peter Douche et al.)

title: Ronan Moore for Meath
summary: I was honoured to be elected as a Meath County Councillor in May 2019 and I am working hard to make change happen at local level. I am standing for the Social Democrats in the next general election for Meath West,  because I believe life should be about more than just existing. Our government can do so much more for what really matters to Irish people; quality of life. The Social Democrats are a new party, unhindered by the past and the old style of politics. The most prosperous, inclusive and progressive countries on earth are social democracies and I believe Ireland can join this group, and that a great many Irish people want us to. We know that a strong, creative, prosperous, fair, equal and democratic country – in which all children have the opportunity to achieve their potential – is not just an aspiration. It can, and should be, Ireland’s reality. It's time to tackle the housing crisis; to reduce the cost of living; to fix the health crisis by introducing Sláintecare; to make public transport fit for purpose; and to deliver local amenities. Being from Trim, where I live with my wife and young family, teaching in Navan and with parents from Westmeath, I also believe Meath has been forgotten about for far too long. It's time for joined-up thinking at local and national level; to ensure value for the taxes we pay; and equality of services for people.My priorities if elected are:- Taking action for a reduced cost of living through better funded healthcare, childcare, education, housing- Ensuring fair treatment for Meath at a national level, greater fairness of how our resources are allocated - Tackling climate change, including lobbying for vastly improved public transport and Navan rail-line- Giving dignity and opportunity for the most vulnerable in our society Will you help me to work on your behalf? You can volunteer to canvass with me, or you could donate to my campaign. Thank youFind out more at:www.socialdemocrats.ie/our-people/ronan-moorewww.facebook.com/RonanMooreSocDems/www.twitter.com/RonanMooreSocD

title: DNC Watch - Puerto Rico Livestream
summary: Let's talk about transparency in the Democratic Party. Two important DNC Committees are meeting in Puerto Rico in a few weeks - the DNC Rules and Bylaws Committee and the DNC Executive Committee.  What will happen at these "public" meetings?  The only way to know is to:A.  Attend the meeting yourself, ORB.  Make arrangements with the DNC to travel to Washington DC to read the transcripts of the meetings several months after the meetings occur, if you can get permission, and likely with a babysitter that the DNC assigns to you in their office, ORC. Watch it on my Facebook LIVESTREAM so that you and others can watch this public meeting in our pursuit for truth and transparency. I hope you help with Option C, otherwise, we may never know what decisions are made about our party. Why do we want to know what happens at these meetings? We just wrapped up two years of advocating for major reforms within the DNC, especially reforming superdelegates, and had huge success!  However, it is no secret that many of the DNC members fought the reforms, but felt pressure from grassroots Democrats across the country that were demanding transparency and fairness.  It is also not a secret that DNC members were told that the reforms weren't permanent and could be changed later.  I would hope that the DNC members would not reverse the reforms they just passed, but how will we know if we don't keep our eyes on them?  After the 2016 DNC Convention, I have been at every DNC meeting possible and began LIVESTREAMING to share what I was learning with others.  I've learned valuable information every time.  At first, I did this all on my own dime.  Then, one DNC member attacked me and accused me of being a Russian operative and working for Vladimir Putin with the intent to destroy the Democratic Party!  The grassroots was furious and many people stepped up and offered to help not only cover costs, but to watch and  share the LIVESTREAMS, which created even more transparency.I want to be clear that my intention is to make sure that grassroots Democrats know what is happening in OUR party. Republicans need to fix their dysfunctional party and Democrats need to fix ours.  I do not want the Democratic Party to fail. In fact, as long as we have a two-party system, I want the Democratic Party to succeed and thrive and work for the people they claim to care about.  Unfortunately, I don't trust that this will occur without us watching and advocating within the party.  If you can, and if you would like to support the DNC Watch Puerto Rico LIVESTREAM for the next DNC committee meetings,  you can make a donation here.   I will Facebook LIVESTREAM the DNC Rules and Bylaws and Executive Committee Meetings on my FB Page - https://www.facebook.com/selinavickerswv/  You can also find other LIVESTREAMS on that Facebook page by looking at the "Events". You can also find links at https://www.selinavickers.com/livestreams Expenses for this trip will include a plane ticket,  lodging, travel around the city (bus, uber, taxi), meals and wifi at conference center, if needed.   No rubles accepted.  By donating, you are confirming that you are an American citizen.Thank you for your support!

title: Christian Smith for Mobile County Treasurer
summary:
Hi All,
Welcome to my fundraising page. 

My name is Christian Smith and I am running for Mobile County Treasurer. I am running as a Democrat and believe I represent the voice of the people. 

I am running as treasurer because I want to bring more transparency and better accountability to this office. 
I believe that I represent the choice of the people and think that I would be able to restore accountability to the position that people would like to see in their government. Here is my Platform, I hope you will take time to read it as well as go to my facebook page www.facebook.com/christiansmith2012  The treasurer adds a level of accountability and oversight to the budget. Some may argue it is a duplication of services provided by the finance office; however, the finance office is not accountable to the people. They are salaried employees of the county. It is also argued we are one of three counties to still maintain the office of treasurer, but what many don't realize is that the other counties have rolled the treasurer's duties into the Revenue Commissioner's office. This is not the intention of those seeking to eliminate this office. If they have their way, no elected official would be over the budget and there would be far less accountability.My objectives, if elected are to have the following 4 goals:1. Provide more transparencyI want to take the budget and break it down for a person who does not have background in budgeting to understand. I want to make it available to whoever wants to see it in a format that can be understood rather than generic categories such as maintenance or building fund. I want people to be able to see how their hard-earned money is working for them and to have concrete examples of it. The treasurer ensures a protective role to citizens of their money by being a gate keeper and making sure the money is spent on what it was allocated for.2. Make Wiser InvestmentsWith the economy currently how it is we cannot afford to rely on a department that is not accountable to the people to make sure the investments are representing all the citizens of Mobile County. It is my goal to task this duty back to the treasurer's office to benefit all the citizens of Mobile county instead of just certain part of the county. It is our money as citizens and it should benefit all of us and not just some. I want to make sure we maintain our current budget by making wise investments and not losing money by taking riskier ones.3. Modernize the Office.To allow the citizens the transparency of the budget on the expenditure and investments site I would like to modernize the office by providing a website directly dedicated to it. Currently it is one of the few offices that does not have its own website, which means if you would like to know any of the financial information about the county you need to go downtown and go through boxes and boxes of papers. Those papers are not broken down for you to really understand where the money is going. I want citizens to have the opportunity to go on the website and know who the treasurer is, what the treasurer does, and where their money is going. By allowing citizens this opportunity they are not only able to question the treasurer but all their local elected officials.4. Use it as a tool of Citizen EngagementBy allowing citizens the ability to review the budget online, they are able to understand what is going on with their money and are able to ask questions. Too often do citizens feel disconnected with their community or see the point in voting since they feel their voice doesn't matter. By having this information readily available citizens can voice their opinions and hold their elected official accountable.Mobile needs to move forward, and we cannot move forward if we do not know what is going on in our backyard.A vote for me is vote for moving Mobile forward.

title: Brad's campaign for Cancer Research Institute
summary: Defying the odds. Modern Family meets the Brady Bunch in real life. A very diverse family combined into one. We have it all and we want to give back. Half mainland American, half Puerto Rican American, Republican, Democrat, Independent, Straight, Gay, Hard Headed, Stubborn, Passive, Compassionate, Redneck, Blue-collar, College. Whatever you choose, we are family!In this family we have at least 5 parents/grandparents who have lived with, and/or passed away from, cancer. In an effort to bond our family stronger, and without making resolutions, we have decided to do a Savage Race, May 5th, 2019 in Maryland. While preparing for the race we feel we can give back as well so we would like to raise funds for Cancer Research. This has nothing to do with winning the Savage Race, our ages run from 15 to 58. This is a family building commitment. In discussing what our target goal was for raising funds, the Passive Compassionate said "$5000.00" The Hard-Headed, Stubborn, said "$10,000.00". Doing what families do, we compromised with $1000.00 per teammate. Since not all of us can enter the race we are putting our goal at $7000.00 for the seven people taking part.However, I, Brad, the Head, the Stubborn, the Redneck, the Hard-Headed, the one with all of the bad dad jokes, the one who does not speak spanglish, the Archie Bunker, the Jay Pritchett, would like to see $1,000,000.00 raised. Aggressive - absolutely! Impossible - absolutely not! realistic - very good question. I just believe in people and I want to show my kids that nothing is impossible and family is the strongest bond in the world.Please help us raise money for this causeOur Team:Brad HeilJuanita del ValleNick HeilJaclyn ScwarzZach HeilMia CalzadaAngel Calzada

title: I'm a a disabled USA Vet Intel Ofcr needs support!
summary:
I'm a Disabled US Veteran Intelligence Officer who served 34 years.  I am in serious need of financial help.

After I was injured in service in 2010, I suffered catastrophic illness while working, and discovered I was a 58 year old with a secret: I was born in the 1950s with fatal Cystic Fibrosis when not much was known. At birth the Doctors told Mom to just let me die in the Maternity Ward. Back then the MDs had  no real idea what the causes of "CF" was. In fact they had no idea I had CF. I went 58 years in the dark with symptoms I worked around. 

Ordinarily, babies died of what I had usually in hours to days.  It causes asphyxiating infections, Lung failure, convulsions, mucusization, and the inability to hydrate. My Mom simply refused to give up on me! She left the hospital and hand nursed me somehow to health at home with a local Doctor's help.  While I never regained perfect health she accomplished enough for me to enter kindergarten right on time.  But for so many years till now, I have been subject to sudden illness and  vulnerable. To life threatening  infections. Now, it's getting a a lot worse since I was injured on the job. 

.According to the 2017 Cystic Fibrosis Foundation Patient Registry Data, patients in the U.S. born between 2013 and 2017 can expect to possibly live to a maximum life span into their mid-40s. I am already 20 years past that wear date and I was born more than 60 years earlier!! I had no idea I even had a wear date! 

I was hired in my thirties by very high ranking Intelligence and Military personnel in 1986 to a very tough job in the Military Intelligence Community.  And I worked 24x7 heads down from 1985 to 2010. Then I was abruptly injured on the job and discovered that I had this secret illness normally long fatal by your 30th to 40th birthday, Cystic Fibrosis. And the injury, poisoning, had triggered it Into high gear!  I had had it all my life and many, many symptoms but I'd just "worked around it" and lived. It all came as a shock to me after I was wounded at my job, that we discovered I'd had full blown Cystic Fibrosis all my life.  Even the Doctors were shocked, some refused to believe it. One shook my hand and said I was the first person with Cystic Fibrosis he'd ever met over 35 who hadn't had a Lung Transplant. Altogether I concluded they were abusing me. There is so little medical experience with full blown Cystic and my age adults with it, since most of us die in childhood or early adulthood. I ran into huge problems getting care going through facilities who said they had Adult CF clinics but really didn't. I'm an anomaly I guess.  I always ate healthy, exercised and didn't let the constant congestion, breathing trouble, heart arrhythmia, and many other symptoms stop me.

I did my jobs as a computer scientist for 25 years before joining the Agency. I did my job for the Agency and under 5 Presidents (directly) for 34 years without stopping. yet I was harboring this illness which has now stripped me of my health by worsening  starting about six years ago. After my in service injury..The ever present Cystic Fibrosis and the constant overwhelming physical symptoms has created  enormous health expenses for me at this age, partially covered only by Medicare. I have very little disability money left each week for food or housing, yet must keep up my strength, I must keep going.  By the fifteenth of the month I"M BROKE. If I lose my home, I will consume the remaining disability money and then what? I somehow have to maintain this home. Food is not easy as bad yet cheap food is very bad for a CF patient. Days go by I eat only one or two  small and sometimes one moderate meal, the lowest cost I can find. I often go to bed literally starving!I had a stroke a while back from it all, my heart fibrillated and threw a clot, from my job injury: poisoning,  which aside from rendering me into a state of working in constant physical distress, also took a lot of my vision to a vision cut and retinopathy macular edema (Retinal Swelling). It took what was left of my vision, after I lost 1/4 of it to blindness, and turned it into a "fun house mirror" image. So I've had 125 surgical injections into each of my eyes, 6-8 weeks apart, or more, just to try and maintain legal non-blindness enough, reducing my 20:85 down to 20:25 in both eyes (thank God, I exercised my eyes daily with a vision machine for 4 years and took injections since 2013!! Thank you Doctor(s)).  I have to be able to travel, drive and see well enough to take care of myself. And so I soldier on. I am fighting to stay alive as long as God gives me.   I thank God for every day I wake up, even feeling terrible. But the 0 balance in my checking account really is costing me.On top of it all because I can not afford the overhead alone, I am now forced to make this appeal for support trying to keep from becoming homeless.  There is no State Tax Exemption for individuals such as me who do not retire under a DD-214 as regular soldiers do. If they are disabled, they are property tax exempt. Me, no relief, though I worked 33+ years and had the same exposure to combat and worse from foreign intel and terror groups the rest of the time.Every day I see people raising money for political causes. Lots of money. I feel for everyone like me who needs moderate amounts but without which they will, like me, be rendered homeless.  We aren't going to stand out with all the Election Year fund raising of immediate need. And this year everyone has their money well invested.  I have none.I recently completed being treated surgically for my kidneys which abruptly started malfunctioning. One day I was driving home from lunch and I felt a twinge of pain in my right hip region. By the time I got suspicious and went to the Doctor, I must have looked like death once warmed over. He ordered me to the Hospital. The surgery lasted from October 2018 to January 2019, repeatedly. Oh such pain you would not wish on your worst enemy. They had to stick lasers and microscopes and lights up, well, you know where. And it scratched and cut me all up! It was harrowing and at one time I suffered a near heart attack from the pain while on the surgery table. I've lost a fair amount of my stamina from that experience and and am facing other "consequences".Hence I am forced to raise money so as to keep my home hoping for the good will of others' generosity. I hope my attention to detail isn't grossing you out. But I am very desperate and have no idea how to do this.Well, enough griping. You get the picture.  My life is not easy. If I lose my home, what then?  Life on the streets would be death. Family aren't available to take me in. And they are democrats.   It's a constant battle for me. Yet even my girlfriend says she's sick of hearing about it. So in spite of her ability to help, she is no longer willing to. Such is the tragic consequence of illness - it doesn't go away to suit others and it is always there impeding your ability to survive. Well,  keeping silent won't help me. And, perhaps, EX girlfriend.  When my partner is sick, no matter how difficult, no matter how repetitive, no matter how difficult to listen to, I'M THERE.

Any support would be a wonderful gift to me. I would be most grateful for help coping with this tragedy. My heart is in trouble, I've become partly blind and deaf.  I have CF related diabetes. I have breathing trouble. I have digestion problems.  I have to fight it. And my lungs and pancreas could kill me if they become infected, all in under 72 hours. I need to keep ridiculously expensive medications going. One pill I take twice a day for CF costs over $25,000 each month. The eye injections are $4800 each.  I do hope to get the house under control. It would be a blessing from God. For the rest I've assembled insurance and Health Grants.  I wish they had Health Grants for every day expenses.

I have to choose between medications and eating.  Health Care and having a roof over my head.  The part of the Military I work for apparently has no care systems or support for long term veterans at all. So as long as I am injured they can ignore me, it appears. Please consider making a modest donation to me, as 2019 is the year if I can not find support, I become a fatally afflicted homeless Intel Veteran. I really do  need your help. That's my fighting pose in the photo. Me refusing to go down or if I do,  refusing to stay down. Just call me "Rocky"!! Please let me know if you believe in me, by Donating. Gratefully, Dr. Jack

title: Sonoma Fire Victims- Childrens Fund
summary: Californians need to help Californians. Having held the previous positions I have. I have housed those that are fleeing fires and sadly Fema and Red Cross are great for short term assistance. They do not assist in the long term, leaving these families struggling until insurance kicks in.  I searched for go fund me and was not able to find one. It's obvious that these families are more worried about getting out and saving what they can, while they can. Our goal is to raise as much money as "WE" can. It will be transferred to a county non profit.   It is hard to sit here and watch, knowing what lies ahead. Peace of mind is something we can assist with. Peace of mind knowing that you helped someone who needed a jacket, or shoes because all they had were slippers and a robe on. The funds can be used to help with underwear and garments that most take for granted.  We need your help, in order to help!!! We do not reside in Sonoma County, but we do reside in California. As Californians it means we help each other.  Californians need to help Californians, especially considering the situation.Anything would be greatly appreciated. These funds will be transferred over to one of the Sonoma County Shelters, or another non profit that can help assist these families with clothing, shoes, ect..Thank you in advance and God Bless....Photography credit- Press Democrat

title: YDA Convention - Indianapolis
summary: On July 17-20 I, and several other Buffalo County Young Democrats will be attending the Young Democrats of America Conference in Indianapolis, Indiana. At this conference I will be learning about field organizing, fundraising, voter outreach, and other important civic duties. I also plan on joining the rural caucus since I am from a rural part of the country! This fundraiser is to bring down the cost of meals and other expenditures while attending this conference. Any donation is appreciated! If you have any questions feel free to contact me. Thank you.

title: Beyond Race and Color
summary: Cliff Dent of Phoenix, AZ and Don Zolman of Warsaw, Indiana teamed up on October 30, 2018 to present a candid discussion of racial and political issues in the current political climate entitled "Race and Color in Our Troubled Times".Cliff (a black Democrat) and Don (a white Republican) believe that this discussion can and should be continued in other venues in the United States -- and we are enlisting the aid of others who similarly believe that these issues must be addressed in a straightforward and candid way that will help to bridge the political divide that is tearing our country apart.The money raised by this Gofundme drive will be used to research, secure and promote new discussions by Cliff and Don on these issues in other states -- and to possibly broaden the discussion to include other important perspectives (LatinX, Asian-American, Native American, etc.) in the discussion and policy analysis mix.Cliff and Don consider this to be an educational mission -- one from which they hope to learn as much as they may have to teach.Any contributions regardless of how small or large they might be will be personally acknowledge and highly appreciated in our pursuit of this new educational venture.

title: Em & Dani: Live and Learn Guatemala
summary: "Travel is fatal to prejudice, bigotry, and narrow-mindedness." -Mark TwainHello all, and thank you for taking the time to read this. Our names are Danielle Denman and Emily Meyran and we have been best friends for about 5 years. We are both High Honor roll sophomores at Gloucester High School and involve ourselves heavily in the community. We are members of the Young Democrats Club, Interact Club (community service), and French Club. Some of our shared passions include travel, language, and learning about diverse cultures. When the opportunity to travel to Guatemala presented itself, we couldn't turn it down. We will be enrolled in a Spanish immersion program and attend 1 on 1 language classes for 5 hours a day in Antigua, Guatemala during the month of August 2018. Antigua is a small, colonial Guatemalan town which is beautiful and rich in history. Outside of the classroom we will explore the area and gain an understanding of the culture. Expenses include room and board at the school, meals, lessons, and flight costs. We are very grateful for any and all donations!Thank you very much for your consideration, Emily and Danielle

title: Persist NY - Funding 2020
summary: Persist NY is a grassroots organization pounding the pavement to make sure that NY is really the progressive state it claims to be.  We've spent the last three years working on voter registration, passing the RHA, kicking out the IDC (aka fake NY state senate Democrats), holding teach-in on state and local government, and  lobbying for voting reform, much-needed housing protections and climate change legislation.But we're only getting started... 2020 will be a big year to fight to make sure that the census counts EVERYONE in Brooklyn, that we retain our majority in the NY state senate and help make early voting a reality on the ground for one of the most important elections of our lifetimes (no exaggeration...).Every dollar you donate goes directly to initiatives in our community - all administration and execution is done by a group of dedicated volunteers.

title: My Climate Lobbying Trip to D.C.
summary: Benefits:Protecting the health and happiness of humanity requires political will to minimize the risks of a changing climate from human-caused global warming.What the funds will be used for:I am hoping to travel to Washington D.C. to lobby for the climate, as a Citizens' Climate Lobby (CCL) Sacramento Chapter representative, on the Sacramento Metro Chamber of Commerce Cap-to-Cap lobbying trip, as a member of the Air Quality Policy Team. The total cost of the trip is $3500, which includes air fare and hotel accomodations. The purpose is to lobby Sacramento Region U.S. representatives (5 Democrats and 3 Republicans), Congressional committees, and federal agencies to consider climate risks as a threat to our regional and national health and prosperity. Why sponsor me? Most people attending have their company sponsor them, so they can network with those who influence policy locally and nationally. As an individual looking to make a change, I am without a corporate sponsor, but I believe my voice for the climate at this event is essential.  CCL chapters raise all their own operating funds, because the national organization does not have chapter fundraising capacity.  So I am asking you to be my sponsor! Because of the fuzzy the line between 501c3 and 501c4 activities on this trip, these donations are not tax-deductible. This makes it even harder to raise funds for this trip.Trip purpose:To maximize the outcome of this trip for the climate, I am currently working to include a climate risk position paper for our Air Quality Team lobbying meetings. I will also have the chance to discuss the climate issue with over 200 community leaders in the business, non-profit, academic, and governmental sectors. There are no other voices directly addressing climate risk in this influential business and community organization. This is a continuation of the work I began on the same trip last year and an expression of my ongoing climate commitment. This trip is part of a larger effort by members of Citizens' Climate Lobby to have a national conversation on climate solutions, as we build the political will to overcome past and current barriers to action.Funds needed by:The deadline for trip payment is February 6, but if I know that friends and family are willing to help, I will proceed with the payment and I would be happy to receive your help anytime up to the start of the trip on April 14.What the support means to me: I paid for this trip last year, but I am unable to make the entire expenditure this time around.  Your support means that I am not alone in this journey to expand the climate conversation in circles of power and influence here in the Capitol Region and in Washington D.C. It means that you have confidence in my ability to represent the issue intelligently in this arena, and that you agree with me that this project in particular is worth the cost. How I will show my gratitude:I will keep you all updated on progress towards the inclusion of a climate risk position in the Air Quality Team policy papers that we will be taking to D.C. I will also be preparing some language for inclusion in other team papers, including the Food and Ag, Economic Development, and Transportation teams and will keep you updated on those. And of course, I will post during and after my trip, reporting back on the meetings and connections I have made.

title: Send Dave Ashley to Mount Everest in 2020
summary: Update:  Succesfully teamed with non-profit American 300, and set up a Crowdrise site.  Please donate here: https://www.crowdrise.com/o/en/campaign/purple-heart-summits-send-dave-to-mount-everest-in-2020?utm_source=manage&utm_platform=fb&utm_device=mobile  if you can take advantage of the non-profit tax opportunity.  Over $7,000 raised on Crowdrise so far!Help send a retired military officer and kidney donor on the trip of a lifetime...climbing mountains all over the world and culminating with an attempt on Mount Everest on Memorial Day 2020 along side other Purple Heart veterans!Joining forces with the non-profits American 300 and Purple Heart Summits, I’m planning climbing trips leading up to an attempt at Mount Everest with military veterans who have earned a Purple Heart decoration! Note: 100% of donations go to American 300. You may be able to claim tax credit on your donation.  Talk to your accountant or tax advisor to discuss your particular situation.  IRS 501c3  Federal ID#: 61-1608532I retired after over 27 years of military service in the Army and Air Force. I’ve served all over the world including combat zones in the Middle East.  I’m begun training culminating in an ascent of Everest in May 2020:Training Completed:Jan: Ice climbing training in Ouray ColoradoMarch: 3-day non-stop adventure race in Florida, finished 3rd overall as a solo racerMay: Glacier & rope team training on Mt Rainier, successful summit to 14,500+ feetJuly: High elevation training on Mount Tapacca, Chile.  Successful summit to 19,200+ feetJuly-August: Mountain biked the Great Divide Mountain Bike Route (GDMBR) from Canada/Montana border to New Mexico/Mexico border, 2,500+ miles in 39 daysSeptember: Adventure Racing World Series 4.5 day race in CroatiaSeptember: 8 hour Venture Quest adventure race in Virginia, 1st place overallSeptember: 30 hour National Championship Adventure Race in Boone, NC.  1st place overall Master's category (45 and over)Training Planned:October: Climbing weekend in DenverOctober: Marine Corps MarathonNovember: La Ruta 3-day stage mountain bike race in Costa Rica; called the toughest mountain bike race in the worldNovember: JFK 50 mile ultramarathon in MarylandDecember: Turkey Burn 12 hour adventure race in FloridaJanuary: Climbing in ChileJanuary/February: Mt Kilimanjaro in AfricaMarch: 3-day non-stop adventure race in FloridaApril: Trek to Everest South Base CampApril/May: Trek to Everest North Base Camp, attempt Mt. Everest!For success, I  attpemting  to  raise $50,000 to cover the cost of equipment, travel, permits, base camp logistics, and guide services over the next 18 months.  The most expensive by far is the logistical support, guide, and permit for Everest; that runs $50k and higher.  I also seeking support from mountaineering gear and clothing manufacturers.Why climb Everest?  My two reasons:First, I’m targeting a summit as close to Memorial Day 2020 as possible to honor the fallen men and women in uniformed services, especially my friends and classmates.  Shout out to the West Point Class of 1997, #WPWD! Second,  I’m a living kidney donor. As a very active person, I’m climbing to demonstrate that giving up a  kidney won’t hold me back from tackling the tallest mountain in the world.  I donated in January 2017, and returned to endurance sports and mountaineering just a few months later and will be on Everest 2.5 years later.  And if I can do that, perhaps somebody out there may make a decision to get tested for a donation, ultimately elect to be a living donor, and have a chance to save a life.I’ve linked up with the non-profits American 300 and Purple Heart Summits.  They link up experienced mountaineers with service members wounded in action, sharing the skills needed to climb the world’s tallest mountains. There are several climbs in the next 18 months in their program, including Everest in 2020.  So I’ll be doing several climbs with some of our wounded warriors as a climbing mentor to those heros.  Finally, you can follow my progress towards Everest and learn more about the kidney donation on my FaceBook page, Instagram, Twitter, and my personal homepage.  Even a hash tag:  #AdventureKidneyThanks for your consideration in support of this mission.  Cheers!~Dave “Dash” AshleySome people have asked...what kind of climbing/training have I done so far?  Below are some of the biggest and most recent:-Mulitple Pike’s Peak climbs, on foot, mountain bike (downhill was amazing!) and winter snowshoe climb (solo, in the dark, and in a snowstorm!) 1999-2015- Multiple other 14ers in Colorado 1999-2015- 1st Mount Rainier summit, ice ax/crampons/rope team (guided by David Adlard) 2014- Mount Adams, ice ax, crampons, (guided by David Adlard and took my family!) 2015- Highlands Sky 40 Mile Ultramarathon, Canaan Valley WV, June 2017 just 4 months following kidney donation!- 1st Mount Whitney summit (tallest mountain in contiguous US at 14,500+ feet), October 2017- 1st Mount Wlison double summit ultramarathon (10k climbing, 28 miles) Dec 2017- Mount Russell, ice axe, crampons (14,000+ feet) Spring 2018- Mount Iron to Mount Baldy (the “traverse”), bike back to Iron trailhead, 40 miles, 11k elevation gain, Nov 2018- 2nd Mount Wilson double ultramarathon (10k climbing, 28 miles) Dec 2018- Death Valley 3-day peak bagging trip (4 peaks in 3 days 80% off trail) Jan 2019- Colorado quad-14er snowshoe ascent:  Mt Democrat, Lincoln, Cameron, and Bross, March 2019 - 2nd Mount Wilson summit, May 2019- Cactus to Clouds round trip summit/descent in one day, Palms Springs valley to top of Mount San Jacinto, over 10,800 feet of gain/loss over 41 miles

title: Support The Planned Parenthood Action Fund
summary: With the passage of the recent Georgia and Alabama laws almost completely restricting women's access to abortion in these states, the Marblehead High School Democrats want to raise funds to support women's healthcare advocacy groups. We have selected the Planned Parenthood Action Fund to send our proceeds to in order to support their pro-choice advocacy campaign all over the nation. We greatly appreciate your support in our country's fight to defend a women's right to choose.

title: Jessica Otero/Levi Lloyd
summary: Press Democrat CSR, Jessica Otero and partner Levi Lloyd were out early on the morning of February 7th delivering newspapers to customers on Levi’s route in West Sonoma County.  Levi's adult daughter was at home and awaken by the smell of smoke in the house she shared with her father, Jessica and Jessica’s son. She escaped the fire by going out a window.  Currently Jessica, Levi and two adult children are living in motels and looking for permanent housing in Sonoma County. They did not have renters insurance and lost everything in the fire. What wasn’t destroyed by the fire has been permeated with smoke and is not usable. Once they secure housing they will need to replace everything in their house.  Anything you can do would help and be greatly appreciated.

title: PRIDE Cares Sonoma Relief Fund
summary: As a family of foodservice E & S dealers, suppliers, and customers located throughout the United States, Canada, and the Cayman Islands, we are devastated by the unprecedented impact the wildfires in Sonoma and Napa present to this strong community.PRIDE Board Vice Chairman, Founding Member, and volunteer fire fighter David G. Castino has shared the direct challenges impacting employees of Castino Restaurant Equipment & Supply, their valued customers, and the many first responders who bravely placed their community first during this time of crisis. There is an immediate need to assist all who have lost so much in this tragedy, and with hearts rooted in the spirit of hospitality, we want to help.As members of this extended family, we ask you to consider the urgent need of daily essentials for many who have lost their homes and more as a result of these tragic events. All donations will be withdrawn and managed by the Redwood Credit Union Community Fund, an IRS exempt organization recognized under section 501(c)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code, Tax ID #47-5084832. Your tax-deductible donations will be added directly to the North Bay Fire Relief effort, which has raised more than $20,000,000 in support of the families affected in the area.Redwood Credit Union’s North Bay Fire Relief Fund was created by RCU Community Fund, Inc. (RCUCF) in partnership with Redwood Credit Union (RCU), The Press Democrat and Senator Mike McGuire, to support victims and relief efforts of the devastating 2017 North Bay fires. To learn more about who/what your donations will fund, please use the following link:https://www.redwoodcu.org/northbayfirereliefIn partnership and passion for our hospitality community, we thank you for your support.-PRIDE Centric Resources Executive Team  For updates on this effort, please follow us at:Facebook: /PRIDECentricResourcesTwitter: @PRIDECenResInstagram: @pridecentricresources

title: Bring Lucy the Poodle Home
summary: On March 1, 2019, my beloved toy poodle, Lucy, slipped out of our fence-in backyard in the Levy Park neighborhood of Tallahassee while I was at work and she was home  with my boyfriend. Scent sniffing search dogs traced her path to the intersection of Tharpe and MLK, where the trail ended. In most cases, this means that someone picked up a dog and put it into a car. It's very likely that the someone has her now, and the person who has her may not know that she has a loving home! To read more, see my facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/BringLucy/Several people have generously offered to donate to the search for Lucy to help bring her home. I am eager to continue my search efforts, and any small donation would help a lot. So far, I have hired a Pet Detective with search dogs, made 50 neon yard signs, posted about 25 neon posters at intersections, posted hundreds of color flyers, sent out one mailing to about 120 dog-related businesses, and placed an ad in the Tallahassee Democrat (print and digital). Any funds raised by this campaign will go toward making more large signs and to sending out mailers with flyers to dog-related businesses in a wider geographical radius. Any help you are able to give will be very appreciated. I am heartbroken that my baby is still missing, but I am still optimistic that I will be able to find her with the right search tactics.With hope for Lucy's safe return,  Virginia

title: GOP State Committee
summary: I am running for NJ GOP State Committee from Hudson County.  The NJ GOP suffers not only from a significant gap in registration with the Democrats but also (and related to) its inability or unwillingness to outreach and engage with communities that do not traditionally vote Republican. We cannot and should not be satisfied by our meager engagement with our Black, Hispanic, Jewish, millenial, and urban neighbors. We must bring smaller government ideas and a liberty based framework to all people, strategically focusing on slightly blue districts we can turn purple and purple district we can turn red.We must plant the seeds of activism in NJ's urban area's not only to put Democrats on the defensive, but to help people realize they are not alone in their frustration with the inefficiencies, red tape, bureaucracy, and high taxes of our state.When elected, I will be the voice on the State Committee pushing our state, county, and other organs to support candidates for local office and to engage in sustained outreach. In area's dominated by Democrats, we are not going to elect State Assemblymen and Senators without first electing Republicans to School Board and City Council.Going up against entrenched interests that seemingly work more against Republicans than for them is a challenge. With your help, we can send the message that a new NJ GOP is on the horizon - a state Republican Party that will engage in an outreach offensive for all of NJ's neighborhoods.I need your support in order to help reach the registered GOP voters of Hudson County. Wherever you live, you can be a vital part of changing and growing the NJ GOP. Donate today.What is the State Committee?The GOP NJ State Committee is the central party organ of the New Jersey Republican Party and sets the agenda for all party affiliates and subsidiary organs. The State Committee is composed of representatives elected from each NJ county and is, in the main, in desperate need of an infusion of grassroots conservative activism that I will bring when elected.

title: HELP ME RAISE MONEY TO ATTEND THE HSDA SUMMIT!
summary: Hi, My name is Juwaria Jama, I am the co-state lead for the Minnesota Climate Strike, District 5 Representative for the Minnesota Youth Council and a politically active teenager. I am raising money to attend the High School Democrats of America (HSDA) Summit in D.C for a week in June. Attending this summit will help me expand my political activism and give me the opportunity to interact with other youth that have the same passion and drive as me. As a co-state lead for the Minnesota Climate Strike, I have been able to connect with youth across the state and country regarding environmental and social activism. Through these leadership roles, I am learning more about myself and my values. I hope to run for office in the future and being able to be apart of this summit and learn and grow with others around me would be a great step in getting me there. Though these are amazing opportunities, as a low income student I do not have the funds to be able to participate in these amazing experiences. I rely on the help of people like you, family and friends to give me the chance to take part in summits like these. HOW YOU CAN HELP: I am raising $950 which would go to;$400 - round trip flight from MN to D.C$500 - tuition for summit (would cover bunking, food, transportation, etc) $50- touring and pocket money Please help me in spreading word about this fundraiser and thank you! -Juwaria.

title: Vote them out
summary:
Vote them out. Our message is clear. If you vote for extreme anti-abortion legislation then we will abort your political carrier. Our plan is simple; we raise lots of money, start a political action committee, and then put up a competitor in each of the anti-abortion politicians districts. Democrat, republican, or moderate, doesn't matter as long as its not someone who votes for an extreme anti-abortion bill.

No matter what race they run, no matter what office they run for. We will run against them and support an opposing candidate. Until the candidate submits a letter of apology addressed to all women, they will have no career in politics.

If enough politicians who signed a anti-abortion legislation careers fail, others will think twice before signing anti-abortion legislation.Enough is enough... Missouri, Utah, Arkansas, Ohio, Kentucky, Mississippi, Alabama, and Georgia your local and state elections are about to get a whole lot more competitive. The silent majority will now speak.  Please donate what you can, let us send a message load and clear.Sincerely,The Moderately Moderate

title: Send Allie & Olivia to Creating Change Conference!
summary:
Allie and Olivia, president and vice president of New Era Colorado's Fort Lewis College club, are two LGBTQ students seeking sponsorship for the Creating Change Conference  in Detroit this January.  This conference is put on by the National LGBTQ Task Force  and will feature workshops on racial justice, community organizing, gender and sexuality, and effective advocacy - all tools they will use in Durango. As two students who have spent their time at Fort Lewis working towards issues of social justice, they feel this opportunity would be very influential and would provide them with valuable tools to bring back with them to the community. Your donation will go towards paying Allie and Olivia's conference and hotel fees. Allie Wolfe is a psychology student who decided to begin pursuing a career in political advocacy after having the opportunity to lobby for DACA in Washington DC this past March with Fort Lewis student government. She is a Common Ground trained diversity facilitator, a member of the Wellness Peer Advisory Council, former editor of La Movida (newsletter of El Centro de Muchos Colores, the Hispanic resource center of Fort Lewis), and was recently a featured speaker for the American Association of University Women Durango. She is interning with the Advocacy Corps through the Friends Committee on National Legislation where she advocates for the demilitarization of police. Allie is a proud member of the LGBTQ community, a stand up comedian,  active member of Indivisible Durango, and AAUW. She volunteers in the community with Durango Sexual Assault Services Organization and is an artist who has contributed to the growing art district in Durango through the creation of several murals. 
Olivia Thomas is a third year political science student and was lucky enough to spend the past year studying in Cali, Colombia. She is also studying Spanish, Native American Indigenous studies, and criminology. She plans on going to law school and focusing on immigration law. She has always wanted to be an activist, something that was influenced by her lesbian moms, her bilingual school with many immigrant families, and the Unitarian Universalist Church. After getting to go support the water protectors in Standing Rock and protest Trump's inauguration, she has come to see politics and law as some of the most effective means to create change, which is why she has put so much time and energy into the 2016 and 2018 elections, both as a volunteer and as staff. She is currently the Regional Director for House District 59's State Representative, Barbara McLachlan, works as a Spanish language tutor at Fort Lewis' Hispanic resource center, and is involved with the La Plata County Democrats and Indivisible Durango.

title: My Donation Page
summary:
Hello, I am King County Council Chair Larry Gossett, 
Please join me in supporting Tandy Williams, a National Delegate for Washington State who will travel to Charlotte, NC for the 2012 Democratic National Convention on September 1-7, 2012. 
She needs your HELP!! 
I have known Tandy all her life and watched her catch "Democratic Party fever" in the fall of   2007, heading into the 2008 Presidential election. She became one of the hardest workers in the state for the election of Barack Obama for President.
She saw a vacant spot in her neighborhood for a PCO, so she volunteered and then ran and was elected to the office. She has held that position now for 3 consecutive terms. She joined the 37th Legislative District Democrats, who recognized a need for her passion on the Executive Board so she ran and was elected as a State Committee Woman, a position she still holds today! 
Tandy has never met a stranger; she's willing to speak to the issues with everyone she meets. Doing what she calls her grass roots politics 101, she has become a really gifted party organizer and educator assisting and registering more voters than anyone else in our community.
That is why I ask you to help me to get Tandy to Charlotte. We need this Delegate at the convention representing our state, voting on the Democratic Platform and helping to secure the nomination for our candidate Barack Obama. 
This is a crucial election! We must get Obama elected. No one can better represent the inner-city of Seattle better than Tandy. Please help her cover her travel and boarding expenses by donating $100. Any help you can give is highly appreciated.  You can make your donations here on line or
Please make your checks payable to : Tandy Williams
 Mail to:                      Tandy Williams "“ National Delegate
                                     4543 Rainier Ave So
                                     Seattle, Wa 98118                   
Thank you, 
Larry Gossett
King County Council Chair
District 2

title: Raul for Sheriff
summary: I am a retired Police Officer with over 33 years Law Enforcement with 3 agencies. I am not a politician, but am running as a Democrat. I am not endorsed by any political group or organization, I am asking that I be endorsed by the voters in El Paso County Texas. I want serve all El Paso County Texas Constituents and not a political or group organization. As Sheriff I want to serve all El Paso Constituents regardless of political affiliation. Please help in endorsing me by your donations of any amount. I have many ideas and plans to make the El Paso County Texas Sheriffs Department it’s Deputies and Detention Officers a greater place to work and to maintain the highest training to better serve all El Paso County Texas Constituents. I will never make a promise I won’t keep. Politicians love to say and promise many things just for your vote, but after elected they forget what they promised. They forget that they are there for YOU!!! I will promise YOU that I will make positive changes that will benefit everyone in El Paso County Texas. Please help with your donations. Thank You
