title: Interfaith Classroom
summary: “It is easier to build strong children than to repair broken men“ - Frederick DouglassU.S. presidents pound nails for him. Celebrities paint walls. Corporations flex their bank accounts. Republicans and Democrats even work together without a hint of political strife....Ever since founding Habitat 25 years ago, Mr. Fuller and his wife, Linda, had a vision to unite people. The theology of the hammer, is when - People who may not agree on a whole lot else will agree that everybody deserves a simple, decent place to live, and so they come together to build a home.Sri Lanka has been through a bloody war for over 30 years. The reconciliation process has been slow and daunting. Communities are still divided and in despair. It is not the status quo that is daunting, but the damage to our youth that is defeating.As a Sri Lankan, I deeply care about the issues of peace, violence and the impact on women and children. I believe that  our commitments to engage and educate our youth must be a priority and a human call. The Interfaith classroom is a community service project that will bring together youth from diverse backgrounds, to collaborate , communicate and create a powerful road to reconciliation and co-existence.I am working with a brave woman, a committed teacher Shagary Arumugam to build a classroom with  the youth in her community, so they will be powerful vanguards for peace and reconciliation  in Sri Lanka. We plan to expand the project to other areas in the country. Please support this mission by a donation

title: Kendall's Surprise Trips of a Lifetime
summary: Kendall is in her senior year at Illinois State University.  She is majoring in Political Science and minoring in Spanish.  She is a full time student who supports herself - is paying her own way (some grants, scholarships and loans) both through school and living on her own.  She owns her own small business and also works a second part-time job. Kendall is currently taking 21 credit hours and has a prestigious internship with Illinois State University's Office of Sustainability. She is on the executive board of ISU's College Democrats and she is the social media manager for a new RSO - Students For Fair Trade. She is very passionate about her interests in social change and follows that passion up with action. Which is why all of the incredible opportunities have just come up for her.  Most within a matter of a couple of weeks.  As her mom, I am so incredibly proud of her. Todd and I want what's best for her and do not want her to miss out on these amazing trips and experiences.  But, we can't necessarily afford it. Some of these are partially paid for, some not.  And she will also be missing out on work each time she's gone. Kendall is such a hard worker and like her mom isn't great about asking for help.  Which is why I'm doing this for her. These are all happening after the first of next year and in the spring:1.) Trip to Washington D.C. with ISU's College Democrats2.) Trip to Costa Rica - Fair Trade Independent Study3.) Trip to California - Fair Trade Conference4.) Kendall was chosen to be in the 2020 Model United Nations in New York City!5.) Trip to Memphis, Tennessee for the Leaders of Social Change 20206.) Internship next semester with local law firm.Some money will be needed at the time of the trips, some before.  Airfares, hotels, food and all the expenses that come with these travel opportunities is going to be a challenge. Kendall definitely needs one good piece of luggage; I don't think just her duffel bag is going to be enough anymore. A passport is mandatory and a few pieces of new clothing for some of these events. Please don't hesitate to ask any questions and we will update as purchases are made and deadlines approach. Thank you very much for taking the time to read this and any and all donations are greatly appreciated.

title: We, Too, Are YU
summary: Pride never ends. That is why, on September 15th, the YU College Democrats are hosting a march and rally, beginning at Bennett Park and ending at the Wilf Campus, in support of more LGBTQ+ representation for YU students. For far too long, LGBTQ+ students have been forced into the closet by the administration. They are given a difficult time about hosting events and gaining approval for a Gay-Straight Alliance. They are hidden away, with YU leadership pretending they don't exist. We are marching to prove that LGBTQ+ students belong at Yeshiva University. Not only do they attend YU, but they ARE YU. Join us if you are part of the LGBTQ+ community, or an ally - friends, family, faculty, alumni - and believe that LGBTQ+ students deserve to be heard. Bring your flags, signs, and t-shirts! Let's show YU what we're made of. We need some extra help from you guys so we can have t-shirts, drinks, signs and equipment for the rally. Please pitch in even a small amount if you can so we can make this historic event happen!

title: Help Me Get to Washington!
summary: Hello! I am raising money to be able to attend the 2019 Carnegie International Nuclear Policy Conference and Advance Camp in Washington, DC! Since high school I have been incredibly interested in nuclear policy and national security. That interest is part of what lead me to study political science and international relations in college. I am seeking to further enrich my education in this field of interest by learning from the worlds experts:From the Carnegie Endowment’s Website :“International efforts to reduce nuclear risks are in deep turmoil. As we approach the thirtieth anniversary of the Carnegie International Nuclear Policy Conference, rising tensions among nuclear powers, technological developments, and doctrinal innovations are increasing the likelihood of nuclear use. The Iran deal faces serious challenges that could lead to its collapse. Perhaps the only bright spot is the Korean Peninsula, where a spike in threats in 2017 gave way to renewed hopes for peace in 2018. Meanwhile, a global effort to eliminate nuclear weapons—embodied in the Treaty on the Prohibition of Nuclear Weapons—is increasing strains between the nuclear haves and have-nots.We hope you will join over 800 experts and officials from more than forty-five countries and international organizations to debate—and explore solutions for—the most pressing challenges in nuclear nonproliferation, arms control, disarmament, deterrence, energy, and security.”At the same time, I will be attending Advance Camp with the Simpson College Democrats! Advance Camp is a networking and training conference for anyone interested in political optics and operations for Democratic campaigns on the national level, in preparation for the exciting 2020 Presidential campaign cycle. "Advance" staff on a political campaign arrive to a particular location ahead of the candidate (hence the name) and make all the preparations necessary for a successful campaign stop — from visual backdrops to crowd management to media logistics.All funds raised will go towards the registration fee and transportation to and from Washington, DC. I would greatly appreciate anything you’d be willing to donate!

title: NJ Young Dems Trip To Indy
summary:
On Tuesday Young Democrats from all over the country will be heading to Indianapolis for the Young Democrats of America 2019 National Convention. This convention is held every 2 years and this one is so important because of all the work ahead of us in 2020 locally and nationally. The conference consists of trainings, information sessions, caucus elections, caucus meetings, National YDA elections, and so much more helpful sessions for the delegates. All the delegates will have such useful information to bring home to their state and local chapters. 

This year we where blown away by the amount of responses we had in NJ to attend the convention. We have been working hard to raise all of the money necessary to cover costs for our large delegation. With 24 delegates attending that made our fundraising goal HIGH. WE ARE ALMOST AT OUR GOAL!!! Please help us out and help this diverse group of individuals from all over the stare of NJ get to Indy! The convention is July 17th-21st so time is of the essence! Thank you in advance for all of you support. 

Aimee Focaraccio 
Delegation Chair NJYD

title: Bob for House 43 seed money campaign
summary: Hi everyone! As you know, I've been looking at running a Clean Elections campaign for the Maine House of Representatives as a progressive Democrat representing parts of Portland and Falmouth. Prior to qualifying as a Clean Elections candidate, I can privately raise up to $1,000 in seed money to demonstrate support. After we qualify for public funding, I will be prohibited from raising any private funds.If you are interested in learning more about me or the campaign, please email me at BobforHouse43@gmail.com, and I will be happy to talk with you privately.This seed money would go to purchase campaign collateral for Election Day 2019, as well as website development and a mailer. Can you chip in?I am grateful for the encouragement of progressive friends and relatives thus far. Let's see how far we can go together.Thanks, Bob(P.S. - It's a $100 limit per person.)

title: YDAR for NEA Pride
summary: ASUYD and YDAR stonewall caucus are fundraising money for the first annual NEA Pride event. So that our event is inclusive, we are fundraising money so Young Democrats will be able to attend with support for travel and housing. The Young Democrats will be at the first annual NEA Pride as allies of the LGBTQ+ community, as well as members of it.

location: Shipton-Under-Wychwood, South East England, United Kingdom
title: Get Hugo to six universities in six months
summary: Help Hugo get to six universities in six months!Thank you for clicking on the link and taking a closer look at my GoFundMe! My name's Hugo, I'm a 17 year old A-Level student studying Maths, Chemistry, and History at Burford Academy. I'm really looking forward to university. I'm excited not only to make new friends but for the first time in my life I'm going to be living truly independently. I'll be taking care of myself, organising my own timetable, and studying a subject I want to spend the rest of my life doing. That's where my problem starts, and where you come in to help! I'm not really sure on what I want to study and where I want to study it. I've narrowed it down to three of the subjects I'm most interested in: Law, Chemistry, and History; and six universities: Oxford, Cambridge, Durham, Glasgow, York, or St. Andrews. Although Law is my preferred route, I want to explore a wide range of curricula and keep my options open as something might catch my eye and capture my passion.The problem is that this is all really expensive. My mum and I would have to travel over 2,100 miles (or 3,380 km) and pay for a total of nine night's accommodation:Petrol Cost:                                 £715.00Accommodation:                     £1350.00That's why I'm asking if you could help me raise £2,250. GoFundMe is going to take 8.5% commission off the top as well as 20 pence for every donation you make.Here's my CV if you'd like to take a look at my achievements and aspirations:https://docs.google.com/document/d/18Vlr4WQCo5zHc1DltNdi0h18ysbvkQ0VR4kd8OfQ96E/edit?usp=sharingIf you can't tell from my CV, I have a distinct passion for all things about people. I love stories, and I love listening to other people tell theirs' as well as telling them myself. It is who I am. It's because of this that I want to become an MP. I want to help the people left behind by the rest of society, the people who haven't been given the opportunity to live their dream and tell it to the rest of the world. I have felt like this ever since I took part in the theatre production More in Common (which some of you may have donated to), which was about homelessness. There is nothing that I am more passionate about than poverty. I am already so far, despite being so young,  the Membership Secretary for the Witney Liberal Democrats, managing over 350 members in my free time; and I don't want to stop my political career there.The way I see it, any one of these three subjects could take me many steps closer towards that goal. History is one of the most important things to learn about. Studying where we have come from is vital to contemplating where we should be going. With Chemistry, I can help save our planet through greater knowledge about our climate and the changes its experiencing, so that I may dispel ignorance. Law would give me a greater understanding of how our country functions, and allow me to really tap into my potential for public speaking. Please donate so that I may live my dream, whatever route I decide to take.Thank you!Hugo

title: Send Claire to the CA Democratic Convention
summary: The California Democratic Party (CDP) is having its state convention from May 31 thru June 2, 2019 in San Francisco.  I currently serve as the Chair of the Kings County Democratic Central Committee and as a Delegate to the CDP.  I am raising funds to cover the costs to attend this convention.  Here is an estimate of expenses:Hotel $900.00Train $82.00Cabs $100Food $400Registration $90CDP Dues $85Progressive Caucus Dues $25Rural Caucus Dues $20Senior's Caucus Dues $15Women's Caucus Dues $10As a grassroots volunteer in Kings County, I spend time and money to organize and attend meetings, rallies, protests and various events with the CDP, Kings County Democratic Central Committee (KCDCC) MoveOn, Indivisible Kings County, the Jimmy Carter Club, Swing Left, the American Civil Liberties Union (ACLU) and others.  The cost of attending this convention plus taking days off work put this event out of my budget.  I would appreciate any donation you can make to help me achieve my goal of attending the CA Democratic Convention and continuing to volunteer as a Democrat in central California.

title: Pharms - A Short Film
summary: OverviewIn a city where naked hippies are replaced by polished models of the modern tech-rush, how do rivaling siblings care for their parents while biases on healthcare and lifestyle clash? What better way to discuss legalization of marijuana and healthcare than film! We want to shoot "Pharms" and explore these issues in the city that represents them best: San Francisco. The film's crew and equipment are already funded! Your help will allow us to cover other expenses needed to shoot the story! Short SummaryThis is an independent project with an international production crew! We are a group of filmmakers via a locally run San Francisco film co-op called, Scary Cow. (See Below) "Pharms" was pitched to over 100 members of the co-op and garnered interest by a full crew's worth of renowned long-standing members as well as freshcomers."Pharms" is a unique short film that deals with the very relatable (and-all-too-pertinent-in-the-U.S.) topic of healthcare and treatment options.As a contributor, you are helping generate productive dialogue between two extreme views. You are also helping support a medium that fosters understanding, tolerance and inspiration.About the Film"Pharms" is about two siblings who try to navigate an increasingly subjective world and find a solution to illness despite their opposing beliefs in pharmaceuticals and alternative medicine.  It is a psychedelic dramedy saturated with visual and musical splendor. What We Need & What You GetWe want to raise $4,000.Not only will you get personally involved in the making of an intimately told story about two San Franciscan natives, but you will also qualify to be awarded some of our unique perks as well as neat add-on perks, "Pharms" swag.The total funds raised will pay our actors (as most projects in San Francisco don't pay actors adequately if you can believe it) craft service (a.k.a. food for the entire crew,) location fees, insurance, props, costumes, make-up artist and other miscellaneous expenses. It takes a village! The ImpactWhat if someone you love has a dangerous disease and the way they plan to cure themselves makes no sense to you? This project explores different perspectives of health, happiness and how empathy can help us improve our personal relationships.While more states are legalizing marijuana and other psychoactive, albeit natural, substances, major pharmaceutical companies still maintain their stronghold over mainstream American ethos when it comes to health care. Take a pill or smoke a joint? Is there a right or wrong way to approach healthcare or is it somewhere in between? Is a "between" possible amidst our binary society where democrats meet republicans, gay meets straight, or conservationism meets mass consumerism?This film depicts how it feels, within a spectrum of views, to give in to our prejudices clouded by biases, passive conditioning and social as well as academic education even in their most subtle forms and patterns.While these topics are heavy, "Pharms" highlights these aspects we all experience with a quirky, alternate-reality twist. About Scary CowScary Cow is a collectively run film company with members from the Bay Area with several screenings a year at the Castro Theater in San Francisco. Almost 70% of Scary Cow films have gone on to be screened at well known festivals such as Slamdance, Palm Springs, SF Indie Fest, and many more.http://www.scarycow.com Risks & StrengthsWhile Scary Cow is a volunteer organization and we will be drawing many of our resources from a collective effort, we can face challenges related to all aspects of film making. Every film has challenges.Many crew members are learning new skills in their roles so learning curves are a natural part of the process. Luckily, the crew on this project in particular happens to draw from Scary Cow's more notable and seasoned filmmakers. This means almost all new to the crew have a mentor. Our cinematographer, Bob Sitzwohl, for example, has a Film Theory and History degree from SFSU and worked in the industry as a gaffer on high end marketing and commercial pieces. After thirty years, he's been a Director of Photography and has won Best Cinematography awards from past Scary Cow screenings. Other Ways You Can HelpSome people just can't contribute monetarily, but that doesn't mean you can't help us!You can always help us by sharing this link with family and friends who love independent films, San Francisco, those that have opinions about healthcare, life and love to smoke the chronic! (Well, this being a non-biased film, we're not beyond cheap laughs.)And that's all there is to it. About the short's creator, Molly McGivern (in her own words)I am an S.F. native with Hawaiian-Portuguese and Irish decent and a B.A. in Psychology from McGill University and recently moved back from New York. I have a ranging span of credits on ABC's "Lost" as "Rosie," (actor) ''Indiana Jones and the Kingdom of the Crystal Skull" (crew), and smaller credits from the underground theatres of Montreal, New York, San Francisco and the historic Aloha Theatre in Hawaii as actor, writer and composer. I find myself trying new things, getting into trouble, curating lifestyles with each relocation and distilling authenticity like a thespianologist. I sing, play violin and other instruments, compose, surf, knit, make things, travel a lot, lived and volunteered globally and have won awards on some of my productions along the way. Themes have included implied dialogue, dreams, as above so below and also a choose-your-own adventure inter-galactic travel piece for the children's series of Montreal's Centaur Theatre. It was beyond an honor to have collaborated with the late Brazilian dramatist and creator of "Theatre of the Oppressed" and "Invisible Theatre," Augusto Boal at NYU. In Romania, I joined English Dramatherapy pioneer, Dr. Sue Jennings, and directed a play with Roma children inspiring tolerance among their communities. I drew from theatre and music as a medium in Hawaii's public schools and Mongolia, for educating orphaned children and those on the spectrum as well as family enrichment programs. Random "day jobs" I've explored ranged from macadamia nut and coffee farm manager to stage technician and to full-blown custodian at Montreal's indie music hub, Casa del Popolo. I hope these tidbits provide a glimpse of my explorative nature and "qualifications" as a fund-worthy storyteller and story-doer. These experiences have helped me conceptualize "Pharms" and set an intention for its purpose as a short film with wings.

title: Collin Pettit 2020 Delegate
summary: The DNC advocates for delegates to come from a diverse background, including LGBTQA members, minority groups, veterans, people with disabilities, and many more. But one group has been significantly left out, young people. Young Democrats are consistently ignored due to party leaders running for the position using their well-established influence over the party. Many of the people who will join this race already have established donor networks because they are elected officials and already have the money raised to fund their campaigns. I, however, have access to no money because and am hoping to fund this through grassroots fundraising. The money I raise will go towards printing out literature and allow me to build the infrastructure for a proper student-led, grassroots campaign.Donate 5$  or more and your name will be put in to win a 100$ Amazon gift card.

title: Roseland Collegiate Prep Ensemble
summary: My name is Diego Bernal-Skala, a senior at Cardinal Newman and a cellist at the Aspirante Youth Orchestra at Santa Rosa Symphony. I am currently teaching an eager group of six students. I am teaching an ensemble of four violinists, one cellist, and one violist at Roseland Collegiate Prep. I am currently doing this as a labor of love, as well as my service project. More information on my project and its progress can be accessed at this link. I teach these students because they had lost their music program after their relocation due to the Tubbs Fire. In order to compromise for the loss of their music class, I decided to make my own music program, inspired by the Simply Strings Program at Santa Rosa Symphony.My students want to be able to continue their studies throughout the summer, and they want to join the Santa Rosa Symphony's Summer Music Academy. However, they cannot participate because they rely on rental instruments from the Santa Rosa Symphony.At this point, I have raised approximately $600 in cash donations. I have set my original goal to $700 for instruments at the low end. However, this GoFundMe is intended to achieve that goal and cover any additional and incidental costs for this project. This project is intended as an ongoing project and will continue next year for my successor.I intend to successfully buy the instruments by May 1st, 2019. If I successfully get the right amount of funds for instruments, any extra funds will assist my students' admission to the Summer Music Academy.Thank you for keeping music education alive and well. The students have been able to enjoy their time learning about music, and they would like to learn more for the foreseeable future.Thank you for your support!UPDATE: I have recently won the Press Democrat Youth Service Award. Thank you very much for your support in the community and thereby helping music students in the community as well.

title: What is your truth ?
summary: WHAT IS YOUR TRUTH ?#truth2020beyondIt all started in Los Angeles, on October 6th, 2019 with Sophie Radermecker • An independent Belgian journalist living in Los Angeles for 10 years - co-author of "Warrior for Truth", the biography of Julian Assange , founder of WikiLeaks • One quest • One question • No budget • One laptop • One iPhone • Across the USA • Raw videos, no editing • Interviews of the faces of America • “What is your truth ?” • Beyond politics and all our differences, there is something much bigger that unifies us all • #truth2020beyondJoin the You Tube channel and watch the interviews : https://bit.ly/32t0bcn Join the Facebook page : www.facebook.com/truth2020beyond Follow the movement on Instagram : https://www.instagram.com/truth2020beyond/My story :As an independent journalist, co-author of "Warrior for Truth", the biography of Julian Assange  and an advocate for freedom of expression, I want to bring more awareness about this essential topic. A native of  Brussels, Belgium, I have lived in Los Angeles, CA since 2009 and observed the rapid changes in the political and social landscape within the United States.  I notice a lot of division, one year from the 2020 Presidential election.  During my project, "What is your truth?" across the faces of America, I will interview a large spectrum of individuals with the same questions. Deep questions that we are not used to asking or being asked: Who are you? What is your story? What brings you joy? What is your biggest fear? What are you proud of? Are you angry about something? Will you vote in 2020? Do you believe in something? What is the truth? What is your truth? In addition, as an Educator, I am delighted to give inspirational talks in schools and also interview personalities about the topic, along the way. The upcoming Presidential election is critical, and I felt it important that I begin my solo journey immediately. However, I don’t talk about politics with my interviewees nor are my questions focused on it. My intention is to show that beyond politics and all our differences, there is something much bigger that unifies us all. Could it be a truth that we can agree on?Friends, the truth can be frightening. I tried to secure funding: however, the media, production, and publishing companies I approached said there were no budgets to support my work or space to publish my interviews. On October 6th, without waiting for any hypothetical contribution, I left Los Angeles with $250 given by two generous donors who urged me to start this daring adventure. That implies no car, no budget, just a heavy backpack, a laptop and an iPhone. I am confident that all I need will be provided during my travels across the United States. From Los Angeles, CA to Albuquerque, NM to Kansas City, MO, then Des Moines, IO, Chicago, Il and now Pittsburgh, PA, I have already interviewed more than 40 individuals and have seen kindness and generosity in the people that I’ve met. My next destinations include Washington DC, Virginia, Kentucky, New Orleans, Texas and Arizona. My hope is to gain media attention and interest in "What is your truth?" and to collaborate on a professional documentary in 2020 with full equipment, crew and budget.I need your support to cover my expenses for the first part of this endeavor. Although some people I meet will host and feed me, I still have expenses for transportation, food, and miscellaneous items (e.g., equipment for the project), and I must cover my expenses at home. I plan to travel for three months, and $7,500 is a fair estimate for the funding I need. I’m immensely grateful for your support. Warmly, Sophie.First reviews : Tara Burgoyne, producer in Los Angeles, CAHi Sophie, I watched a few of your interviews, there's something about all of them that keeps you watching... you are capturing people and where they are at that very moment. I love the rawness and vulnerability you are bringing out of them. Above all, it feels like from my perspective that people just want to be seen and heard, they want to know they have a voice, they exist, above all, they want to feel connected to something and someone. I love that you are not editing any of them because it's often in the silent moments where the audience can see so much in the look on a face. For eg. Erick's interview was so fragile, he was clearly grieving the death of his mother, it was written all over his face, he was at times barely holding it together. I truly felt his grief, his sadness. Anyway, just wanted to send that out to you, this was all my perspective, of course, just thought I'd share. Keep going. I love that you are doing this... what an experience for you. Be safe. Lots of love. Tara Jennifer Baca Moya, homeschool mom in Albuquerque, NMSophie has embarked on an incredible journey to discover what one’s truth is, ultimately her purpose is to see if in fact us humans are not so divided and different as we sometimes think and that we do in fact have more in common which actually can unite us. Leah West Scherer, retired Christian in Des Moines, IOSophie is very warm and easy to talk to. She asked questions that made us think on a deeper level, and we continued to discuss some of the issues later. We enjoyed meeting Sophie! Mary Swalla Holmes, climate activist in Madrid, IOI was lucky to get to meet Sophie and be interviewed by her. It was a fun and relaxed process to answer her thoughtful questions. Connie Hernandez, entrepreneur, democrat in Kansas City, MOSophie has set out to answer the universal question - "What is truth?" Sophie is excellent at encouraging people to express their heart and their inherent wisdom. She is uncovering a depth of feeling across America that needs to be expressed. People longing for community and connection. People longing to express their truth and to share that. Follow this adventure and you will learn and love across America. Alex Lovette, hobo on the road of the USAAn interesting look at the many views and lives of so many strangers.More to discover...On my website:In English : www.sophieradermecker.com/en.htmlIn French : www.sophieradermecker.comOn my Facebook page as a journalist, writer and speaker : www.facebook.com/larondedespossibles

title: Ian's College Fund
summary:
Hello, anyone and everyone. My name is Ian Bell, a soon-to-be college freshman at the University of Michigan - Ann Arbor. On December 19th, 2018, I was accepted to the College of Literature, Sciences, and the Arts (LSA) and was given an 'estimated financial aid package' that made my total cost of attendance to be around $10,000. Given that my father had recently become unemployed, I was ecstatic at the almost 85% coverage that the package had; although any cost of attendance would not be affordable for me and my family, I, at least, would not have to take out such a huge loan for such an amazing educational opportunity. Then, the unthinkable happened. Soon after I committed to UMich, my 'Official Award Notice' came to our attention via a phone call with the Financial Aid Office. Since I was currently attending the Arkansas School for Mathematics, Sciences, and the Arts (ASMSA)-- a rigorous, public, residential high school in Hot Springs, AR--, I was unable to talk to the financial aid office myself and heard the news second-hand from my mother, and, let's just say, that was not my best week for me. The initial reason for the phone call was my curiosity in seeing if there was any possibility for an increase in my financial aid, with my recent receipt of the prestigious Arkansas Governor's Distinguish Scholarship of $10,000. The actual news I received then is similar to the news I recently received this past week, which was my financial aid package being dramatically reduced, making my total cost around $37,000 (subsidized & unsubsidized loans included). The recent news regarded my appeal for more financial aid, which unfortunately only increased my aid by $1,000.I have since applied for a plethora of scholarships to make some sort of dent in such a hefty price tag, given the commitment I made to the University and the timing of such news, but have received no such luck. However, I have been making progress toward working on this situation myself, luckily receiving an amazing, paid summer research internship at the University of Arkansas for Medical Sciences (UAMS). Although it will not even begin to cover the cost, at least it will pay for the flights to Ann Arbor in the fall (with good research experience being an added benefit-- we're analyzing a possible therapy for breast cancer right now!) In short, I am in a very precarious situation; I am scared and have begged the question, "Why am I in such a set of unfortunate events?" multiple times. In the future, I hope to work for the Center for Disease Control, the World Health Organization, or UNICEF as an Infectious Disease Specialist/Researcher, which will be enormously helped by an education at UMich (which explains my unwavering desire to make this work). Although I do not feel entitled to better financial circumstances, I just hate how it seems like all my hard work these past four years is being put to waste. 

For qualification's sake, at ASMSA, I was a Student Ambassador, Human Rights Club President, Non-Profit Henna Art Club "Henna 4 Help" Vice President, Young Democrats Secretary, and Interact Public Relations Officer. Academically, my ACT is 33, my weighted GPA is 4.30, and my unweighted GPA: 3.93. Anything will help, thank you for listening to my story.

title: Bill Switalla's Lawyer Fund
summary: Shawano County Supervisor William Switalla did such a deed for the county, but instead of the county expressing appreciation for an act of kindness that he expected no compensation for, it decided to bring felony charges against him and threaten him with prison time. The next time someone asks why people don’t volunteer anymore, we should all point to this case and say that it’s true that no good deed goes unpunished. Who in their right minds would want to perform good deeds when the payback is jailhouse bologna sandwiches and years of wearing prison scrubs in the most hideous colors imaginable? Rewinding to April 2018, Switalla was among a number of folks with the county government who checked out the property on Webb Street in Wittenberg that the county acquired. He offered to clean some of the garbage off the property, and among the trash was a grill. Switalla removed said grill, prompting ire from county officials, so he returned it. That should have been the end of the story, but the county decided to make Switalla the poster child for why you should never try to take something from the government. The property had been returned, and yet the county still wanted to label Switalla a thief. Let’s look at the wasted man- hours — the time spent investigating the matter, the time spent on appointing a special prosecutor because having a Shawano County district attorney trying to lock up a county supervisor is a conflict of interest, and the time spent in court for what was ultimately something that could have been resolved with a stern warning from the county. What was the end result? Deferred prosecution and 40 hours of com- munity service. Yep. That’s an efficient use of our taxpayer dollars. Why don’t we try to score death sentences for jay- walkers while we’re at it? The grill in question was de- scribed in Leader news stories as “rotten out” and garbage. Outside estimates put the value of the grill at $2 to $2.50, but County Treasurer Deb Wallace claimed it was worth $100. Maybe in mint condition, but if trash was really worth money, we’d all be sending our broken furniture, appliances and other large items to a recycling center instead of the landfill. Many of the major players in this melodrama, even the special prosecutor, Michael Balskus, agree that Switalla did not use the best judgment by removing trash before offically getting the county’s blessing, but that what he did was not a criminal offense. How has justice been served by dragging this through the courts? How many other counties or municipalities would go to this extreme over something that was ultimately returned? The case would probably still be going on — Switalla and his attorney were originally asking for a jury trial — had the two sides not come to an agreement. Could you imagine the testimony that would have taken place, the strange logic county officials like Wallace would have used to justify the need to throw someone in prison for property that Switalla had returned?  What would have happened if, in some bizarro world, Switalla had been convicted? Forget the prison sentence for a moment and realize that, with a felony count, he would have lost his county seat and his position as president of the Wittenberg Village Board, since felons cannot serve in elected positions. I realize Switalla’s a Democrat in a county considered a Republican stronghold, but is a junk grill worth destroying someone’s political ambitions?

title: Hornchurch & Upminster Parliamentary Election
summary: I’m the anti-establishment and pro-Brexit candidate taking on the establishment parties (Conservatives, Labour, Greens, and the anti-democratic Lib Dems) in the Hornchurch and Upminster constituency at the general election on the 12th of December 2019.Your support will help me to compete against the establishment parties.There should be a level playing field in elections but I have contested parliamentary elections where each of the large parties will regularly spend between £50,000 and £100,000 for each constituency. I'm looking for help in paying for about 50,000 high-quality leaflets to be sent to each household, just like the other parties.Your help will be greatly appreciated, and any money raised will go only towards the parliamentary election in Hornchurch and Upminster.The British National Party is the original Brexit party, and we have campaigned against a political union in Europe since 1982.The Prime Minister, Boris Johnson, told everyone that we would be leaving the European Union on the 31st of October 2019.Furthermore, he said that he would rather be dead in a ditch than ask for a Brexit delay.However, it did not happen because he’s still alive!Brexit BetrayalThe Conservatives have had three and a half years to get us out of the European Union, and yet we are still in it.Theresa May had her slogan - No Deal is better than a bad deal - but still could not get us out of the EU.Now Boris Johnson has his slogan — Get Brexit Done — but has effectively abandoned Northern Ireland as part of his weak ‘Brexit deal’.The Labour Party promised to respect the result of the referendum but now says it wants the option to ‘remain in the EU’ on the ballot paper of a second referendum.A second referendum is anti-democratic because we have already decided to leave in the EU referendum 2016.It's democratic to implement the result of the 2016 referendum.Despite promising to respect the result of the EU referendum, the anti-democratic Liberal Democrats want to revoke Article 50 and remain in the European Union.When a democracy refuses to implement the result of its own democratic voting system, it ceases to be a democracy!The political establishment doesn’t want any Brexit at all.That’s why after nearly three and a half years, we are still in the EU.The ruling elite hopes that people will get fed up, and they will abandon their desire for independence.Furthermore, the outgoing European Council President Donald Tusk has interfered in the forthcoming general election by urging Remainers not to give up on stopping Brexit. Why I'm standing in this electionThe UK should have left the European Union on 31st October 2019. I’m the only true Brexiteer in the country that is willing to face the establishment parties in the general election 2019 with no reservations, restrictions, or excuses.People are assuming that Brexiteers will be voting for the Tories — not true!Many Labour Leave voters will never vote Conservative.One such Leave voter told me that they would rather cut their arms off than vote Tory.Similarly, many Conservative Remain voters will never vote for Labour or the anti-democratic Lib Dems.For these voters, party loyalty is more important than their views on EU membership.Another assumption is that all Conservative MPs will be Brexiteers —not true!For example, the Tory replacement for Anna Soubry in the Broxtowe constituency is Darren Henry, a Remainer! Therefore, you cannot trust any of the establishment parties - that’s why I’m standing in this election!I’m the only candidate that demands a REAL Brexit!Boris Johnson’s appeasement has emboldened the European Union, making it think that we don’t have a backbone.As explained in the video, the UK needs a simple trade deal with the EU — without political union.We should say to the EU: What tariffs do you want to put on our exports to you? If it’s 10%, then we will put 10% on your exports, and if it’s 20%, then we will put 20% on your exports to us.The UK is the largest export market for the European Union.We pay £1bn a month for the ‘privilege’ of running up a colossal £80bn trade deficit with the EU.So, a trade war would hurt them more than it hurts us.The solution is a zero % tariff rate, which would solve the Irish border problem.However, the European Union will only agree to this if we have ‘regulatory alignment’. In other words, they want us to have automatic alignment with EU rules on social security, the environment, state aid, immigration, and a whole host of other regulations. It’s all part of the European Union’s desire to create a European Empire, which is hell-bent on destroying the sovereignty of all member nations.We should tell the EU that the integrity of the UK is not open for negotiation, and we don’t want ‘regulatory alignment’ — a euphemism for political union. So, Boris Johnson’s deal is not a real Brexit — it’s a Brexit in name only.Let’s have a real Brexit and use the £39bn saved to help the NHS and eradicate poverty in the UK.Thank you,David Furness

title: Purchase an AR15 before Gov. Cuomo says no!!

title: Clean All Veteran Headstones by Memorial Day 2020
summary: Patriotic Americans are going to clean the algae and grime off every veteran headstone in America by Memorial Day, May 25, 2020. What we've allowed to happen to veteran headstones located outside of National Cemeteries is disgraceful. Too often, black algae, lichens, and grime are so thick it's difficult to read the military veteran's name. Yes, this is a huge undertaking, but cleaning some built-up organic growth off a few million iconic marble monuments is nothing compared to what those men and women in uniform sacrificed for us. We live in a desperate time in our nation's history when we need something of a sacred purpose to rally around as Americans. When we work together toward the common goal of cleaning veteran headstones by Memorial Day, it won't matter whether that soldier, sailor, or airman beneath that marble stone was conservative or liberal, white or black, Republican or Democrat, Protestant or Catholic, rich or poor, North or South. What will it take to clean all the once beautiful white, now disgracefully dirty, iconic marble monuments that collectively represent the true cost of freedom?  It'll take volunteers willing to get down on their hands and knees, spray bottles filled with D/2 Biological Solution, bathroom scrub brushes, water, and American pride. This effort of showing respect and honoring all of our most important heroes is way past due.Time is of the essence, so please make your contribution to this worthy cause now. We have much to do during the limited number of days leading up to Memorial Day.

title: 32nd Birthday!
summary: Hey friends, today I celebrate my 32nd Birthday. In all honesty, my 30’s have been harder than I expected. In May of 2018 I was diagnosed with Testicular Cancer. After talking with my family, and my doctors, I made the decision to have surgery to remove the malignant tumor. My life changed forever.Thinking I had dodged a bullet, I returned to work. In November, during my last Young Democrats of America meeting (I did not know that at the time) I received a call that confirmed my worst fear. The cancer had spread to my lung and lymph nodes. I returned to Salt Lake City, confused and demoralized. In January, I made the decision to take medical leave, undergo an aggressive form of chemotherapy, and fight for my life. Today I am happy to say that I’m in remission, and there doesn’t seem to be any sign of cancer in my body. My battle with cancer and the chemotherapy after, have forever changed me. My battle is not yet over.For my 32nd Birthday, I’m going to focus on my own health. Any funds raised will go to me in aid of that quest. I’m planning on focusing on my mental health and psychical health. I’m choosing to focus on this aspect of my life not because there aren’t deserving organizations out there, but because the chemo in my body is going to take a long time to be expelled. It’s toxic nature is slowing me down, and the only way to fight it, is to stay active, and engaged. Lastly, I want to say thank you to everyone who reached out over my yearlong battle with Cancer. My friends and family have been amazing pillars of support. You have helped guide me though the loss of my father, my life long battle with Fabry Disease, and now my battle with cancer. You have helped me pursue my dreams in fighting for a more just world, and held me accountable when I have strayed. You continue to be a source of inspiration and strength when times have looked dark. Thank you! Your friendship is the only gift I need this birthday. But just in case you have money to spare, feel free to help pay for my next year gym membership.

title: Black Conservatives for Change
summary: Our names are Pierre Wilson and Charrise Lane. We are young black conservatives looking to inspire change in the black community. We believe the Democratic Party has taken advantage of our community and we want to put an end to it. Through their various social programs, they incentivize the removal of the father from the home. They’ve also prioritized illegals above the black community, and even worse, they promote the mass killing of black babies through ABORTION! We believe that conservative values are the right values. We believe in low taxes, limited government, the second amendment, protecting the life of the unborn, and much more. Also, President Trump has done tremendous work for the black community through criminal justice reform, the urban revitalization act, opportunity zones, HBCU funding, and so much more. We are well aware that the facts are on our side, but this battle isn’t easy. Black people are prideful people and we often face attacks from the left. We are called “coons,” “boot lickers,” “Uncle Tom,” and much more but still, we press on. But we need your help. Please understand that we travel to HBCU’S, forums, summits, low income neighborhoods, and more in an attempt to spread conservative values to a community that doesn't ever hear about them. These trips are costly and with Charrise still in school, financially it is not easy to always travel. Any donation you give will go towards this cause. If you follow us on social media than you are already aware of the work we’ve been doing. If you don’t follow us, we encourage you to do so (pages are below). This is the best way to know your donation is going to a good cause! So we ask you to give only what you can if you believe in the values we shared above. The Democratic Party can’t afford to lose any of the black vote. Even a 10% shift would cause them to lose almost every election. So be part of the journey of freeing our people from the grip the democrats have had on our community for years!Thank you, God bless you, and God bless America. #KAG #MAGA #BLEXIT-Pierre and CharriseInstagram: @CharriseLane @PierreNWilsonTwitter: @CharriseLane @ThePierreWilsonFacebook: Charrise Lane Pierre N. Wilson

title: 9/11 Memorial at Washburn University
summary: Hello! The students and faculty of Washburn University in Topeka, Kansas are wanting to set up a 9/11 Memorial on campus, consisting of 2,977 American flags, to honor the lives that were lost on September 11th, 2001. We learned that a good portion of our Freshman class do not know much about 9/11, so we are wanting to make this 9/11 Memorial on campus an educational experience for them by telling them what happened and why we will never forget. Our campus did a 9/11 Memorial last year and it was very successful. Like last year, the Washburn University College Republicans and Washburn University College Democrats are partnering together again this year in sponsoring the 9/11 Memorial. Here are some links to articles about the 9/11 Memorial we did last year:https://www.ksnt.com/news/washburn-students-plant-2996-flags-for-victims-of-9-11-attacks/https://www.wibw.com/content/news/Topekans-remember-those-lost-on-911-492996611.htmlhttp://www.washburnreview.org/news/wu-student-organizations-join-forces-to-commemorate/article_e632da6e-b625-11e8-8a03-e7ea119cc443.htmlTo make this happen, we need financial help. Our goal is $400 because we need to purchase more flags for the 9/11 Memorial, equipment to set it up, and food and beverages for the students, faculty, and community that will help set up the 9/11 Memorial the night before 9/11. Please help us reach our goal. Our campus is very proud to have two different political groups and a variety of students and faculty on campus work together on this project, which is rare these days.  If you like what we're doing, please consider donating. Any amount will help and be very much appreciated. We are hoping to reach our goal by Tuesday, September 10th.If you live close to Topeka, Kansas and would like to help set up the 9/11 Memorial the night before 9/11, please send us an email at bonski88@gmail.com and we will send you more information.Thank you so much! Below are some pictures that were taken last year.

title: We the people will not be intimidated!
summary: My Name is Adrian Krieg; I was a manufacturing CEO for 37 years, then an expert witness and management consultant and turn around specialist. Beginning in 1998 I began authoring books on money, economics, history, politics, social issues and even an autobiography. In the last 21-years I have written over 25 books and countless articles. I am a regular contributor to The Nationalist Times, wrote the editorials for The Sovereign for ten years, and am a regular contributor to numerous publications in Europe as well as America. I do all my own research, and have foretold the disadvantages of NAFTA and other poor trade deals in 1992 when it was enacted as an EO. My company A2Z Publications LLC is a labor of love for my adopted America and the education of her citizens; I am a legal immigrant from Switzerland. I realized back in the 80’s that things were going in the wrong direction for our country. We were heading for socialism, having been brought up during WWII in Switzerland; I am very familiar with this failed economic system, which invariably ends as a totalitarian dictatorship. The new Democrats call it progressive, which is nothing but another word for socialist. My company’s problem relates about the fact that even though we have sold over 100,000 books over 20-years, A2Z Publications LLC has never been profitable.Last spring our printers Lighting Source canceled our 17-year longstanding contract, which required us to find a new printer, which we were able to do, but at increased cost. Then the hammer was dropped, when Ingram the largest in the world, book distribution company also canceled our agreed contract; as usual in other similar cases, neither company gave any rational reason for the 30-day cancellations. This created a situation that structurally eliminated our ability to sell books outside America. You see; books are too expensive to ship overseas $22.40 for one book to the EU. Lighting Source has printing plants in England and Australia those markets are now closed to us. In one move publication and distribution eliminated half of our market-potential. Ingram listed all our titles that were then entered into the book-distribution sites used by booksellers; by canceling our agreement Ingram blocked our listings in the retail trade.I am now over 80-years of age, and would like to be able to advertise the books widely, this is not affordable for A2Z. I would like you to consider funding A2Z, anyone who funds with over $40, will on request be given an autographed book of their choice from the available list on our site: www.a2zpublications.com *(excluding Before Departing)As a veteran of the U.S. army and patriot, I hope you can consider funding us. All funds will be used for advertising books in various pro-American publications and to fund direct mail and e-mail information to potential buyers. Our detractors like SPLC have spared no effort to slander my name and have labeled A2Z a hate Group—it is a corporation, not a group, which has never inferred hate against anyone or anything.How will I know that funds will be used as claimed? I have been in business for over 50-years and have never cheated anyone. 100% of any monies donated will be used as directed on this page.A2Z Publications LLC is a legitimate Nevada corporation. A2Z is not involved with any political party or any politicians. Contributions to A2Z are not tax deductible, however book purchases all of which are non-fiction are tax deductible as an education expense.

title: Help fund my dissertation research!
summary:
I am studying the social and psychological factors that influence political polarization for my dissertation. America has become more polarized than ever and this continues to grow at an unsustainable rate. My research will consist of two experiments. The first will determine if increasing self-esteem can decrease negative feelings for the political outgroup and also make partisans process information more objectively. The second study will collect data on the types of people Democrats and Republicans talk to and then assess what components of personal discussion networks are associated with reduced polarization. The goals of the project are to expand academic knowledge, but also generate possible ways to reduce polarization.I will be collecting data from Democrats and Republicans online. I will pay them to participate in my study and there will be a total of 580 participants. The total cost to pay them is $1,202. I also need to purchase a student subscription to Qualtrics software so I can run my experiments online. This costs $95 and brings the total to $1,297. Thankfully, I received a $1,000 research award from my department so I only need to cover the remaining $297.I will definitely share the results of my work with the public once I am done! I aim to collect data by the end of October 2019, write up my findings in my dissertation during the next few months, and then finish my PhD by the summer of 2020. Here is my website to check out my previous research and other work. 

Thank you so much!

title: Wm "Dave" Martin Houston City Council AL #3
summary: WILLIAM “DAVE” MARTINCANDIDATE FORHOUSTON CITY COUNCIL AT LARGE PLACE #3  2019My name is William Dave Martin, I am running for Houston City Council At Large. The City Council has been traditionally non partisan, that is a sham. There is no place today for a thinly disguised Republican representing the working class people of Houston. The color of ones collar is not a distinction, if you must budget your income you are working class. Get use to it and vote with your class. Any candidate who supports or has supported Trump or his party should boldly admit they approve of his policies and morality I am running openly as an FDR Democrat. I am retired from Harris County Engineering, I live on my Social Security and County pension. I am not on the board of any bank, engineering company, real estate agency, development firm, or special interest. My moral compass is my own, I am not for sale. I am free to use my God given brain and compassionate ethics to concentrate on the welfare of Houston's working class and the employees of the City of Houston, including its Police, Fire Department and First Responders.I am a home owner occupying the same house in Sharpstown my wife and I purchased when we moved to Houston when the Sharpstown Mall was grand and the Clock of Texas was an attraction. We raised 3 sons who still live in the area. We are stakeholders in maintaining the safety, integrity, and value of our little piece of Houston. I plan as a City Councilman to vote to protect the property values of citizens who love their neighborhoods and are concerned about deterioration from slumlords, commercialization and corporate creep.As a recent retiree from Harris County I enjoy a decent retirement and am thankful someone in the past took an interest in structuring it and the health care benefits I enjoyed during my employment. I plan as City Council member to focus on benefits that keep Houston's valuable employees and encourage new talent to join them. So often Councilmen with lofty occupations forget who is doing the heavy lifting. I am retired and can devote my attention to the City.I was born in Fort Worth, Texas, attended Texas Christian University earning a BA in Geology and Mathematics, and studied computer programming at Southern Methodist University. I studied Anatomy & Physiology at Baylor College of Medicine and Counter Terrorism at Naval Post Graduate School. I worked as Assistant Geologist at then Texas Highway Department and as an Analyst at Mid Continent Geophysical Corp. following as Geologist at Geo-Technical Corp Dallas, Texas. I served as an Intelligence Analyst and was contracted to DOD holding a Top Secret clearance. I have been a medical electronics salesman and a small business owner. Most recently (past 10 years) I worked as Special Projects Mgr., Harris County Engineering.I served in the Naval Reserve and as an ELINT analyst during the Viet Nam War. I am a member of AFIO, Association of Former Intelligence Officers, I hold a Federal Firearms License and a Concealed Carry Permit. I believe a background check should be a mandatory for gun ownership. I am Harris County Democratic Precinct 311 Chairman. I am a member of Sharpstown Democrats. I will be on the November 2019 ballot for Houston City Council At Large. .Please vote for me I will appear as William “Dave” Martin. I can be contacted by cell 713.885.1885, by fax 713.772.4425, and by email dave2578@att.net, and on Facebook

title: I like money
summary: Go fund me has done a lot of great things for a lot of people, but let’s face go fund me is little more than the internet equivalent of the person on the corner with the cardboard sign. With that being said let me grab my cardboard, marker, and begin this story. Like a lot of people I have a family and things get expensive and the more your family grows the more expensive things get.   I am living the American dream. I have a house, a car, a loving family and a job that for the most parts keeps the bills paid.  You see this and may be wondering why I would start a campaign if my family is relatively healthy and I don’t need a transplant at the current moment.   The truth is I want to pay off everything and retire.   Please keep reading it gets better and I explain my retirement plan with your money.  Later I’ll explain why you should donate.If this his campaign makes it to $100,000 I’ll pay off what is left on my house and other debt I have. At $200,000 I’ll pay everything off and remodel the house and buy the wife a new suv to fit the growing family.  We got another kid on the way. It seems like the only think I know to pull out is money from the bank account. If if this makes it into the million range I’ll get me a financial adviser and invest it. If this hits the goal of $5,000,000 then I will retire from my current place of employment in a manner that many people will find inspirational and awesome and in a way that they wish they could leave their job.  If this thing blows up and surpasses the goal and hits $10,000,000 then things get real stupid. After making sure I’ve got my finances taken care of then it’s  Lamborghini top speed through a pasture drop half a million on a house party  kind of stupid.   I’ll also open a couple different small business ideas I have. I’ll also have a monument to the greatest dog that ever made it into my life built. I’m talking a big, annoy the neighbors size monument.Ill probably even go around the world eating all kinds of food and fill my Pokédex on Pokémon go.Now for the why you should donate. If if you want to see someone do something amazing and stupid chunk a couple dollars this way. If if you cheated on your spouse and want to get the guilt off your chest donate and leave an anonymous comment, I won’t judge you. If you are a republican think of it as investing in a new business that you might one day shop at. If you’re a democrat think of it as spreading the wealth and helping out someone.If you like sloths throw some money my way, because with this amount of money it doesn’t matter how many times my wife says no I’m buying that damn sloth.Pretty much give me some money and put whatever crazy thing you want in the comment section . If you love trees say it. If you hate koalas use the comment section to spew your hatred for the misunderstood marsupial If 1,000,000 people donate $5.00 then the goal is reached. If $5,000,000 donate $5.00 then this will become the most successful go fund me to this date. Alright internet let’s see if we can get to lambo in a pasture levels or just me retiring early. And if this gets to the goal don’t worry I’ll bring y’all along for the resignation.

title: REVOKE REAL ID
summary: Dr. Shelli Manuel Landon is a veteran of Washington DC legislative processes, having successfully, anchored an unanimous US Senate Vote on her resolution #550 in 2014, to Preserve the Star Spangled Banner, and to officially recognize it's 4th verse, and to educate American children and extend it's  Bicentennial celebrations, in spite of fierce opposition to banish it!  Her SingItAmerica.com website and event on the Lincoln Memorial was officially recognized as part of the government commission's website, StarSpangled200.     Shelli and her team, enjoyed working with both Republican and Democrat members on that project to acquire 4 sponsors producing 6 drafts, having given presentations to members of Congress and political activists , military and educators. As a member of the National Press Club, she also hosted press conferences..     Currently, she is working with local state and federal legislators in both Congress and the Senate, as well as Governors and other factions of government on the project to push another successive resolution to Congress for join majority vote to REVOKE the REAL ID Act and driver's license.     Dr. Manuel-Landon and her husband, Barry, live in Tulsa, OK, in a state that is resisting the Real ID Act.     Funding is needed to facilitate that.  REVOKEREALID.com tells the whole story.God Bless You and God Bless America!​Sponsor Dr. Shelli and her teams,Travel, fees, publications, media costs, web site costs etc..

title: Intelligent Idiot Needs Your Help
summary: You decide:Am I an intelligent idiot? Will you help me to continue to be one?And, thereby, I will do more for you than any person you don't know.Of my bona fides for being intelligent, people usually think I am a liar. Why? I tell them that I graduated from the largest university in Illinois cum laude in two years. One semester, I ace'd 24 hours. (transcript ) I set a similar record in the US Navy's electronic school. My record final score contributed to my assignment to help maintain one of the first two cell phones They were for the US President to conduct war. At nineteen, I was the youngest of 88 ET's tasked with the job.When people read my resume, they again think I am a liar. Wrong "L"-word. Right "L"-word: Lucky! I was gifted with a fine brain in which I take no pride per se. I find my brain a source for self-deprecation:I am a deviant because most people IQs are within 3 standard deviation of the average. I am a 4.61 deviant. Or, how do you tell really smart people? Most people want to buy a smart pill to be smarter. Really intelligent people price-shop lobotomies.My high school classmates elected me "most witty" probably because I was a banner boy . My jokes are pointed and sometimes bad. I told my mother-in-law that I was going to improve my jokes by spending some money at a joke school. She said it would be faster and cheaper to buy duct tape.If I am so intelligent, why did I graduate about 190 out of 400 seniors in high school? Because I was frying hamburgers 40-50 hours a week to survive. I did not have time to do the homework. But I was learning in the classroom, scoring 98% on college boards.My work ethic was acquired early-on. I left home at age 8, self-supporting by shining shoes 40-50 hours a week. A lie? You decide--see "I did not kill my mother ."At age 25, I realized that I had had five life mentors who helped me escape poverty and depravity. When asked how could I repay them, they all said the same thing: Pass it on. From them I derived that "Help that does not help the helpless to self-help is, in fact, not help."I passed it on in my various businesses where I had a youth employment section for high schoolers. Almost all were from lower social economic condition as I was. I told them at the start that they were not hired to be my friend and that they could not get rich working after school. If they did not learn the work ethic--solving problems--then they would be out the door. For several summers I funded a Work Ethic School  with the students formulating 14-point poster .For many years, I would get that call from a former young employee who realize they were doing better in life because of my tutelage. Universally, they said they did not, at the time,  like me because of my tough love. My best thanks came from a chocolate fellow of about 50 years of age. (I like the terms chocolate and vanilla instead of blacks and whites.) In a park, I was approached by Chris who inquired if I was Bob Barnett. When I said yes, he responded that he was in upper-middle management of a large information company. He also said that each time he ponder why he escaped the projects, why he had no drug problems, and why he had not ended up in a jail or down in a grave, he said it all came back to working for me in high school 30 years ago. I would not trade that thanks for all the money in the world.I abdicated from academia in graduate school because of the widespread hypocrisy. My intellectual curiosity did not abate. Consistently with my businesses, besides the youth employment, I had research assistants on the payroll to investigate and answer questions about the nature of time. (This was before Google.) Often 25% of payroll went for the researchers. I had more research time than if I was a professor with duties. A series of books were written in the 1970s and 1980s.When I found that hired computer programmers demanded double pay after six months, I became a programmer to avoid retraining and re-acquainting new graduates. My resume shows, again, some top-shelf computer achievements--see "Entrepreneur sees solutions from computers ."My greatest intellectual achievement is Timism: The Morality of More Time . Timism has been my intellectual mistress since 1971. There are many definitions of time. However, if one limits time to two variables, one can construct a T.O.E. (theory of everything) from physics to religion. The primary time variable is the measurement of the event (entity) from start to finish. The secondary time variable is the value of that event on other events with which the event interacts. Events are interactively creative or cancerous fostering stability of instability.An event measurement can be a split-second, a lifetime or an eon. An event's time value can be dependent upon the environment of other events. Consider the time value of yelling "fire" in crowded venue when there is or isn't a fire. Time gain/loss can be quantified on the continuum from love to hate, that is, from the giving of time to the taking of time. Friends give time while enemies take your time. Politicians waste your time in over-taxation and wasteful spending.Once one focuses on time, as defined above, one sees the stamp of time directly or indirectly in all the schools of thought:Einstein's relativity ... periodic table of elements is a periodic table of periodic times ... mentality--no sense of time, no sense of self ... economics--time is money, money is time ... politics--solving time-wasting problems ... religions--timeless existence.Time is the thread in the fabric of life. One truism is that the spin bars or bares the reaction (1981 reference as D.L. Spinbar: Dibs Lifehourious Spinbar ). Most interestingly, the linear speed of light is an epiphenomenon of the basic particle's rotational speed and precession angle. When time of existence is equated with stability, then gravity is the basic, universal form of time from which all other time and stability derives.Timism is a great heuristic tool, an intellectual Columbus to explore new, undiscovered areas of thought. Along the way in exploring and delineating Timism, some ancillary insights were derived.  For instance, in 1982 I wrote Oil Droughts  which predicted worsening droughts at the mega-sources of CO2 (e.g., California) with downwind deluges and flooding. (List of essays on climate change.) The most important essay is the summary of research: CO2--The Global, Multi-Tasking Killer Molecule which is crowdfundable .401ks are the biggest bank robbery in history. In a zero-sum world, 401ks enrich a few while the middle-class loses its retirement time. As lotteries are a tax on those who do not know math, 401ks are a tax on the muddled-class who igknow math. People's time awareness is obscured by an obsession on funny numbers on funny papers.To have the same standard of living as it had in 1980, the average middle class family must  annually work 12 weeks longer. People are economic lemmings when they focus on the symbols of their time rather than the substance of their time. More funny numbers on funny paper is a poor substitute for more free time and a lower cost of living in the real wealth, your time. Would you like to see an end to the cancerous 401ks that are killing your retirement. Please help me. There are simple solutions.24in4 : Share job time or jobless time. One taxes and spends. The other borrows and splurges. title: Send TPS holders to DC:  Lobbying & Summit
summary: [Please scroll down for English]La Campaña TPS para la Residencia Permanente exige legislación del Congreso. Estamos recaudando fondos de viaje para permitir que los titulares de TPS del Área de la Bahía participen en los esfuerzos de cabildeo, así como en marzo y Cumbre, en Washington, DC, del 1 al 3 de diciembre. Los esfuerzos de cabildeo se centrarán en el Senado de los Estados Unidos y la SECURE Act.Esperamos enviar 6 titulares de TPS, así como 1 hijo ciudadano estadounidense de un titular de TPS.El Comité TPS (Estatus de Protección Temporal) para la Residencia Permanente Now es una organización de base con sede en el Área de la Bahía y miembro de la Alianza Nacional TPS. Estamos trabajando para obtener un camino hacia la residencia permanente para más de 350,000 titulares de TPS de 13 países, incluidos El Salvador, Nicaragua, Haití, Sudán, Nepal y Honduras.Desde junio de 2017, cuando el Departamento de Seguridad Nacional anunció la finalización del programa TPS, hemos hecho campaña para obtener la residencia permanente. Hoy, los titulares de TPS no son elegibles para solicitar tarjetas verdes a pesar de vivir en nuestras comunidades durante décadas. La comunidad de TPS incluye 250,000 niños ciudadanos estadounidenses. La legislación del Congreso que proporciona un camino hacia la residencia permanente es vital para mantener unidas a las familias.El cambio legislativo es vital-Nuestro comité ha participado en viajes de cabildeo anteriores a las oficinas del Congreso locales y de Washington DC. Estos esfuerzos han llevado a que la Cámara de Representantes apruebe HR6: la Ley Dream and Promise que ofrecería un camino a la residencia legal en los Estados Unidos (tarjeta verde) para los receptores de TPS y DACA (Dreamers).-Sin embargo, todavía queda mucho trabajo por hacer para aprobar la SECURE Act en el Senado y cambiar la ley. La ley del Senado no ha sido sometida a votación y los líderes demócratas no están presionando esta legislación.---------------------The TPS Campaign for Permanent Residency demands congressional legislation.  We are raising travel funds to allow Bay Area TPS holders to participate in lobbying efforts, as well as a March and Summit, in Washington, DC on December 1-3. Lobbying efforts will focus on the US Senate and the SECURE Act.We hope to send 6 TPS holders as well as 1 US-citizen child of a TPS holder.The TPS (Temporary Protected Status) Committee for Permanent Residency Now is a grassroots organization based in the Bay Area and a member of National TPS Alliance. We are working to obtain a path to Permanent Residency for more than 350,000 TPS holders from 13 countries including El Salvador, Nicaragua, Haiti, Sudan, Nepal and Honduras. Since June 2017, when the Department of Homeland Security announce the termination of the TPS program, we have campaigned for permanent residency.  Today, TPS holders are not eligible to apply for green cards despite living in our communities for decades.  The TPS community includes 250,000 US-citizen children. Congressional legislation that provides a path to permanent residency is vital to keep families together.Legislative change is vital -Our committee has participated in previous lobbying trips to both Washington DC and local congressional offices.  These efforts have led to the House of Representative passing HR6: the Dream and Promise Act that would offer a path to legal US residency (green card) to both TPS and DACA (Dreamers) recipients.  -However, there is still a lot of work to be done to pass the SECURE Act in the Senate and change the law.  The Senate law has not been brought to a vote and Democrats leadership are not pushing this legislation.

title: Operation Reset 2018
summary: We know school lunch debt is squeezing Williamson County families. School meals are just as important to student success as textbooks and teachers in the classroom. Williamson County Black Democrats want to lend a hand and ease some of the burden inflicted by the stress of school lunch debt, but we cannot do this without the help from our community. Please help us in what we are calling "Operation Reset", which will help reset some of the school lunch debt plaguing Williamson County.

title: MY BROTHER'S KEEPER
